w1HPfAyGnQJNI5LY9l4Fkg.text: My fave indian joint in vegas! Best lunch buffet ever! The food is always on point great selection and amazing service. The owner is always in the dinning room ensuring everyone is enjoying their meal! This place is fantastic ... everyone must try! Mmmmmmmmmmm

QbtYEGsIJ-XpoGVARcynMw.text: Awesome food, many varieties & best price. This might not looks like a great place from outside, but I loved the food. Best part was there were 15-20 dishes in lunch buffet & all were  really good.

zr1YNI0ISSZ_mh0wwXx6dQ.text: We were here for dinner.  One of the best meals we've had in awhile.  Please note that the food for dinner is freshly prepared and has no relation to the lunch buffet.  My husband had a mixed tandoori platter, and I had a vegetarian platter.  Then we shared.  Probably enough food for four people, but it was so good that we polished most of it off.  The vegetarian platter came with an appetizer of deep-fired vegetable fritters - well seasoned and not a hint of grease.  Also a rice pudding dessert - sweet and light.  A standout was the homemade cheese in the palak paneer.  Also the naan.  The chicken tandoori was the best I've ever had.  So often it can be dry and stringy.  This was juicy, tender, and perfectly seasoned.  There were two servers, both gracious and helpful.  Although this place is close to the Strip, it was not touristy.  We'll be back.

vCODdHy0OCoo6KlnQc6kxw.text: Really good food, friendly staff.  The cheese naan and tikka masala are awesome.  I've been there several times now and will definitely go back. Small cozy room, good prices for the quality.

fAbeh49InXEBO10d7YDPrw.text: Super yum, best part is its very clean authentic Indian, not that greasy chewy stuff you might get other places. Loved this place will def. be going again.

kIuzpp_IxmENrENmh3VfIA.text: Hands down, the best Indian food in Las Vegas. The naan comes out hot, the saag paneer is amazing, masala sauce is the best I've ever had. The owner is a very nice guy who isn't afraid to roll up his sleeves and wait tables. Try the lunch buffet for a wonderful variety of dishes.

XKt8MkdoG4qsvShgroCOSw.text: Snagged an online deal for this place after I heard about it from friends; it was really great! The portions were generous, the prices were reasonable and the staff was very kind. They don't have a full bar here though, so plan accordingly.

cJeZ16XTOqnOQ0iV5aTSzg.text: A few friends and I visited Mt. Everest India's Cuisine and we all agreed that we enjoyed this place a lot.  The service was very good - we felt neither rushed nor neglected. The owner is good at guiding hesitant diners to the type of dish he feels each would appreciate. We had a lot of fun sharing 5 different dishes- all were delicious.Definitely a place to return to.

0IANsvomp2U3KXHJK80wQg.text: Super yummy foods and a great buffet selection for veg heads like me. The mango lassi was one of the best I've had in a while. Nice friendly service and good food makes me a fan!

9Z2aT2NnIAgG4K6wv91Scg.text: Delicious food and friendly staff. All the things you'd ever want from a restaurant. Great for vegetarians- even vegans.

AlgRI3FuBKI1BV3TiydnLQ.text: O Happy days.  When on site at my client in Las Vegas I cannot wait for my lunch break so I can jet down to Mt. Everest India Cuisine for my much needed Indian food fix. I became aware of this place after searching Yelp for an Indian restaurant and have never looked back.  The restaurant is just a couple of minutes away from my work site so the lunch buffet works out really well. I can immediately sit down, order my plain naan bread and start dishing up.  The food is always flavorful and there are always very many options to choose from. They take care of the vegetarian and the meat lovers between us. I take particular joy in the Chana Masala at this venue - a delight which is shared by one of the waiters who told me this a while ago :)  I love the fact that I can go back to scoop some more of any Indian curry with which I can enjoy the remainder of my naan bread. I have ordered a Chicken Tikka Masala take out with Mt. Everest before and that sparked off my 'must have' mindset with which I now approach every trip to Las Vegas.  I confess that I will easily come here more than once per single work week because that is how good the food is. And as for the price - you will hardly ever convince me of better value for money elsewhere.

XzJnkwe80pbVWD3y4SUMTA.text: My family and I come here atleast every month with good reason: the food is outstanding and the manager and employees have proven themselves to be very amiable and helpful. Everytime we come the owner greets us with a smile, leading us to a table with no delay. The food is very good at anytime of the day, be it lunch time with their buffet or dinner time with their freshly prepared food. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anybody interested in Indian foods.

zNgV2aO10ZJ7yi3I27LH4Q.text: Per very positive Yelp reviews, a couple of friends and I stopped in here one evening... And very glad we did! Food was amazing & service was excellent! We ordered Saag Paneer, Chicken Tikka Masala and garlic naan- all phenomenal (and I eat quite a bit of Indian food). Our server, which I believe was also the owner, was incredibly nice and sincerely thankful for our business. Such great service seems hard to come by these days, so this place really made an impression on me. I'd recommend it to any one in town craving something other than hangover pizza. ;) Excited for leftovers tomorrow!

JufsEEVguIS0FE1f4RhT5g.text: this place hits the spots and location is a little dirty looking on the outside,   but inside clean and totally different atmosphere, they impressed my friend that they use real table clothes at lunch? It is off the strip,no casino buffet  line here,prices are great and food is tasty too.. If you have few friends get the coupon on their web site-to get  a discount... lunch was hot and fresh,and we got garlic and plain naan,with our meal,oh yummy.. And you have to splurge and get the mango lassi-again yummy..

g3oHmKKu95u1Q9ZauyExKg.text: Very good food! Nice crew! Recommend this place to everyone who likes indian cuisine!

qMhFgOOsOAukGuCMjzQYvw.text: The staff here is very nice.  I came to expect much less from Indian/Pakistani restaurants.  They understand the meaning of hospitality and the food is outstanding.  Try the Chicken or fish Tikka Marsala with garlic naan.

X7mkoT3sY8kKnPXyKi6aKQ.text: This place is amazing!  The food is delicious and the owner is the nicest guy.  He also serves the food and is great at food service.  This was my first time eating Indian food and I loved it.  It's my new favorite!  The building is very deciing, used to be an old fast food joint but it is beautiful inside!

h6eLdkLZaiG0-hY7tMncQQ.text: Once you try this restaurant you will make it one of your very favorite places to eat. EXCELLENT food and service. My wife, son and I go there more than any other place. Inexpensive on the pocketbook for as mush as you can eat.

B_cA0r_m28oyv9ZfhkCuhw.text: Let me start by saying that the food is delicious (on most days). My review will be covering my lunch buffet experience only, so please keep that in mind when reading.  Pros: Plenty of variety - Chicken tikka, tandoori chicken, saag paneer and so forth. The naan is freshly made, but be sure to mention custom requests such as Garlic naan etc while you are being seated (or they assume you want it plain).  Cons While the food quality ranges from good to excellent, the customer service is lacking, depending on the season. The owner is a really chill guy, but he seems have 1 person working ALL the tables sometimes (which gets chaotic during lunch rush, and customer service suffers).  I've noticed he's hired more staff lately, but I suspect its only seasonal. My note to him - Keep your location well-staffed :)   I love their carrot dessert (gajar halwa), which is light years better than the sugary Gulab Jamun. They have a salad bar, which is decent.  My advice to readers - You better make sure you are leading an active lifestyle, if Indian Buffet is your goto for lunch. Although the food here is tasty delicious goodness, its not really good for your body :/ Authentic Indian food isn't this greasy or creamy, and most Indian people don't eat like this.  Because of the health implications of eating such loaded items, I tend to go there once every 2 weeks...maybe once a month.

9o1FtkBR3jEG0Ik-CFCaFg.text: This is a dinner review not lunch buffet. Service and atmosphere was very good. I was really hoping to give this restaurant an honest 5 rating like many others did and also why I stopped in here.. Perhaps in Las Vegas it may be considered one of the best but I've had many Indian cuisine experiences mainly in the valley of L.A. where theres many Indian places. But the food lacked somewhat here. The first thing I was surprised at was the garlic naan bread was not included for dinner, although it was good. First time I've ever seen an Indian restaurant not serve it as complementary. The chicken tandoori was a little dry and mostly smothered in bell peppers, onions, and cilantro. Cilantro??? Had I known about the cilantro I would have requested without it. No basmati rice either although it specified in the menu that it came served with rice. Tikka was exactly the same. Now that I know a couple things about this place I may try again but order carefully. I was with a party of 6 and everyone was eh so so about the food. We were all pleasantly surprised with the service.

BggVnHrKOz9QbhScIJ7zwA.text: We ordered our food to go and it was ready early and was exactly what we ordered. The pick up was seemless and friendly. The food we ordered was delicious, but the basmati rice was a little dry and the naan bread was rather tasteless. We tried both the regular naan and the garlic naan and neither was very good. We of course still dipped it in the yummy sauces. We will try it again for sure when we are in town again.

lsiAbon_zwpRDWklRH0oQw.text: Simply delicious sauces. The mango lassi is perfect and service is friendly enough. The parantha was a letdown. The only black mark on an otherwise lovely place.

aISlCBuDyYzybH4lQkbWrw.text: I've gone to Mount Everest more than 10+ times and every single time no matter if it's buffet or dinner it's always fantastic. This family owned restaurant is a gem, doesn't look it from the outside but just walking up to the place you smell the aroma of spices pouring out. Walking in you're always greeted very warmly and kindly by everyone that works there and they all make you feel like you're at home. The food is so so good, all the food has the perfect textures as you would expect and the flavors pack a huge punch. Everything has so many flavors and smells. I love their naan, chicken tikki and korma are all amazing. If you're looking for amazing service and AUTHENTIC tasting cuisine that tastes like homemade then go here ! You will not be disappointed! You know it's good when you come out smelling like the food !

abAsGzLVYGBofJOi08G3EA.text: food was great! the owner and staff all very warm and welcoming to guests! we all liked their Tandoori chicken legs.. well cooked, spiced and served hot. rest of the food order was average and taste could be improved but I would greatly appreciate the owners sincere effort to keep this place welcoming. that compensates for all the shortcomings.

pt_8xBX0Sh-3TK9lnEJsQA.text: One of our favorite spots for Indian food. Good place for a big group; they have platters, which is affordable and you can try all of their main dishes.

zeEn1t6q6YtaOl9jXh7tcQ.text: Fantastic food, fantastic service, and a fantastic atmosphere. The owner who helped me was kind and helped me navigate the menu. His suggestion of the Tikki Marsala was on point, and tasted delicious. He even gave me a free dessert just because. Highly recommended!

Dj-yoOlgxcicjgfpSGA5nQ.text: We ate here with my parents and toddler who we encouraged to try different foods. The atmosphere was welcoming with Nepalese prayer flags lining the tops of the walls. Very clean and the staff was hospitable. We ordered the tikka masala (a staple of course), mushroom matter (peas) and the chicken korma - the most delicious of the three. My daughter enjoyed the korma and the cumin flavored rice. Very delicious- as a family of Indian decent, we can say with confidence that the food was authentic and properly cooked. We will be back!

BdDXitt492GmD9C0pOEFFw.text: True super yummy Nepali Indian food. Wish it could be in Houston. Gravy tastes so authentic and naan are very soft n fresh. Was visiting Vegas with friend and so happy that we decided to come here. We tried tikka Masala chicken, tikka Masala paneer, malai kofta and breads. Food was so damn good that we felt as if we were eating in India, in fact this place can run out any good Indian or Nepali place back in india. Will come back for this place for sure.

krUlVng11x4Bg1BTyeMtEQ.text: This restaurant is absolutely delicious, the servers are the best, the service was amazing. They took care of us so well. If I could eat butter chicken and drink mango lassi, and treat myself to gulab jamun all the time I would come here. 12/10

brLTfiYtLyx5Lb8Y2iYOfA.text: Hands down our favorite hole in wall Indian food. Every year we are in Vegas for a week on business, and every time we have made a point to eat here, 8 years now and has never disappointed. The not so savory neighborhood chases away tourist. Leaving foodies in the know.  The building appears to be an old Burger King, but they have done their best to compleate the decor with real table linens. A flat screen TV always plays Bollywood music videos.  Great garlic naan.

-LOs9WqNGkTA1lSsURvqcQ.text: I've been here for the lunch buffet as well as night dining- both were great experiences. The food is great, the buffet is packed and the food is constantly turned over and fresh. They work their hurt off for good service and are very kind

uAOWi1CPViJQkahLPUKvaA.text: Just ate here for the first time a few days ago... big portions.  My son is 15 & ate 1/2 of the large portion of rice for both of our chicken tikka masala & ate his entire portion of the chicken & sauce along with 1/2 of mine!  This is a favorite meal & we just got mild.  I love spicy but figured I'd start with mild, my nose was still running but I definitely could have gotten spicy  also very warm & cozy atmosphere! Amazing service too!  We will be back

fb3rW2oLFMfU4UIWPKPyDg.text: We were recommended here from the owners daughter who always does my eyebrows. I have to say,this is by far the best indian restaurant ive veen to in the valley! Wish i wouldve gone in sooner.  We were greeted by Parkass -- who by the way, was a nice gentleman eith a great personality. He made us feel welcomed and no complaints on service. The atmosphere really makes you feel like your in india! The selection of food for the buffet were delicious and fresh. I was really impressed that they were serving chicken tikka masala--one of my favorites!! The garlic naan is a must try!!! Hands down the best garlic naan i have ever tried. The bread was baked into perfection. The rice pudding was a delicacy!  I recommend this place!!! I prefer to drive an additional 1 mile than india oven. (We went there yesterday and walked out immediately cause food dont look fresh) come to mt everest and experience a day of indian cuisine:)

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic naan bread! Very addicting.hands down the best garlic naan in town

kDKKtMtSPInTY8EgI7tzEw.text: We were here in Vegas for a week and were craving for good Indian food. This place is not high end but the food is really really good. Probably one of the best Indian food I have had in a while. I will definitely recommend this place!

lqvKyZgBdVF3mIDF_e7vJg.text: I went here to have the lunch buffet. The layout for the buffet is quite good and the price is reasonable too. The only reason why it did not make a 5 would be the taste. Being a big fan of indian food i would really like to see some more indian aromatic taste/flavours in the food. The staff is very friendly and prompt in addressing your questions and requests.

N451nwHA0uj49Gs7d-kJtA.text: Delicious lunch buffet for $12. Great butter chicken, palak paneer, goat curry, and naan. Might be the most flavorful and rich Indian food I've ever had, and for the price it's a steal.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nrUzFHjOlNK_xQCGFwVGvg.text: Authentic Nepali taste. Great service. Loved the place should definitely check it out. Good friendly service. Five star definitely deserves it.

Yf6TjwQ1PGsslsGytch9yQ.text: Vegetarian food not that great! Quality of food was okay! Its doesn't resemble flavor and taste of India

K4s0dwTe3BJrbLLRu9H1IQ.text: We've eaten here before and they always have excellent food, until today, we are so disappointed because everything was so salty - our tongues seriously  got numb --- I think I have 5 days worth of my allotted sodium intake in one single meal-- we ordered Chicken tikka masala, navratan korma, lamb vindaloo and shrimp curry--- all flavorless, just salty!!! The only thing that's not salty is the mango lassi, oh and the gulab jamun. Duhhh?!! The waiter told me they changed chef. Well,  until they change their chef and improve their food, I will not be coming back.

2W1VbQBYa7DEECepTW54Eg.text: In our group of family and friends, no one ever said no to the suggestion of going to Mount Everest for lunch.  We never minded the twenty-minute drive from Henderson for lunch or even dinner.    The staff are always very nice and attentive.  The food is always delicious and fresh.  There's no reason why you shouldn't give Mount Everest a try and make it your favorite Indian restaurant in Las Vegas!

6ROs-dmOqeuS2oykigMOJA.text: So happy we came here to eat! Service was astounding - everyone here is so kind. :) The show stopper is the food. Every single item on the buffet is delicious!! Really. Everything. If you're craving excellent Indian food this is a must!

C1xE7QpkbiZ-C3e7PNivVA.text: This is our second visit here. The first visit was really good but our second visit was amazing! We had the Chicken Mo Mo, kinda like pot stickers which we were told were a Nepalese specialty. Great start to our entres. We order the Chicken Makhani and the Chana Masala. The Masala was really good but holy shit, the Makhani was the best thing we have eaten in a long time. We asked for a to go menu to jot down some notes for next visit.  Ownership and employees were extremely nice and offering suggestions and servicing special requests as my wife is pregnant.  This is a must visit! WE WILL BE BACK!

6ll-mjyAo84APLv-jR5F3w.text: If you really want try or like  spicy and hot food then it's the tiny  nepali Indian combined restaurant around Las Vegas area, also they have buffet too which I liked, I suggest them hope they make more restrooms!..

JsgqhZ2LluqIFVnzAeZLaQ.text: So flipping delicious! The food was flavorful, and the service was friendly. This was honestly some of the best Indian food I've ever had, and I love Indian food. Additionally, the place was low key (but still nice), which was a welcome refresher from the casino club dress scene. Go! Eat! You won't regret it.

PdVacXvaEsrYA6L7nmIzOA.text: Prakash the manager was so great. I don't typically like Indian food but my family dragged me here and I reluctantly went along. I looked at the food and it seemed weird to me but I took a little bit of everything and went to my table. The thing is, turns out the food was really terrific.  Out of the 10 things I tried I think I like about 8/10 things. Plus, the naan bread was really great and doughy. I'm not from the area, but if I was I would sure go back.

RFCHYHWsAGpQ82Rcn4nv2g.text: If you want True authentic Indian food Mt. Everest is hands down the best restaurant. The food is so mouth watering and flavoring you won't want to stop eating. The workers serve us with a happy attitude and the atmosphere is always so inviting. Anytime my family and I have a craving for any type of food we come and leave very satisfied!!

BIo7JO2Q8R_h2TzsMDny8A.text: Tonight I brought my family of five to Mount Everest on empty stomachs and we left all beyond pleased with the service, food and taste.   We began with chicken momos, that were fresh and had plenty of flavor with and without the sauce.  We then got the chicken tiki masala, chicken curry, lamb korma and vegetable biryani.  Each dish was unique and the flavors built off one another. Our water glasses were never empty as the spices climbed, a True testament to the service.   Both the garlic naan and the plain are perfect accompaniments to the dishes and really round out the meal.   From the moment stepping inside and breathing in the fresh scent to leaving Mount Everest makes you feel welcome whether it's your first time or old regulars. I told my coworkers this is some of the best Indian food in town and I can't wait for my next meal here.

Asv5yzojSB37Cc8swotfKA.text: This is by far the best ( and most authentic) Indian Cuisine I can find in Vegas and I've eaten at multiple locations prior to finding this one. Their chicken Tikki masala and lamb vindaloo are my favorite dishes... but that's just my favorite I enjoy any of their curry dishes, especially the goat, and their spicy dishes are always done just right. I come AT LEAST once a week, and have for about a year now. All the people that work here are really nice and the service is amazing. When you dine-in your water cup never goes unfilled and they're very attentive. I. Love. This. Place.

5w6BUwNWPOrBcILC54R8tA.text: Outstanding. Friendly servers. Delicious food. My old lady had never tried Indian and now we'll be eating here regularly. Pretty busy joint so don't be afraid to make a reservation

1ST2mxISzcPIAuFbp-3axg.text: Excellent food and service. If we could have eaten more, we would have! We'll definitely be back the next time we're in town.   Everything from the samosas to the masala to the okra dish was phenomenal.

vZRY8ryabTUaM4haoDUNDg.text: Awesome Indian food, it's a little bit greasy but it's good. Real authentic Indian flavor check out the chicken Viriani

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I-bZRgwixVBl9pH66uddPQ.text: This is the best Indian food in town hands down. If you didn't like it, you HAVNT had good Indian food, so you don't know what you're talking about. They do keep it pretty bland unless you ask for more spice. Love the mutter paneer with garlic an smothered in yogurt. So good!

Vv5XeRyv0t8op3oG0Ia7aQ.text: Went there for dinner (as opposed to their $10.99 lunch buffet). The chicken tikka masala was quite good, but everything else was just decent. We also got the lamb vindaloo, lamb kebab, and some shrimp dish, but would not recommend pay $13+ for them.

o3cP-OEQCYB2yxeZvDmu9A.text: I kept hearing good things about this place so I was excited to come here. I must have come on an off day because nothing really stood out for me. The Tandoori chicken was too dry and bland. The different types of curries were a little watery and didn't have the right levels of spice and flavor. The naan was mediocre and I didn't even finish the samosa. I can't name one thing that I enjoyed from the buffet.   This place was super crowded when I went. I went on a Tuesday and the line was out the door and some people were standing next to our booth partially blocking us so I was felt trapped. No complaints about the service. I probably won't be back though unless someone else is paying and really wants to go.

IAv4XiBi0K49yXsIA_pAPQ.text: I have only eaten the buffet, but it is some of the best Indian food I have ever had, and I have had LOTs of Indian food all over the country.   Their curries are diverse and delicious, and the staff is friendly and attentive.   I can't wait to come back for dinner!

i6kb6fEmkidGMedos0gv1Q.text: This place was amazing. A friend from work suggested it and I loved the food. I had the curry chicken plate a spice level of 7 and it was just perfect. Can't wait to go back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MB515WidW9xlJBMfC7qX-A.text: I'm not sure how this is the highest rated restaurant in Las Vegas. We went for lunch buffet and is not good at all. Chicken items were sweet. And no Briyani

S8JPY9i9pinmJpGoPozrFg.text: Excellent traditional Indian cuisine. I had the chicken saag (so good!). Service was also nice. I'll come again when i vegas.

ASizP6LrRMvqjIUe9YApCw.text: Highly recommeded Indian food in town!! Delicious buffet with humble staffs!!! Awesome!! Made our vegas trip special

sNbZiOBUQ1iKP_sbTXegFQ.text: Just one word- disaster. Interior totally hideous.. They don't know what an appetizer is. So basically we unfortunately ordered the vegetarian momos which like tasted really bad. As soon I finished taking the first bite I get the main course. The server didn't let us eat and was pushing plates on our table to make room for main course. Now for the main course we ordered malai kofta (which was with minimal gravy and some koftas that were totally stale and tasted really bad) and paneer tikka ( which was equally pathetic). Save your money for something better. Stay away

1dD3bNGtORurxW_GrKK40A.text: Friend recommended we go to Mt after class she said it was cheap and tasty as a college student cheap is always good and I'm so glad she took me here BEST INDIAN FOOD IN TOWN!! The staff was also very friendly definitely coming back!

7xxidCYCg1Wc0YBMeepdFQ.text: We decided to give it a try for my friends birthday after reading lots of positive reviews here on yelp, and upon arrival we were seated immediately. Everyone else's food smelled so good when we first walked in, i was really excited, even though I don't typically care for Indian food. We ordered a bottle of wine and a few various dinners and naan, which we did wait a little while to actually receive, but it was so worth the wait. Everything was amazing! I had the Chicken Tikka Masala, which I would surely order again. The owner was also there making sure that everything was perfect, he even brought my friend out dessert for her birthday :) We will definitely make the trip back across town to eat here again.

tT8PFTTw504_OP44L8JqIg.text: Always a perfect meal at Mt. Everest! Great service and the best indian food in the city. Prakash runs an amazing restaurant that is indeed a hidden gem.  Don't forget the mango lassi, it will definitely bring you back !

tQbJugAtmz_ET4YKkdCi2g.text: Ask for garlic naan.  Best Indian cuisine lunch buffet in town.

C9HM_NGRzvfmrfUOmOg21w.text: Thinking Indian? This is your place! It's central location is close to everything. However, what I like most about it is the taste of the food. I got my dear Grandma hooked on this place, and now she often calls me wanting me to come here with her. I have been here many times with colleagues and when you have that person that wants to "try something new," this is my go-to! I always recommend the lunch buffet, especially for Americans that do not know what to order, they can easily try it. There is something for everyone. Not everything is so spicy. I love Palak Paneer, and this place has some of the best in Vegas! I love it, everyone is always kind in serving and even when they are busy, it's still a lovely experience. Don't forget the complimentary na'an at lunch... Very yummy!!

NaDOJK8ZwwOn1icyv1WEgw.text: My wife and I absolutely enjoy Indian food and have tried countless Indian restaurants. This is definitely one of the best Indian restaurants we have ever been to due to the food and service. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for great Indian food.

_oRV51qLmJVwNLGZYISfUQ.text: My boyfriend and I tried this because of a Groupon Now offer, and we weren't disappointed.  We ordered a chicken appetizer, the paalak paneer and a lamb dish we had not heard of before, along with some garlic naan.  The order was more than we could finish, even though we enjoyed every bite! Particularly, the lamb was so tender and succulent!  The atmosphere was comfortable and the owner came to greet us.  We would definitely go back again.

dEO1JuYmS2rqLyzS1bRQpw.text: It was busy when I arrived for the first time tonight, which is a good sign. Chicken tikka masala with garlic naan was excellent. Friendly staff, reasonable price. I will be back for more :)

I7RSa0QWsCjlBshb5NhOtA.text: I don't why this hotel is rated high. It's a Pathetic restaurant . Actually I am right now in the restaurant. They have a buffet lunch. Once I took the curries I was told I will get the naan but I had to wait 30mins until I went and ask for it again. Atmosphere sucks. I would better have gone to some gas station and got Pringles.

T5jNXU4vW1l0p2w3KjaZBA.text: Highest Quality Indian Lunch Buffet.  Wow! Very tasty food, spicy enough for most Americans (though not so spicy for many from the region). Twelve bucks with drink and tax.  Very impressive restaurant!

SgUgVWW7h0RkSd7lNJZnIw.text: Hands down the best Indian lunch buffet in Vegas. One in a while, they have the "carrot pudding" and it is amazing! Their paneer has great texture and in great texture, I mean it is soft enough to absorb flavor and hard enough to not break apart. The chefs at Everest know what they're doing!

u48S-nCx0k4POp7Ie5yMwQ.text: This place doesn't look that great on the outside. The inside looks far better! The food was very impressive and price was great too! Got a lamb dish, chicken dish, garlic naan, regular naan, mango lassi, and rice for around $30. Went back a second time and tried the buffet. It was so good with lots to choose from at a great price. Was a bit hot ac wise with all the people who pack in for the lunch buffet. Well worth the visit!

aA59LYwPfVqJQCryIW1r9Q.text: I took my family here to eat for an dinner at 5:30pm, since we purchased a Restaurant.com certificate. It may have the old structure of the Burger King, but it's a nice and relaxing atmosphere where they don't rush you. I was impressed with their tandoori oven chicken. It was very good portion. I've ate at some other places like San Francisco where they don't give you too much meat on the chicken, but this place in Vegas is really good. To tell if an Indian restaurant is any good is if they can't make the most common, typical Naan and chicken tikki masala taste good that Indian restaurants are famous for, then I advise you run away and head for the hills! But seriously, their onion naan was good and tasty. Everything we ordered was good and we will definitely go back. :-)

Tjr24RlhiImxrf7fPEyjdw.text: We decided to try this place based on it's pretty consistent Yelp reviews, and we're glad we did. A few reviewers have mentioned the sketchy surroundings, but I say if you can throw some carpet, a few tablecloths, and the drapes from an old bordello into a defunct Burger King and come up with a perfectly comfortable dining room, more power to ya!  I have loved Indian food since I first discovered it during a brief sojourn in London, when it seemed that the only options were steak and kidney pie or starving to death. (I chose the latter. Valar Morghulis)! Anyway, as a person who considers curry to be more of a drug than a food, I'm usually prepared to like what I get in Indian restaurants, which is a little meat floating in a sea of delicious sauce which you happily sop up with some fluffy, toasty naan, and fill up on the rice.(I'm getting hungry again just thinking about it). The difference here was that there was plenty of tender, juicy meat in that sauce; apparently a side benefit of keeping the rent low. Hope they don't get too big for their britches and move to Summerlin. Goodbye, meat!  I adore Chicken Korma and theirs was perfect; rich creamy sauce with just a little sweetness and those complex, spicy undertones that keep you coming back for more bites long after you're full. Chicken Tikka and tandoori were both served sizzling and still moist and juicy. The favorite appetizer, in a unanimous vote, was the lamb samosas. They were golden little pockets of pastry stuffed with seasoned, finely ground lamb, but the best thing was what wasn't there: My sister didn't find a hard thing. Mind you, if there is ground meat involved, be it burgers, sausage, meatballs, whatever, she ALWAYS gets the hard thing, and the rest of us have to suffer along with her. It's one of life's little miracles that she didn't, and practically worth a sixth star. Will definitely return to try the lunch buffet, but don't be surprised if they raise the price after our visit.

419c7NSWIcj06M0nscnB3A.text: Upset our stomach!!!  Within an hour both of us running to bathroom.  The first visit the buffet was good and fresh..although a little too spicey.  We went back for dinner a few days later. The food was not fresh. It was  heavily spiced even though we asked for very little if any hot spices. The desert was hard and couldn't be cut with fork.

txC1HwPUgXFldoNK5pGgdg.text: If Indian Cuisine is what you are looking for then this is the best bang for the buck in Las Vegas. Take it from a native of 35 years. I've tried many places across the country and it's great to know a top tier restaurant is nestled like a hidden gem right down the street from me. You know it's good When our former and current Mayors "The Goodman's" will be your potential dining patrons. The wait staff is top notch and they always get the order right the first time. I recommend the chicken tike masala with garlic naan. You can't go wrong. Just my opinion though. Give them a try. You won't be disappointed. :)

raFoGbQkWO0QUpxv7Dmyww.text: Great AYCE spot! They have a variety of dishes, all of which were very tasty. My favorite was the samosa dipped in the yogurt sauce or mint chutney. Also great was the channa masala. It had a great heat and was spiced nicely. I thought the garlic naan was a bit too garlicky but that's just my palate. The waiter was not very attentive and slow to refill our drinks.

nlJXcS9VUyB3W0c5w3QBLA.text: This was one the best Indian restaurants I have ever been too. I tried their lunch buffet and it did not disappoint. Definitely making it a must when I am in Vegas.

FQ3uYlB0lJ1I02FmhE9HqA.text: By far, my favorite indian restaurant in Vegas! I originally found out about them through groupon. I stopped by while in the area for take out.  My go-to dish is often Chicken Makhani (heat: 6-7) but the second time I decided to opt for a dish that wasn't so heavy and the waiter recommended the Lamb Curry.  The lamb was cooked to perfection! Lamb that is not cooked correctly is tough and gamey! The portions are generous and the price is more than reasonable.   I will continue to go out of my way for Mt. Everest!

FmeM7sxFF3JG0vPbn1w6NQ.text: The place is very clean, the staff is attentive, and very friendly.  We started with the fried cheese and steamed chicken dumplings. Both were good. Then our main dishes came out. The chicken curry and butter chicken! Both excellent. The chicken curry, even though I ordered medium spicy came out a little more spicy than I expected, but was delicious. The butter chicken's spice of medium was spot on, and also excellent! Pair them with the awesome basmati rice, rotti and garlic naan breads and you can't go wrong! I'm a late sleeper and need to try their ayce lunch buffet that looks awesome! Give it a try.

jP93xKs-YuIyD94dTH601g.text: In Vegas , we were craving for indian food after our pool party. Water makes you super hungry. Found this place over yelp . Was a little off the strip but Vegas has Ubers now , so wasn't difficult to get there .  We ordered momos ,lamb biryani and several other things. Food is surprisingly fantastic . Very yum! Lamb biryani was so good and also their momos are a must try.butter chicken was good too.overall, if you are in Vegas , would recommend this place for indian cuisine.

vhJ-IwiMRhoOU_ZYvUhBEA.text: Food was OK.  Service was terrible. Servers were too busy looking at the game on TV.

fHtJU2iXw3vCnmuk4g0bFA.text: I had the lunch buffet a couple of days ago.  Food was good and reasonably priced.  Service was OK, but it would have been nice to get my Naan a bit earlier in the meal.  Restaurant is clean; it has a diner vibe so it's probably not a date destination.  If I have a craving for Indian food again I'll probably go here.

mJlYVT2pnXPDRHjvZWhUYw.text: We visited this restaurant on our trip to vegas during Christmas. It was super crowded with around 40 minutes of wait time, but was worth waiting for buffet. Generally for vegetarians, there aren't much varieties in buffet but here I found lot more items compare to other restaurants.

4IR2Lf_YMcRWY3Bo-ifE_A.text: The Tikka Masala was delicious! I added potatoes to it and it made it even better! The portion size was perfect! The rice was cooked to perfection. Garlic Naan is a must! The customer service was one of the best I've ever experienced. I'll definitely be a regular here.

1P-Z3GkdxhvKyurP6acOyg.text: Yummy, couldn't be happier that we found this place. My 1 year old son who's a picky eater like to eat here too. Very homey and the owner was very accommodating in helping us selecting the foods

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken masala with plain Naan... chicken tandoori

3wONxJvQc6_fuucTsAeGYA.text: The food here tastes awesome. I personally liked their chicken kurma and karahi chicken with chilli garlic naan. It is the first place to go in vegas if you like spicy Indian food. It has decent ambiance, food is served pretty quickly, the portion sizes are appropriate (1 curry for 2 people) and is not a very pricey place.

c3ZfNe4D87N5rqSenw_V5g.text: NOTE: Mt. Everest is the tallest Mountain in the world and it's in Nepal. When you enter this restaurant it's clear that it is Nepali with the Buddhist prayer flags, photos of Nepal, and the drape of Swayambunath temple image of Buddha's eyes hung up on one of the walls. Although, many of the dishes are Indian and the lunch buffet has many Indian dishes, a significant portion of the restaurant's menu is pure Nepali food. Being a Nepali, it's disappointing that the restaurant needs to be advertised at 100% Indian to retain and bring business. I just wish customers would recognize that it's both Nepali and Indian. They are two different countries with similar cuisines.   Anyway, hope some readers found that educational!   Now for the FOOD! As a lover of Nepali and Indian food, this restaurant is top notch. Definitely one of the best I've been to the in the United States. It rivals restaurants in Queens, New York which probably has the highest density of Nepali restaurants anywhere in the states. My partner actually thinks its even better than our favorite place out there.   We came here twice in two weeks when we were in Vegas for rest stops during our epic road trip. We both focused on entirely on the Nepali food side which is on the left. Their chicken chilly is AMAZING - so on point with the flavor. Perfect amount of onions, bell peppers, and loaded with tender and fresh chicken.   Their goat meat is as good as my mama makes it,  especially the gravy. A lot of Nepali restaurants tend to under cook or have really tough pieces of goat meat, but everything is so tender here, it's incredible! Chicken curry also absolutely delicious. The second time we were there, they had toor daal, so I had a traditional plate of dal, rice, meats, and vegetables and even ate with my right hand. The very traditional way of enjoying Nepali cuisine to the max!   Also, my partner and I bought a bunch of orders of Nepali momos to go, which they have on their menu outside of the lunch buffet. Simply delicious. So authentic. Loaded with tasty meat filling! Loved having it later at our leisure.   I also tried all their Indian dishes and they're just as amazing. I especially like the vegetarian kofta. Each dish is perfect. I typically find that restaurant's that have both selections master one or the other. Mt Everest is a slam dunk at South Asian cuisine.   Whether you live in Vegas or are stopping through as a tourist, get your behind off the strip and come here for amazing Nepali and Indian food.

Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Nt6fRHlW1_87RhwEol_mFg.text: Mount Everest restaurant is no joke! I've been to my share of indian restaurants all over in many different states and this was by far the absolute best I have ever had. The lunch buffet is incredible and the variety of choices is awesome! The service was amazing. Today was my first time here and I cannot wait to go back very soon! Don't stray away because of the older neighborhood and rough diner-looking exterior, the food is outstanding. Their chicken tikka masala is so good, you'll want seconds & thirds! The gulab jabun is pure heaven. I cannot say enough great things about Mount Everest restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Incredible lunch

wyKJ92OUvZS2dEpMQ8zfCQ.text: Tasty food, amazing and very accommodating staff. We had very limited time for a food stop, they took our order ahead of time and was ready by the time we got there. Food was delicious too. I definitely recommend this place. They have parking available and if you are passing through Vegas it's just a 10 mins detour from I 15.

yhK0RJDZQBW7YAMc59R7Fw.text: My family and I have been coming here for years. The owner knows us and always says hi and asks how we're doing when we eat here, even if it is only once a year! We always get chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, fish curry, and garlic naan. This is hands down the best Indian food I've ever eaten! Even my father, who has visited India, says Mount Everest is still his favorite place. If you're thinking about coming here stop thinking and just do it!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tDMt_aedKyZ-YCAdgM3mCg.text: Lunch buffet choices for vegetarians was limited and the overall taste was average as well. Found most of it white salty. The place was quite crowded and felt like out of place.

08ryU2IeNR8cxqTnDqMaDg.text: I did not enjoy this food at all. I ordered malai kofta and it was super sweet. I could even finish the meal. The dessert was also very dry. The only good thing was the naan bread. I will not eat here again.

adh_OinxhF4Wazn-_Ahdow.text: I can't believe it...I've been working in an office for years now, less than 5 minutes away from Mount Everest, but it might as well have been a world away.  I've only recently discovered this hidden gem!  I'm not experienced in Indian food, run-ins with curry and the occasional purchase of naan from Costco were about all I knew.  But wow...what a flavor bomb Mount Everest is!  Very unassuming restaurant on the outside..BAM!  Get your taste buds ready!  If you're very new to Indian food I urge you, start off slowly.  The multiple (and I mean multiple) spices used to make a majority of the food can be very overwhelming.  Indians are not shy with spices and they will throw everything in the book at you!  That can be a very good thing!  Wake up your senses!  Tastes from everywhere will be making your brain go BOING!  To be honest there must be a dozen or more critical spices used in Indian cooking, all present here at Mount Everest, I'll just name a few:  *Cardamom *Clove *Black pepper *Cumin *Coriander *Nutmeg *Mustard seed *Fenugreek *Turmeric *Saffron  Are you ready?  Thought I was but I really wasn't!  For your best options, go for the daily lunch buffet.  You get to try a little bit of everything that Indian food has to offer.  There are some definite familiar dishes along with a few that are great starting points for newbie Indian foodies.  Only a beginner?  Go for the tasty Chicken Tikka Masala over a bed of their Sweet Rice.  Sweet, spicy, but not too spicy!  Also go for the Tandoori Chicken, marinated in yogurt, garlic, ginger & herbs then grilled over charcoal.  Delicious!  More experienced?  Go get it with their Chicken Curry or their Goat Curry (yep), try a Veggie Samosa or Pakora.  Don't forget the dipping sauces!  Raita, Mango Chutney, and Tamarind are ready to accompany all of your entrees!  Vegetarian?  The buffet also offers a few good options like Palak Paneer - homemade cheese cooked with fresh spinach & herbs.  Or the Aloo Kauli - potatoes & cauliflower cooked with tomatoes, peas, cilantro, roasted cumin & coriander.    Please, please, please don't look a gift horse in the mouth - each table comes with a basket of freshly baked naan bread!  This is critical!  The curries, Hell just about everything goes excellent with the naan bread!  It's sooooo good!  Sop up all the extra goodness off your plate with a piece of naan!  If you get a chance order a basket of the garlic naan as well.  Carbs be damned!  Mount Everest is possibly the best Indian buffet around currently.  If you go for the lunch buffet be prepared to wait.  Tables are often full with regulars!  But it is totally worth it for the flavor explosion you will be receiving.  The price isn't bad either, $10.99 a person...what a deal!  Eat to your heart's content!  I've only been to Mount Everest for the lunch buffet, but I hear the dinner buffet as well as the regular menu is on fleek as well.  I will have to come back to give either of them a go.  But for right now I am happy with my lunch buffet for my Indian fix.  I will be back!  Everybody in the world....SPICE UP YOUR LIFE!!

wU2X4SMjyBllwcgidyK5vA.text: One of the best Indian restaurants I have gone to. The staff is extremely nice and it feels family owned. They always made sure we had what we needed and checked regularly while we were eating. Their chili pakora is extremely spicy but we loved it. If I lived in Las Vegas I would come here every week.

G-AB12m0WXLQCGd1X1NDBA.text: We have been going to a different Indian restaurant in town, so we thought we would try a new place.  It was okay. Not bad, not fabulous, it was okay.

LoIBEpiyjlXQFFDo3Ptrxw.text: I came back (a couple times in the last couple months) and I am so glad I did!   The place is cleaner, the service is much better, and the food was excellent (I only ate the vegetarian dishes). The food was better because they stopped over salting all the food so you taste all the lovely spices without the salt overpowering the dish. I don't leave feeling like I'm needing to drink water. All the veggie dishes I tried were just the right amount of spicy and not over powering. Now if the dishes could be made vegan (no ghee) I'd be over the moon! Thank you Mt.Everest...I'm glad I came back! Keep doing what you're doing!

oLU4LAEYNfJgVn9qk3BSWg.text: Wanted to rate this negative. Deceived by the reviews and went there for lunch buffet. It's just disastrous, please do not call this Indian food. Waste of time and money. Bad ambience, bad food, bad maintenance. Whoever gave it a positive rating never would have eaten Indian food. Tandoori chicken and chilli chicken are awful, I pity samosa for they called one of their dishes so (uncooked and tasteless potato stuffing in a thick shell). A 0 rated Indian cook can cook much better than this place. Please please please do not call this Indian food and downgrade Indian cuisine.

rYk6POUNayLF7tN6mMrg9A.text: 3.5 for food and atmosphere, 4 stars for service and price/value. I will round up to 4 stars overall.  I was craving Indian food so decided to check out this place for their lunch buffet. The interior is a bit worn, but it is clean and the workers are all very friendly.  There were a decent amount of dishes in the buffet, but not all that many to be honest. All of the food was tasty, and there was a good variety. Chilli chicken made an appearance again, and I'm starting to think this Indo-Chinese dish is a Las Vegas Indian buffet staple. While chilli chicken is indeed a very popular Indo-Chinese dish, I never saw it in Indian buffets when I lived in California or in Virginia.   The meal comes with freshly baked naan, and there is no surcharge if you want garlic naan, though it does take a little longer to prepare and you have to ask for it. Water is included and served in cute mason jars, and the servers were pretty diligent about refilling waters and clearing used plates.  Overall, at $10.99 for a lunch buffet, Mount Everest is a good value and has decent food. It is not the best Indian buffet I've ever had, and nothing particularly wowed me or stood out, but it is a solid restaurant for sure.  P.S. I find it ironic that the restaurant is called Mount Everest India's Cuisine even though Mount Everest is located in Nepal. xD

dPXxPYrIKT4Y3Dz4Hlju2Q.text: Awesome food!!!! Good service too!!  Second visit: Awesome food again.. this time we tried lunch special for 11.99   Salad, fruits, samosa, potato fry as starters. Super soft naan (bread) wide variety of veggie dishes (mix veg, pawlak paneer, dal, channa masala, veggie koorma).  Also, 5 varieties non veg dishes available.

a2PIQsLHhz76_BoANPPV2A.text: I work right up the street so this is my local Indian restaurant. I love it ! I've eaten here at least 30 times. I'm a buffet type of guy so I only go during those hours. But I can't help it it's delicious every time !   I always come back and always will lol.

HCvGuE1lB5ANJAlVMi782w.text: Loved the Saag Paneer here! Really good tandoori Roti & garlic chili naan if you like spicy food. Excellent service, will definitely come back.

plqTUtCTEWjDjkjNFSTFfQ.text: So I actually got to try their lunch buffet too. It was awesome. Keep your eye out for both the little sweet ball desserts AND the rice pudding! You get a basket of fresh naan too. We asked for the garlic naan because you can never have enough garlic in your life. NEVER.

8xmo6W4z0pL13s13-zil6A.text: Everything here was so good--the daal (yellow lentil soup) singlehandedly saved me from my hangover misery. The tandoor and chicken marsala were also delicious.   We got here at noon on Sunday and there was about a 10 minute wait for a table but it's oh so worth it.   Like my friend said, forget the fancy $60 buffets. Get yourself to the best buffet in town for only $11.

w6Yl2ZBmY6zhMnzdFHtnGQ.text: I hear that the Chicken Vindaloo was too salty, but their butter chicken and garlic naan were made, just right. I like how fresh everything tasted, the staff was friendly, and they played Bollywood movies on the TV in the corner to add to the ambience. Like most other Indian restaurants, it was very reasonably priced.

xOQA9xqakQNO8cktAwjqQA.text: My favorite Indian place in Vegas. I absolutely love these guys. Food is amazing I grab take-out or dine in at least a couple times a month. They are all so nice. My wife and I realized we'd accidentally left our sons iPad somewhere the other night and we thought it may have been at the restaurant, when we called we were so happy to hear they found it and were willing to hold it for safe keeps me a couple days until we got back in town to pick it up. Can't say enough good things about these guys. Highly recommend to anyone local or visiting you won't be disappointed.

mZlT2SFu55DoWOMgxbLIHA.text: Very nice Nepali/Indian meal. Their service is a bit slow but you really won't realize it (unless you are very hungry like I was). Like all other Indian restaurants in Vegas it's crowded most times.

YocCkhDQgigsncyeyqgh0Q.text: My craving for Indian food comes once in a blue moon, and finally that blue moon was shining so bright!....Nah, just kidding, but as far as I can remember, the last times we've had Indian food was the CMYEs at Namaste and Mint, Walking to India Masala after helping set up for the first Nerdy Dancing and most recently, apps at Mantra Masala which was okay.  This called for a visit that was long overdue, so we scrolled down the list and picked the highest rated place in town which was Mt. Everest. At $10.99 for a lunch buffet of a pretty good spread that would please just about any palate:  Basmati and Sweet Rice, Jhukuni Aloo, Vegetable Samosas, Punjabi Kadi, Palak Paneer, Mattar Paneer, Gajar Halwa, Chicken Curry, Goat Curry, Chili Chicken, Chicken Makhani, Tandoori Chicken, Salad Bar, Assorted Chutneys, Naan, and Rice Pudding. I tried every offering once, then went back for seconds and thirds of my favorites, the sweet rice, goat curry, punjabi kadi, and both paneer dishes. Honestly one of the best lunch deals in town.  Service was great, water glasses and our naan basket was replenished quickly, and you can watch and listen to some Bollywood action while enjoying your meal. Looking forward to returning, and this time, no need to wait for that blue moon!.....ALOHA!!!  Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uu  4.5  YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(38/365) "Bomb Bites And Bollywood Beats"
