YPBDwqm_X6ofRI4ac7Dspw.text: Been to Vegas multiple times but never went for the Indian Cuisine but this time finally decided to try the Indian also. Now comes the time for the making the decision making and after reading the reviews this restaurant was picked. Its little off the main strip. The location is in sort of a strip mall but as it the first place from the main road so don't worry you wont miss it :).  Now lets talk with the ambiance, so this wont blow out your mind and just standard.  The food variety is good for both veg and non-veg. There was good selection of the non-veg and generally the mutton is not easy to cook and this place has mutton served the day we went and luckily it was not under-cooked.  The nan's were hot and fresh.  The staff is friently and from Nepal. The owner didn't charge the money for the kids which I am not sure if all the other resturants do that.   In the end i have to say I can out with yummy food in my tummy.  If you are in vegas and want to try Indian i will recommend this place.

zU8QEnSP_mCCweP4UEPdTA.text: Dinner was amazing! Highly recommend. Shared 3 dishes with friends and we loved everything.

T5ZqJo-MnGa25A7Uwzr9hQ.text: Great restaurant, friendly stuff.... did I say the food was Yummy ... perfect

XGfiwGYTYB2FTF1oczMYtg.text: Came here for the first time for the buffet. Everything was very delicious, tasted fresh, and it was also surprising the amount of options they had. The price was cheap too! We will be coming back again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BestYN9SyuLotVxhL5thDg.text: This was the best Indian dining experience I've ever had. Was nervous about the atmosphere and feeling out of place but the crowd is a mix of all types of people! It smelled so good! All of the food is hot, fresh, colorful, flavorful! Most of them menu is meatless so it's great for vegetarians. Try eating with your hands! Don't take more food than you know you can finish, it felt disrespectful to do that because everything is so home made with so much love. Seems like the staff is family and this is definitely home for them!

UZQu86-OJ3btVMo-aBg9BQ.text: Timely delivery on the strip. Mango lassi was great. Goat biryani was good. Little on spicy side but I enjoyed it.

o342yy65lfmMmyWbqDtx9A.text: Below average.   - navratan korma was sugary and not creamy - palak paneer was not creamy and lacked the normal strong creamy-spinach flavor (probably was undercooked) - the rice was above average - the kulcha was below average, what I might expect if I ever tried to make it - the garlic naan was pretty good  I ordered these things at lunch, so perhaps their good chef was busy making the buffet items.

TXB6m-4moIAiIkP1c0-a6g.text: If you are used to old and recycled food cooked by inexperienced people, then you will love this place. This is the worst Indian restaurant in entire North America and I have been to 100's.

3zP_zD9fx1FYwAEUSBcOzQ.text: First time here and won't be the last. My friend and I had vegetable samosas which were 2 big pieces that came with green and red sauce. Our server had given us papad chips to start out before ordering. I had the vegetable curry and my friend had the shrimp spicey rice dish. I noticed alot of pick up orders on a Friday night.

AZgeEqXuj-UqGmFxvdDKng.text: Fantastic!!! Chicken dishes were perfectly prepared. Tender goat curry, mild to medium spices (I'm not a fan of tongue-burners), sweet carrot halwah (ground), sweet orange rice, potatoes and eggplant, palak paneer (spinach), samosas, naan, pakoras, yellow Dahl ... all wonderful. This was 12/24 and the place was packed for lunch. But the staff was gracious and efficient at getting all seated quickly. The chaffing dishes never ran out despite the crush of the 80% Indian/Pakistani clientele. My only suggestion would be to not add sugar to the raita. Otherwise ... a solid winner.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MaAqKIFcp5rL8ekH4ATSCA.text: Good food for Indian in the area. Bit far and middle of nowhere but worth the drive when craving good Indian food. Other places in area not as great.

AGScV5OPy019cYDQDQMELw.text: My girlfriend and I are regulars here!!! Their butter chicken is the best in town by far!!! The staff is very friendly and has given us free dessert several times! The carrot pudding is very good. Super delicious!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vp0Ue6DiBKIRcojbSoMUFQ.text: We came here for lunch buffet when I was majorly craving Indian food and my husband insisted we finally try something other than our usual place, Mint.  The food was honestly good (and spicier than Mint, which was a welcome change of pace) but the surroundings are kinda bleh and we didn't get refills on our naan and we had to wait forever in between pop refills. The service was pretty iffy. The buffet selection is decent and I liked that they had samosas on the buffet.  The food was good and I wouldn't object to going back but there are other places that I think offer a better all-around experience.

Rm0-_o5mhrn3vdNHRf-ChQ.text: I love this place!! This is my 4th time coming here. I live near Henderson and it's worth the drive and traffic. I'm 9 months pregnant and am craving spicy lamb curry With mix vegetables. It smells so delicous in here and outside. The customer service is amazing as always. The place is clean and the ambiance is relaxing especially after having a hected day. Will continue my loyalty at this restaruant!

BLlMmOoncxnyHSULj11CWg.text: Amazing Indian food! The naan is always soft and warm. I've ordered chicken tikka masala, chicken makhani, and the chicken kadai entrees. All of which were amazing. I really like spicy food, but ordering medium spice (level 5) was enough for me. My favorite appetizer is the chicken momo.  This is the only Indian restaurant in town I go to. Definitely recommend!  Also, the owner is very nice and welcoming.

YoNFOTLu-LyQ3TVU9-_k6A.text: Very good food. The curry and flavors were thorough with a hint of spice here and there. The service was amazing, with constant checks from the excellent owner. Desert was the best, with the rice pudding flavorful added on to the special ice cream, delightful to the taste buds. It has a unique name i dont recall. Overall, amazing service and awesome taste.

1OXZazzOrYJWDov5qKkJiQ.text: Went here based on reviews.  Probably drove by 100 times but never checked out.  It is a great restaurant, good service/great food/good pricing/ good selection.  Definitely will be back.

GOVUs4ldIHOpnJTq5d5Ydg.text: My husband and I frequent Mt. Everest every date night. The food is perfectly delicious and they have plenty of vegetarian options for me. The service is always excellent, and the staff is invariably friendly and helpful when looking for a new dish to try. If you're looking for delicious and reasonably priced food, I highly commend Mt. Everest.

vAvbvdA8oqQueFbBh34UDg.text: My son and I stopped in for the buffet lunch and we were very impressed! Friendly staff, delicious variety of Indian dishes on the buffet AND an excellent price. We love Indian cuisine and Mt. Everest did not disappoint! Thanks to Yelp we found an awesome restaurant off the strip...We will definitely return and tell our friends!

MJzmhGBb2FGEFyrjhtKrVw.text: Lovely Indian place. We were initially a little hesitant since the outside doesn't look that appealing, but the ambiance inside, as well as the food, was wonderful! Recommend the veg. momos!

YeMkd0KtWjE3reorLrzJQA.text: Husband and I love coming here for lunch buffet, the food is always tasty.  Today was no exception but after finishing our first trip to the buffet my husband points out their health department grade C.  I'm like a C what does that mean? Varmints?  He googles and sees they most recently received 39 violations.  39? Yikes we both feel sick.  Knowing it's all in our head we still stop eating and leave.  We both wanted to vomit for the next 2 hrs.  Why does a restaurant not take the health code seriously?  We hope they start, and when they get an A back we will be back.

XG8fnKQzb2i0wnRhLDBEPA.text: It was really good lunch. Great food & great service. We enjoyed Kheer & Gazar ka Halwa.

RRJ7ebY0etA2gDuv3pGCYw.text: I've had a lot of Indian food in my life, and this is definitely my favorite place to go for it. I probably eat here 1-2 times per month, and I have yet to be disappointed. My go-to is the Saag, but I usually eat off of my friends' plates as well and it's all been delicious. The customer service here is unparalleled, and I always feel like my business is appreciated. Often it is the owner serving us. The only downside I'd have to say is that the food is so yummy I usually accidentally over-eat to an uncomfortable level... But I guess that's my own fault!

rjxF96JBBoILdWs1DsAr_Q.text: Being an ex-pat Brit, I've searched for many years for the best Indian restaurant in my adopted home. A couple of years ago I discovered this wonderful restaurant almost on my doorstep. At last I found my "go to" place for a curry away from "home". I come here nearly every week and of course it's nice to be warmly welcomed by the owner Prakash, and his staff and then to be treated so well. I and other members of my family have probably had everything on the menu but being a creature of habit, my favorites are: lamb saag, chicken tikka masala, aloo gobi, mushroom mutter masala, keema naan. These dishes are consistently fabulous. Other notables include the tandoori mix grill, kadai chicken and chicken pakora. I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough. Between the outstanding food and wonderful service I believe it is the very best Indian restaurant in Las Vegas.

_3svo6e0e3_kE0mwy7iH-g.text: My bff and I wanted good Indian food.  Yelp led us to a different Indian restaurant but because it was New Year's Eve and there was a ton of traffic crossing Las Vegas Blvd, we opted to go here instead.  We were happy with our choice!  My favorite Indian dishes are Tikka Masala and Palak Paneer with naan.  However, we saw that there was a dinner buffet line.  We asked, and to our surprise, it was only $10.99!  Sold.  Typically, dinner buffets at restaurants have a limited selection.  At Mt. Everest, pretty much all of their entrees are included in the buffet.  I can't remember everything, but I know they had about 8 different main dishes (including my two faves above, and about 3 different curries), samosas, dessert, and fresh fruit.  They bring unlimited fresh naan to your table.  Everything was so good.  We are definitely coming back next time we're in town.  Definitely worth the $11!  I came here on New Years Eve and at the end of the night, the server gave me a rose.  How sweet!

x4RaT2wdQM60xI9Wkzg-YQ.text: This is a gem in vegas. Food reasonably priced and tasted very good. Good selection of curries. Had good parking space. Only thing was the older meat that one felt was reheated on some dishes. Otherwise everything was good.

rCqyLXACgh_r9RVt8u1ISA.text: Got here at exactly 5:00, we were seated and given papadam right away. The staff were friendly. Food was delicious, & the chai tea was excellent, the best I've had. It was just a little bit of a wait but I didn't care since I had all night, lol.   I shared the appetizer with my bf; it Really  filled me up.i was done after that. Great price! Must try Mt Everest thali specials for $21.99, trust me its a lot of food. Didn't I mention, awesome customer service?! For sho'

2MhVbA56Umv4z9tiU_tbbg.text: Awesome food and great service, just like in India where they make you feel at home. The nepali momos are a big hit, again just like back home. Strongly suggest the goat curry, chicken Tikka masala and yellow daal. Will definitely come back next time we are in Vegas.

L7OqQpmU2DRYLxDGsWTSSQ.text: Amazing! We had a little bit of everything! Both samosas were fresh and delicious! The tikka masala and saag paneer were my favorites!

mikDj_AvZPQ9hD8I1vSEhQ.text: Great Indian food!!! Go go gooo!

ZX4kUFo5hrPwpn_IniVrcg.text: Brilliant - flavorful and delicious..  For vegetarians try : - Paneer Tikka Masala - go for 8 if you like spicy - Shahi Paneer - Dal Makhani - Biryani - Garlic naan and onion kulcha  Avoid: Dal Tadka (Dal has no Tadka!! - Compare Dal tadka from India Palace on 505 E Twain Ave)

HVw135mKUvhi1UL0IGmiqA.text: After Misti Y. suggested Mt. Everest to me. I had to stop by to try out their $9.99 lunch buffet. I had such a pleasant experience here. I dined solo and arrived around 1:00pm (buffet ends at 3pm). The food was still hot & delicious. The rice was still soft. And it wasn't too loud or too busy. The server and the manager were so incredibly polite. They periodically checked on me to make sure everything was to my liking and my water cup was always filled to the brim!  The food was awesome! A variety of lamb and chicken curry. A few vegetarian options. The samosas were on the salty side but still incredibly delicious. They had plain rice and a bright orange sweet rice which was awesome but I preferred to eat the plain rice with all the sauces and meats. The naan was fluffy and as delicious can be. ! I managed to scarf down a whole basked by myself!  Next time I'll be asking to try the garlic naan too. I saw a table next to me order it and it looked awesome!  The food speaks for itself but the service is what will keep me coming back.  Two thumbs up.

sLKCImCOpSDKtwP-pov4rg.text: Went here for the Lunch buffet a couple of days ago.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't my favourite.  I will, however, come back again for sure in the near future as I know the nature of Indian buffet is to constantly rotate the types of food.  For those just trying out Indian for the first time, there will be at least some thing there you will like.  The place was clean, white table cloths and stemmed water goblets on all the tables, and they are very attentive to the used plates and the empty water.  Worth the price for sure.

BlHHv2-7V1myCygAB4yKoQ.text: This restaurant is really wonderful. Went on a Friday evening, and was greeted by a friendly host right away. Appetizers and main course arrived quickly. The food was absolutely divine. The flavors were rich and full, spicy, but not too spicy. The kind of food that you want to keep eating even when you are full. The staff were all very friendly and attentive. My family will definitely be going to this restaurant again.

ifaV4Qo032G9PuLvqj-0mg.text: We tried Mt.Everest a few weeks ago and we were very please. I always order the highest level of spicey available and I very please with the amount of sweat built up on my brow. They even gave us a to-box full of rice for our leftovers the next day. They really want to please.

KDqXUV12KBOQ3lhWoSnnuQ.text: As a kid I used to hang out with a lot of guys from Sri lanka and Malaysia and this place reminded me of the food they made.  I didn't look at the menu much on this visit because that buffet called to me, teasing my nose like a cartoon depiction of the smell of food tickling Scooby's nose.  The curry selection here is fantastic and so are all the other dishes on the buffet.  This is definitely my favorite Indian cuisine restaurant now and I will come here anytime my better half lets me lol.

JSW_nJZAOcH80baa4essKg.text: Most pathetic food.. If I am sitting at the restaurant and posting this review, you can imagine how bad the food is... You can smell oil while eating.. No variety in food.. We went seeing the reviews on yelp, but guessing things have changed. Worst Indian food.. No recommended at all..

K46VkE2ip7RMnDiuF9OOyg.text: We had lunch today at Mt Everest India's Cuisine with an out of town guest. We have been there before, but we feel this is the very best Indian Restaurant in the Las Vegas Area and beyond.  All the food on the buffet was outstanding. We especially love the spinach and lamb and chicken curry.  We had some special Indian hot tea for our digestion after the meal.  The two kinds of Naan was awesome.  The owner is extremely pleasant and made us feel welcome. Our guest was impressed with the variety of food on the buffet and remarked that everything she tried was delicious.  The service was outstanding and the value of the meal was incredible,  I can't say enough good things about this restaurant and recommend it very highly.

lpwkENR4HTRx1OnAZdD7vg.text: I'm not an expert on Indian food , it's probably not even on my list of top 10 cuisines, Maybe every 4 or 5 years I'll have a craving for Indian food. I'm more of a Japanese or Thai  curry person. After today's meal at mt everest I will b eating more Indian curries . The lunch buffet was really good . Everything was hot and fresh,the naan bread both garlic and plain was super . Everything I ate I enjoyed  daal,tandoori chix, some spinach and cheese dish a lot of other foods don't remember the names. Service was attentive and the restaurant look alot better inside then out,I think it was a burger king in it's former life . Like I said not an expert on Indian food, but this was goooood!!

6ElBYg7zVLlfvddDmCzl3A.text: Up until now I never really liked Indian food, especially a buffet.  Everything just seemed soggy, overcooked and old.  THIS restaurant however,  is completely the opposite of my preconceived notion.   We went for the lunch buffet.  It was amazing.  Everything was fresh and hot.  A very good selection of both vegetarian and meat dishes.  Most everything I tried was absolutely delicious.  I went back for seconds and even thirds.  The next day, I came back for more!    The restaurant was clean, the decor tasteful and comfortable.  The price was very good too.   Careful though, all that curry can get to you.  ;)

cyyPpTZw_1ZESBqvkrPAkw.text: I visited this restaurant in June, and I had their lunch buffet.  The food was excellent, and their prices reasonable for good Indian Cuisine.  I would definitely go back there when I return to the Vegas area.

0HJvI_m84QxSdjelYrZjxA.text: Outstanding! My favorite Indian restaurant in Las Vegas. Very busy during the lunchtime buffet, evening dinners are more relaxed and comfortable.

7J2JgXIsHjaERmu4zBEecA.text: 3 stars is really giving the benefit of the doubt here.  I would say service was a solid 4 stars (although there was a bit of the soft upsell here on beer and extra side items like multiple orders of naan), but food was 2 stars, 2.5 stars tops.  I really like the strong and bold flavors of Indian cuisine, and also the quality of the sauces, which tend to be very smooth, with supporting notes of texture like cashew or other items to provide some 'tooth' to a dish.  I found the sauces here to be very heavy, a bit 'gloppy' and just lacking in quality - the sauces just weren't inviting to me.  Actual taste of the sauces was ok - serviceable, but nothing great.    Also, lamb was pretty tough, and chicken had small bones (the kinds that should not be in a dish, small enough to catch in one's throat and cartiledge - just unappetizing.  Paneer dish we had was one of the better items, but sauce still had that heavy and unpleasant texture.  I have not yet found an Indian restaurant in Vegas that measures up to Origin India in its heyday.

k4n58uKwbxWMZxCsLvMp6g.text: I give a 4 star for the food and service.  My wife and I were a bit hesitant when we only saw 2 others eating in the restaurant. Also it looks like a converted Burger King and the decor is a bit drab, but decided to try it anyway.  We had 2 great dishes and the Naan was excellent.  If you can overlook the very basic decor and consider the food end service, this place is great.  We would eat here again.  A note to the owners if you read this. Get rid of the florescent lighting and add more soft lighting. Maybe get spend a bit to warm up the atmosphere and you will have a winner restaurant! good luck.  Prices seemed mid range for Indian Cuisine. I think we had two dishes and Naan totaling about $25 before taxes. Very fair for quality food.

lp2LdBQlbhRwbWQ1hxeaLA.text: I went there for a lunch buffet with a group of 4 people during our visit to Las Vegas. Food was decent. Being an Indian, I would expect the items on the buffet to be little bit hot and spicy, but it wasn't the case here. Some of the dishes were sweet with little or no salt. That is the reason i gave it 4 stars. The garlic naans served was great. The kheer, gulab jamun and sweet honey rice were good. Overall I recommend it. Will definitely visit the next time i come to visit Vegas.

--8E9xGc1p6Z9Pic5J40fw.text: It seems like I spend most of my life in this place and for good reason. The food is amazing, I've tried almost all Indian restaurants in Las Vegas and have been eating Indian food for over 30 years. This place is the best in town. Highly recommend the Chicken Tikka Masala and Kadai Chicken. That said all dishes are great, even veggies dishes are delicious. They also have a lunch buffet 7days per week, which is also dangerously delicious! A real festival for the taste buds! ;)

Fkby2IAanSugP2YQvhg3iw.text: We went for the lunch buffet, which was absolutely amazing!  The service was great and the food was unforgettable. I highly recommend this place.  The location is easily accessible too.

C3aPs5gpervdSSIjrig6rA.text: If you like Indian food, this is the place to go in Vegas! Pleasant atmosphere, waiters are very friendly. And the food.....first, he naan bread is the best I ever had in the USA or Europe, I had a chicken korma , it was perfect, creamy, delicate and a big portion. love this place, will be back soon!!

EMZONz0ikd0tirwQeyz_VQ.text: Lunch buffet was mediocre.  Flavors were good but meat quality was below average.  Service was average.  Nothing special here.

AYbiLbQsDL2z1qfgNPeY0A.text: This place may have tasty Indian food but somehow I felt bloated all day after eating here. Maybe because of baking soda in the bread. I remember hostel messes in India doing that to keep people from eating too much??? I agree with some of the reviewers here that the Owner/waiter needs to have an attitude makeover. He scowls if people ask for another round of nans.Thankfully his cellphone did not go off while we were there...And rice pudding as a desert! I can't remember when a Indian resturant got away with pulling that stunt off. India has so many wonderful deserts and surely rice pudding is somewhere down at the bottom of that list....If you have to eat Indian in LV, maybe this would be my recommendation just because others are worse (Mint-ok, Origin-terrible)

6zk2_Gnvkp1Gcx6pebiIYg.text: I visited this restaurant last night while in town on a business trip based on previous reviewers from yelp. I was glad that the outward appearance of the restaurant had been mentioned, as it may have kept me from going in if I had just been driving by. Once you enter though, it's a great environment with the white tablecloths and napkins. As someone dining alone, I particularly enjoyed the Bollywood playing in the corner. It kept me entertained while I was waiting for my food, which was an excellent break from the standard of playing with my phone. I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, which is my basis for judging a restaurant (much like Pad Thai at a Thai restaurant). The sauce was amazingly creamy, and had a slow burn to it, which I find the hallmark of a good sauce. I want the spice, but not at the expense of the flavor. The naan was perfect with a crispy edge and soft center. Ideal for sopping up the sauce.   But even more than the food, the service was phenomenal. Everyone is very friendly, but give you your space. My water never got below half-way full, and I can put away water like a camel, so that's impressive. And when I had a problem, they were endlessly gracious and worked with me while I figured it out. Few restaurants would take the time or effort to come up with a mutually satisfying solution the way that they did.  End result: If I lived here, I'd weigh a million pounds because I would eat here all the time. As it is, I'll have to settle for stopping in every time I'm in town.

8HyTG-w2cpogt3I-ZByKOA.text: Did a lot of Yelp searching for indian restaurant for dinner on our stay here in Las Vegas. That led us here and we loved it. Environment is delightful. White linen tablecloth. Private booth. Enjoyed Navarattan Korma and Paleek Paneer and garlic naan, mango chutney, tasty mango lassi. Delicious and authentic. And great service. Owner very hospitable. We loved it!

C9E3Saw0L4HS6ICpULQH_A.text: Great service, one of the best Indian and Nepali food, so recommend if u wanna eat Indian food this the place to go to.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian sambosa, please open it a lil to cool
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Achar, if u love spicy ask.
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prawn and mushroom masala

5cTR_Iw3EVksMdadVGHydw.text: My boyfriend and I came here to try something new and let me tell you, I was kind of skeptical about it at first. But I am so happy we decided to give this place a try. This was the first time we had real authentic Indian food.  We ordered one of the Thali specials: Mount Everest India's Cuisine Special. Which was a platter of mixed appetizer, papadam (Indian chips) chicken tikka masala, dal makhani, palak panner, lamb curry, chicken tikka (4pcs), rice, naan, raita. When the platter came out, I honestly didn't know which was what, but everything was SO good!  We also had the Tandoori Chicken. This was my favorite dish we ordered. It was chicken baked in a clay oven, marinated in yogurt, garlic, ginger, herbs, and spices on an onion and bell pepper bed on a skillet. All the dishes were so flavorful from the spices. And the portions were huge! We ordered a lot for just us two and only spent $43. But we had yummy leftovers to take home. :)  Service was quick and friendly; always kept our waters full. They also have an all you can eat lunch buffet. Will be returning.

WGv7Nu5UyHzdpBOyBuzZ4w.text: This is the best Indian food in Vegas. It is probably the top 10 in places to eat in Vegas. Ask Prakash to take care of you. You won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All this for under $25

LZcA3_DYmFqEO5KqCOqY9w.text: Love this place. It's always delicious, and the service is always stellar. Tonight I had veggie korma, which is great because it also comes with paneer chunks. I had a mango lassi and garlic naan, too. My husband and sister in law shared lamb korma and chicken tiki masala, and they loved their meals so much that they had no leftovers. I look forward to my korma later this evening or tomorrow for lunch!

a_FT9lPWUT_pljvevuJuOA.text: Really incredible food, great service and unbeatable prices. This is our favorite Indian restaurant in Las Vegas!  Every time we come in, the service is quick and friendly. The quality of the food is consistently excellent. I dream of their garlic naan :)  The portions are generous and splittable if you aren't too hungry (or want to fill up on garlic naan) and the restaurant is beautifully appointed.

fHmzzZzfpa-6i8U9VWZF3Q.text: It was my first time having Indian food so I was excited to try Mount Everest. I went for dinner with a group of 7 people. We didn't make a reservation but they were still able to accommodate us pretty quickly. We ordered paneer pakora and chicken pakora as appetizers, both which were really good. They also offered free papadom along side the appetizers. Most of us ordered chicken entrees, all which were pretty delicious. A friend of mine ordered the prawn vindaloo which I really liked. The dishes were rich and spicy and there was enough where we could share with each other.   I would definitely come back. The prices were good and the staff was attentive and friendly. The only thing that got me is that I thought the restaurant would be bigger than I expected but other than that, I liked Mt. Everest.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kadai chicken, chicken vindaloo, garlic naan, and chicken korma.

CdCuA0BUGE_SGulq4LYAZQ.text: Look I'm no Indian food connoisseur. What I ate there seem to taste OK.  The big problem for this place is that the bathroom was infested with roaches and they have a glue trap on the floor with a bunch of dead roaches on it.  I don't care if Martha Stewart was in the kitchen cooking I can't eat from a roach infested place. I will say the staff was very nice so unfortunate

LMDeO_Xaa2U9qRDHFgENvQ.text: I have no idea what Indian food taste like, but, I could tell their food was great because the restaurant was packed. Lunch was buffet style, so I was able to try different dishes. Curries were bit spicy, but, I was told to mix yogurt and it worked out pretty good! Orange colored rice was very tasty. There were many vegetarian dishes.

yE6I5OOHeq6oMVWg18YHpw.text: Oh it's so good. I enjoy the chili chicken. The owner is a good man too, all good staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good lighting, clean and really nice staff.
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmmmmmmmmmm -- awesome chili chicken

Wxgm3YlE5gGTBE5NaUlrCw.text: My boyfriend and I went for dinner and the service and food was amazing. We were greeted with a smile and great service and the lamb was phenomenally tender and the spices were on point. I would definitely go back for dinner again. Next time we are going to have to try them out for lunch!!!  I give this place a two thumbs up!  must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KxEm6Ty2nOKy-BC45DWBNA.text: The owner was very accommodating we called in our order before the closing time stated, and he let us dine in as we were craving for Nepali/ Indian food. We were getting tired of burgers and pizza and wanted comforting home food and the food here hit the spot. It was delicious, I loved the biryani and saag paneer and the chicken momo. Would definitely come back on my next trip. Thank you for being so kind and catering to a customers needs.

O_1UMGxSGkuuWDtROtjAKA.text: Good buffet.Liked the pakora,Naan,Paneer curry(ordered ala carte).Carrot Halwa was top class,Rice Kheer was better than average.Very reasonable price and kids were charged only half price.Would visit this place again and again when in Vegas. Need to try their ala carte menu next time.

OlzwEF8beVk_07xreQnlmA.text: wonderful food! we had the lamb curry, shrimp curry and butter chicken curry tasted amazing! The service is really good, and very clean place to eat at. definitely a place to go again.

18oUzK3G_nOw3tMW30Yl1w.text: Great food at a reasonable price.  We tried the Lamb Korma and Lamb Jalfrezi.  Both were excellent and with the Garlic Naan, it was a perfect combination.  I will definitely add this restaurant to my list for a return trip the next time I am in Vegas.  Highly recommend it.

CqnUQBM3iWhntv0P-cZsEw.text: The food is amazing really original Indian food , the best service .. We going there every two weeks and every time it's amazing ... We love this place and we always going back

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We finished every thing.. It was perfect

NOCOYegYVyJ4Qm3bFwv_vw.text: We came to Las Vegas on vacation. I crave for  MOMO whenever I travel, so we searched for a good Nepali restaurant and came across Mt Everest. The vegetarian momos were delicious and the sauce was amazing. While leaving Las Vegas, we wanted to eat some more of those momos, but the owner informed us that buffet was ready to serve, and we could order momo if we wanted to during  he buffet hour. I have tried multiple Indian buffet, but here daal and vegetables tasted like Nepali homemade khana. I loved the Gulab jamun!! Overall, food was amazing! By the time we were done with our food, I saw the place was almost full with customers enjoying the food!!

Lh2jf0GkOAvTsypbYFy1qQ.text: Authentic food and great service! Filling not only through quantity but through quality as well. Really amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jz_F2P4dnxg3dm4n2U1XNw.text: I ordered delivery with postmates first time with this restaurant and i gotta say that this is the best tasting indian food i'm ever tried.

ifmYNdmeQDAVQU8ebGCqjA.text: Ok all you Yelpers and non-Yelpers... although I have not really left a review before - here it goes.  After spending 25 years in a part of the country where Indian food ( great food at that ) was as common as a Starbucks - I got used to my week having curry stains on my fingers, and then it happened, I moved.... and moved to a place that not only did not have Indian food, but the town had not one red light, nor anyone who liked THAT type of food. Uggggggggg.  Then on a trip to Las Vegas, I found Mt. Everest, and fell in love!  The wonderful people there understand what great food, friendship, and service is. I had even left a book there and they held on to it for over a week until I could return. I wonder if it was my subconscious having me forget it so that I had to go back for another wonderful experience. Yummmmmmm !!!  To top it off, they even called me a cab. I felt like royalty, and left knowing that I have not only found the best food in Vegas, but that I had also made friends.   I will soon be moving my business to Vegas, and know that when I return there is a place with friends, and great food, to come to anytime I get the urge.  If you are looking for a wonderful experience, and don't want to make a mistake about where to eat - This Place Rocks!

vb9-pIGTKdlk-1IvLWSKbw.text: One of the best Indian restaurants in Las Vegas! I wrote a more detailed review more than a year back. This one is just to confirm that this place is still as good and continues to maintain its great tasting food!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hUFdX5HRGufMafuDnn5dpQ.text: Excellent food Excellent service The honey rice is out of this world and you won't find it anywhere else The best Indian at the best price.

5FkiT8EKZeHOZIecc-9KrQ.text: Reception was good. Veg Biryani is yuck. Nan was okay and so is the curry. Ambience was okay.

tF86guT0xFo4CjB7pc0sLg.text: This restaurant had excellent service and food - a great combo. We went around 1 pm, their peak time, and even during the stress the staff took the time to get to know my baby niece's name and catered to us before we were even seated. They were incredibly patient and humble. I've yet to meet restaurant staff like this.   FOOD: We went during the lunch buffet time. It is $12.99 / person. Every dish they presented at the buffet offered a different delicious taste that my entire family enjoyed. My personal favorites were the Punjabi Kadi and Daal Makhani. The gulab jamun was also perfectly made - not too sweet. The in-house made samosas and pakora were also tasty! I honestly didn't want to leave. The food was that good.  SERVICE: The staff took the time to speak to us in Hindi and English. They refilled our waters and took away our used plates quickly. (These are things I notice at a buffet style restaurant.) They had a baby seat for my niece and were readily available to answer our questions and help us with a SMILE. Also the bathrooms were clean!  If you're in the Vegas area and are looking to try a family friendly authentic Indian restaurant with lots of both vegetarian and non vegetarian options, I'd strongly recommend giving the place a go!  Some things to note- for lunch it's only a $12.99 buffet and dinner is a la carte.  I didn't take a picture... was too busy eating haha

sw5tEVqkHdieuTsG5CpUog.text: This is an AMAZING restaurant. We had the mango lassi and mutton biryani. The mutton biryani was amazing and cooked to perfection. The meat was tender and rice was flavourful. The mango lassi tasted amazing as well. This place has a huge wait time for dinner. But the wait was definitely worth it.

_p6nuNaKVCU6oh26iB2TNw.text: I don't know how many times I've told people about this place, but am sure plenty! This is really my go to spot for Indian food. From their lunch buffet which is delicious and very affordable to their abundant a la carte dinner menu. My family and I go as much as we can, their service and amazing food is unbeatable.   Our favorites Samosa- we make our own Samosa chat when at buffet Chicken Tikka Masala - of course Paneer Saag Meat Tali Plate Lamb Biryani  Bhindi Masala  I mean I can list all but honestly everything in the menu is amazing, portions are great and the prices are very reasonable.   Definitely check out the lunch buffet $10.99 so you can taste a variety of dishes and they serve their top sellers on the buffet line. So you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Lunch Buffet

iPl4Q4JYqdhnJQERDXVv2g.text: AMAZING FOOD! AMAZING SERVICE! AMAZING ATMOSPHERE! Tikka Massala was spectacular! The place felt very homie and well taken care of. It really was the best indian food Ive ever had!

zhxtTxQEXFOx3WQyP3IweA.text: Been in three times for lunch buffet now. Really, for the price, it can't be beat!  Couldn't help but notice that the clientele is overwhelmingly Indian - which speaks loads about the quality and authenticity of the food.  With the large crowds at a relatively small buffet line, it can get a bit chaotic. But food seems to get replenished quite quickly, so it is always hot and fresh. Nothing sits around long.

gZadkjeUx76Di4I-lgbHWw.text: Not as expected like the reviews given and it's more of Nepali cuisine taste not the Indian taste... I expected more and it's just simple menu & the rice was dry hard, not worth the price they are charging for the buffet....

eOfKuhr-BwivxOlc_N8szQ.text: Great food not too far off the strip.  Every thing we tried was excellent!  Would definitely go back when in the mood for Indian food!

bfGm4j392zxW2WNQelPyEw.text: I have never been inside, I always order take out. Delicious! Tikka Masala sauce is great and the chicken is really moist but not soggy. It was my husbands first time eating this cuisine so I ordered him lamb vindaloo, he is hooked. My favorite dish always is malai kofta, very hard to find made well, this place makes is amazing. I'll be back for 3rds!

ziFOXmOLh_oVJbHKZ6MV2Q.text: I com here for the weekday buffet which is from 11-4pm. Going into it I would recommend the garlic bread naan. They make it fresh and it comes out hot. I would say their flavors are very good, more so than Mint(another restaurant). I love the chicken tikka masala, the sweet rice, chili chicken and pakora. Check this place out for their lunch buffet which is a good value.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Indian goodness

TACI6vFx-DgK8bEo07GO0g.text: Never did I ever think I would say an Indian cuisine buffet was amazing, but Mount Everest did just that.   Coming from San Francisco, you would never find a buffet boasting Indian cuisine with the high quality, great taste and potent spices, decent cleanliness that Mount Everest has.   It's a really simple buffet dining experience, simply grab a plate and scoop some rice, salad, and the various curry meat dishes they have. Their curry lamb dish was super tasty. To top it all off, ask for the Garlic Naan with a small sample of their spicy chili sauce (if you're into that).

NFzpom8UXpedR-P5WzS4rg.text: We went for the Sunday Lunch buffet and it was delicious! Great selection of curries, the vegetable korma is the best I've had. Highly recommend to anyone trying to escape the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zVGuoW36WAayzqmPs8gWKA.text: This place gave me nuts when they knew I had allergies and made me go to the hospital. Do not go here. The management does not care about the health.  They tried to say there are no nuts but when your lip flairs up instantly after eating the curry it's hard to deny it.  Then I got hives aall over and spent the night in the hospital.

4h92q15gE0KBeDXzT9wmlQ.text: Definitely some of the BEST food in Vegas. Mom and I have been steady customers for a few years now. The food is consistently delicious and the staff is friendly. The vegetable korma is a blockbuster win when it comes to creamy and savory. A great selection of stunning dishes prepared by brilliant chefs-and they're open 7 days a week. Must be tiring, but they pull it off each time.

Yt46jGRAfRT-a5WzIdQZGw.text: This was a pleasant surprise of our Las Vegas trip. The food was absolutely the best Indian food we have had in LV. I ordered the goat curry and my wife ordered malai kofta along with garlic naan. The food was great and they cooked perfectly according to our spice level.  Great unpretentious Indian food that is reasonably priced.

Kol8_O6HWA1S1XQvUGkdgg.text: I have been searching for butter chicken in Vegas for probably 5 years now. Saw a few lukewarm recommendations but nothing spectacular. Decided to search for samosas the other night and this restaurant popped up! And what does it have? Delicious spicy butter chicken!  Just perfect. Cute little restaurant. Clean. Good staff. Amazing food!

QW3536ztOqV280FC0F2Onw.text: This restaurant is easy to find and one might describe it as, "a hole in the wall." At first I was a little skeptical of the environment but when approached by the friendly staff I soon realized it doesn't take a beautiful building to enjoy a dinning experience. The dishes we chose were delicious and perfectly spiced to our temperature tolerance. One suggestion would be to note the beer volume when ordering! The Taj Mahal was humongous! When the server brought our beverages, I felt like I was ordering to the tune of my college years! If you are craving Indian food, this is certainly a great option~

pChz1prWUJj73eVaqILuRg.text: Got take out which was ready on time and the staff was friendly. I ordered butter chicken, palak paneer, and vegetable korma with garlic naan and raita. One of the better Indian places in Las Vegas.

ARba3nnrmwEM1whCMdXS-w.text: OMG this place is out of the world. Such an authentic, delicious and homely food. I live in NYC and I never had such a good Indian food. My parents were visiting with me for a week trip to Vegas and don't wanna go any where else. There tea is awesome. 5 stars to tea. Staff is really friendly and guide you if you are new to cuisine. I loved this place.   After two years taste is exactly the same. This place is pricey but it's worth it. I am very happy with the food after a long day.

ysvhkIm0f7jI1S81EOb77A.text: A very generous 2 star. And that's for clean restrooms and overall cleanliness.   We went in for the lunch buffet. I will remember just 2 tastes coming out from here - Sweet and bland.   The buffet has the standard fare of veg and non veg curries along with sweet rice (rice + honey!!!?!) and basmati rice. Naan served on the table.  Of the curries I sampled, heres what they tasted like -   Mixed veg korma - sweet and creamy  Chicken curry - sweet Chicken Tikka - sweet Dal makhni - bland. And no trace of salt.  Chilli chicken - sweet. Yes, this traditionally spicy indo Chinese dish is sweet here... Akin to mandarin chicken at panda express.  Pakora - manageable but somewhat soft and soggy Tandoori chicken - cold. But perhaps better than the remaining dishes.   If you are expecting a spicy Indian fare.. Look elsewhere.

foAk-LaItUszC8G6bMWWkQ.text: Excellent lunch buffet- so fresh and full of flavor. Fresh naan brought to your table. We definitely will come again!

qC5iIzDFpLisf90cDrLnTw.text: Love this place!! Everything I've had has been fantastic!! Whether it's tikka masala, vindaloo, or korma, it's all great!!  Service is also great!

B6GmUSRVf-uO4VsQbKmEIg.text: Wowwwwww so good! Ordered delivery. Arrived on time, hot and it's some of the best authentic Indian food I have had. Will definitely re order soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AMAZING Veggie Momo

dV0IA_leWnO-rZefel-fvw.text: We went here since it was closer to the strip. The food tasted home-cooked and the staff were friendly. We had mixed vegetables and daal. The naan was fresh and delicious! Everything we had was amazing.

ieiX58qfTTcYQSgSoFeg7Q.text: We went for the lunch buffet 10.99$ a person. I was very impressed. The curries were flavorful especially the chicken tikka masala and chicken curry. I don't normally like goat but they cooked it here to taste like beef which was very nice. The naan was the BEST naan I ever had!!!!!! It was just plain naan and I wasn't expecting much but man I was wrong. It was the perfect piece; slightly sweet, chewy, salty, and so perfect. I would order fifty of these when I come back. It is a hole in the wall place that isn't well lit and it's also in a sketchy part of town, but other than that lunch buffet is a must try. And eat the naan.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

41ljjEU1F2PsLcwCZzuK2Q.text: My BFF swears by this place.  I thought it was just ok.  Nothing was remarkable.  We waited 30 minutes to get served (didn't even bring Nann bread out) but my BFF also swears it was busier than she's ever seen it (Sunday around 7pm).  If you're in the mood for Indian and you're in the area it's worth a visit.

Z6Q-sKfXBvzjW8FGUtyOKg.text: I am so AMAZED by the amazing food they have here! I was more shocked because they have great selections in their buffet! They have everything from garbanzo curry , lentils, spicy chicken curry , mutton curry , rice , naan and all the condiments that I favor ! Tamarind sauce , mint sauce , cucumbers , onions etc. And for their dessert they have numerous sweet dishes , but I didn't get to try because I was too full of the amazing food! All of these selections for 10.99!!!!! So amazing ! When in Vegas come to this place , rather than Other places in downtown Vegas!!! And let me  say the mango lassi and the chai tea get a 5/5 star rating too!! FYI if there's a wait , better wait than to say sorry

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is pretty amazing ! They even have a drive thru !! We need this in LOS ANGELES
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch buffet as you can see the great selection of food ,I and my Raja chose !

HkZGNMb7yEUcA89F59-CDg.text: I enjoyed the food and did not feel rushed which made the dining experience great. My tummy is very happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y7qEuVsy0a92T09Pjsff1g.text: I'm not a fan of spicy; but, dinner was gooooood.  We shared the Mount Everest Thali as we wanted to try different dishes and this particular selection was perfect.  Appetizer:  Mixed Appetizer  Main Dish:  Chicken Tikka Masala, Dahl Makhani, Palak Panner, Lamb Curry, Chicken Tikka, rice, naan, and Raita  Dessert: Gulab Jaman  $25 split plus tip

2oB42G4UOLEYWpp8-800aA.text: Amazing, delicious everything I wanted. Small quaint and great service. I even ordered extra to take home. Double of everything please it was that good

i8Gy8TE_uymy8_oYRKIAcQ.text: I can't explain enough of how flavorful this place is. So, I'm here for the lunch buffet which is between 11-3 pm. And it's worth the trip. Your options are bountiful but for what they have to selection is what you need to get that belly filled. Please by all means, come out here and try it yourself.

6oQuDh3AVo7SNPppHzhsiw.text: Holy cow!!! Come here for their daily buffets up until 3 pm. I discovered this place about half a year ago. Gosh, their curry actually appears in my dreams. I am not joking. I love this place, particularly, the chicken tikka masala and the honey rice. To. Dieee. For. Now, I don't go to any other Indian place. This place is my always and forever. Also I can't leave out the fact that the inside makes you feel like you're somewhere foreign and I love that too.
