rnLwKIV_qhsOI9oNCwe5YA.text: Food are delicious specially goat curry,malai kofta,mango lassi.service was great,excellent sitting area and good vibe

jrDuqwqHrkq-4RCbwwxCCg.text: Loved it!  We've been to Nepal and India.  This restaurant is the closest thing we've found to authentic Indian cuisine.  Try this place!

GkcCqOc9W2FnpLYAGTacrw.text: As an Indian, I can be very picky about the india food. That being said, this was fantastic! The buffet provided veg and non veg options. The naan was also delicious. The service was great and the price was unbeatable.

GjPxCN_SdAJLstDAmrbU0g.text: Good food and service. Highly Recommend this place to anyone visiting Las Vegas. I ordered vegetarian dishes. Taste was just perfect. Restaurant closes at 3 pm for lunch so you want to reach there latest by 2.15pm. We reached at 2.45 so had to take out. Overall happy customer  .

R34yJgbQ50_XXLMlaacJMA.text: Popped in on a whim because I wanted to eat vegetarian tonight. What a gratifying meal. I can't really spell the names of the dishes we ate, but all were flavorful, both fresh and complex, in ample portions that allowed for sharing without that grudging, resentful feeling. Somehow I have hard time imagining that anything here will disappoint. What stood out most, though, was the service. It had a wonderful lightness and alertness. No hovering, just a perfect awareness of our needs at the table and the rhythms of the meal. I'll be a regular. And in my next review I'll check the menu so I can be more specific about what I ate.   Delightful.

KCUh8Nxe2SM52BGsNVBpxg.text: They currently have a B rating. I didn't notice it till I sat down with my first plate of food, as I sat behind the register facing the back wall. I too went and tried this place due to a high rating on Yelp!   I went one hour before closing for lunch, selection was sub par. Most of the food looked greasy. I was hoping to try their Chicken Masala but they didn't have it, instead I tried something with red sauce and chicken breast, chick peas and potato with cauliflower. It was all just okay. And the Naan bread smelled rotten.   It was kinda dark and service was not friendly, the guys seemed kinda lazy. I just saw them mostly standing around and talking to each other.   I would recommend Mint for a Indian lunch buffet, it's cleaner and bright inside. More food selection and staff  are friendly and attentive!

lLTnxBomD-rAIf4MGc1c_w.text: Food was great, spice level was perfect. Had 15 min wait - but to be fair, they were quite busy and the wait was broken with papad - chutney and we ordered lassi. Momos and the accompanying chutney was authentic. Would recommend.

mDQzZBMq9qO3cmjJ4JL0SA.text: Enjoyed a delicious dinner with my husband tonight. We order veggie pakoras, tikka masala, naan bread, and the veggie korma. Everything was amazing including the customer service.

S5iLsKunpf7ARmPLpJyPsA.text: Delectable,  reasonable, very good service.  Extensive menu is kindly explained for a westerner.

AEkKN2_SHaOqQ8Zi5XaxkQ.text: Worst Indian food ever!!!! Worst Customer service ever!!!! VERY VERY unsanitary. One of the servers sneezed Infront of me in the lobby and did not even go to wash his hands.

wAQTdPst71OdTKkQtGMkZg.text: This place is pretty good, but certainly not amazing.  The meat that I ordered (meat platter) was incredibly dry.  I haven't had the lunch buffet, so I can't comment on that.  However, if the food I had was representative of the food at the buffet, I would raise my rating based on the price of the buffet alone.  That being said, I went for dinner and it was pretty pricey and I didn't think it was that great in comparison to other Indian food that I have had in Vegas. I would come back here to try the buffet, but probably won't be returning for dinner.

i1j8tVY-kcimwIT_-Xk9ZQ.text: Love this place! I've been here for dinner as well as the lunch buffet and haven't yet tried something I didn't love. Mount Everest is still my "go-to" Indian spot, despite having tried several others since my first visit. If they delivered, you bet your ass they'd be on their way to my house right now with a big bag of awesome.   Yes, everything you've heard about the "rough" location is True, but the food makes up for it. It's not a huge place either, so prepare for claustrophobia during the busy times.

-PDTLkOLPlyEgYmWLxSy_g.text: Living on the west side of town, my cravings for Indian delecacies was sated as Mt. Everest is the best Indian restaurant and the best price point and hurry up with the water refill...thanks! Just in time before I knock horns with the goat vindaloo.  Atmosphere begone! Who needs atmosphere at an AYCE Indian Buffet? Keep the curries coming! I'll be back again and again!

_lH-HSmkt1WwceOvIBYpgw.text: I love this place ! Seriously the best place for affordable and yummy Indian Food in Las Vegas . The atmosphere is great and service is ALWAYS on point.

h8rxPpmZPlKU2LGuHvDlew.text: Its hard for me to rate any indian restaurant at 5 stars because no one will ever compare to some homecooked meals by my mom.  But that being said this food was rather tasty.  They used an appropriate blend of spices that weren't overpoweringly spicy!  For an indian person I don't do as well with spicy food as one might expect.  This was a great balance of flavor amidst the kick in my mouth.  (I did ask for mild)  I came here for dinner and not going to lie was a little turned off by the outside.  Very seedy looking place.  Then I stepped inside and saw that it was decorated in a comfortable manner.  Clean and efficient enough.  (at least for appearence's sake!).  They brought out some papadum and a couple sauces to go with it. I ordered the shahi paneer which was good, (not the best I've ever had but again i'm partial to homecookin).  One little complaint I had was that I needed to ask for water a couple times as I tend to drink a lot of it while eating.  This is usually a given at higher end places, but as there was only two people working and it was rather busy i'll give them benefit of the doubt.  Also when I asked the waiter if I should try the shahi paneer or the paneer tikka masala he said he didn't know because he didn't eat vegetarian food.  (in a slightly rude manner)  Overall worth the trip and they provide a solid indian food experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic naan
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shahi paneer

L-gmCxfac7XLeR0gai4qyA.text: We decided to venture off the strip for something more authentic and visited by locals. We picked. A perfect spot!! Great service. Delicious food. Great prices. Couldn't have asked for more! Plus, they gave us complimentary dessert that was fantastic.

aoxQAJvGxbNAJqL0fwnRtw.text: BEST PLACE ON EARTH!  My brother had to point out that it was a rather crappy part of town, but I didn't notice anything. Granted there were a lot of bail bond signs around and title loan locations, but that does not mean it is a bad part of town.  Walking into the place, I was hit in the face with the smells of India, but not like it hit me in the face with a metal bat, more like a large fluffy pillow. We were seated and given our menus. As some of the others on here have said the mixed platter is excellent, the waiter is also very hydrating.  I thought I was in Delhi while eating. Without the monkeys, or the 2 billion people around. It has been almost 24 hours and i am still stuffed. This place has made me rethink about the indian food I get in San Diego. I probably will never be the same again.  The one chick that works there, that we saw... like a 9 on the hotness scale too.

_vMTSGkgachvlH35BfrZcw.text: Great Indian food! My family had never tried Indian food so I played it safe with the Samosas and chicken Tandoori.

z1qEGiZfzDAfeO7buLmkVA.text: A good place for a good Indian buffet. Like the place. It's neat, has good variety of food. The only problem- we visited the place twice and both times they had the same menu for the buffet. I dunno if it was just the days we visited, but would have been nice if they had different food on the buffet the second time. Overall a great place esp if you are really hungry, esp when you get em muchies

ISCh1nDkbQOAJDB_DqIRdg.text: I am a huge Indian food fan! I've had Indian food all over the US and this place is one of my favorite! Every time I'm in Vegas I come here!!

qKJ4LcVYl0lkfp6zLubE0A.text: Worst food. They just killed the flavor of Indian food. This afternoon we bought briyani, naan, lamb curry and mango lassi. It was completely mess. Waste of time,money and health. They have prepared the briyani with kind of ready mix powder. It was not well cooked, lamb curry was also half cooked,the naan was not at all like naan. Thank god at least the mango lassi was good. People who have never tasted the actual Indian foods will think this is the taste of Indian foods. This is not Indian food flavor. It is tasteless. I advise them to learn how to prepare Indian foods. Don't spoil the taste of Indian foods. I will never go to this restaurant and I will not recommend to my friends as well.

ez3LkRP1J0TR4vc088bibw.text: I may not be an expert on Indian food, but the large number of Indians I see eating at this restaurant must mean something. Their buffet is $10.99 for lunch, which includes everything but garlic naan  and mango lassi. The restaurant may not be attractive from the outside, but is clean inside. My favorite Indian restaurant in town!

QJjFICPrZsnxVP-QdjPCdw.text: The best Indian and Nepali food in Las Vegas! The staff was terrific and the owner, Prakash, was so friendly and attentive. Try the chicken tikka masala, it was out of this world. We can't wait to go back!

DYKwx2XnEXB42gnja0NIJQ.text: Came for the lunch buffet.  It was not the same food quality and taste as the normal dinners they have. The chicken and meats were really dry and the spices were way off par.I will not go again to there lunch, but for 10.99 what do you expect.

zF-AYSb_6XQiquG1KOeo-Q.text: Tried the vegetarian lunch buffet. Everything except dal (palak paneer, pakoras, chana masala, veg kurma etc) tasted bad. Ambience was casual. Don't recommend this place..

sMY-dcw6Z87JPZzXfQKEfQ.text: The Mt. Everest is the best of both veggie and meat worlds!  My wife is a vegetarian and I am on the Atkins diet.  I love the huge selection of meals and Prakash (the owner) is the nicest man.  The restaurant is spotless (table cloths!) with endless attention to detail.  I wish I had known about this place years ago.  Try the Buffet lunch for welcome surprises.  They change the food selection every day.

ztLy1zw9Rc7ADJIP5CUoNQ.text: Have eaten the lunch buffet here at least 15-18 times over the course of 3 years, and I must say that Mt. Everest is finally in it's prime. I immediately sensed a new chef 2 visits ago, and my guess was confirmed by the owner. The owner was visibly excited about the new chef's contributions, smiling and describing all of the new dishes. Tastewise and lookswise, the buffet has never been better. It costs $1 more than before, but it is worth it.   The Sambar soup is perfectly seasoned, the new dishes (Chicken Chili, Vegetable Korma) are colorful and tasty, and the overall spice level is kicked up one notch closer to a straight-up medium. The Chicken Mahkani is masterful and complex - as good as some of the best Chicken Tikka Masala-type curry I've tasted. The Dal Mahkani is a 3 or 4-bean variety and is much improved over the previous chef's version. Great Samosas and Aloo Vegetable varieties. Very importantly, the buffet console is boiling hot so all of the food is steaming hot and remains hot on your plate several minutes after you sit down at your table. This is a huge detail that can make or break an Indian buffet. Mt. Everest nails it - keep it up!   Business seems better than ever, which is a good sign that I'm not the only one who feels like this food has gotten really good. Typical to an Indian lunch buffet, the fresh-baked naan and roti are complimentary, but the whole wheat roti is especially good here - one would expect it to come out traditionally thin and flat, but the Mt. Everest version can be mistaken for a puffy naan bread - a nice surprise. Whole wheat roti has taken the place of white basmati rice in my Indian lunch diet.  Buffet plates and bowls are clean and shiny. Water glasses are refilled constantly, every single visit. Finished plates are picked up quickly. Overall service is great. My only warning is you may smell like Indian food for the rest of the afternoon, so if you are on your way to an important meeting in a small office space, maybe bring a change of clothing if you are self-conscious about that kind of thing. I guess this is proof that when you eat the lunch buffet at Mt. Everest, you are immersed in a cauldron of Indian deliciousness.  Go now and get it while it's hot! I've waited this long to write a review because if I really care about a place I want to make sure it's right before friends go try it for the first time. (see my Cravin' Cajun review).

YFEIqzsrcZo7rudWHDWi4A.text: tried this last night ..   Found on Yelp and have to agree with reviews.. great food service was wonderful and very well priced..   How you could buy a burger when this place is around...

7InsCuIAgYVgnbzBNISkcA.text: Best indian food in las vegas!:butter chicken and chicken tikka masala with garlic naan is my favorite.  I have been eating there for years and always been consistent with food quality

kCguiuj9sUlzMPC1mMbmNQ.text: Our favorite India food restaurant when we visit Las Vegas. Favorite dishes include the tikka masala and the garlic non. The Boss is pretty nice too.

fC1Qaxwv0G82WM7Vz34xBQ.text: Being Indian and all, I can cook Indian food fairly well, but I seek out Indian restaurant for the beautiful diversity of regional specialties that I just don't know how to cook or do not have the equipment to cook (eg. Tandoor oven). In the 3 years, that I lived here I have yet to find an Indian restaurant that blows me away, but Mt. Everest is one of the "better" ones.   Came here on a Saturday night around 7:00 PM. Not the best looking place from the outside, but still hopeful this was a diamond in the rough. The parking lot was full however, surprisingly there were only two other tables filled. However, towards the end of our meal the restaurant filled out.  My husband and I got there before the other couple joining us (it is one of their favorite restaurants).  The staff immediately greeted and seated us.  We had a few moments to look around...decor is a bit dated with the dark green upholstery, but well kept.  We ordered a bottle of wine from the limited but reasonably priced popular wines.  Once the other couple arrived, they were immediately recognized as familiar faces by the staff.    Prior to ordering we were served complimentary papadoms with the tradition mint and tamarind chutneys. We ordered Tandoori Chicken as an appetizer. This is a great value given there were atleast 8 pieces.  It came out sizzling hot, serve on a cast iron skillet.  I wanted to love it as its sight and sound captured my senses, but it was missing that aromatic smell.  That is right, it was not aromatic or flavorful...kind of bland for Tandoori, but nothing offensive and definitely well prepared.  Still worth getting, because it comes out fresh and sizzling, just spritz with lemon and sprinkle  salt it is more than fine.    Shortly after our main dishes came out--palak paneer, chicken tikka, rogan josh, garlic naan, and a side kachumber salad.  First off, the portions were plentiful, and more than enough to feed four hearty adult appetites and two for lunch the next day.  The palak to the palak paneer makes that dish silky, creamy and very comforting, but could use a bit more spice although it was ordered at a level 6 on spice scale (1 to 10).  The chicken tikka was tasty and familiar in the sweet, tomatoey style...I prefer it slightly less sweet, but again, well made and worth trying.  The rogan josh's flavor was complexly layers and my favorite dish; it almost like my moms!  However, we ordered it at a level 10 spiciness, but it was much milder than expected.  Although I don't eat bread, according to my fellow dinners the garlic naan was fresh, warm and soft.   The kachumber salad was standard.    Throughout our meal,  the manager/owner(?) kept checking to make sure we were satisfied and of course, asking if we wanted more wine once we finished the bottle we order.  He gave us generously filled glasses for $5, and we had a friendly conversation.    Overall, the food was prepared with quality ingredients and with care, but lacked a bit of seasoning.  I haven't returned to many Indian restaurants in Vegas, but I am sure to return to Mt. Everest because the food is good, well priced, and the manager and staff is friendly... a special combination lacking in most Indian restaurants.

MQCPs6VqgVH1k4YaDwztYA.text: One of the best Indian restaurant in town,you don't want to miss it! The boss is very nice too. All dishes we tried are delicious, and the dessert rice pudding with gulab jamun is unbeatable! We definitely will come back again!

tYec2MvRGkUY3gWAeqUaRQ.text: Have been here several times for the lunch buffet and it's always been great. Very friendly staff and delicious food.

dU_q7jlQ9T0vR6Dz8Gj7WA.text: Saw the yelp reviews and had an out of town visitor who loves Indian food best of any. It was shocking to see it had a drive thru window and the neighborhood is a bit sketchy but not scary. Once inside it was very small, dark and stuffy warm. We all three had the buffet and it was about 12:45 when we arrived so you'd think it would be well stocked. The chicken korma was all sauce, no chicken to be seen and of the rest of the dishes, some were sparse, some were old looking with sauces separated and the Tandoori chicken was only dark meat and not nearly crispy enough on the outside nor cooked well enough for me inside. The samosas were cold & too doughy and I didn't like the rice being sweet, I prefer savory with veggies in it. The chili chicken was tasty but also very greasy and the vegetable korma was good and I enjoyed the spiciness of the food, it packed a heat punch. Naan was just okay, I would have ordered garlic naan if given a choice but service was sluggish and we were fairly ignored. My daughter needed water since all of us had empty water glasses and no one refilling so I got up and poured all of us a glass of water from pitchers they had sitting nearby. The guy copped an attitude after that and did his best to completely ignore us. I'm shocked that yelp reviews this as the best Indian in LV because I'm definitely going to my favorite, Mint Indian Bistro, next time I want Indian food.

56DrrsukTXAdMwY7JWLuKA.text: The owner is very friendly and service  is exceptional. The food is delicious, wether it's buffet or menu food.

iahRe0g30gXpvCBWKH-1zw.text: If you miss home cooked food this is the place  .. it's one of the best food I ever had in USA .. Punjabi kadhi and gajar halwa was yummy .

RQiSbhwPzrpbBxoOS6fWJQ.text: The garlic nan was fresh.  They just kept on serving it.  The curry was pretty flavorful.  Be sure to get the fresh batch when they bring it out.  If there aren't a lot of people there... it might be sitting under a heating lamp for a while.  It's good value and a welcome change in a town full of sub $10 buffets.

h6JfNkWIIDz_izq1JmGeEw.text: Love love loved this place! Delicious food, wonderful staff. The Malai Kofta was my favorite dish that we ordered and the desert rice pudding was divine! I would recommend this place to anyone. Very satisfied customer.

Iq8JvHinpEX3JCVlKt-N1Q.text: Not bad. Closest Indian restaurant to Summerlin, unfortunately. The price is great for what you get. Not the best but acceptable for a quick lunch. The waitstaff could be a little more attentive as well as wear matching uniforms or shirts to show who they are. They were dressed like customers.

VbRWdY-aU_cml7_jZSRI6Q.text: Amazing food! Bakash is constantly checking on the tables to provide the best experience.

T8vBi7lTBBvvkSKwRMM5iw.text: Yummy! Great food and service.  Enjoyed the meal and would recommend to locals and visitors.

uOkinnLpXK3iK_LDsBPx7g.text: Been coming here for a long time and food is always good. Service is also good. My personal favorites are chicken curry and palak paneer. Lunch buffet is the time to go

-4wHsobBsVj8k0pZ-gDS-g.text: This place is freaking fantastic, my parents were craving indian food (couldn't go 3 days without it) so I just found this place on yelp. TERRIFIC FOOD, FANTASTIC SERVICE. I'm usually very wary of Indian places because they never compare to my mom's cooking but this place is amazing. If you're craving indian food while in vegas be sure to stop by

c4X4tuHXcOqE0VvpK_KOTQ.text: This place was amazingly good!-not only was the food absolutely delicious but the service was great! They were very welcoming and of all the Indian buffets I've tried, this one had the greatest variety (and even for vegetarians). And we were going to take home leftovers, the owner even included extra naan for us to take. I highly recommend Mount Everest India's Cuisine! I would definitely go again :D

OgiLvIEXI2uAdfBigU6eWw.text: Very good options for veggie food. Had malai kofta & dal tadaka. Very good food compare to other options in Vegas.

dGMSeiRS61bA0JDRdaMoWQ.text: We were visiting Vegas and I had a craving. Glad I listened to Yelp! Place was FANTASTIC. Don't let the poorly lit exterior fool you, the food is the star! Our server was polite, friendly and quick.

4ceJ4bMp43wZgKvRXzUxMw.text: Comfort Food. Im a foodie and have literally eaten at all Indian Places in Las Vegas. I have eaten here since day one. And I have to say this is the best Indian food ever. I have taken many people here and now are regulars as well as friends from India , they told me that its like  real home cooked food. Love this place. I will always continue to come here and only here for Northern Indian food.

KOIC9jDjOdiqlocmM2V_4g.text: If you can look past the fact that this place is obviously a former Burger King, this is a great lunch buffet.  Jam packed on a weekday.  The only thing we had that we weren't crazy about were the samosas.  They were small and not very flavorful.  Otherwise, pretty solid.

TalrELJHENrlEUIBcTqqHA.text: Best Indian food I have ever had. Los Angeles, San Diego, Philadelphia, Atlanta, Nashville, Memphis, D.C... This place is truly legit. Chicken tikka masala, vegetable korma, garlic naan. Amazing.

7YD5vAs0eVY1_a8xcmmd7g.text: Hands down my favorite Indian restaurant in Las Vegas!  Tried most of the Indian restaurants in town, but keep craving this one.  No glitz and glamour here, the restaurant is nothing fancy, but what it lacks in grand decor it easily makes up for in  tasty delicious fair-priced cuisine, AND they actually understand HOT when I say hot for how spicy I want it.  Almost brought me to tears (literally), it was beautiful.  Don't worry, for those who like less spice, my hubby orders it milder, and they get that right too.

cjQx8GXs_-Dh6O0rJELctg.text: Veggie options are very good here! I love the basmati rice. It is cooked to perfection!  I have been here many times and they have different options in veggie dishes. My last visit they had an excellent cabbage dish which was sauteed in yummy herbs and spices.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Nan is my favorite!

W6qtYXFGlYkxl7VlHb9cCg.text: Great experience!! When we got there it was really busy but they greeted us right away and got us a table. First thing I noticed was that the owner was helping out with everything! Busing, greeting customers, making sure everything was going well. We had the lunch buffet for $10.99! Great tasting food. I will definitely be coming back! Felt very welcomed :)

8sSA0sc0lTf6o3SLcGr9MQ.text: This place is awesome! The buffet is delicious and the staff is very friendly. My favorite indian food in town.

sfzdjJSCo6NwjOnlIsmuRw.text: Deelish! My friend and  I went after finding the place on yelp when looking for Indian in Las Vegas. In an odd part of town, and not the best of areas- the food is really really good.   We had the lunch buffet, and it was so good that we could not stop eating even though we were both full. The gentleman who greeted me was so nice and sat me right away. I never had to ask for a refill on my water as he was very attentive to that was well. The only negative thing I would even mention is that I wish that the dishes had an english description in addition to the indian names because there were many that I had no idea what it had in it. I like to try new things so it wasn't a huge issue, but it would have been nice to know what I was eating.   Definitely worth a try, especially when you get eat for two people under $25

gjOauv9l7miDiMwX8iDZiA.text: Thoroughly enjoyed the meal and service (we arrived before the crowd and were spoiled by three charming waiters). The flavors were authentic and portions very generous. Definitely will return for the buffet.

4j3JhI4rpFYDlFm_kdRMRQ.text: I had a fabulous lunch here with Yelp's Misti and Honey ! I'm not an Indian food expert - I'd defer you to Misti's review if you're looking for technical insight on the food quality.   Overall I was quite impressed ! This will be my new go-to Indian food buffet spot for lunch. $8.99 ($6 with coupon!) is definitely a great price for the quality level. As the other ladies mentioned - the Naan basket is out of this world. Garlic and plain!? Yes please ! I might have eaten like half the basket - sorry girls!!   I should also mention despite the location and the shady looking exterior, the inside is neat and clean and very spruced up. Don't let the location scare you - this place is worth the $9 investment.

Epa2LzynfDTMzCyi0MP-nw.text: AMAZING FOOD, great service, and exceptional staff they're all super friendly! This was our first time from our friends referral, and it definitely won't be our last!! #mynewfavoriteplace

7bHiN8pcdxLz2a-2Q5nzXA.text: We found this place randomly on our trip to Utah.  The food was great, but beware the portions are HUGE.  So you can probably share with a group of people.  Worth trying if you are in the area, food has great flavor and service was good.  They lost one star because we thought we waited a bit long for the food.

_8swBn1fdbnt0dHdTRxWtQ.text: Nice food. We had the Veg Momo's and Paneer Tikka Masala. Both were excellent. The service was really good. The place looks a bit dated.

tzLovoiq0dYcCSgK4W_F5g.text: Every time im off work and wanna eat a delicious large meal at a decent price I come here. Best indian lunch buffet with the best selections. Their dinner menu is still good but a lil om the pricey side so I come for lunch...and its all you can eat! How can you beat that?   Recommend it to everyone when family and friends come to town.

3Zqhh27myJgWgjfhLS7xwQ.text: My go to for Indian in Vegas.  Solid food and take out is easy.  Kandahari naan is very good.

_6XyCDYzEW_APYefHASU3A.text: Food quality is bad but it's a cheap option. Don't expect for good customer service. Lacks basic courtesy .

KcoIsmlSodDQIJRzDcsUCw.text: The food was great . Price is right. Warm atmosphere.chicken butter was my favorite dish.

IO6HWjFxbwBSdtFvQj8dPw.text: I like the atmosphere and the way the people who are working  are very attentive the food is really good and it is a good place to try if you want somewhere that's quiet and nice to eat

xu4gF6vlS43bh9AT7pOiAw.text: Not only the best Indian food in Las Vegas but by far the best service and hospitality I have ever experienced. There tika massala was absolutely exquisite and the way we were taken care of has turned me into loyal customer. Highly recommend.

Tx229Ce08gBZ5Qc6S4Z9xQ.text: Hands down the best Indian cuisine in Las Vegas. I have done a few taste tests within the city but nothing has come close to my dining experience at Mt. Everest. It is not only the food that keeps me coming back but the service as well. It is a family run restaurant and every member is always hospitable, welcoming and attentive. I cannot recommend this restaurant enough.

hPjGRu9waffU3QGviMvE0g.text: I knew from the first, crisp snap and aroma of the pappadums that  this was going to be a treat! Fresh, fresh, fresh.  Chili Pakora (3), Lamb Vindaloo (3), Palak Paneer (4), Bhindi Masalaa (5), Garlic Naan (4).  Service = 4.  Value = 5 (the serving sizes are ideal for sharing, or taking away for tomorrow's lunch!).  The vindaloo was a little disappointing as the flavor profile never showed up; it was also very tame for a vindaloo, especially when I asked for a 7/10 spice level.  The Bhindi, on the other hand, was perfect; this is the ONLY way I'll eat okra; it was tender and cooked just right, with the carmalized onion, fresh chopped tomato and spice mix = tremendous.

Djp5oMZc8XP993oVlHLsEA.text: WORST Indian food I've ever had (and trust me I've had enough Indian food across the globe). Never gone wrong with Yelp reviews (particularly one with 700+ reviews).  --Paneer Tikka was 'sweet'   --Paneer Kadai didn't have any salt in it  --Kofta in Malai Kofta was stale  --Mango Lassi didn't have sugar in it  Service could not have been worse.   I could have given negative rating if possible.   Go to the McDonalds down the street - the food will at least be in line with your expectations.

mEvweH2ay9x8mIDrlGFlcw.text: Good, authentic, AYCE Indian food at a great price. Satisfied our craving for Indian cuisine. The garlic naan was so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Assorted curries, samosa and basmati rice
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic naan

zOhDTyEkOV88hbnrl49ZGw.text: Take my advice and save your trip to Mt. Everest. The food was horrible. We were a party of 8 and each one including our two kids did not like the food. The chicken dishes felt like it was from last night. The only thing I can say about the Yelp reviews are that it can be bought.   Oh, btw... Chicken drumsticks with food coloring is not tandoori chicken.  The only thing positive was the price and their service.

f6tMCHqvx4hlvpBbD6zUgw.text: I got the best reviews for this place and I decided to try it myself so I went there for a lunch buffet. The food is delicious and I just couldn't stop myself from eating more. The owner Mr.Prakash is generous and looks after all the customers personally. I would definitely recommend this place if you are a fan of Indian food.

E8dqqtG6MQoi2fP9KzWDWg.text: By far, the best Indian food in Nevada. Hands down and stomachs full. You have to come on Saturdays for the buffet because it is killer! Family owned and operated, great service, fantastic food, warm environment, and it's hard to leave. Definitely a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmmmm

JA_GkOzY3qY-XL7kWF8dZQ.text: My first time having Indian food and all I can say is wow! I'm so hooked. I had the Mt Everest sampler so I can try a bit of everything and omg party in my mouth. The service was great. I plan to be a repeat client. I am totally in love.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All gone... LoL!

CbiqbG2NqwX3KzlLOTnkDQ.text: I don't understand the 4.5 stars. Food was average that's why I gave 3 stars. We ordered Chicken Tanduri & Chicken Tikka masala. Garlic nan was somewhat off.  Service was good considering it was a Indian restaurant.

ETakufpfG8pO9g4KFY-8cw.text: Great: food, ambiance, personnel, service! Just read Nelson Q.'s review.... nuff said! I'm coming back whenever I'm in Vegas :)

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffet in the rear, quiet atmosphere, great food!

WmgLXcl0RIvhfvFdATjBwg.text: Amazing food. Lots of authentic flavors, and a wide variety of vegetarian options. It was a great price for the lunch buffet. Harish was very friendly, and I enjoyed the atmosphere. Even though it isn't in the best neighborhood, and the building looks like an old pizza place; don't be scarred. Venture in, and you will be pleasantly surprised. Delicious food

0m1qaaCymKq28jhdf7Reeg.text: It was like my mouth went on a journey to heaven:) I've been here twice before with my best friend and every time it's been so satisfying. The lunch buffet is always worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We destroyed our meal.

MXfoPKXt-0KJArWqpUPE8g.text: This place is my go to for Indian food in Vegas. Off the beaten path and away from the strip.  The food is awesome, the service is great, and I've never had a bad experience.  I greatly appreciate the atmosphere and traditional food... The flavors create the perfect mouth party !!! It's a must visit!

4t6NdnSah2Ai717loBwSLQ.text: Thanks for the delicious food. Very good service and excellent food. Everything was fresh and tgis is the best Indian food I had in US.

8FjuOVQBRXaldBRRlIDdLA.text: Finally left the strip and found pretty good Indian food. Looks like a hole in the wall but if you are a foodie you know that's where it's at. Garlic Naan was particularly good and fresh.

0k159EouIAidtoDpQEBq_g.text: Went for the lunch buffet, it was fanastic, great menu for the price.

olDmMjh1LiRujTWspdngqQ.text: Even though the food was decent, and the mango lassi was good, an hour and a half long wait was unacceptable. I love Indian food and I will skip this place and drive farther to get decent service. It was me and my sister, with my two year old daughter and we ordered two entrees with naan. They did not tell us it was gonna be a long wait, and the couple that got arrived 30 mins after we did ate before us! They kept glancing over at us in pity since we had a hungry two year old. My daughter was very well behaved considering, so I don't know why they kept putting us off saying it was gonna take twenty more minutes for food. It happened at least three times. That's why we waited so long, because of the empty promises that our food would EVENTUALLY come out. I won't ever eat here again.

iILCxoIQm51wqoKMl6wd7w.text: Soooo yummy and at a good price! Friendly staff. I enjoy watching the Baliwood dancing on the tv as I eat.

PJ_kpnG48QJQhBnvvDFvZw.text: Buffet review: Very crowded and food was average. Definitely not a 4.5 star material. You are better off not going for Indian food in Vegas.

wCNp9TRdqsmfMDDzQDrxGQ.text: I just tried this place for the first time and the food is very good. It's very flavorful and I like their nan bread. Their service was good and they're very nice.

ZR-i9BWRM3Ys-stomE9V7g.text: Every time I have been there is great! The food is fresh, the naans are just perfect!  If you are new in Indian cousine you should try the Thali

98polbDyymdeMOZfi01AJQ.text: ***THIS IS A REVIEW FOR THE LUNCH BUFFET.  I HAVE NOT BEEN THERE FOR DINNER***  Wow, I was a little surprised.   I had heard so many good things.  Perhaps this was just an "off" day for their lunch buffet.  Let me explain that we were not treated badly, we were just ignored for the most part.  I tried almost everything on the buffet and I enjoy eating Indian food and was looking forward to lunch here since the day before since I had never been.  That said...   I have been to several different Indian places here in town and after reading other reviews I didn't know exactly what to expect.  The service was barely there and the lunch buffet (about an hour and a half into service) was messy.  The steam table was occasionally being "refilled" instead of changed out.  At least, theoretically, the food that was there at the beginning would only last till the end of the lunch hours. There were a few other cleanliness issues but I'll leave it at that.    The tap water served in the cloudy glass could not be overlooked.   The items on the lunch buffet itself, some overcooked, were just okay at best.  Other items bear only slight resemblance to the preparations I've had at other Indian places.  I really do enjoy Indian food and I really went into this WANTING to like this place.     There are a lot of Indian lunch buffets in Las Vegas and if you have the means to go to a different one... *sigh* ...go.

Upx0rmm_ME6Tl5AAbG-Kuw.text: Not authentic Indian but if you are craving you could go there.. Watch out for the neighborhood especially the super market behind it

U-4oHE4B4fDUaE1lo0wI4A.text: I'm no expert on Indian cuisine, but I've been to numerous Indian restaurants (Pioneer St. in Cerritos anyone?) that I can distinguish the good from the bad.   My wife and I saw the high ratings on yelp and decided to give this place a try.   Unfortunately, we didn't quite reach the summit on this place in terms of our satisfaction, but this is based on just one try.  Lamb samosas- Too dry.  Chicken Tikka Masala- Not the most flavorful masala we've had. Felt like something was missing.  Lamb Curry- This was my favorite dish. The lamb was super tender, and the curry sauce was savory with the right amount of spice.   Service was outstanding throughout and that made the experience a more enjoyable one.   We'll definitely be back to Mount Everest again and hopefully reach the top then.

bpXHM5TVQIu-Susxg-kzgg.text: Wow!! We come down to Vegas from LA atleast once a year, and I'm surprised how did we miss this place all this while!!  The Food - Quality is beyond expectations, we called for a great meal ranging from paneer chili to yellow daal.  Each dish was flavorful and enticing for our taste buds, if you have the urge for something spicy and zestful the chicken chili is a must have!!   The Service - Prakash, the owner/Manager does a wonderful job from greeting you when you enter to making sure the food arrives before your stomach growls for the second time! The other staff was on point too!!!   Definitely a must visit!

QuUz2mHBTO0JmIXGdIxC_Q.text: Hands down, the best Indian Food I've had in quite some time.  They're lunch special for all you can eat 10.99 is a wonderful deal. Sometimes they can get very busy, which is indicative of how well their doing. Love the chicken korma, chicken tikka masala, the bread and that dessert ball thing. I believe the owner took our order one time for dinner, and he really made sure we knew what we were ordering and recommended dishes that went well together. Palak Paneer is easily my favorite dish.

-tjsvLR3UGiJgQsC9ZIvSg.text: Delicious food and attentive staff. We ordered the chicken and shrimp curry, both were great. We also ordered the cheese and regular naan, both were flaky and buttery. Would absolutely come back on our next trip to Vegas.

5tX9tA1IyZeM4HgpV3UTqA.text: Stumbled upon this place when looking for a new place to eat here in Las Vegas , I've been here about six times in the past month , and the food is still just as amazing as day one , food stays very consistent ,  extremely authentic and fresh.   The atmosphere is very relaxing, music isn't too loud, and just beautiful colorful decorations!   The costumer service was at beyond par, it was lively Prakash was who took care of us and every time we do come here he always takes great care of us !   By far one of my favorite places in Las Vegas !

TL9B-8Xo5Z5Ewg2Le2cLFg.text: This. Place. Every time we visit Vegas, we visit Mount Everest. It's our favorite Indian restaurant in the country! We travel A LOT and we always sample the Indian food wherever we are because it's our favorite. And this is THE BEST. Get off the strip folks and visit this place - it's worth the short trip. The food is deeply complex - if you like spicy food you don't just taste heat, you taste every flavor. If you don't like spice, don't worry, everything can be prepared mild and it's just as delicious. The naan melts in your mouth. The rice is fluffy and fragrant. The home made deserts are small portions of rich, delectable, deliciousness! I can't say it enough... Eat here!

SyVoZwn2noaNiGcRp8NKOg.text: Very tasy yummy food great and friendly staff. Clean and delicious food. Everything is good

czdb9STGtOxj0xKkWAkKAQ.text: This place is fantastic! $10.99 for a lunch buffet with quite a selection (a lot of dishes I've never seen offered at a buffet before) and good quality food! My favorites from yesterday would be the potatoes, the roasted chicken and the chicken in the tomato curry sauce. I also enjoyed the fact that they offered a nice little salad bar of romaine, cucumber, tomato, onion and jalepino.    I will warn you that this place is on the small side and the sit pretty close together. It fills up quick! At 12:30p it was full and shortly thereafter there was a line. So get there on the early side of lunch (the lunch buffet is offered until 3p)!

RACQTY31B11uD_-V6aJkjA.text: Contrary to these rave reviews, I had quite a different experience here. I'm a huge fan of Indian food, and have had my fair share. I came here with a frequent patron who claimed this place is the best in Vegas, and even she said that the food didn't taste how it normally should. The flavor profiles were all off.   Chicken tikka masala- 1 star. The curry didn't taste right. no richness, not much buttery or creamy flavor.   Paneer saag with chicken (spinach dish)- 1star. I wasn't too impressed. Nothing too special about this dish.  Aloo gobi (potatoes and cauliflower) - 1 star. Cauliflower was overcooked, mushy, and lacked flavor.   Garlic naan- 1 star. The dough was undercooked in certain areas.   Samosas with minced lamb-2 stars.  I've always gotten potatoes or vegetarian so lamb was a first. Inside was good, but the breading was really strange. It was super doughy and over-fried making the texture almost as crunchy as biting into a rock. Not like I know what that's like...  Service- 5 stars. Our glasses were constantly full, they are on top of their game.   The highlight of my dinner was the green sauce and tamarind sauce they give you at the beginning with some fried stuff. That's about it. I'm a bit afraid to give this place a second shot after my experience as I was really looking forward to it.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Puffy stuff with green sauce and tamarind sauce. Yummyyyyyy.
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Samosa with minced lamb inside.
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic naan

CVo7Be1zBg0waJ33P57ShA.text: #1-Loving this find. I have tried other Indian restaurants in town and found them to be either too expensive or catering more to the Indian customers at not giving me very much attention. Mt. Everest was recommended by my Indian doctor (not for health reasons) and it is everything for which I could have hoped. You can expect all the usual fare prepared well and to order. I am vegetarian and my girlfriend is vegan. We were guided through the menu very kindly to support our dietary needs and a couple dishes were altered to further that cause. Can't wait to return.   #2-Wonderful food and they really work hard to make things right. My girlfriend is vegan and "assumed" the vegetarian dishes were vegan. Nope. Many of those contain yogurt or are served with a dollop of butter. The owner quickly took care of this and made something special that was completely vegan. It is much appreciated and after our second visit we are even more impressed than after the first wonderful visit. We will be returning and telling our friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JueB07dtxKiaIPHUVfPsmQ.text: Overrated restaurant. Wasted our time and money and hugely disappointed with the food. Deceived by Yelp rating and its number 1 position in Indian buffets and went for lunch buffet on a Friday afternoon. Very bad experience. Do not want to give a single star to this place. None of the dishes are fresh, especially chicken tasted very bad. Paneer in palak paneer is rubbery, crispy pakora is tasteless, samosas are hopeless, gulab jamuns are disastrous, finally even lentils are tasteless (needless to say more). Will never go again.

CVb4SVYCLBENyta8wi3Qdg.text: My go to place! Love love love their lunch  buffet and their samosa chat is bomb!! Great atmosphere and friendly staff, it's the reason I come back every time. They are awesome. :)

mNT6NzMOjTqUnuOZrEfUDg.text: Good food, good service and friendly owner but this place needs some serious TLC. Their naan is the best.

CLJ6qgD3Einrc12PUKBGnw.text: As I'm still venturing out with Indian food I was very pleased with lunch today.   The naan was good. Lunch as buffet style.  The potato cauliflower dish was delicious even though it looked awful lol.  Indian food as a whole doesn't present well on a buffet line.   Goat and two forms of curry chicken were all tasty and just the right amount of spicy.  The Tandoor chicken was good but I've had better.   Service was great and food was hot and tasty.

ToWKNMxIvAuelUwZHx4wGQ.text: I have been craving Indian food for a while. Haven't gone to any of the well known places in town until today. We were downtown  and close to a few Indian restaurants  and decided on Mt. Everest for lunch.   The minute I opened the door, the aroma of Indian spices welcomed me in. It brought back memories during my years in The UAE. The place looked clean, the staff were friendly, attentive and helpful....and the food was really good. They serve hot buttered naan with the meal. I requested garlic naan and they happily obliged. I excitedly went around the buffet to check what they had to offer. The first thing that caught my eye were the samosas. It was hot, freshly cooked and pretty good. More doughy than what I'm used to but still good. Then I see the chicken curry and goat curry in the very corner...boom! Be still my heart!  Those two dishes didn't disappoint at all. The goat pieces were so tender and the gravy was addictive. The chicken curry was equally good. I couldn't stop dipping my naan in the gravy. The chutneys totally complimented the curries. I also tried their chicken tikka and their chicken tikka masala. They were ok. They also had about 4 vegetarian dishes but everything pales in comparison to the curries. For dessert I tried kheer and gulab jamun. Their kheer was refreshing and not overly sweet  with a slight cardamom taste. Gulab jamun is good too but too sweet for my taste.   The place got pretty busy around 12ish. They had a lot of South Asian clientele which is a good sign. The owner, Prakash is nice and friendly. He was constantly making sure that our needs were met. We left happy and full.   Price for a lunch buffet : $10.99....definitely not bad!   I wish they served biryani during lunch but no worries. This place is definitely worth trying. We will be back!  Our verdict:  Service - 5* Food.    - 4.5*

cWzp-NJOgHd1FpVQnHOVmw.text: Great restaurant! We ordered the butter chicken and chicken tikka masala with garlic naan bread. All three were excellent. I highly recommend this place to any lover of Indian food.

UP7YbRSizkxYUm5Z9mx8CQ.text: This place stands up to its reviews! We had the lunch buffet and everything was incredible, including the chili chicken which was unique for an Indian buffet! My favorite of course was the garlic nan and the Tiki Masala. Highly recommend!

-o9bjGMTYzv9ehyJGypkBQ.text: Terrible service and long wait time I have ever seen never coming back this restaurant

At $24.99 You get a taste of everything  The tandoori chicken was cooked perfectly and seasoned very well The tandoori shrimp was a no go super salty and super dry! And over priced  Naan, garlic, cheese and plain all amazing  Parking! Super easy!  Area in the ghetto!

QWBr0nn7c6Di02ddmem5Zg.text: Awesome food & excellent service. Highly recommend this indian restaurant. Don't judge the location...good people seeving good food with a good heart.

rRr8TLeVP5OJ2Z8SBm2-UQ.text: Truly some of the best Indian food in America!!!  There balance of spices is Godly.   This place has one of the best prices on lunch buffet and the options are all delicious.

Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I travel all over America trying Indian food in every city I go and Mt. Everest is by far one of the best you can find in this country.

s4nJ5NPz13E-VfkTm7ZoVQ.text: Looking for a place to eat that was different. Decided on Indian food and found this place with high ratings on Yelp. Set the maps app to this place and started driving.   Found it easily as it's well marked and has parking right in front.   As we entered, we were greeted right away and given the option of a booth or table, we chose a booth. Comfortable seating at the right height.   We were given this type of flat crispy "bread" to start with and two sauces. One was a spicy green one and the other a brown one. The green one was kinda green herb type and the brown was like a steak sauce like. Both were tasty and can be used for other dishes so we kept it on the table.   Ordered the butter chicken since it was recommended here. The chicken was boneless and cut up. Tasted kinda nutty like peanut butter (butter chicken?) not sure but it was tasty.   Got lamb curry and that was also tasty but not gamey.   Also got rice and garlic nan bread. The bread was heavily flavored with garlic and smelled so good. If you like garlic, get the nan bread and you'll be in love.   Service was excellent, my water glass was never empty for very long and I never had to flag down someone for a refill. There is also a tv monitor playing tasteful Indian music videos, adds to the feel of India. The colors on the wall and the decor resembled the color of spices but done tastefully.   Quality of food was excellent. Service was excellent. I would recommend this place without hesitation.   Side note, after I left I remembered I had forgotten my hat at the restaurant. I called and was informed someone was already seated in the booth and if I could call back later. After hanging up and about three minutes later, I received a phone call saying they located my hat :)

Trf__XjQ4Lc4Ls8CX5OSrg.text: Tried all Indian buffet in LASabd found out : One of the best Indian restaurant in LAS Vegas... must try buffet, momo's ,paneer butter Masala and mutton curry.   Thanks, Ashim

uiYb6nlyt0C__5afG0OCmA.text: First of all, the service is amazing! They are super friendly and kind! Their food is soooo good and savory. I've been there during the weekend and the weekday during the buffet and it is seriously such a delicious time to be there. They have so many fresh options and always enough of everything! Definitely a favorite!

Phg9g23eqwKVti-KbtkrlQ.text: It's not always I can eat Indian food. It tends to be a little heavy for me. But when I do get a chance, I think this is the spot I want to head to. So good!  My go to is the Paneer Tikka Masala. I love that creamy, tomato goodness on a bed of rice. The bits of cheese always add a great texture and a bit of protein. Garlic naan is always required as well. This spot has some pretty great naan - I could pack it up and eat it for breakfast, honestly. My partner also had an event eggplant and potato dish. A little too spicy for my taste, but if I had ordered it less spicy I would definitely be all about it.  Finally, I the service is absolutely amazing here. Friendly vibes and smiling faces all around. Will be back the next time I'm super hungry!

vtHrBIcC6liGqo7bm8bOXg.text: I had the Chana masala and it was very delicious and savory. Medium spicy was more than enough spice for me. Definitely will come back!

I2BKB3afdHZZLKAdESCV1w.text: Came here to grab a quick lunch with a friend. It's in a weird part of town and next to some shady spots but this place serves BOMB Indian food!!! We had the lunch buffet so it was quick and at a great price point! I'll definitely be back!

-M5D9GU_np9znqAFgjCtIA.text: The lunch buffet is always my favorite way to eat Indian food. An opportunity to taste several different dishes, indulge in the sauces & fresh warmed naan for a reasonable price.  This restaurant is a hidden gem - located in a nondescript building in the parking lot of a strip mall.  The food was fantastic!! Homemade from scratch Indian cuisine just the way your mama (if she was from india) would make. Don't be afraid to branch out and try everything on the buffet, there's more to Indian food than tikki masala!  Curry curry and more curry! Goat, chicken & chickpeas - all spicy and flavorful. The tandoori chicken is enhanced when you squeeze fresh lemon over it - the flavor explodes in your mouth. 2 different kinds of rice - sweet & traditional white basmati rice cooked to perfection. Tiki masala, the tried and True did not disappoint.  Tip - you can even get the buffet to go if you don't have enough time for the indulgence. Fit as much food as you can in 1 to go box, they will even give containers for sauces on the side along with Naan, fresh pita bread.

RmTOL2ERa2eanfgr3UGUqw.text: Mount Everest is my most favorite Indian buffet in Vegas. It must be for plenty others as well, because there is a bit of a wait during prime lunch hours! Smaller dining area and no waiting area leaves people packed in. Nonetheless, the wait is short and definitely worth it. Not as many food options as Mint, but everything that is offered is delicious and well seasoned with the perfect amount of spice. Great vegetarian options. Plain naan is offered at the buffet bar instead of brought to your table, which I prefer as there is no delay in waiting for your naan to be made.

I really enjoy the service here as well. Very friendly and very attentive.  Great place to bring your group of friends and have a great meal .

1PMEqx77rZMFi1tBy-zRzQ.text: This food is spectacular. We went for the lunch buffet and I wish I had more room in my stomach because everything was extremely delicious. A little girl stood on her chair while we were eating and proclaimed that, "This is the best food in the entire world"! She's not wrong.

taKT7435ke_apJ3_8lQ9Pw.text: I saw good reviews on this and my girlfriend ordered "Butter Chicken" (prior to ordering checked if they had nuts in it).   The food was not that good and it had nuts that made her really sick. When we called them they were really ignorant and rude. Very disappointed in this service they never even offered a differdifferent dish.   In the USA it's illigal to sell foods containing nuts without letting people know. Their menu mentions that few does but not the one we ordered.  Anyways terrible experience and they made no effort to make it right.   We will be also contacting authorities to complain.

_WLpbCDU0Xn0HZqtuejNLQ.text: Came here during lunch for their buffet.  Really good quality Indian food and the service was perfect.  They had red sweet rice and regular basmati rice, vegetable korma, squash and potato curry, tandoori chicken,  daal, chicken masala, goat curry, and much more.  My personal favorite was the vegetable curry with basmati rice and a mango lassi to pair.  The mango lassi was fresh and smoothly blended.  For dessert,  they had the sweet dough-balls in syrup, fruit, rice pudding and a few other items.  Really impressed how good this buffet was and there was a lot of people during lunch so that's a great sign.  If you want to beat the rush go a little before 12.

sPGhf-HxU2yu2jZw3wUxhg.text: Pros: everything is excellent Cons: I always overeat here. About the only thing bad I've had here was their take on Chinese Indian food, which was a noodle dish that just used spaghetti noodles.  A huge mistake on an otherwise diverse menu with great flavors.  Caution when ordering vegetarian dishes, they are almost entirely potato.   They still have some room for improvement,  but it's our go to Indian place for now.

u-mOh8mCW_04-AETatc95w.text: This is the worst Indian restaurant.  Very bad quality food. The chicken chilly is rubber. The food doesn't feel fresh at all. I don't know why they give 5stars to this restaurant. Don't do buffet. The owner told my old parents to stand outside the restaurant to wait outside in sun while I was paying. This was ridiculous.  No restaurant has ever said anything like this.  Don't know about the Alacart but the buffet is for sure terrible. Will never ever go back or recommend.  The staff and food are same not worth.

rZztShuKV003y0QoD4Nj8w.text: This is our first time here and it was GREAT! We enjoyed the Aloo Baingan, the Chicken Curry, and a side of garlic naan.  The rice was delicious and the portions were more than enough.   Perhaps what made our experience here 5 stars Plus is the service!  Our waiter explained the spicy levels and provided the perfect insight to aid in the decision making for our dishes.   We are DEFINITELY keeping this on our rotation when we go out for dinner!  The medium is a good base to start from regarding the spiciness of the food.  The medium in the chicken curry was delicious and had a very subtle and persistent after kick.  We'll probably step it up a notch next time in requesting the spice- but always good to try foods in the "state" that the chef envisioned.   Thanks for a wonderful dinner!

rk0-3BrOIl8RPNYC-axrgw.text: Definitely top 3 Vegas buffet, maybe top 2, great choices and quality cooking! Service was solid, manager looks very attentive.  Make sure to get the naan!

ngcBn_9nB2539r18vZ_XEA.text: The food here was delicious, I recently went with a friend: we got the sampler which is was really delicious and the staff was very nice. Will definitely go again.

VTKKUOI2mxTYN5xXxJREsA.text: i have been here only once and thats my last time goin ....the staff is very rude and unprofessional...the food was also kinda raw and cold ...its looked kinda old as well...i had an awful expirence there i will never return....they should close the place...

Ncf9UNHiR8xIE-h_aWWogA.text: 5 San Diegans in town for APA (pool) championships.  We are an eclectic group from different backgrounds, tastes, and expectations.  Based on Yelp, we decided to check out Mt Everest India's Cuisine for a lunch brunch buffet on a Thursday afternoon.  I believe it was only $9.99 per person (clearly I did not pay) and it was delicious!!!  The food was absolutely fantastic.  The lamb did not have that gamey lamb taste and several of us who do not normally eat lamb went back for seconds (and thirds??).  The samosas were the best I have ever tasted (my husband is Indian) because they were not overwhelmed by potatoes.  You could actually eat one and still have room for the rest of your meal.  The service was excellent and based on the variety of different customers we saw enjoying their lunch Mt Everest India's Cuisine is clearly a favorite and worth the short cab trip from any Vegas hotel.  (They even called us a cab with a wonderful driver who had us laughing all the way back to our hotel!)

0SZTiMgteFSsWAabv311Iw.text: I stumbled across this place when we were looking for a new Indian place to try. The place looks a bit sketchy on the outside as the building used to be a Burger King and is in a somewhat run-down plaza. However the food is very yum! The buffet is not the most extensive, but the price is so cheap, especially for Indian food, and the dishes that are available taste pretty good. I am always on the lookout for some good vegetarian Indian dishes, and the 2 times that I have eaten here, there have been always several excellent choices. The palak paneer and the malai kofta were especially good, and their raita and chutneys are excellent accompaniments to the meal. The service is pretty good, too. The manager or owner is pretty friendly and always makes sure to fill up your water glasses. He also drops off a warm basket of fresh naan within minutes of seating you at your table and makes sure to ask if you need more naan. All in all, this is an excellent choice for Indian buffet.

_CKQboBkiixnKqyljG1LDA.text: Awesome environment owner extremely personable. Best Indian food buffet in town. Wish there was a jogging track here to make more room

7WoQjTJXgCQBYrOWsjVteA.text: Yum!! Ate the buffet for lunch And omg so good! They have a sweet rice that is so amazing and chicken tiki masala is so amazing!!!! Really really good! They bring fresh naan to the table and have tons of options! They also serve these soft fried dough balls in honey syrup that are so good with the rice pudding!! I will be returning!

FhKguwdbcp6KQr16WogLyA.text: No doubt about it, the best Indian food in Vegas. I've been coming here for years, from 1 to 5 times a week in my prime. My fav dishes are Lamb Jalfrezi, Lamb Tikka Massala and Lamb Rogan Josh, but over the years I've tried almost the entire menu. You can't go wrong.   Wash this glorious food down with an ice cold Taj Mahal and you're golden.  Conveniently located just a few mins from the strip.  A 'must do' when you visit Vegas.  Enjoy!!!

lr0GwGVfWLq9ElEEhL5eoQ.text: Reached at 9.35. Denied service. Either update the timing on website or honor that. The manager told us all indian restaurants close half an hour before posted time, which is not True !!!

6UAlSsFQ6JHE7qoqKvHwXg.text: Went for dinner, so can't speak on the quality of the lunch buffet but the dinner was amazing.  Service is just a tad slower but the food is extremely fresh and worth the wait.  I had the lamb samosas, a must have for any lamb lovers.  Outside very hot and crisp, clearly straight from the fryer to the table.  Tried the butter chicken, fantastic flavor and very tender.  They were generous with the servings and with the rice, even offering refills on the rice.  The garlic naan was fantastic, but how can you go wrong with garlic naan?  The rice pudding is out of this world, fantastic flavors with this little warm dough ball plopped in the middle (a more authentic person than myself would probably know the name of this) that just made it decadent.    We had ordered an appetizer, two entrees, two soft drinks, dessert, naan and a side of raiti sauce and our check was about $40 so the pricing was extremely reasonable.

kYGuzIp-7kGbMW0N9XJKcQ.text: By far the worst dining experience  Food not properly cooked.chicken tikka was raw!! Then they microwaved it and replated and served chewy and shriveled not good.   Place is not clean glass filled with water only to find bits of dust or cloth floating no table cloths sticky icky tables.not worth a dime to spend ..so please avoid visiting the restaurant. Not at all worth the 1 star rated

dcsYOtwODWuZ_Pvf60YLOw.text: Excellent. For $10.99, you'll get a lunch buffet of steaming hot rice, curries, chicken tandoori, masala, salads, and fresh naan bread. A special shout out to Gulab Jamun. I felt dubious at first. What the hell are these copper colored balls floating in a steamy translucent mixture? It looked like something out of Alien. But I was proven wrong. They were sweet, fragrant, and the perfect size. It was like a sponge donut soaked in a sweet sauce. So good! They were the perfect end note after a hearty meal.   The ambience is cute, too: white linen tables, nice glasses and silverware and a television showing Indian pop culture. Fabulous. Plenty of parking around the restaurant and the service was excellent throughout. I will gladly come here again if a pang for Indian food sparked.

p46sXxGNEfRdIeo5reFxYA.text: After a very long journey of trying Las Vegas Indian food and ghastly fusions I finally found a gem.  The nan is made fresh to order and the papadam is never burnt.  Ugh I hate burnt papadam.  If you go for dinner, bring a friend and order the sampler.  The tea is such a treat and the variety is amazing.  My favorites are palek paneer and the little veggie fritters.  I put curry sauce on the and eat them with rice.  The buffet is good, but just never as fresh as when the food is made to order at dinner time.  The service has always been exceptional, and if you are a repeat customer they will remember you.  I absolutely love the food and the people.  Thanks Mt Everest!

7zcKkTELe3CBGZ8c6akLRA.text: Would you care to feed a small army? Does your army enjoy delicious Indian-spiced foods? Then bring them down to Mount Everest! I don't know why, but my husband and I always order our "staples" when we go to an Indian restaurant and we can be pretty particular about them. Things were no different here. Our staples are: Saag Paneer (called Palak Paneer here), Vegetable Korma, Mango Lassi, and Garlic Naan. Because we had a restaurant.com coupon, we were also able to order Paneer Tiki Masala and Vegetable Samosas. Normally at other Indian restaurants this would be a ton of food for us which (sadly) we can finish if we are hungry enough (but we are giant pigs). Mount Everest takes the cake for largest serving sizes in the valley. We had two boxes of leftovers! You are definitely getting your money's worth here. Not only are the portions huge, but this is some of the best Indian food I've had. They have given my beloved Mint a run for their money. The Paneer Tiki Masala had great flavor and lots of paneer. Plus the paneer was fantastic- it was denser than most paneer and had a very mild flavor. I could be wrong, but it seemed like it was made fresh. The Vegetable Korma was mildly spiced (in a good way) and was loaded with a large variety of fresh vegetables. The Saag Paneer was a little different than what I'm used to, but I still enjoyed it. It was a little milder, had a lot of cream, and the spinach was well-blended. All these dishes we ordered medium, but they were pretty mild on the spice. I think we could have could have ordered spicier and been ok. The free Papadums were good and I enjoyed the mint and tamarind sauces. The mango lassi, while having a very interesting intense orange color I'm not used to, was very good as well. The vegetable samosas were gigantic but a little bit on the greasy side. The garlic naan had every inch covered in garlic (hooray!) but seemed a little uncooked in the middle. The service was very friendly but a little slow at times, especially when the place began to fill up. The building may be a little iffy on the outside (what is that, an old Pizza Hut?) it was very nice on the inside and very clean. Plus they play Bollywood movies! Oh, and did I mention that they gave us an extra giant order of rice for all our leftovers? For free? Overall, this is a great place to enjoy some delicious Indian food. Just be prepared to take some home!
