Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saag paneer served with rice.

7lY9ZQn0oRWaWUbGCFDrLw.text: This is my go to Indian restaurant whenever I am in Vegas. Have tried almost all Indian restaurants in the area but none is as good as Mount Everest. Superbly flavored Indian food at its best

wradgjZU5pDanhJ-txUTLg.text: Ok Indian fare for lunch. Curries were hit or miss. Service was decent for this kind of restaurant.

apGmv94J7eacsDtYP4530A.text: I love this place best Indian food I've ever had! We go here about twice a month I have lived all over Vegas and tried a lot of different Indian restaurants no matter where we end up we make the drive to this place ! I get a lot of different things here but my favorite of all time is the lamb tikka masala! We also love to take family and friends that are visiting here service is always great and the  atmosphere is always fun

RvUs37-Bgcgc0twb4pJLmQ.text: This was my first time trying Indian food, and was blown away! I was a bit skeptical at first, considering the outside of the building. But the food and service made up for any of my disbelieving ways. I ordered butter chicken, garlic naan bread, and topped it off with some rice pudding. I couldn't stop putting food in my mouth, the flavors were so good! I might have been wheeled out of the place, but it was totally worth it.  At least one star just for the owner. He was so personable and kind, and genuinely wanted to make sure our time there was well spent. That was the winning point of dinner for me.

5jpOT0a_Uy9_HRBeYY1M0g.text: After seeing good reviews on Yelp I went to this place. The food was no so great. It was a lunch buffet and the taste was just fine. Nothing really extra-ordinary about the place. Don't believe the reviews that it is the best Indian food that they have ever had and all that(Probably those guys have never tasted authentic tasty Indian food)

PY1vflqY8yC-kYK8UBQN5Q.text: One of the best Indian restraunts in town, food , service, ambiance , everything perfect.

KihexB0wkFs1fGJ4ZNAFvg.text: I went today for the lunch buffet and the food was great! My favorite thing about this restaurant is the abundance of vegetarian options. I had the bismati rice, green beans with potatoes, spinach saag, vegetable korma, and samosas.   The rice was perfect and not overcooked. Since I am vegetarian and absolutely love spinach, the saag was my favorite. Everything was seasoned well and had just the right amount of spice. I am glad this restaurant did not go light on the seasonings to appease some delicate palates.   I will say I am not a big fan of buffets, but all of the food was hot and fresh. I also liked the fact they had someone keeping a close eye on the buffet to quickly replace rice and any other food item that was running low.   On a side note, as a local, I forget there are a lot of tourists in town. When a large group stopped by on the way to the airport with luggage in tow, no one gave it a second thought and they were quickly accommodated.   I will definitely be back.

gRNtej84nLSMYc6V-TLKZg.text: I'm originally from the UK and love great Indian food. I've lived in many places across the U.S. Over the years, Seattle, San Diego, Los Angeles, Las Vegas, Austin, Miami, Tampa to name the ones I can remember off the top of my head.  This is my favorite Indian restaurant in the U.S. The food is great and the owner makes everybody feel welcome, like they are in his own home.

SWFADgzcrwsb8b_iFBPJVg.text: I had the lunch buffet today and it was fabulous.  The selections on the buffet were very varied and every one was hot, fresh, and delicious.   The Chicken Tikka Masala was outstanding though.  Creamy sauce perfectly spiced with just a touch of sweetness!   I can't stop thinking about how perfect it was!    The service was also very gracious which made the experience a perfect 10!   Can't wait to be back in Vegas.  Definitely my best meal all week.

thiKN7JfHQsaAcby5Id83Q.text: Probably the best indian food I had! Highly recommended.  Went there with a group of coworkers and all of us loved the food. Price is just right.

sIThVKuy0Y0tsq5ouVcl9w.text: Wow! We went for dinner tonight at 5:00. Shady looking building but the inside is cute and of course it smells amazing. The men working were so nice. We ordered A LOT! The fried paneer, shrimp tikka masala, shrimp vindaloo, garlic naan, lamb naan, and mango lassi. Everything seriously was spectacular. Indian food is my favorite and my boyfriend and I are very judgmental diners. I'm not sure I've had better Indian food than this. The only suggestion I would make is to use larger shrimp. One of the guys even brought over a rose for me as we were leaving. Thank you all for giving us such a great experience.

z2XXM9NDOuWxkyoNjMbv7w.text: LOVE it!  I have eaten here about ten times now, and it is a pretty new restaurant, so that is saying something--especially since I am a very picky eater.  At lunch you can either have the buffet or order from the menu; at dinner you order from the menu.  Many of the items on the lunch buffet vary from day to day--some days there will be chana masala, some days vegetable korma, etc.  It's always great.  I actually like ordering from the menu better, though.  The owner is a very nice guy and works hard to make sure his customers have everything they need.  I have introduced several people to this place, and they all come here regularly now.  And some of them are pretty picky people, too.

R7uiWmTvxwhupz-KcaUc4A.text: Starving Ethiopian kids would go crazy for this food, it is that awesome. The naans are always fresh and soft, great service and the food is always great!

PWj9TmS_0Wr5U5sL8DWb_Q.text: I think it is definitely a decent place, but there are better in vegas. The Tikka masala sauce was definitely lacking, ...and I believe that is the most popular selling indian dish in the U.S..so they need to improve it.  Naan was good...service was friendly.

Kbsuodis7TPmsuIWLdabEQ.text: This place has a great variety of Indian dishes. We were here for the lunch buffet and were not disappointed. The Naan bread was a little fatty and not as crisp as I hoped it would be but all other dishes made up for it. We will be back for sure.

hBirTmT9vnJqP9f7JD79tQ.text: This place is really really really reaaly good. It was a "yelp it to get off the strip" find. Everything made fresh and "instant". (see the naan on the menu). The buffet is for lunch only  and yes, it had some weird decor, a couple of electriic guitars and a neon billiards sign. Go here. Eat here.

JBhd6ecjuX1sQw9btGFaug.text: Love this place. I make excuses to be on that side of town mid day so I can do the lunch buffet. Delicious. Wish I didn't get full so quickly. Went the first time with a visiting friend. We had the big sampler deal- took home two styro containers. It was even delicious cold the next day. Indian cuisine is not for everyone- but if you like it- you'll love Mt. Everest.

B8Z2jDUQSd5ZE1Wo-KT2Gg.text: I and 4 co-workers tried this place for lunch. I was anticipating this place opening as soon as I saw the sign that it was an Indian restaurant AND had lunch buffet so when it finally opened, we had to go.  It did not disappoint! The lunch buffet is 8.99 and there is a great selection of food. It's not the BEST Indian that I've had but for the value, it is excellent!! The thing I also appreciated was the naan was included with the meal and you didn't have to pay extra for it as I had at other Indian restaurants. They give you a choice of either plain or garlic so we went with garlice. It was awesome! Hot and fresh from the oven, had herbs and plenty of garlic to our liking.  The service was great as well as the servers attended to our table and made sure our drink glasses were never empty. They checked regularly to ask how everything was.  All of us left VERY full and happy with our experience at Mt. Everest. We will definitely be returning regularly for lunch.

0m3Q0qmrBZZJQTOE0v5IJw.text: Actually a pretty good place.   Owner is always there and very nice.  Food is good and reasonably priced.  Try the pistachio ice cream.  it's sooo good.

W6FuwRRiF_Zm7QzABqnjdQ.text: Don't judge a book by it's cover (they got new windows that makes them look closed hehe). We love this place. Great selection, changes per day (good thing because we do come here consecutively). The service is friendly and attentive. Lunch buffet= 8.99, wow. For the low maintenance diner.

xeQVeuJkudFfS3Ry8xvIkA.text: Mt. Everest is a great find and we were really impressed with the caring service from Prakass and food.  We had Chicken Tikka Masala (fabulous) we were eating the sauce by itself when the chicken was gone, Rogan Josh (lamb) was tender and NO FAT.  The Naan bread was fluffy and crispy.  I'm not a beer drinker but our server Prakass suggested that we try the Indian beer, Taj Mahal.  Loved it. The food portions are generous as well.   Will definitely return

TBl2CoSqBAdtGU5j0M5z5A.text: according to my indian roommate...this place is ok. however, when she is comparing the food to her mom's home cooking, that means the place is pretty legit. we stopped by to check out the lunch buffet. you can't really beat it for $8.99. lots of food....plenty of curries (veggie, chicken, lamb), samosas, buttered chicken, etc. the naan was really good, they brought it out piping hot from the kitchen. i'm not the best person to ask about indian food...but i thought it was good. so i would def come back. =)

-pR5vFN2HIcxUn31CmrZ3w.text: Dined alone here on a Saturday evening; four other tables were occupied.  The host and waiter was one of the sons of the Napalese family that owns the restaurant.  I had tomato soup, garlic naan, and lamb tikka mesala (ordered "6.5" spiciness).  I enjoyed all, but I thought the soup was especially good.  $19.97 plus tax, including white tablecloths and cloth napkins.  I expect to return.

akD31wn1Z79UoPANuHhigg.text: Most of the time, their buffet looks beat up and it tastes like it's out of a can.  Sometimes it's good, sometimes not.  And the service . . . forget about it.  Service is lousy.  I think these positive reviews are from their relatives. Too many Indian restaurants in town to eat at this one and this Mt. Everest is one of the newer ones.  It's not all that bad, but I'd rather try out some other places.  Vegas didn't used to have many Indian restaurants.   Ghandi's went down hill years ago.

4gf63eMwEj_h-II1bictUw.text: First experience with Indian food, very delicious.  Made the server aware of my first time and he took care of everything. Awesome experience, for sure heading back.

4oqlE_L47wJZZVXPlK9-4w.text: My wife and I went last night . This now is, by far, our favorite Indian Joint. Amazing

5zN-jZJhKTToS1U65WuVig.text: Reviews are 100% correct.   Food is outstanding and very authentic!!!   Beware that the place DOES not look that impressive from the outside, but rest assured the Food is outstanding!

ODMYLG4vI5t8eejUTVAG8A.text: This place is excellent. The entire restaurant was perfect. The staff warmly welcomes you like family. You feel that you belong here. The food just tastes great. The food is plentiful and excellent. Once you taste the food you will love it. The price is pretty inexpensive. The ambience is also good.  My colleagues and I go there thrice a week to eat there. It is THE Indian cuisine of Las Vegas.

YJiNyf-46EMLOwKUhVFaEw.text: I've been to Mt Everest several times for lunch (buffet) and dinner, and have been pleased on each visit. I had dinner there about 1 week ago, portions were large, food was good quality, service was fast and friendly, overall definitely recommended.

zMYsBHjTYtvM1E2ezRRJtA.text: i just loved the buffet, amazing food forget the buffet go here for lunch the food is amzing the breads are fresh and the service is amazing and very good variety of food and all tasting very nice :)  very impressed :)

xJnqN5FOsE4ODXfum2ytvg.text: Great place. Went for the 11 dollar lunch buffet. They had lots of delicious choices; among them were pakoras, saag paneer, curry lentils, chicken tikka masala, and two kinds of rice, including my beloved basmati with peas. Everything was hot, fresh, and tasty. They brought us hot naan bread in a basket with our meal. Service was excellent. I would love for them to add a dessert--rice pudding, maybe? Good experience. Highly recommend.

PCHoaGZujEkdg9JLr6Ta-Q.text: Just got done having lunch here and again...the BEST INDIAN FOOD in VEGAS hands down. The staff is amazing and they understand how to treat their customers, regular or new. The buffet is a can't miss. Beats anything on the strip in my opinion.

4DIp7uPFrSMujvTyFGJR9g.text: This place has by far the best lunch buffet with everything tasting fresh and flavorful.

2tCzsbKVVBDOyHWNkqXFXQ.text: Outstanding Indian food in an unglamorous part of town. Love the food & service, atmosphere inside is very good.

OeKQVM3If11Wv9fHpQkzQA.text: Mt Everest is excellent. The owner is always there and always in a great mood. The food is delicious every time. This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas, and in my opinion the best place to eat Indian food. Highly recommended!

LP3MTsh2jpRgRFP2Voyc6A.text: we stopped here on 12/28 evening  after enjoying a day long in valley of Fire. It's located completely away from Strip, so pretty good spacious parking space available. Ordered Garlic Naan (Aweome ! sooperb), jeera rice (just too much of Jeera felt bit uncomfortable wile chewing), Mushroom masala and Paneer tikka masala along with Pakora - all prepared with perfect authentic propositions. Few of my friends tried Lamb Briyani and they said it was hard to bite. But on the whole we had a perfect diinner for our evening. Hall is very spacious and have very less  wait time is 1-4 mins.  -  Must try if you are in need to tasty good Indian food in LV

w16Gx-x3zd6G_BdjIxhbLw.text: Food was amazing and I would totally go again! Plus it's so much cheaper than anywhere else!:-)

gxG8PFw-wicuR1kcJ3rghw.text: The chicken tiki masala is delicious and the servers were so nice.  When we first pulled up we were not so sure because it looks small and old and in an older area but once you got inside it was ok and smelled so good.

2dhP3Imoo1xngTPZAKj00w.text: I went to this restaurant based on reviews but let me tell you it was a disappointment. I would give it a 2.5 stars at best. Plenty of better choices in the city.

mpZ-oXzJgCVpQ9_os6cluQ.text: Very good food for the price ...nice selection for the veggie people and taste of the food was great

6Ff1t5bRdSxBmpXlo6uUzg.text: Best Indian in town. The wait staff is extremely knowledgable and friendly and gives great recommendations.  I have been here multiple times and never have had a bad experience.

RGnLC1biEwWy0eqb6pA1cg.text: This is the best indian food you will have in your life unless you actually go to India.  The lamb is tender, no matter the dish, and the spice levels are always on point. The naan is fluffy like a big cloud on the sky (chili garlic naan is DELICIOUS!!).   The most delicious thing though is the butter chicken. Good god almighty. He recipe is nothing I have ever had before and is apparently a secret recipe.  On top of everything the staff is polite and super kind. It's the indian cheers of Las Vegas.

GJjiX5zFo2gM0OpmCKJwrQ.text: After wanting to try this place on my last couple visits to Vegas, I finally made it there on Monday. The husband and I literally drove from Phoenix straight to Mount Everest for the lunch buffet. This buffet was no joke, the food on it was very good. We both felt it was one of the best Indian buffets we had been to. So much so, that I ate a ton of food and couldn't eat another thing for the rest of the day. Standout dishes were the chickpea curry, the sweet rice (never seen this before!), and the warm carrot dessert.... so tasty! The chicken tikka masala wasn't the best I'd ever had. Complaints include: we finished a full plate of food before getting the opportunity to ask for naan (they didn't bring any to us), our booth was in a weird corner you had to squeeze into, and their women's bathroom wasn't super clean (although I imagine that was from a recent customer and not due to a general lack of cleanliness). I would recommend this place to locals for sure.

sOshf34dCZzyBTskW3jVUA.text: Very delicious Indian food at reasonable prices! Friendly staff. My wife and I had just finished climbing in Red Rock and were craving Indian. This place had good yelp review so we drove on over and it was as awesome as everybody on yelp said it was! We ate vegetarian: momos, daal soup, masala and some mushroom dish along with garlic naan. Very tasty--especially the momos!

DR06bM9VdNobRwRcqZ-auw.text: Brilliant buffet- super spongy naan, crunchy pakoda and samosa were my favorites. If u r dying for some good Indian food, this place will definitely satisfy you

b_zp_dTa_aD2XPAA8dzPZw.text: I've never gone here for dinner, only for the lunch buffet.  If you enjoy eating a lot of meat, you'll probably be disappointed with the lunch buffet. But, that's normal for most Indian buffets I've been to. I usually only eat the vegetarian dishes.  The naan is better than most I've tried. It's soft and thick, rather than the tortilla-bread-like naan you find at some places.  They also have basic potato samosas and vegetable pakora.   Sadly, I don't get to come as often, because I don't work nearby anymore. :(

MRbXzP-TfDBVptwMyZ8Iaw.text: Girlfriend brought me here at 2:30, just 30 minutes before they close the buffet. Normally I would never go to a buffet right before they close because of the poor food choices that are left but this is not the case! All the food was still being replaced and hot and ready. The chicken curry and sweet rice were especially delicious! Price is cheap too. Only $10.99 for a Indian buffet for kings? Yes please! Will definitely recommend to friends and return for more!

s_Rrb-Q1N1k9iRbrq5qz1Q.text: We love this place.  Travel from Henderson to eat here.  Staff is friendly and attentive.  Food is prepared exceptionally.  You can taste the individual flavors in all the dishes.

rC2l2CewFyx_H0SrSazBBw.text: We came to this restaurant based on yelp reviews and we were not disappointed. This place is not only close to my house, but everything we ordered was delicious. From service to presentation and portion size we had a perfect evening out. We ordered Saag with Lamb, butter chicken, tandoori chicken and garlic naan. The least favorite was the tandoori chicken. Not that anything was wrong with it, but because everything else was so damn delicious that the tandoori chicken was the only thing left over. This is our new go to place for indian food. I will 100% return

yitjVQvA4Mtfw79r91SQ-w.text: the food is the best i try other Indian place in town and none of them was as good as this one! the buffet lunch is supper really good price and great food the staff is nice and friendly

2LZsEc-evJmU1gwxYfcGHg.text: Best Indian food in Las Vegas! Great food. Great service. Can't go wrong :)   My Recommendations:   1. For Appetizers: Vegetarian Samosa, Chicken Momos (spicy).   2. For Entrees: Tandoori Chicken, Chicken Tikka Masala, Bhindi Masala (Vegetable - Okra), Garlic & Regular Naan (to dip w/ Curries), Chicken or Mutton Biryani (Indian Jumbalaya), Raita (yogurt sauce to cool you down if you can't handle the spice).  3. For Dessert: Gulab Jamun (Indian donut in sugar syrup), Kheer (Indian tapioca pudding).

eFOHDEBXeBivn8n2BGdWag.text: I had never had sweet rice before.  Absolutely de-lish!!! The restaurant was packed when we arrived and stayed that way! Best palak paneer I have ever had and the chicken curry and masala were divine!!

2TxRW2GboetGPZMFV8rQrw.text: Food is not amazing, but not terrible. Not a huge fan of places that serve tap water though.

XVj2nPs7l6p9re9hJ750Cw.text: Had the lunch buffet nice variety, good business dine and run crowd, Professional staff.  Will be back next time I'm in town. .

ydZdmJjbZGf4inw20dXvmA.text: Very enjoyable!  I have to start off by saying you need to ignore the environment. The location inside isn't nice on the eyes. But once the food starts coming you forget and just dive in. The food was top quality start to finish. we ordered many dishes I have to say everyone was better than the first from the naan to the chicken dishes each was a winner in its own right.  My only regret was not saving room for dessert. If it was as good as dinner and the appetizers it would have been a treat.

qxHweFHdyZeqtJ_Di4vBqw.text: The buffet line is simple and small, but if you like spice and want something different, I recommend going during lunch 11am - 3pm for $10.99 and the flavor is great, they only give a couple small pieces of naan for the food so you have to keep asking for more, it also cost I think $3 more for a soda. They have items for vegetarians like spinach with cheese and potato with indian seasoning.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LcLnPzLEUMLRJfgMvrTzLg.text: This is hands down my favorite Indian restaurant in town.  The food is amazing and the service is fast friendly and attentive.  We always ask the owner for recommendations so we can try something new and he never disappoints.  We always order extra to take home for the next day. Delicious  I highly recommend everyone to try this restaurant. You will keep coming back for more!

aVdvjGZl42Z0fWpIdyhsXA.text: Food was delicious and service was great. Thank you for the great hospitality. We will definitely recommend this place .

lTnnQfK2-RXw-Cg-1BJD8Q.text: Epic Buffet! Seriously some of the best Indian Food I have ever had!! Found this place on Yelp! And the consensus isn't a lie. The chicken is excellent quality, the selection is vast as well. They bring papadam and naan to the table. Mango lassi is fantastic too!! So happy I tried this spot.  You won't be disappointed!!

dBuQsfS2Ayr6G5p8an1bYA.text: Not a huge reviewer, but had to make sure this place got a great rating from me. Not shocking that it is already rated five stars with over one thousand reviews. Everytime I eat at Mt Everest I am reminded that it is so delicious, but more importantly, it is THE BEST for customer service. Anyone living in Las Vegas knows True customer service is very rare. The owner, Prakash, is super slauthentic and polite and always makes us feel welcome. Tonight I ordered the wrong dish, Chicken Tikka instead of Chicken Tikka Marsala, and he made it right and did not charge me even though it was totally my mistake. I even offered to pay for it so i could have it for lunch but he would not hear of it.  A place with this quality of fare and the best customer service truly deserves five stars.  Thank you Mt. Everest for providing a place to dine where I can be treated like a person. I will be back soon!

2tYC9muptyi8Fvoj7wEBdg.text: Food is amazing.   Service is Excellent.   Restaurant is great.   Prices are very reasonable.  I HIGHLY HIGHLY HIGHLY  recommend this place!!!    Ishwar (Part owner) was so accommodating and so nice.

UEVp-PKjAR1MTzEq2VjA8g.text: This is our favorite Indian restaurant in Las Vegas. The food is delicious and we keep coming back!  Also really friendly and attentive staff. We are always well taken care of!

lpvW32FN7qUW9UNNrqR9Ow.text: Asked for the garlic naan to have extra garlic.  It was wonderfully fresh and fluffy.  The chicken tika masala was deliciously tender.  The service was fast and friendly.  And owner Prakash finished us off with some nice desert!  Nice experience.

Oa5NcEg6yyhzcRacZRTMyA.text: Me and my husband love this place. Food is excellent! We come here whenever we crave for Indian food. (Like once a week...LOL) We've tried different places before but we always end up going back here. Food is served fast, servers are friendly most especially the owner. He always make sure everyone is enjoying the food and of course very good service! Highly recommended.

Ta-wHHchEbS4S9sMmkXUFQ.text: The best Indian food in and around las vegas strip... Worth taking a cab from your hotel/ casino just to eat here. I had buffet and all the dishes were so good, it felt like authentic homemade indian stuff. Veg korma and chicken masala were amazing... and hot butter naans were cherry on top... The owner is very helping and hospitable... V welcoming nd decent ambience.

N7jzGeOSZKOwAZdiFi9b2w.text: Tikka masala was great! Tried it with their garlic bread and it's heaven. Great staff and very friendly. Check this place out if you love Indian food.

r09pd6l3Xx3tzlSS6GLdfA.text: I went for dinner and had a great variety meal that showcased many appetizers and dishes for around $20.  The appetizers of deep fried vegetables and chicken was well cooked but nothing extraordinary.  The main meal had great variety and a small kick.  We ordered 7 on the spiciness scale and it was barely hot or noticeable other than a few late hit on some dishes.  The chicken, lamb, and spinach were great.  The bread and naan were tasty as well.  Overall nothing really to complain about.    I hear great things about their buffet and I feel like my meal was similar to their lunch offering.  I enjoyed my meal so I would imagine a lunch buffet in my future will be just as enjoyable as well.  I will be back.  Service could be a little better but hey, the food overpowers it.

Jp2bxF50FxgOQO8d1xrJIw.text: I ordered dinner because I was craving something exotic and different. I called in and the menu on Yelp really helped me order since I never been here before. This place was recommended by one of my clients that says she always comes here because the food and service is exceptional. I called-in the order for pick up and a gentleman helped me. I ordered the food items then towards the end I was confused because I wasn't sure how much I should order for 2 people. Then he said, are you ordering for tomorrow lunch as well? I guess I ordered too much. Haha! He said that he recommend removing one entree from the order and that should be more than enough for dinner for 2 people. I appreciated this because it was a lot of food! The gentleman was very professional and nice.   The food was fantastic! So flavorful, delicious and fresh! The garlic naan was a bit addicting. Chicken tandoori was very satisfying. You cannot go wrong with the food here. If you are into Indian food or you are a first timer, you need to come here and try! I cannot wait to come here with a group of friends.  One thing that I think would make this place even better is background soft Indian music to make the experience better. Just my thoughts :)

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice cozy dinner setting

nrKmyITxDbdtlQRHxm5efg.text: We LOVE it here. We've visited Mt. Everest at least four times - yum!! Authentic and delicious. Prakash provided excellent service and the food was AWESOME!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0LjmmOq3gcLva2iFR6X0Gg.text: I had never had India ever. And one day my friend asked me if I wanted to go have some Indian food And it blew my mind it was so good. If you're adventurous and you like good food definitely try this place and it's a great price.

YOfMJKPRTYFR3U532f42aw.text: Hands down the best Indian cuisine in Vegas.  Plakat Paneer (spinach & home made cheese) brings back incredible memories of Indian town in Singapore. ..doesn't get any more authentic than this. . And you can beat the $10.99 lunch buffet price!

LJ0H_XQDiH8SpGYsdk51yg.text: Every time my husband I come here, I fall in love with the place all over again.  I've only been here for dinner, not the buffet, but have heard great things from friends about that as well.  The food is amazing, the service is always friendly and conscientious and the atmosphere is a mix of small intimate date night and casual laid back.  My favorite is the Thali non-vegetarian, which comes with a mix of several small servings of different dishes, the fruit and nut naan, and a pair of mango lassis. This is enough food to feed me and my husband and we leave stuffed, for not that much money for a sit down restaurant. Once, we even brought our 6 year old and he was treated as courteously as any adult guest, with the staff making suggestions of things he might like to try. I love this place!   I recommend Mt. Everest to all my friends looking for something different but delicious. Even the water is a little bit magical, and the naan is the best in town!

5Aplq0wbmlYx5yR9HAWb-A.text: This is my favorite Indian buffet in town.  I love Tikka Masala, and theirs is one of the best I've tasted.  They bring out fresh, hot naan with the meal right to your table.  They've got some spicy dishes, which I always appreciate.  It's always a treat to eat at Mt Everest.  Thank you and keep up the good work!

phisCPS-0ztxgbmV8-phBQ.text: This is typical family run Indian place ..just off the strip ..very enthusiastic guys and service is great . Food is also nice . Decor could have been better but the guys friendly disposition makes for it ..the food is fresh and portion size is great .

cDdZsTU2x5hxoVXQOZhisg.text: Lunch Buffet.  Great food.  Service was mediocre, what with the owner/employee talking on the phone while tending customers.  But the food makes up for it.  Naan was fresh and soft, a decent amount of choices at the buffet.  But everything tasted amazing.  It is most definitely worth the trip away from the strip to come here.

LQp77SirQVp59l4GUosOjA.text: Tried their lunch buffet and it was good for most part. They had a big selection of veg and meat dishes and also a south indian sambar and idli option. The place was very busy and it took about 15 min. after we had served ourselves to get a naan. The good items on the menu were: Kheer(rice pudding)-amazing! samosa-nicely seasoned and not greasy at all butter chicken-very good roghan josh( lamb)-very good  The not so good: dal makhani-dal was not cooked completely and was tooooo salty kadhi-it was made very well but toooooo salty again pakora-dry and hard white rice-dried out  Since they were busy, it was very difficult for us to get the attention of the server(who was the only one doubling as the cashier as well). We gave up and didn't get a second naan. It also took forever to get the bill so we finally walked up and paid at the register. It may be a good idea to get more help on the weekends.

RP2RxeLIrCO_awSYPK4fjA.text: If you are looking for Indian food in Las Vegas, this is the place to go. The food was awesome.  We are vegetarians and there were lots of items to choose from. The service was exceptional (looking at the location and the appearance, it did not look special, but the food definitely was). There was no veg vindaloo available but the chef made it specially for us and it was superb (special thanks to them for making something so customized). Appetizers, sides, breads and rice were all excellent. The next time we are going to be in LV, this would be our to go place.

kFYhCV3xRz3ZnXCSTyaZMQ.text: Vegetarian Review: The food, service, and atmosphere were decent. I liked that the food was not oily.

ho8wLMGxcVrJRLvMsJONFQ.text: The staff behaved very bad...if you ask them for "liquor menu" their reply is an arrogant "No" because you asked for a wrong menu...it's called the "Beer Menu" (not liquor...lol)  Food is average, not something exciting. All my rating is for the samosa and the Indian bread, which was always served hot! Very good service, even when it was crowded.  Overall a decent 2 star

T4oRliOe_QyAVM483UMy6A.text: Great service! Super friendly staff . Food was steaming hot ! We ordered the spicy lamb dish and potato stuffed naan . The rice was perfectly cooked . We've tried a lot of different Indian restaurants all over the u.s & this is by far one of the best !

X4967hQeDfmCuL8SS-KfMA.text: Dive into this incredible buffet 10 bucks. 5star   I love Indian, and they do it really great here, and you cannot beat the price.  Small place in the ghetto, sahara and valley view, not too ghetto, but still, its not pretty on this corner, but inside, you forget about it quick when you start salivating at the door, and running to the buffet like a wild animal ready to eat yourself silly.  Take a breath, its ok, this place will give you everything you need.   Every indian spice is in something, the quality and freshness is stellar!   Hightly recommended, just see the other reviews, dont take my word for it, try it and take you own word, its amazing!

G5ONKFtDnMNcGZ9EGpWoSA.text: This place was amazing! My boyfriend and I took his mom there for a late Mother's Day dinner. He had recently gone to India so she thought trying Indian good sounded good. We showed up and got seated right away. Very small, quiet place. All the employees were very nice and our server was very helpful with suggestions. There were 5 of us so we just got a bunch of different things to share. This dish I chose was the lamb masala! AMAZING!! Very sweet/spicy sauce and that lamb was cooked perfectly. By the end of the meal everyone was so full and the bill was very reasonable. Overall great experience and will definitely be back to try the lunch buffet!

6Ktc3il7LIBqx3QRo-pIpQ.text: we had a short vacation to vegas this year and Mt. Everest was the best thing that happened to us! we had both the lunch buffet and dinner here and was one of the best indian food places my wife and I have ever been to in the US! their naan and paneer dishes were made from scratch and you can taste the fresh ingredients cooked to perfection! service was great and the owner too was very friendly. i really look forward to visit this place again on our next trip. indian food lovers this place is a MUST VISIT during your vegas trip!

2Nrm4oqJ_MyegH4kkfgKRA.text: Lunch buffet was fabulous! A good number and variety of dishes to choose from. Friendly and attentive staff as well. Must try if you like Indian.

Vu-gpWFgf05hTrsPwcPlUA.text: The best indian food. I am stuffed. Wondeful fluffy naan. The vegetable korma was a little sweet and absolutely delightful. Chicken tandoori was flavorful. The goat was tasty. Palaak paneer good as always. And the Tikka masala sauce was perfect for sopping naan in. My girlfriend loves the sweet rice and everything is just wonderful. So good it hurts.

T3AieRsB0VhRjQrql8rqSA.text: Taste was there, BUT $13.99 for Fish Curry & barely get 4 bites of fish hummmmmmm, where's the fish????????? - feel definitely overpaid for this dish - lentil dish very good, but then Lentils are very inexpensive - Dad lives on Valley View, will advise if he is hungry do not eat at Mt. Everest

sX56tCgz9DgqEI11qfpYPQ.text: Amazing food, great prices, excellent service. I'd happily come here again. Get the paneer pakora. It is excellent!

7i3MouMkFlEqEvFZH2fIXA.text: New fan FAVORITE!!  We have been in Las Vegas for about a year and we are slowly adding to our list of favorite ethnic restaurants. This place is TOPS!  The owner greeted us and instantly made a friend in my 4 yr old by giving her a high five. Gotta love a place that embraces kids!  The service was fantastic and the food was even better than fantastic. We can't wait to go back!  We devoured the chicken tiki masala and lamb curry. And let me not forget the 2 orders of garlic naan. We left stuffed, yet wanting more!  Until next time...

awynIEG4hFjkb9Ngc-UQAA.text: Best Indian buffet in Vegas. Restaurant is very clean and staff is always very friendly and attentive. Good selection of items on buffet and they are always hot and fresh.

Z_QM25-7_LOOmNFPRjzdvQ.text: Great buffet.  The options were were plenty, food was fresh and authentic.  Would definitely go back.

QFzXsflokhfZCvJDUXqjvA.text: Good Nepali food. Affordable, clean and tasty. Everyone should try the momos, they're top notch.

TrSW47EzPB2ndcWBg3goeg.text: Wow, I had high hopes for this place with all the rave reviews. This place was a flop! We arrived at 11:30am for the lunch buffet. The food was just ok, below average at best. They open at 11am, getting there 30 min past opening time, I'm assuming everything would be super fresh and piping hot. The food was just warm, by the time I made my plate and sat down it was already room temperature. I serve myself some palak paneer but had trouble finding any cubes of paneer in there. Ridiculous, if it was the end of the buffet, this makes sense but how are they going to last until 3pm if they already ran out after 30 minutes? The chicken tikka masala was meh, the chicken was super dry and almost grainy. The malai kofta - ok seriously, wtf!! The kofta balls were just floating on top of the gravy, they weren't even soaked in. I had to mix them in!! They were way too stiff. Then I make an attempt at the chili chicken. Again, I am searching for pieces of chicken in the vat of bell peppers. Oh and they were out of naan, so we had to wait which gave our food more time get cold - annoying!! The naan was super thick and more like a pita, I'm used to thin and crispy, charred naan, like a flatbread. I'm not sure how this place has so many epic reviews. I'm Indian and I advise you - do not eat here, you can find better. At least the $12.99 price was decent but who cares about the low price when the food isn't even worth it?

lnHW0O5wz5vPvWcFoAd1Bw.text: After reading all the great reviews I was excited to try Everest, but I would not return. As far as Indian food goes it was a little disappointing, spicy enough but lacking intense flavors and not a huge variety to choose from. The tandoori was dry and not season very well. I also found a hair in the plate but that's something I can forgive them for. The restaurant is small and darkly lit and somewhat depressing.  I was hoping it was good since I live right down the street, but I guess I will have to drive farther to go to my favorite Indian place Mint next time, it's worth the trip.

8JdN0LqamvoAAG1q6G30rg.text: Wow. As in W-O-W. Full disclosure: I never thought I'd stumble upon my favorite traditional Indian restaurant in the middle of the Mojave desert, but this was no mirage yelpers. Mt. Everest is hands down some of the most delicious Indian I've ever tasted.   Right off the bat, this place has got a great atmosphere. Colorfully decorated and dimly lit with upbeat Indian music and a friendly and attentive wait staff. I felt welcomed right away and was glad to find that the menu was just as accommodating to me with its many vegetarian dishes. My biggest problem was narrowing down to a few dishes because truth be told, I wanted it to order up everything on that menu. But I started off with just the complimentary papadum, which was spiced with cumin and went perfectly with their mint chutney.   Let's just hit the brakes for a second here so I can tell you about this glorious green creation that became my favorite mint chutney ever to grace these tastebuds. It was just divine. So fresh and so smooth with the perfect balance of spice and herbs. My best advice? Arm yourselves with multiple sides of it and get ready to add that magic to the everything you eat - you won't regret it.   I started things off with the samosa which was flaky on the out, fluffy on the in, and stuffed with a yummy compilation of peppered potatoes and peas. Then I moved right on over to the vegetable pakora which didn't disappoint with the light and spicy batter (both integral mint chutney moments here, people). Then, as I was at this point very familiar with the art of going "all in" (RIP all my chips at the roulette table), I ordered up the whole Vegetable Thali which came with vegetarian appetizers and palek paneer, daal, and kofta. The paneer cheese was delicious, the lentils in the daal were too, and the kofta was a mix of delicious vegetables in a creamy tomato sauce, topped with nuts which really kicked the dish up a notch texturally. I also ordered the aloo gobi and the potatoes and cauliflower were cooked just right.   In a lot of cases, I'll order Indian with a high spice level only for the dish to come lackluster and plain as ever in the spice department. This wasn't the case at Mt. Everest; everything I ordered had me feeling like one of my girl Daenerys' dragons and I loved every minute of it.   Garlic naan was hot and fresh with great buttery and garlic flavor, the basmati rice was light and the perfect compliment to all of the plates. And the rice pudding was the first I've ever finished when ordering up the vegetarian dinner plate. It was an excellent cool down to a fiery and flavorful feast. At the end of our meal, the owner came to introduce himself and offered to make us another dessert especially for the table. After feeling like I ate my way through India itself and then halfway into Bangladesh, I declined - but you better believe your girl will be back to cash in on that goodness someday in the near future.  If you're visiting or in the area, I can't recommend this place enough. There's a reason it's racking up these five stars fanatics. Whether you're a local or just a passing tourist, Mt. Everest will have you feeling like you hit the dinner jackpot.

yvDa7Kzf-6IZ8qXYl6RsUQ.text: Im there every other week. Quick, unlimited lunch! Im big fan of goat and they have it! Highly recommended!

u1XLS3Dpt447YP7-G2z8LQ.text: It has been awhile since I've been, and I'm so glad I returned!  The staff is friendly and the food is delicious. We had the lamb tika masala, lamb korma, and naan. Yummy!  Hope to return soon!

kapL5zG48R4F9nFn5vPZCw.text: Still the one to beat. It's the one that I judge other Indian-American restaurants by. Superlative food, but the standards, no innovation, no flair, no incredible presentation or service.  But the food is REALLY REALLY GOOD, and not over-priced. It would be difficult to be disappointed here. You can order it as spicy as you want, from don't-hurt-me to Flaming Ears, and they will respect your choice. My ears burned off, and I'm happy. Good for larger parties, if noisy and a little crowded.

B2lNeLPWosm7xiK7FbvqyA.text: Wasn't impressed with the taste profile of the food. If you can't get chicken tikka masala which I assume is the highest selling item. Heavenly loaded with spices instead of delicate flavor of tikka masala. Rice was dried out - might be sitting all day. Won't be going back.

VNBcqk9i2YsZtfY1UStLhQ.text: This place is a overpriced piece of crap. I am not sure about the buffet, but went there once for dinner, and the food was terrible. I don't know why there's always a long line though, for such shitty food and environment

-cMkeb-8G7uhvg0Zc-jg7Q.text: Good place for a quick north indian food. The items were not much spicy, 4 rating for that reason.

j5WW9fXvcmoAndHW3sOoxA.text: The best Indian Restaurant in Las Vegas. You can debate different dishes at different restaurants but you cannot debate the service and staff. The lunch buffet is a must! Very wide assortment of dishes, all you can eat and the food is delicious. Dinner service is just as good. We have been coming here for years and the food never disappoints!

ish7bU9Cgr3KHLVgHO-uyA.text: Authentic, genuine, delicious and mouthwatering flavors of India, all synonymous to this family-owned restaurant. Owner Prakash is an impeccable host. If you're a first timer don't be intimidated by the menu. Prakash will be more than happy to guide you through it and make some recommendations.  Don't be fooled by the outside. This place is a hidden gem. My wife and I have tried other upscale Indian restos and Mt. Everest keeps on going back to our top list. Thumbs up!

kBDsNZfA7lJjcQcSEXaXCQ.text: How can this Resturant get 5 stars?? People are rude, it smells , looks unhygienic... hopefood is better... Resturant is a hospitality business.. so be welcoming not rude when people walk into your place for crying out loud.. this is America.

D6p2XvvfCCwMeIwV7rVk0Q.text: I'm not an avid Yelper/reviewer so I almost forgot to update. I had been coming to this place a lot for the past year. I feel the service is getting worse each time I come. I havent/didnt revise my review yet becausw I used to love this place, I refused to leave a negative review. Although the last visit, my husband just didn't feel like eating so I was the only one who ate (buffet). This place wasn't our plan for lunch but I'm pregnant and have random cravings so my husband was sweet enough to drive me all the way here. When we came in and told them only one would be eating, the older man gave us this look like he was going to roll his eyes. I'm not sure if he's the owner/manager but he's the one that often seats, cashout checks and answers the phone. Once we were seated, another man asked for our drinks. I told him two cups of water if it's alright since my husband wasn't eating. He gave us one. We let it go since my husband had a drink from Starbucks. As I ate of course I needed water. After my first trip and towards the middle of my second round  (of only vegetarian options btw-meaning what I ate were cheap food cost wise) I have flagged and asked three employees for a water refill but none of them came back. The owner or maybe manager guy also saw my cup empty but didn't bother to ask if I needed a refill. I saw him look at my cup. It was terrible. I lost my appetite without even finishing the rest of my meal. Again to give you an ideas what I ate, I was only eating Malai kofta, paneer and the plain binyari rice. It was the only ones I was craving. My husband was already upset from the beginning but was shocked when I got up telling him I'm done while still chewing. I walked to the cashier and he followed me. We there there for like 10mins tops. The owner/manager even said "oh done already?" So I told him "yeah I lost my appetite. I asked for water multiple times and no one came back". He said "oh sorry about that". But still didn't offer it. Wow just wow. We come all the way here from Sahara and Town Center. And we've brought our families and recommended this place to many friends. Never again will step foot here nor recommend it. There are 2-3 Indian buffets near us but chose this because of their Malai kofta. Check out Angara, they have way better service and a more beautiful restaurant. Also, I recently just read they were once on Dirty Dining yikes!

D2nd_ciVJK77CgFZ1fud-A.text: this is the best indian food in las vegas and i've tried alot of them. Everything tastes great and the food is made using fresh ingredients, you can tell. I think management is from nepal so its more northern indian flavor. I've been coming here for over 6 years and never once has it let me down. It can get crowded during lunch hour but never had to wait more than a few minutes. Lunch buffet to go is a nice option. I wish i lived a little bit closer.

R2VEFVPHAjtAWP3dYITlmQ.text: Great Indian food. Loads of vegetarian variety. Humble and friendly staff. Family run place with loads of love in the food.

hJjDL47YgXLMJV9woAWB7A.text: Yummy food. Loved the naan. Soft and fresh. Paneer tikka masala was very tasty as well. Worth the money. :)

wMpWHV4b_kQH--Gpeic1tQ.text: Mount Everest is an excellent choice to get your Nepali (Indian) fix! We ordered chicken momo and mango lassi for the appetizers which were great. The chicken tikka and goat curry really hit the spot too (two big thumbs up!). My parents were impressed with the goat and would highly recommend it to others that enjoy khasi! The Dal makhani is a great choice as well and all the entrees come with rice. Naan was really fresh too but does not come with any of the entrees. It was an excellent meal but the ambiance isn't exactly "Vegas". But come here for some amazing food at a great price!! Only a mile or two away from the strip!

5ydGydBdW5ARdVsVlAsCmQ.text: This is the place my sister and I have to hit up every time we come to visit relatives in Vegas.  The restaurant is clean with ample parking and easy access in comparison to many other Vegas restaurants.  People have typically low expectations when going to a lunch buffet, but we were blown away by the quality of the food. I personally prefer vegetarian Indian dishes, and they did not disappoint. Aloo gobi was the best I'd ever had. The potatoes and cauliflower were cooked to the perfect tenderness and  had the perfect seasoning. The palak paneer was unique and savory. Chana masala was more acidic and fragrant than I am use to, but it was a welcome change. Don't get me started on whatever that sweet rice is called, it's orange, and is made with magic and cashews.  The non vegetarian dishes were quite good as well. The chicken tikka masala was creamy without being heavy. The goat curry was delicious, savory and perfectly cooked. The flesh fell off of the bone and was more tender than I thought possible of goat meat.   After I mopped up the delicious remnants of my meal with the fresh crispy naan brought to my table, I realized not once did I find my water glass empty. The hosts were very friendly, and checked on us often at our table. Prakash, the benefactor of the restaurant, stopped by to make sure the food was to our satisfaction. After asking about taking some gulab jamun (a must try) to-go, he brought some over free of charge. Beautiful man.   If you want to eat Indian while in Vegas, THIS is where you need to go.

7-srbZL7bUZQQo6n4MQRBw.text: Oh WOW !!!   The buffet here is the best Indian buffet in the whole country and I am not saying this figuratively. Me and my wife have literally travelled most of the country and had Indian buffets across and take my word this place is the best.  This place has become one of our Vegas attractions, we might someday come from California just to have this buffet.  Ok let's talk about food -   sweet rice is absolutely mind blowing, I cannot remember a place which serves this dish anywhere which has right sweetness.  Samosas are light and non oily which makes it perfect for appetizers.  Goat curry is awesome as well if you like goat though...  All other dishes are very good and fresh as it can get.

IyUFb680k-9-zdBaiy-hyw.text: After reading many reviews, I decided to stop in. They let me know they would be closing soon, but never made me feel rushed. The food was absolutely delicious and the butter naan was piping hot. The lunch buffet doesn't have a huge selection, but it's enough to satisfy your fill. I will most definitely be back.

-Wg8fgOxc0f_MvgUt0jr-w.text: An update to my review! We went in the other day during lunch time and was surprised to see that it was only lunch buffet available. They saved our evening because my aunt had a flight a mere two hours later and we didn't have time to change restaurants. Thank you very much! Food was delicious and service was great as usual.

DUMFFfOmheAqUikTgGL_aQ.text: My boyfriend and I visit Las Vegas about once a year for a climbing trip, and eating at Mount Everest is one of our ritual splurges. (Though with the affordability of this place, it's just the tasty food and excellent service that makes it feel like a splurge). We frequent Indian and Nepalese food places often, and my biggest disappointment is that I don't live in Vegas to eat here more often. If I had to chose a last meal, the veggie korma is so delicious and unique, I think I could die happy after eating it. I can not recommend this place more highly.

-PUsTnd004n_anfeJ-LWLg.text: Our first experience here was good enough that we returned and this time brought some guests over. The entrees were pathetic...we had ordered the butter chicken and lamb kadai. The chicken was super creamy and tasteless and the lamb was tough and super salty. Our guests felt sick that night after dinner and suspected the food from here to have done it.

P_WcaYX89ZmIE4nNVTqS9w.text: So this is the best Vegas has to offer in Indian Food?  I came here based on Yelp reviews and left highly disappointed, not because it was bad (it wasn't, it was just pretty good) but because of the notion that this is as good as it is supposed to get in Vegas.  Granted it was only for the lunch buffet, but I guess I don't know if it will get any more than marginally better for made-to-order entrees.  Now, the food in itself is pretty good - decent flavors, ample choices for buffet.  But it's not very spicy.  At all.  That's actually a big deal because I think part of what makes curry & masala what they are is the distinct kick they produce.    Service is spartan due to the buffet nature, but is pleasant when provided.  Place wreaks of herbs, so I'm thinking maybe they need a bit more ventilation.  Area is a bit fishy, but out in the open so not too worried about safety.  In all, it's a fine place for Indian food but you'll leave wanting to see if there is something better.    Table-for-1 Factor:  Not sure for dinner, but I felt it would be just fine sitting alone for a bite.

See you soon!!!!!!!!
