nvtmRmfT7WDKku3Afo3ETA.text: Decent food. Warm, personal service from the owner himself despite it being very busy. Biggest plus: you can get momos here!! Momos are like spicy xiao long bao with thick skins, or if you know real authentic Mongolian food (not those food court type places that basically reheat a pile of Americanized Chinese dry noodles for you), it's closer to a spicy buuz than an XLB.  This is Nepalese, not Indian. Our first time the owner took the time to explain some regional differences. It was clear that he is passionate about and proud of the food and culture of his people.  Aside from the owner, everyone was also attentive, polite, and good with refilling our waters.  We enjoyed everything we ordered here, not just the momos (though we liked those the best), and, what with the generous portions, ended up with enough leftovers to feed ourselves for days after. Mango lassi is pretty good here, not the best but nowhere near the worst.  PROTIP: Never bother with the buffet, not just here but anywhere. Everything is much better (though more expensive) if you order it off the menu because they make it for you to order instead of it sitting out congealing for the entire service.  Unfortunately you have no choice but buffet at lunchtime. It wasn't bad for a buffet. The tandoori chicken especially was tender and juicy, surprisingly not dried out. Some of the dishes even had a bit of kick for a buffet! (Usually buffets are pretty mild to cater to the lowest common spice denominator.) Favorites were the palak paneer (saag paneer), some aloo (potato) dish, tandoori chicken, vegetable samosas (relatively crisp considering they are sitting out on a buffet), chicken curry, and gulab jamun for dessert. Naan was also good and moist, not hard and dried out. Chicken tikka masala is on the sweet side. The goat curry was really tough, which was strange because it has been pretty tender when we've ordered it a la carte for dinner.  UPDATE: This place was on TV for cockroaches and unsanitary practices in the kitchen September 2016 but I don't care! Whee, germs!

05CoXnJQrOx1ITSphDy3bg.text: This place is amazing. I never get enough of their food. I was educated that this is North Indian food and maybe why I like it. Asian influence ?   Everything I've ever eaten here is amazing. I have never had a bad dish ever. And I am picky. Love the service and the garlic naan and momo sauce.   Best Indian place in town.

nrCNYgvU6pAltytchsJqVg.text: We went for a lunch buffet. Place was pretty empty and has a himalayan vibe. Spread was good enough to fill up any hungry person. I started with rice, sweet rice, vegetarian starters like samosa and pakoras. They were just ok, i found pakoras to be a bit doughey. There was channa masala, palak panneer, dal, brinjal masala and couple more. I liked only the palak panneer. My wife is a vegetarian and to her, the vegetarian spread was just ok and naan was fine too. She was not very impressed. I moved on to the chicken items like tandoori chicken, chilli chicken, chicken tikka masala, chicken curry and goat curry. I liked them all, though i found some chicken pieces to be hard but overall taste was good. I loved the chicken and goat curry though. Dessert was the sweet rice and gulab jamun, they were good too. Overall an OK experience. Worth a visit for Indian food but not regularly.

7DyrMMoKmsBtuKMbi4TO2Q.text: Very Average, if you're visiting from the Bay Area! Ambience is very poor and food tastes OK!

28Lcoq8FDqAj6IPYOpeKAw.text: Solid Indian buffet place. Good variety of meat and non-meat dishes. Everything tastes freshly made. Staff is... What you normally expect at Indian restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy looot.

MiH4ftT3_wA_64vuWo-Rng.text: We went for the lunch buffet. It's from 11-3. The food was amazing. Paid 30 bucks for two people including tips.

rStLuufxxem8iE7zGznZdw.text: As someone who grew up in New Delhi, India and is constantly craving good North Indian food, I can say that you'll not go wrong with this place. The food is pretty authentic and flavorful. The breads are amazing and so is the service. Highly recommend this place.

-RbG3Rhob82SVNi-DGxH-A.text: Came again after our initial visit and we had a much more enjoyable experience.  The server was friendly and attentive this time around and kept our water glasses full and answered any questions we had.  I am addicted to the chicken curry. I didn't know I liked Indian food till I found myself at home craving the creamy, flavorful curry with moist bits of chicken.. mmmmM I think the lunch buffet is definitely worth it at around $11 since dinner entrees can add up $$$. All the other buffet items are just bonuses but the chicken curry with garlic naan are what will keep me coming back for more~!!!  HOT TIP: Get the garlic naan! Way better than the regular naan but make sure to place the order as soon as you sit down or they will bring out the regular naan and you can't order a new batch till you finish it haha

fHUGSUXPGmGgSAYvSlOp1A.text: Great Lunch Buffet! $10.99 for all you can eat from 11 am - 3 pm every day.    I've been here a couple of times and always walked happy and full.  They have a large selection of dishes friendly to both meat-eaters and vegetarians.  My favorites are their cauliflower dish and goat curry, but really you can't go wrong from anything in their buffet. Their plain naan is warm a perfect pairing with their many curries.    I have never had a problem with finding a table, even at peak hours.  Also their service is also super attentive and friendly.  I don't think my cup of water ever went empty.  It is easy to say that will continue come back here to satisfy future Indian food cravings.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch Buffet

vBE9tELFWVk2TViBINL19g.text: We had dinner here during the Memorial Day weekend. The food was great ! We ordered butter chicken and navratan korma. Along with garlic and butter naan.   I liked regular naan better because garlic was not as moist and soft. I am only giving 4 starts because the chicken curry had a few bones.   Service was good and enjoyed the dinner. Will be back once in Vegas again.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary rice
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Naan
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter chicken

vpyeXZlzY4WrGH_clp0yrQ.text: This is absolutely the best Indian food I have found. The customer service is spot on down to refilling your drink at only half empty. The price is very reasonable, considering the high quality of the food.

QVt3GIWDNTwrrSZeirRO6g.text: This is the BEST Indian food in Las Vegas and the service is always phenomenal. I love that the food is made to order and delicious.

qliPVfv7bXJVO40ecKqG8A.text: Amazing food!! We had the thali and it was just perfect. The service and host was also very nice and accommodating. We even got a curry changed in thali which shows above and beyond... best bang for buck!!!

5LctGvJTaH0qt3-e7K7OTA.text: My favorite Indian restaurant (Gaylord) is now out of business and other Indian restaurants I've been to have been mediocre which is why I'm so glad I gave Mount Everest a try eventhough the place was kind of creepy.  The quality of the food is comparable to Gaylord's but you get more food and pay a lot less.  The people that work here are very nice and friendly.  They have Bollywood videos on at all times.  They give you a basket of papadum with mint and tamarind sauces.  We started of with samosa (they're like potato-filled empanadas with ginger and spices) and aloo tikki (fried patties of mashed potatoes in chick pea batter).  Mango Lasi: Creamy mango shake. 5/5  Veggie Samosa: You get two pieces for $4.  The crust was the right thickness and wasn't too doughy.  You can definitely taste the spices.  I had to use the tamarind sauce to tone down the heat a bit. Very filling. 4/5  Aloo Tikki: You get 2 patties for $4. Crispy deep-fried mashed potatoes.  Very filling as well.  Great flavor. 5/5  Palak Paneer: I was looking for the cheese on top since that's what I'm used to.  4/5  Garlic Naan: I love this stuff.  We had 2 orders. Hot, garlicky and buttery bread to scoop/dip saucy dishes with. 5/5  Chicken Tikka Masala: My favorite Indian dish.  We ordered mild but it was still quite spicy...but it burned so good. 5/5  Kulfi: A mild cheesy ice cream and you can see pistachio bits. 4/5  Gulab Jamun: My favorite Indian dessert. They're like hot cheese dougnuts in simple syrup. 5/5  I honestly wasn't expecting the food to be that good.  This is my new favorite in Vegas!  They also have a lunch buffet from 11am-3pm for $10-11.  I'd come back here for that!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gulab jamun
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kulfi
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prawns

keU1_39z4K_Q55hZKwzwng.text: My first visit did not disappoint! I ordered the vegetable samosas and they were delicious and filling! The brown sauce (I apologize I do not know the name) was a sweet delight for dipping! Taking a group of friends back next week to enjoy the buffet!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable samosas! A filling treat at a remarkable price!

U4SIpBdiP7Ai-3hcNcm4Og.text: This review is really for how they set their price point with regards to children. I've been a regular  here since my kids were 4 and 6 yrs old and now they are 6 and 8 yrs old. The problem I have is this, they don't tell you much kids pay for buffet. In the past I've only paid half so I thought that's okay,  when I came here this weekend I paid full price for both of my kids even though they did not eat as much as me and my wife and so I wondered. Any other buffet restaurants in Vegas they would have paid half price, since they are just kids. Most restaurants (casino or not) based their pricing on children's age, if your kid is over 11 or 12 they pay full and so on and so forth. I asked the guy who took my payment on why my kids pay full price when they are 6 and 8. He told me they based the price on how much a kid should pay based on much they eat, I say what??That is ridiculous, what if my kid is not a big eater, how can they assess this, by putting their plate on a weighing scale? I feel like I was scammed and for that this restaurant just lost a long time and loyal customer. It's misleading, I might even think of bringing a complain to BBB. Going somewhere else next time, for everyone else please be warn, if you bring your kids you don't know how much you will be paying. Should have went to SURA korean BBQ, half price for kids, more selections and cheaper overall!

aB4g6JRzGLGrCtVO4RvziQ.text: Super nice staff! Never went thirsty great service! We ordered a few sampler dishes, to try various things. Everything was really good, I'd definitely order the Chicken Tikka Masala, it was so good, savory, a little sweet, and exotic. Prakash also told us to try the Mango Lassi, it's a tasty sweet yogurt drink. It was really good alone, but helps tame the heat of the curries as well. When all was done He even let us try the rice pudding dessert. Which I thought was wet cottage cheese at first by the look. But it like everything was homemade and Tasty!

kratqn2yiC0QuaXR7bZ3aQ.text: First of all, please don't go by their advertisement "vegas's biggest indian  buffet". It is not. Food was alright. Not good selection of appetizers. Place is ok.

GGp7KIY8x3dO3GXJNXKYJA.text: THE BEST Indian restaurant in Las Vegas. Don't waste your time, money or taste buds any where besides Mt. Everest Indian Cusine. I have tried almost all of the Indian restaurants in Las Vegas. Tamba Indian restaurant was the worst of all I would not eat there even for free. If you want real Indian experience of Indian Cusine then definitely you should go and try this place out. Best of all Excellent Customer Service from all of staff. - Guru

Vyqm9k1osWdB1tcsQEAy_A.text: Awesome. Food was delicious affordable and came out quick. Prakash the owner was friendly and ready to make suggestions about what to order and the service was great.

8uhXuj1_5KeBn5Dmo0TJsw.text: I'm a indian food lover and had a indian craving while on mini vacay in Vegas. Stumbled upon this place on yelp and due to the great reviews I decided to give this place a shot. We were greeted and sat immediately. The food on the buffet looked pretty good so we went with that. Oh boy, what a good life decision that was! Just about everything I put on my plate was above average in flavor. Usually at an indian buffet there are at least 2 items that get left on my plate...Not here, the only thing I didn't care for was the potato samosas, and that's strictly due to the too thick, not crispy pastry surrounding the well spiced potato filling. The butter chicken was good,made with a mix of white and dark meat,and had a nice deep flavor throughout the chicken and sauce.  The paneer palak was wonderful and flavorful with a kick of chilies, My partner in crime enjoyed the veggie Korma greatly, as did I, it was creamy, with well rounded flavors and tasted very unique compared to other veggie kormas I've had. Heck it put mine to shame! They didn't shy away from spice or heat as some indian places do to adapt to American palates and I dig them for it. Service was a bit slow, plates weren't cleared as fast as I would've liked them to be, and my water glass was parched a few times but I'll cut them some slack for being a bit short staffed the day we went. Overall it was great!

G8ri99sppie8uJ9VGVAP9A.text: WORST FOOD !!!Totally disappointed with the service and food quality ... If you are in town never go for this restaurant ... I don't understand why people give this restaurant 4.4 * . It's not even worth of -4.4 * .. My parents got food poisoning after having food here .. My suggestions to owner Plz Stop serving  shit to innocent customers ..

QsgQFy3-Tl2HThocD6LxEg.text: We loved our experience here! I haven't eaten Momos in ages! Thank you so much Prakash for the delicious food and beautiful hospitality!

iGiFTMdRsFgMqGwCNa798w.text: Always a great experience.  Food is amazing with a excellent variety of spices.

Xw9P5eTnoZrhTeVO-pCIMQ.text: Excellent! I knew I was in the right place when I saw paneer pakoras on the menu! Mango lassies smooth as silk!

fLJz4ig2iPMOT8r3VFze3Q.text: Really good food. I'm an indian and knows what is a good indian good. Friendly and quick  service.  We ordered spicy food .. And loved it. Their dessert was average ..  Therefore giving 4.5 stars else would have given 5.

w9dC8vmb0okcHHksb_Nfwg.text: Went back after last being in Las Vegas a few years ago and discovering this place. I didn't remember the name so we just went to the one with the highest yelp ratings and we were so excited to see we had hit it!Great mango lassis, seems like everyone in the restaurant was drinking them! And the staff is very friendly! Food excellent. We wanted to come back the next day for the buffet but we had so much leftovers we made our own buffet in our room!

H7B482v6_a0xC3FhviDS6g.text: If you are craving Indian Food and CHAi (Tea ) in that dessert, try this out!!!

hg24wXrntJB43br_5PvfnA.text: Stopped by this place twice the last two times I went Las Vegas. Loved the mango Lassi! Awesome service and friendly too! Would go there again!

AOrLZ20XsJMC7BS0eHbi7Q.text: AMAZING.  AMAZING FOOD, even better price. Forget spending $25.00 at a casino buffet when you can eat here for lunch. TRUST ME.  The service is amazing. I love waiters that fill your drink glass without you asking...well, lets just say my glass was always full.

3ar9pFSUMSp7tL9Ou7v9iw.text: I have been to this retaurant many, many times. While I have been to several other Indian restaurants in town and enjoyed them, this is the place if you want the best food and a pleasant experience.  The owner, Prakash, greets us by name which I'm sure he does for everyone he knows is very attentive, likes to joke and makes sure that we have what want.  It's an informal atmosphere, so don't be surprised if they just point you to a table when you first arrive, that is no indication of the service. You will be well taken care of.  Don't let the neighborrhood put you off. It's a little down, but not even close to the worst in Vegas. It's well lit, and the parking is very close.  Tony

pyoiUu3r4PbRVJOLH_V3vg.text: The food here is delicious, flavorful and colorful. This nice Indian buffet on the corner of Valley View and Sahara costs $11.00, and it's worth it. The restaurant has a nice elegant setting as well.

wovzO9uxxWu-djZ1BMintg.text: Read the reviews and wanted to give this place a try. Bonus this restaurant is on restaurant.com. Located in a seedy area of town but very welcoming inside. First thing we ordered was the lamb Samosa and was disappointed. Way salty. But the garlic naan and chicken tandoori was yummy. Learned something new though... One of my favs 'butter chicken' is called chicken makhani.

1qU_axJQx1r2WanEFl2JUQ.text: We got a cab from the MGM Grand in an effort to see a little more of "real" Las Vegas when we were in town for a conference.  Boy was it worth it!  The owner (also the primary waiter) was the kindest, most hospitable man.  He gave wonderful beer and food recommendations, checked on us numerous times, and brought us a small bite of dessert on the house before calling us a cab back to the strip.  What a wonderful evening!  A must-dine restaurant for anyone adventurous enough to get away from all the typical tourist traps.  Thank you to Mount Everest; we'll be sure to come back on our next visit to Las Vegas!

AOfLnJ2lFe6knThSOkOB4A.text: This place was great, I ordered the Lamb Vindaloo, Garlic butter naan, and Chicken Tikka and all tasted fantastic.  The servers were very pleasant and accommodating as well.

dH0FGWJ1K-U_6iWAyoD4AQ.text: Phenomenal service, extraordinary food, and a spot in Las Vegas that no one knows about. I bring my Asian, white, and Hispanic friends here all the time. And every time, they are amazed by this culture. Any restaurant that can impress all cultures is an extremely rare thing.   Three key elements  FOOD: 10/10   Reason being is because the food here is diverse and encompasses all common aspects of Indian food. Unfortunately, most places offer one or two specialities, and the rest is bland. Ever dish at Mt. Everest is a speciality because I can't find any other place with better food.  NO GREASE, NO FUSS, AND LOTS OF VARIETY! FOR UNDER 12 FOR A LUNCH BUFFET. their fresh baked bread I could eat all by itself!   SERVICE: 10/10  the owner himself, pradesh, was walking around to greet, and serve the customers. Any owner that is willing to clean and pick up dishes, is a phenominal manager in my name. And I have worked in food industry as a floor manager for 3 years. Extremely friendly, and sincere. Two things that are rare in this world!   AUTHENTICITY:   My best friend is very native to india and a wealthy person. He chooses this place over fine dining restaurants every time he visits me. There's nothing more to say.   This place is the only Indian restaurant that will sincerely and fully impress you.  -Charles

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Even the cups of water are fancy!
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!

HStTUwiagAzeCOIC39FvOA.text: Amazing!! My friend brought me here once and I've been hooked ever since. It's very authentic food with the best naan bread you'll ever have! The owner is very friendly and cares about your experience. Will continue to come always!

cpI040LIhpyJRKqSIlVCdw.text: This place is horrible, DO NOT come here!!! The food is of substandard / poor quality and the service is horrendous.  What restaurant brings their naan as soon as you sit down? Ps - the naan tastes more like bread than naan  And they server never refilled out naan - he was busy watching cricket on his tv behind the counter  The samosas were very oily - refried  The gulab jamun were uncooked in the center - defrost?  There weren't many Indians when we there, which is a tell-tell sign that it is not catered to Indians!

-be1euyaj-8-T2ie7_1NEQ.text: Truly my favorite Indian restaurant in Las Vegas.  Across the street from the community where I live I am happy to say I'm in this restaurant sometimes three times a week!  The waiters and owners know me and know what I like. They have a great buffet during the weekdays at lunchtime.  The restaurant is always full and sometimes there's a line out the door for the buffet which is always a good sign - their ingredients are fresh and the dishes are thoughtfully prepared.  The naan is home made.  I take friends from in and out of town as often as I can and everybody always really likes this place.  They serve Indian beers as well.

UwXWRpGjy_VoucCHf7PZ6g.text: I LOVE this place. Amazing service, you truly feel like family. Delicious food, whether you are there for dinner service or the lunch buffet.

rkvdNEXrsuYSSTW6RaK-Vg.text: Spent few days in Vegas and checked in to this hotel after reviewing Yelp.. Lunch Buffet was good (both V and NV).  If you are looking for nice Indian food, this place is definitely a choice..  Four stars only because the waiters weren't helpful and not interested finding seats...

MC5l4ntKvTyoGGp4nGDIIQ.text: this was my first time trying Indian Cuisine. The buffet was a nice selection of different things.  The food was very hot.  Nothing worse than luke warm food at a buffet.  The naan was amazing and there was an orange colored rice that was to die for. I was not in love with any of the food but I am a very picky eater.  My 4 stars was because the people I went with enjoyed all of the food very much and all have had Indian food prior to visiting Mount Everest.  They said it was one of the best Indian restaurants in Las Vegas!

UkFM9tBUyAaWnsPTJA0S6w.text: I have a friend who says this is his favorte Indian restaurant in the states...and he lives on the east coast...it is good....lunch buffet is a good deal....but there is no wow factor...

pmgVzMRiusWy2DhiXgKFnQ.text: Chicken Korma is phenomenal. Chicken Vindaloo is spectacular, although when they ask you how spicy you'd like it, consider asking one spice level down. Service is excellent and very gracious hosts.  I also recommend the Indian beer. Get the Taj Mahal, which is a surprisingly refreshing lager.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XwjOYQMF6AKNAovRh28fmA.text: How anyone can give this place 5 stars is completely beyond understanding. The place is disgustingly dirty and raunchy both inside and out. The service is decent from the hired staff, but the ones who appear to be owners or operators are very rude. The young guy who took my order was relatively nice, but the manager who was working at the front was on his cell phone as I came in and he didn't give me eye contact and just asked me how many??? I thought he was speaking to the person on his phone so I didn't respond until he again asked in a condescending Indian accent... I felt sorry for interrupting his phone call by visiting his dirty establishment. The restroom was also nasty and they had no toilet paper. The carpets are grossly dingy and dirty. The place is gross

wcRyWVgWlABlWpqfwn3BAw.text: The kadhi pakora, saag paneer and vegetable korma were some of the best I've ever had!  The  flavors were rich, bold and full of spice and flavor.  One of the best Indian buffets I've ever been to.  Also the gulab jamun was incredible.  Everyone there was very friendly.  Sad that I was just visiting Vegas because I'd be coming here weekly otherwise.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The kadhi pakora, vegetable korma and saag paneer were amazing!  One of the best indian buffets I&#39;ve ever been to.

uJ0EH6AfjcPbkGAR6Jfhqw.text: Went in for a lunch buffet with my family and the food tasted fresh and delicious (unlike other Indian buffets). Malai kofta, Gajar (carrot) halwa and the soft eggless naan were my favorite and what I gorged on majorly!

pTpf-Hgk8_4Pb0sX0drhyA.text: I'm very picky when it comes to food from my culture, especially in Vegas because there are so few options for good Indian food.  My first time here, and in between my 2nd and 3rd plate, I have to say it has hit the spot. All the food is extremely flavorful and hits every part of palette.    The curry chicken, tandoori chicken and butter chicken with the butter naan are delicious. Squeeze a little lemon and your good to go. The service is good and everyone is very friendly.    I will be coming back here for the lunch buffet and this place has instantly become my favorite Indian restaurant in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After the 2nd round, still going for more. Naan, tandoori chicken, basmati rice with daal, pakoora, chilli chicken, and more.

YSzBzky7RDDigoDAn1KFXw.text: Has to be the best in Las Vegas. Very casual lunch, and very nice family atmosphere for dinner. I have been to both. I prefer the lunch buffet.  Its hard to have Indian cuisine for lunch for me because most places seem more upscale and a dinner style establishment. Not here! They make it very inviting and laid back!  The buffet option gives opportunity to learn about most dishes you have never ordered before. It was great! Sample some of everything.  My favorite was the Palak Paneer. Spinach with homemade cheese. If i could eat this with every meal for the rest of my life I think i would! Chili chicken is very good too!  The spice level was perfect for me, If it gets too hot try a mango lassi drink! I don't usually drink sweet stuff with my meal, but this drink actually compliments and cools the spice! Very good!  I always suggest this place to friends. I will go anytime!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Lassi
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch buffet
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everything good!!

Y3vK2wlLUMmslO6XGMpKeg.text: The service here is really good! The owner gave us many different flavored naan to try out! The food is also good too, especially the chicken masala! Love this restaurant!

I6tzkyQ-Le2WTKt_L2iqQQ.text: Served buffet style all the food well exceeded my expectations. It is a big small but cozy. The workers were friendly and it was only $11 a person!!!

VD32OyUJMlYuTi1eVJZKdQ.text: Amazing food and great service. I have nothing negative to say about this place. Simply the best in Las Vegas.

ZABa76FZEoS9Vcebw-i8Qw.text: haven't ordered Indian anything since I was in Australia but this place has some amazing food. I ordered off UberEATS and it was seriously great. I will definitely be visiting the restaurant itself to check out the food fresh this week. And I'm pretty stoked on it.

IdnAhnvraTRnF93YFqrnZA.text: Come here for the lunch buffet. The chicken tikka masala is amazing, and there are so many different curries to choose from.   The owners/managers are also extremely friendly. We came on a day where they didn't have our favorite dessert out (gulab jamun), but one quick conversation and they brought it out! Would highly recommend...there's a reason this place gets packed around lunch time.

XJcaih7C_U8C2DZBigrs8Q.text: This place is very nice. They serve the authentic himalayan flavored food. Service was top notch too. Along with tasty food, dont forget the masala chai at end. They have buffet during the day time at reasonable price. Please try this if you are in las vegas. Will definately be back.

pHtS7hGATus_qPahcuOafw.text: Amazing Indian cuisine with exquisite and prompt service. I come often and am never disappointed.

G52PLkP6mi-Dg8FYJqqAmA.text: I only come here to see Prakash and his awesome customer service. Really great environment for families. Food is amazing always fresh and smells delicious

VOucEuPfOoKUG5Ft2fFb4Q.text: I've been eating at Everest for a couple of years now. Their food has always been the ideal comfort food. I quit going to Mint because the experience at Everest couldn't be topped!   That said, what is going on with this place!? I haven't seen the owner in months. I visited on Sunday and though they have 4 people working the dining room, service is a disaster. You have to beg for water and napkins. My water was refilled once in the whole visit, but the check was promptly delivered before we finished eating.   The food quality is WAY down. I couldn't cut the chili chicken with a knife, it was dried to jerky. My favorite, richly flavored makhani is now a strangely over spiced lackluster sauce.   The overall quality has taken a major hit in the owner's absence. I can only hope he returns and whips that place into shape!

twDB9pRbTpQvV3A8qSM9rw.text: Back in Vegas again for another short business trip and my coworker and I wanted to try something different. Something out of the normal. Came across this restaurant on yelp and thought this might be a new experience. I have to say that I loved the atmosphere of this place. Great scenery. Wanted to try some spices from the east. We ordered the chicken tiki masala which I certainly loved along with cheese nans. Wow perfect meal for what I was looking for. I only tried Indian food once before but it didn't catch my eye like it did this time. Might make it a weekly dish if I can find one as good back home. My coworker had lamb which I didn't enjoy as much. But overall great experience.

f-K_kYa4tKq8rFyZbze9Rw.text: This place is awesome!! Awesome food and awesome staff.  All the staff members are so kind and helpful.  The food is AWESOME!! The lunch buffet is perfect if you want to eat great, fresh food for lunch for a perfect price.  Dinner is awesome because there are so many different options to choose from.  Great place for vegetarians and people who love to eat meat. You have to try this place, you'll become addicted!

5yE1cJnrvRlOYFPk0tA8UQ.text: This is an AMZING buffet! I love their Indian cuisine and they are open7 days per week for buffet! This commits to the culture of Vegas buffets in being accommodating to different individuals. You can dine solo, as a group or bring a date! It's My number one place for Indian cuisine.

mvrDjWFOXeGbiBZ4K5Virw.text: Had lunch buffet here on my back to Los Angeles based on yelp reviews. I'm so glad I picked this one among the millions of Indian restaurants in Vegas. For $10 you can select from mutton curry, chicken tikka masala, pakora, naan, etc. as well as a few desserts. A much bigger selection than the average buffet in LA. Service and ambiance was good, too. Will definitely come back next time I'm in Vegas.

Hm0JEG_3qJg8xwrWw97VNw.text: Fantastic lunch buffet and friendly staff. The saag paneer is the best!

m4SPO1KPo8jglmZNJmJvkQ.text: Great service. Delicious food. Affordable. Don't expect it to look fancy inside.... But it hits all other requirements.

LlVfFVYvBwAYJPkukn0_nw.text: Went in for the lunch Buffet -- I believe it was like $10.95 . Anyways, food was good- they could have filled up buffet  a little more  ( as everyone was taking all of the chicken), but overall very good. The decor could use some sprucing up and cleaning but overall great indian at a good price with good service.

g-OlEwZK1gnMTl1w2Ql2ZA.text: Food is really good but dinner portions To Go are TINY. I spent $10 on my favorite cauliflower dish that was really small and half of it was potatoes!! Highly disappointed by the portion size considering how much it costs and that you can have all you can eat at the lunch buffet for the price of 1 small dinner dish. Best bet is just to go for the lunch buffet unless you have extra money to spend on multiple dinner dishes. We spent $60 on dinner for about the same amount of food we eat at the lunch buffet. Maybe I'm just a gluttonous pig =)  But the food is delicious and the lunch buffet is the best in town.

4U-8k4DPY9Q44tCfzmmKAA.text: I never thought anyone could take the title away from Tamba on the Strip, but this is my favourite Indian restaurant, be it buffet or dinner, in Las Vegas.  I'm a vegetarian, so I can only comment on the meat-free dishes, although my husband the carnivore seems to end up using all of the same adjectives I do: subtle, complex, smooth, consistent, rich, plentiful, varied, fresh...  We've been visiting Mt. Everest since it opened over a year ago, but it was only last weekend that I got to try their Navratan Korma. A-ma-zing. Buttery, spicy, and not stingy at all with the paneer.  One thing I should confess is that I do love paneer dishes, save for that one most people love (sag paneer), so when I encounter an Indian buffet with only vegetable dishes, those vegetables better be pretty special to win me over. Mt. Everest is one of the few buffets where the vegetables are so tasty that I don't need a paneer offering to feel satisfied. (That said, Mt. Everest always has some sort of paneer dish, and when it's my nemesis sag paneer, they usually also have a kofta (dumpling) dish. Also, they always serve pakora, so I never lack for a "hearty" item on the plate.) I especially recommend their bombay aloo and any dal dish. One vegetable I've never seen at Mt. Everest is mushrooms, but otherwise the veg section is often a surprise.  Another point in Mt. Everest's favour, per my own tastes, is that they always offer samosas (small, light, pleasant) and vegetable pakora. Again, I like an Indian buffet that doesn't leave the more substantial offerings to the meat eaters. I also appreciate that the pakora is of the "funny shapes" variety, which I prefer to the greasier "pressed patties" you sometimes find elsewhere. (I'm looking at you, Bollywood and Samosa Factory.) The pakora tend to be small enough to not get overly dense, but - unlike my former fave Tamba - Mt. Everest never leaves you with tiny pakora "droppings."  The dessert selection is certainly smaller than on some other buffets - almost always a sweet rice and a type of rice pudding (the names escape me). They're both solid fare, but I seldom seem to save room, so it's a bit of a non-issue for me. (It's saying a lot when I can love a buffet that doesn't offer pappadums or gulab jamun.)  The naan is billowy and brought hot to the table. When we finish, we are always offered more. (Sometimes we are also often offered garlic naan, although after reading others' reviews that may just be a perk for the regulars. No worries - if you come here once, you too will be a regular soon enough.)  Most of my comments above pertain to the buffet. If you like the buffet, dinner at Mt. Everest will not only impress you, it may spoil you for all other Indian places in town. How can something so delicious for lunch be even better at dinner? Perhaps it's being able to get exactly the dish you want spiced just how you like, but somehow they exceed expectations with care that goes into individual dishes. I particularly recommend the shahi paneer. It is now the gold standard by which I measure all "creamy + nutty" sauces.  I realize this review is very gushy, so I'm racking my brain for some sort of flaw lest someone think I'm on the payroll. I could pick on the location - a former Burger King in the Mariana's supermarket parking lot - but you know what? It's so nice inside that you'll never notice. The decor is simple but comfortable and fastidiously clean. It's not an ultralounge. It's not a reimagining. It's just a restaurant with terrific food and the occasional Bollywood video playing on the corner television.  Service is always very friendly. You will never want for ice water, and the staff takes a genuine interest in how you are enjoying your meal. The only way they could make me happier is to offer cooking classes. (Please? Please?!)   Oh, wait, I do have a criticism! Sometimes, I think the mattar paneer is just a teensy bit too full of peas... yeah, that's the best I can do. Sorry. Mt. Everest is simply rather wonderful In fact, it is the sort of restaurant for which Yelp should offer a sixth star. Mmmm...

b1MNEhJ6a_UBFRle7eDt2g.text: Their lunch buffet special is stupendous: they have a great selection of homemade curries, masalas, and other delicious goodies plus naan for $10.99 a person. The owner, Prakash, is a very friendly, great guy!! We love coming here for weekend lunch. ()

nyljourBcmS5in_MDTbLzQ.text: Excellent Indian food, don't be scared by the looks of the building. I run a software company with 15 employees in Bangalore and travel there a couple of times a year, so while I wouldn't call myself any kind of expert, I do know when the palak spices aren't fresh or the nan was left sitting. Neither of those things happened at Mount Everest. Definitely recommended.

W0fQZBGfVquYc4GPunPq1w.text: Great place, always good service and even better food! The restaurant has always been clean. I especially like the mango lassi drink and all of the naan is fresh, warm, and tasty! I'm getting hungry just thinking about it!

6X9sCOzd_KZcXap2efeuWw.text: I hate to downgrade this place, but it's totally necessary. After telling everyone how great this place is, we took a friend there for dinner. Being pregnant, hungry and soon to be chubby, I ordered two main dishes. I love saag and I love masala sauce so I ordered both. My chicken tikka masala was good and made to order. My friend got that as well and liked hers. The hubby liked his curry, too. We had exceptional service that night. Where they get downgraded is that they without a doubt served me leftover saag from the lunch buffet. The spinach was browned like it had been left under a heat lamp all day, it had tell-tale paneer in it that they missed removing even though I ordered it plain, and it was spicy as hell even though I ordered it mild. So disappointed in this place for trying to pull a stunt like this. Even though I feel this place may still be the best in town...I'm now on the hunt for my new favorite Indian restaurant in Vegas.

mAlogrTYbXDHMnKOFxiRvA.text: I have been going here with my Bangladeshi friend for over a year.  I found it while going shopping at the Mexican market next door (didn't buy anything, kinda crappy selection, but I was looking for a horchata).  Anyway, it is not a large selection for a buffet.  But the items that they have are very good.  There is half for vegetarians and half for meat eaters.  I usually get a lot of the tandori chicken and lamb with curry. Their dessert rice pudding of some sort is pretty dang good too.  I think it is a staple of most Indian restaurants but they do it well here.  I usually grab 2 co-workers and use buy 2 get 1 free coupon and pig out once per month during lunch hours.  Dinner is the same but they dont have the buffet.  The place is clean and the nan bread comes out hot. I told my friends this was a hole in the wall, and it is on the outside, but inside is tastefully done.  On the wall is the obligatory Indian dramas who dance away the whole time you are eating.

juv1yRt_swhXxZOTK2pFCA.text: Service oriented, Great food. Prakash Ji assured a great experience for us, gave personal attention to our party.

m782LD56DuuY2SdJ_1pN6Q.text: I'm normally not a fan of Indian food, but this place is AM-AZ-ING! We ordered a ton of food and gobbled it down like vagabonds who had been starving in the desert for centuries. I highly recommend the Chicken Tikka Masalla and Okra dishes. PS: You definitely can't judge this book by its cover.

GDo6WG3hAHtGWhkjGrLZ-Q.text: Outstanding! Authentic, great flavors. I could literally eat there at least 3 times a week! Naan is perfection.

tK6IYFHNlOGD8Zaa-nJGgQ.text: Went to the restaurant for the first time yesterday. Ordered the chicken Tikka Masala and I was blown away. I also orders garlic naan and the sweet naan that has cherries in it (can't remember the name) and they were absolutely delicious. The food was flavorful and just enough spice to it. Service was very good, staff are very attentive and polite. If you are looking for good quality and good price Indian food this is the place to go. I will definitely go back on a regular basis.

27mK2_WQAgVU51IRE42okg.text: I absolutely loved the food! Had the Saag Chicken, garlic naan, and tabuli naan (which was the best) and it did not disappoint. They had very friendly and attentive service. I'll definitely be back!

6qcvuVt9sVqv8E4jD6Ajgw.text: Very excellent indian good. Came for the buffet. The Chicken Tikka, Tandori Chicken and Chili Chicken were very very flavorful. The textures of the food could be a little better though. Some may find that it is more on the rubbery/old side (especially the chili chicken). Other than this, it was great.

as2Dapha0_piroY_q0uF1w.text: Best Indian food in town. The Mount Everest Thali set is our favorite. Everything is always fresh and flavorful. The palak paneer and curries are so good! And they make best naan bread. Friendly service and just a great place to enjoy authentic Indian cuisine.

0FhvS4DtzOBIDs_BiskkVQ.text: Two Words: Very Accommodating   We have been tired of ordering from Mint, our normal Indian dining destination.   I found this place through yelp and my god my yelp fam came through!!   Their portions are quite generous. I always get the lamb curry with garlic naan. They cater to vegans as well. Biyriani is amazing.  One time we ordered pickup and had to wait 30 minutes past the estimated time. We were patient and gave us a lassi drink. Delicious and accommodating

8ulq1aSo4mf0ZqeZ7VyTpg.text: Best momos I've had outside of india. Tomato  soup and Biryani was excellent. Garlic naan was giant and chewy and delicious. Delivery was fast and food was great overall. Thanks, Mt. Everest India's Cuisine for a great meal staff was awesome our soup was accidently was ordered spicy they changed 3 times and staff makes sure we have what we accepted over all awesome experince !

JwAOF-9XbDd4pXOcjp3SuA.text: The lunchtime buffet here is a great deal.   Just be aware that service during the dinner hour is a little slower than it should be...but the food is excellent

45OStpV1YwyPg4izGuJzuw.text: We were in town for a couple of days and wanted to find some good Indian Food and ask one of the locals where we might find some , immediately he responded no doubt Mt.Everest India Cuisine . Walked into this restaurant with the aromatic smells of India.  We got there just in time before people started to come in . Seated in a booth they have table seating also it was a buffet so after taking are drink order we were told to go and enjoy the buffet .  All you can eat Lunch Buffet for $10.99 they had all the standard Indian Food but what really stood out for me was their Curry Goat which mesh so well with their Sweet Rice the flavors were how can I describe just Delicious , giving a touch of sweetness with the spicy flavor of the Curry Goat , the Tikka Masala was just as good. For many reasons it was like being invited to someone's home that really knows how to cook .  Both my Husband and I enjoyed this meal.  Being in Vegas let's put it this way you have to be good to stay in business because the competition is fierce and they are good and when in Las Vegas again this is definitely on my Itinerary !

RB20pmCzwSSFME8JuL80Rw.text: Oh yeah you better believe it. That's what they said when I said the food can't be that great.  Guess what ? The food is absolutely amazing. Every dish from the chicken masala to the chicken tandoori, the rice and the vegetables were absolutely fantastic.  The service was great. The restaurant was clean in the front and the restroom was clean as well. It had an A rating proudly displayed which I really love. This is a five star experience at one star prices. An  absolutely wonderful place. I will come back here again and again and again.

cXNeT2HflK1yRR4VnnQppQ.text: Our first time coming here we weren't sure what to expect, the service was so amazingly warm and welcoming. Thank you so much to the friendly staff, definitely will be recommend and will be returning   P.s try the Shrimp Biryani

4gLGS0uKxViAiXRzSlGM4Q.text: Absolutely loved this place. The atmosphere, food and staff were excellent. I have a high standard when it comes to Indian food and they did not disappoint.  The tandoori chicken tikka, vegetable biryani, paneer saag and naan where all great. I am in town several times each year and this will be one of my regular stops.

efjnC5Sf5ZYSQUsNYiJSoQ.text: My favorite North Indian place in Vegas. Excellent mattar paneer (my favorite dish), overflowing Thalis, and delicious mango lassis. My friends and I come here all the time. Highly recommend!

_ShjBmmks1d3ZXDKJQYPCQ.text: We craving some Indian food in Vegas so found this place on google search. We went for their lunch buffet.   Had a good spread for a lunch buffet. The food was fresh and they bring hot naans to your table which is awesome.   Could expand a little on their variety but an excellent deal for under 12 bucks.

Ogyby5Bod0nrO1DonzWZzA.text: The food was really good. Service is really good and the owner is very friendly. Chicken tikka masala, kabab, Palak Paneer. It was all good. The mango lassi was really amazing and we liked it so much that we also took some to go.

KZQH9FxhtwFP6KIpzFc5bg.text: Found this place on Yelp and noticed the amount of reviews. Recently moved to Vegas from San Diego and hadn't had Indian food in over 2 years so i was definitely overdue. Thankfully, I was not disappointed. The service was great and the food was even better. I was pleasantly surprised to see that it was buffet-style so I was able to try more food that I really enjoyed. I normally stick to the chicken tikka masala but I'm so happy I got the chance to enjoy other options. I will definitely be back soon.

u0kBI6ws_CfleZ_zShoszw.text: Amazing, good, fresh, great place to diner or to order. Good Indians restaurant are very difficult to find, this one is really amazing. It's a go go go !!

7mgMHVCmKFHctlkFGqE3gg.text: Well, the second time I had this food was a very different experience. I got the veggie korma and palak paneer delivered. They tasted good enough when I first had them, except that the first night (sampled a bit of each) I had some symptoms consistent with perhaps either soy or lots of sodium. I blew it off and had the food again the next day for both lunch and dinner and, wow, was that a mistake. I ended up with a pretty bad headache and general malaise lasting several hours. I'm guessing they're not doing their sauces in house and are getting a pretty lousy second hand vendor's work. Yikes, really not good. I just don't think the stuff was made with fresh or high quality ingredients. No plans to ever get food from them again.

452DeTMjLVipHwaNWmc6nQ.text: We just had another wonderful dinner at our favorite Indian restaurant! This is by far the best Indian food in Vegas! The food is always fantastic, the service is always impeccable and we always leave saying, gosh, that was delicious!! I can't say enough good things about this restaurant! You won't be disappointed!

rQLiI-Xr97AUzE46-dg_1w.text: We came for the lunch buffet but were not super hungry so we got a one meal box, bowl and naan bread. We tried the samosas, chicken dishes and a goat dish. All had delicious flavor and were very fresh! We'll come back for sure the next time we are in Las Vegas! Highly recommended!

z1og0q2YJ9VOREbvX1oLGw.text: What an awesome place for lunch! 11am-3pm they have a lunch buffet and their naan bread is to die for. I live close by so when I have the time I defiantly make time to have lunch with these guys. Service is always superb.

gY12C7w56ZCZtVyxeOKPzg.text: We went for lunch buffet and to my surprise the food was amazing. After a long time, i had good indian vegetarian food. And their gajar hawal was simply delicious. Pricing is also decent $10.99 for lunch buffet. Overall loved the food and gave 5* only for Food.

OoSgCswKOzBBYGz9YyLw1Q.text: I had been planning on making a visit to this restaurant for years. Finally the day has arrived and I found myself pulling into the parking lot Monday night. Unbelievable,  I could smell the scent of curry from outside.  The atmosphere was pleasant for a small space and the seating was comfortable.  The wait staff was very polite and timely. In spite of two seated large groups being served.  The menu is quite extensive and the prices are reasonable. I had the tondoori chicken for carryout, it didn't come with rice or naan . I was a little disappointed,  but who doesn't have some cooked rice at home. My food group made plans to return for the buffet lunch,  I'll keep you posted.

U1LxS2kCJEEuP7MRTyZDew.text: I have been in there, like three times and it's 'passable' Indian food, but barely - I found there tandoori chicken to be over dry and chewy, there lamb to be questionable if it is really even lamb. and the prices higher then the quality of the food.  Give it a pass.

l51RjIkQhJRFlyZEsVIokQ.text: I LOVE this restaurant. The biggest thing that stand out to me is the service. For some reason, I rarely have good experiences with service in Indian restaurants, but the young men that work here are so kind and patient when being asked about recommendations. I think i've been here about 3 times now, so it's difficult to remember what we ordered but a few things stand out.   Chicken vindaloo- spicy, warm, thick sauce, delicious Palak Paneer- the cheese has a beautiful consistency and the spinach is cooked perfectly Garlic Naan- perfect Samosas- not the best here. The momos are a better option.  Yellow Lentil Soup- Good, but again, not life changing.  One suggestion I would make is that they update their decor! IThere's really a confused sense of style, throw in the mason jar cups...and well..none of it makes sense. But that doesn't take away from the food.

kxofSE6xLo_sdZD2dwnQzQ.text: 5 Stars for food for sure. Its the best Indian food in Las Vegas. But the dining room is downright depressing. Kinda like a sad cafeteria from the early 1970's. Busboy rolling around a noisy cart with a metal dishmachine tub does not help the already awful ambiance. Get it to go because the are dishes wonderful

IYefC8gKyxj_SSTdFsevrQ.text: 4.5 star rating???!!! Not even close. Yelp ratings are becoming a big sham.   Went for lunch buffet, this is our experience: - Food quality: some decent but mostly poor quality. Worst - spoiled appetizer pakoda, couple of curries. Best - fresh naan. Decent - chicken curry - Service: one of the worst I've experienced. They decided we didn't need any drinks and just brought in water no ice. How about a simple ask on what we want? How about asking us if we need more naan? - Place: meh! Nothing like in the pictures.   Avoid this place if you are looking for decent quality Indian food. You can do much better by picking lower rating places on the strip.

smysmwdarEmMe0Nf6eoejw.text: This was probably the most disappointed I've been in a long time. I don't understand why this place such a high rating.   The place is small and the buffet selection is miniscule. The meats are dry and rubbery. The veggies are made with heavy cream. And the ones that are not are very bland.   We came here based on yelp reviews; but, were bitterly disappointed by everything here. Stay clear of this place. You can get way better indian food in other restaurants.

zrrpesN3jsZccvrIT80edQ.text: So, be patient. I usually write long reviews. Lol.  I'm not from Vegas. I have been to this restaurant twice, with my friends. The first time was on a Sunday morning, 10 minutes before they opened for a buffet. Everything we ate was fresh, all trays topped up. The service was also at par. Their goat curry was one to remember.  The 2nd time we went there was a little late in the afternoon, on a Sunday again. But somehow I did not get the same experience (with the food especially) that day. It was okay but nothing exciting. Oh and by the way, do NOT get their mo:mos. It's HORRIBLE. We tried both chicken and veggie and both of them sucked.  The owner (well, I don't know his name but I guess he is the owner) and guys who work there are very cheerful and accommodating. Their space is a bit cramped for a restaurant that offers buffet.  Thanks for reading. Cheers!

2RDi6rEE5IB3CueKv5ET0A.text: Fantastic Indian food in a surprising location (Corner of Sahara and Valley View). Great for take-out or eat-in. The dishes are delicious and authentic, and very reasonably priced. Especially good value is their all-you-can-eat lunch. Highly recommend.

jcb-0dYfHYlGaMPr77iMzA.text: I had lunch here, going on the reviews, boy its really poor quality. I am surprised so many good reviews for pretty below avg Indian food - the buffet was were standard and did not really have any thing which stood out.  I guess high reviews are misleaders sometime, disappointed totally with the presentation, quality and ambience.  I guess people who put reviews have no or little understanding of Indian food.  By the way if you ask for Garlic Naan, there is $3 extra charge - which is very uncommon with other Indian restaurants in town. There are many better options.

NhUSudOhLYCRW3_h2UYmhQ.text: The food is delicious! The customer service is honestly amazing. I bring all of my friends here. I totally recommend

TqxqZziD3JrUnAgdIvBT1w.text: I receive a notices from Yelp about hot new places to check out every week or so. This one popped up the other day and it peaked my interest because good Indian/Nepalese food is hard to find. I was impressed by all the positive reviews and decided to take my girlfriend out this evening.  All I can say is wow, the food was amazing. Just as other reviewers state, the owner is very hands on and very attentive. We wanted to try everything and ordered the appetizer sampler platter (5 stars), Lamb curie  (5 stars), and the Chicken Tikka Masala (5 stars). Order of garlic nann bread and dessert to go I believe it was Kheer ... very good as well.   I also ordered a beer and she wine. When the bill came I expected it would be the normal $90-$120 when we normally go out to eat.  It was under $60 before tip so value is 5 stars as well Service 5 stars.  If you have never been here, go try it out. I guarantee you will be back. It isn't overly fancy in decor but makes up for it in everything else !!

zA2XYFqEeg5gqhsmt17UXA.text: We ordered delivery and the food was amazing. They got here very quickly and the order was perfect. The delivery charge was a little high but it's worth every penny. I highly recommend this place and will be going soon to eat in!

uIRltigIYmuNKTDmcWLaFA.text: This is a great Indian buffet with a ma and pa shop feel. That feeling is reflected in the price but not the food, with a variety of northern and southern flavors. They consistently keep you drink filled and table clean. Great price, food, and service. You can't lose!

in2Y9UHurai28YvK4iBVGw.text: Once again two years later. Excellent food, excellent and friendly service. Prakash keep up the good work. See you in another year or two.

cYFEeW2eph4lDLnY7-l5kg.text: I love this place, the food is delicious and the staff is very friendly, authentic Indian food, I go to this place all the time. I highly recommend it.

M3qeAgbJgfTlYazZt_CpfA.text: This is truly authentic Indian food. We get sick with diarrhea 50% of the time we eat here, BUT it tastes so good we keep doing it. Delhi Belly is just part of that 'feel' for India.  5 stars for taste, 1 for Delhi belly = 3 stars!

L49i1qbZ8BHNOAkuqznfgA.text: Food is Awesome and very authentic. Taste is very consistent from last couple of years.I am not local but I do many business trip to Vegas and everytime I been here. The owner is very nice. Always take care of customer pesonally. Very few Indian restaurants keep the taste consistent and this is one of those and my favorite. Usually I don't review any restaurant but food of this restaurant finally forced me to review it.

L_63xSNL8lCn-Bz6uPc4zg.text: We were craving Indian food and Mt Everest was a great choice!  Staff and owner were extremely courteous and efficient.  The chicken in Biryani melted in your mouth!  Chicken Makhani-superb; delicious!  A great restaurant!  When back in Vegas, we would definitely go again!

1ZElPEci-2CWvEHzbAgaeA.text: What a fantastic place! The service was quick, friendly and they had the BEST tikka masala I've ever had. Will DEFINITELY be back.

u1KuIOvlUMvGEUpTQPZV7Q.text: This is the fourth time we have visited this place and it has been very consistent - and great. We're from out of town and this is one place we always visit. My wife is vegetarian but I will eat meat so we love this place.    We typically get the baingan bharta and saag paneer. They have a spice level system of 1 to 10, we get 7 since we like a good kick to the food.  I like it really hot and had 8 once, which was hot and good for me but too much for my wife. She still loved it but had to eat slower.  7 from now on!  Naan is super fresh with nice crispy and soft textures. Samosas are crispy in the outside but not overdone, and fresh. Chicken Tikka also great.   Service has always been attentive and friendly. It's a family run place and the owner is super nice.  We love this place and always look forward to come my back when in town.

f8BzxHqw-PUiPDIZI56e3Q.text: Bone less lamb biryani was too good at this place (they add kissmiss in that most of them dont like that) but biryani was good at taste and order spice level 6 .

wpuPwNlCXE2HpG4nVBJm3w.text: This is by far the best Indian restaurant I've been to in Las Vegas. The lunch buffet was very good, all food was piping hot and there was a wide variety of items. The place was packed on a random Thursday at 1200 so there could be a wait but worth it!

uKTgaBcnv6zrNyfsu0EoJw.text: Decent food and service. Tried the lunch buffet -- good selection of traditional veg and non-veg Indian dishes including Tikka masala, Tandoori Chicken, Goat Curry and plenty of Paneer based veg choices. Good flavors, great aromas, tasty dishes.   There are not a lot of good Indian restaurants in Las Vegas, but Mount Everest certainly serves up a good meal.  I recommend giving it a try.

yzfPFYG-WVf2spj-37ERdQ.text: I am here every Tuesday for my chicken makhni and masala chai tea.Great food! Full of flavor.

h7_KaWv5IYeXPWSyjRPxig.text: Food & service here is amazing! Ordered 3 vegetarian dishes to share: Paneer Tikka Masala, Korma and Palak Paneer, plus garlic naan. SO GOOD and SO FULL!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 amazing vegetarian dishes: Paneer Tikka Masala, Korma,

OfgU54DDl2FYw-lOFAU4Mg.text: Phenomenal. The butter chicken, the garlic Naan, the chicken tikka masala, the tandoori chicken, the rice pudding, all incredible. I don't like to review until I've tried multiple dishes and I'm sure. This place has exquisite Indian food. The food is spicy where it should be, sweet where it's needed, and a great balance of flavors that aren't just overdone to compensate for poor food.  Truly authentic, from the moment you walk in, you smell the rich roasting spices, and are greeted by a warm and inviting staff.  The owner takes personal responsibility for your visit, always there to check in, refill your drink, or talk about Katmandu, Nepal, where he's from. The only Indian food in the desert I'd recommend. Period.

3V4LBonMjRUp0B6TlDf9WA.text: Food is very good and the owner is very accommodating. The rice pudding with donut is the best dessert that we've ever had at an Indian restaurant.

aih_6q8rrpsi8yIoFopK_A.text: This place is in a GHETTO part of town. I mean GHETTO with a capital G. Shady, nasty creatures outside constantly. A bus stop with sweat pant hustlers being loud and obnoxious and often fighting. And most of all... their CLIENTELE, though varied with good people... also consists of BELLIGERENT regulars who will try to start altercations.  And the staff? Will do nothing. Just leave it to you to be abused, potentially in danger, or defend yourself.  IF YOU COME TO THIS RESTAURANT, AND HAVE A CONCEALED CARRY PERMIT... wear your gun. Hell, open carry it in this neighborhood... the people outside as soon as you park and surrounding the building and strip mall are SKETCH.  There are literally riff raff walking around drunkenly harassing patrons with impunity. Even starting fights.  And if you don't want to wind up in a fist fight just getting Indian food and trying to relax...  I'd keep yourself strapped. That goes for ANYwhere else in this neighborhood.  I figured this place was an exception. But there are no exceptions in this part of town.  And if  you have anything to lose, then you have everything to protect. Because some of this riff raff clearly has -nothing- to lose.  ---  The people who own it are good people, honestly. They're not some uncaring idiots. They DO care about their patrons. They're honest, hard working people with a great menu selection.  But they're hardworking immigrants from India. They don't want to get involved in things better left to bouncers, etc. They're a family owned business and I understand that they don't want to pay the overhead for security.  I didn't think I'd need to have my gun on my tonight to go eat some curry. But in this area of town... you can't be too careful.  ---

Tg4mRcjUKjooanJYIS6Gag.text: One of my favorite Indian places!!! Super friendly services, and the food is soooooo yummy!

-OVqrKeaaxYdErLSEMhTVw.text: Some of the best Indian food I've had, including in India. The spices were fantastic. Each dish we had was absolutely wonderful: chicken Vindaloo, Aloo Goni, Dal, Nan, rice pudding and rice. And the menu's offerings are impressive. Plus very warm service. If you like Indian food I recommend you try it! And I look forward to returning this restaurant in my next trip to Vegas. Only wish I lived closer to it.

fcG2WUAXz3XGgp_B3bynXg.text: Great place all around. Have enjoyed everything I've tried here. The Chicken Kadai is my go to main dish, though the butter chicken is excellent as well. Garlic naan is very good but the star of the place is the Chicken Momo's. I am huge fan of all different kinds of dumplings but have to say these are amongst my favorite. Many times I just get 2 orders to go on my way home. Overall fantastic place that I highly recommend

OYVkRVEpidz5qDKtiu2T_w.text: I guess I should have reviewed it the first time I went about 3 months back as that was a 5 star performance...Still was a good buffet but I left thinking...eh...4 stars. Maybe I just wasn't hungry enough today  The tandoori chicken was just a slight bit dry and we had to wait a bit for the naan to come out.  Overall a lot of Pros:  +Every dish had a unique curry flavor...wasn't the same curry taste in multiple dishes +Food was hot and fresh... +Food quality was good, you'd think you ordered a la carte +Service was excellent...water was always refilled promptly (the guy that gave one star and said they used tap water...not the case today) +Love that paneer spinach and cheese thing +Chili Chicken was good  We were there early enough so that when the cooks brought out the trays, they too took some plates of food from the tray into the back for themselves. For me that means no monkey business in the kitchen...you always assume there's not but I've seen too many episodes of Kitchen Nightmares.  The goat was so-so...kinda fatty and lots of bones, was hard to find a good piece in the whole tray...for $10.99 perhaps that's not enough to cover a lamb substitute and maintain profit.  I think what was missing today were my sweet monkey balls that seem to hit the desert spot and some beef korma...my favorite dish...I think they had it last time.  Despite this not being as good as I first remembered...it's still the best Indian buffet I've tried (been to about 3)  Overall a good spread and I will be back...call it 4.5 stars.

rldllxQEh4vjS_bsj9wOxg.text: This place serves great food! We highly recommend coming here during their lunch hour for the buffet so that you can try a variety of food and save a lot of money.  What I did find rather funny and unusual was a conversation I had with the waiter.  I asked for garlic butter naan and the way he answered the question and what he said was really weird. It wasn't until after my boyfriend and I left that I laughed about it. He said they weren't making garlic naan because if they did, people would come to their restaurant and it'll be too busy. Haha isn't that what you want? Then he kept going and said "we're going to continue serving it after the holidays. And we don't have it because it takes too long to make." Hahaha I didn't understand all the excuses. So I just said "it's all right. Not a big deal." Although I was a little disappointed they didn't have the garlic butter naan because I always order it when I go to an Indian restaurant.

nmFoCCvbhPAxXYkV9IlQyw.text: I swear some of these reviews here have to be FAKE and made my the restaurant owners themselves.  Interior is decrepit (don't believe the pics), the area is sketchy and parking arrangement is bad. Service is good and nice. With that out of the way lets talk about the food. Simply put...not good and not made with care. Samosas was searing hot on the exterior but had very cold spots inside. When it comes within 2 minutes of ordering...you know its microwaved and simply recycled from the lunch buffet. Mango lassi tasted like a bland artificial blend that was premade the day before. Mixed grilled platter was bland. Chicken was DRY, shrimp was overcooked, lamb was ok however. Chicken tikka masala was dry in terms of meat, the sauce tasted good but nothing noteworthy. The naan was NOT naan. It was too doughy, undercooked, and lacked in flavor. Lamb biryani tasted pretty good however and that's the only thing I can say I actually enjoyed compared to the other dishes.  Would not recommend. I've tasted real indian food and this place is simply NOT it.

ANaeYY6K1uY1acDXNjw54g.text: I'd like to start by saying the bad reviews are silly. I'm no expert on Indian food but I know delicious and this is delicious. If every chicken tikka masala tasted the same what would be the point in visiting other restaurants? I welcome variation and artistic expression. I can't say whether the dishes are traditional or "right" but they are all yummy! My favorites are the Aloo Gobi, Chicken Saag (substitute for the traditional paneer), Tikka Masala and the tamarind sauce is delicious.

MMQcmIg7D_p6y0XqO8ushQ.text: Dont eat here if u want atleast a little bit of indian taste. 4.5 stars is a myth for this restaurant. None of the cuisine in the buffet were good. I just wasted my money on new year eve in a bad restaurant.

QWZGy60TGsd8dpfiy5tg2g.text: This place was recommended to me by some friends, so I decided to stop in for the lunch buffet. The food was very good and tasty and the service was excellent. I would highly recommend.....

d1qJg4gwedyMO3j7BEgvVg.text: The only problem I've ever had here is eating too much. The food is delicious and the service is excellent. I've had their buffet a couple times, and it never disappoints - there are the typical things that I know and love, but there are always other dishes to try that are always yummy! When we come for dinner, I usually get chicken makhani at a spicy level 10 - positively to die for!  I know there are other places in town, but if you want the best Indian food, look no further than Mt. Everest!

4RRyh38jhr53KRJ31NFv5g.text: Horrible, worst Indian food I have ever eaten. Wondering how the hell it got more than 4 stars, must be paid reviews. Fell sick after eating this food and that ruined my whole trip. Please don't take people's health for granted. I wish I could give minus stars. Now let's describe this in detail. First they served complimentary papad which was soggy. After all it was complimentary. The vegetable korma had literally big pieces of vegetables. Ok option is you cut it and eat. What if the potatoes are not cooked, well in that case u can't cut. The cauliflower pieces were so big that I wondered whether they even had a knife in the kitchen to use it. Now the next was goat biryani. It had sweet corn in it, who puts sweet corn in a goat biryani. Well they just used the ready to use cut vegetables and that has corn. Plus they had all kinds of dry fruits which was never mentioned, people can be alergic to some kinds of nuts. Now the million dollar question, how was the goat. Answer is amazing and normal human being teeth can't chew it. It was so hard that I literally had to throw away most of the goat pieces. It seems that they thought that they had to simply put goat pieces in the rice. FYI the goat has to be cooked well before putting it in the rice. I can go on and on but never mind, all I can say I will remember this place for a long time.

HXgjGiQiKZrMBUQsejm0yg.text: I love this place amazing food and great service! They have buffet during lunch! There chicken masala is my favorite!

hZSidZVeW8zUHiZV60zuwA.text: We received pappadum plus delicious tamarind and mint sauces to begin our meal and after an exceptionally long wait we received our aloo tiki, deep fried mashed potatoes, which were overdone and virtually inedible.    A few minutes later the remainder of our meal, chicken makahani, lamb saag, plain basmati rice and kabuli naan (stuffed with raisins and nuts) appeared.  The naan was flat as a pancake and the filling was very bland.  Both entrees were large and delicious though the lamb was on the tough side. We concluded the meal with a shared portion of carrot halwa which was a bit too sweet.    Service, other then by the busboy, was abysmal from start to finish.  The sole waiter, I am guessing the owner, sat in a booth across the room from us playing with a cell phone and never once looked in our direction to determine if we or any of the other diners needed anything.  I had to call the busboy over to get our check and then it took the waiter an inordinate amount of time to process the payment.
