Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken makahani and lamb saag
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pappadum with sauces

ap6V2aHPCauNL2fe6PrjjQ.text: A surprisingly awesome buffet in a place I would have never guessed (a bit of a shady corner next to a gas station). Easily the best Indian buffet in town, this place offers a small but very tasty buffet (about 12 items or so) accompanied by some delicious naan. The owner is very cordial and welcoming and will make sure your table is well taken care of.  A lunch buffet with a mango lassi (very tasty, btw) will run  about $14 and will be worth every penny. They also have a la carte items, which I have never tried, but I bet they are just a tasty as the buffet items.

1xQ6wF3y6UZsse0PCCWzsw.text: New in Nevada, and my girlfriend took me here. Never had India's cuisine food and OMG let me tell you it was amazing. I completely fell in love with the chicken Makhani and garlic chili Naan so delicious. I highly recommend this spot! Service was great and friendly and the price was very reasonable.

SwPruH_pqrVD3iak8eOmcA.text: Fair Prices.  Super friendly.  Always busy...  Good FOOD!!  And good experience all the time!  :)

dvNwnpjSwQfhMq64CInLZA.text: Delicious! I'm a Las Vegas resident and this is one of my favorite places to eat. If you go, get the butter chicken and garlic naan. It's AMAZING!

9O-pc7KaBRVqgUN_BiAC6Q.text: This place is good, torn between 4 and 5 stars.  My first visit, so guess I'll stick with the 4 stars for now.  Good food, large extensive menu, great service.

A3COwuxd5r8r-vwBtJRD7A.text: Went for a dinner while on visit in Vegas. Ordered Tandoori chicken,  chicken makhani(butter chicken),  paalak paneer,  and raita. Tandoori chicken on sizzler was okay; it was moist from inside but not as flavorful as I had at couple restaurants in the bay area. Chicken makhani and raita were very good. Paalak paneer was decent, Garlic Naan was good, soft and right size. Ambience and service were standard, nothing exceptional but acceptable. This is not a fancy restaurant but certainly a place where you can go for good Indian food.

nMP_gVTWfBTcU-ouP7HW-Q.text: No need to stage a When-Harry-Met-Sally-fake-food-gasm here. This Indian cuisine packs a huge punch, and I was in heaven from the first bite. Seriously.  For the money spent it's a tremendous value. I can't wait to go back.   I deducted one star because the bathroom was pretty dirty.

TweVkVX5iVMFZkqE0cjfEw.text: Love coming here! Food is tasty (made vegan for me by request!), price is good, and the staff is courteous and helpful!  Trying gobi aloo tonight,  pix on my Instagram @fauxphox743

Q5cC_J2gBovjqTqvse_Jgw.text: This is some of the best Indian food in Las Vegas, hands down. Don't let the area put you off...you'll be inside anyway!! The staff is very friendly and helpful. The food...YUM!!! It is perfectly spiced, just the right amount of heat. The fried foods are not greasy, the lamb is not gamy. The Mattar Paneer, the pacoras,the veggie samosas, the naan...WOW!! Mount Everest is THE place for Indian Cuisine in Las Vegas!!

yiDuMlDNdFWfh2YprrCzTg.text: Some of the best Indian food in the area! To be honest, it's not in the nicest neighborhood. But if it's mighty tasty food you crave, at a very reasonable price, take the 5-minute drive off the strip to enjoy delicious grub. Don't be scared by the exterior, which rather needs some TLC, because the interior is actually quite nice and cozy, and well-maintained.  Try the vindaloo, it's some of the best I've ever had anywhere. I wouldn't recommend the salad, it's not exactly as pictured. The naan, however, is fragrant and fluffy!   The owner actually still recognizes us from when we visited one year ago... either we're funny-looking, or he's got a good memory. :)

1-C3_fx6R4iJhwuoE8aTJg.text: I love coming to this place. Every time you walk in your appetite increases with all the wonderful smells coming from the food. There hasn't been any times that this place disappoints. Even when when the place is packed full it still it doesn't get rowdy or confusing. The selection isn't big but it's all delicious.

TMUtGbvTerY6h5gj1669HA.text: Good lunch buffet. Third day in Vegas and we started craving for Indian food. After reading the various yelp reviews we decided to go to Mount Everest and we were not disappointed. The restaurant was pretty busy. The spread was usual, not a great lot of variety, but enough to satisfy your Indian food craving. The good thing was that the food was pretty spicy and flavorful. Not bland at all. The naan bread was soft and just amazing. Except the palak paneer ( spinach and Indian cheese) I think everything was made to perfection. The carrot halwa ( carrot pudding) was good too. The yellow daal tasted homemade, just how my mom would make. The butter chicken and goat curry were good too.  I always get excited when I see momos ( Nepalese Indian dumplings) on any menu. We ordered those with our buffet. But they were nothing close to what you get in India.  However, a decent place to have Indian food in Vegas. And it is around 15 min by cab from the strip.

beAG7XbDZdvzOCpTqSw3dA.text: Food is not good, non veg curry was tasty. Better avoid and look at other indian restaurant...

qotPqeupLDe9j5p-yHCtmw.text: This is by far the best Indian lunch buffet I ever had in Vegas.  The service was amazing and restaurant itself it clean and quiet.  Most Indian restaurants' lunch buffet are dishes from days ago.   At Mt Everest I could really taste the flavor of different spices they use and the meat dishes were tender but not too soft.  The curry dishes were just perfect, enough sweetness but also taste the kick of other spices they use.   I truly believe this place roast their own spices and grind it up themselves also.

oUsC59rSLvvJKVCz4ejRXQ.text: Fabulous experience, this location was recommended by a friend and we are so glad we tried this out! Amazing service, each dish we had was fantastic. We will definitely be back!

yOcwKuOWYw7ZGx_lPbUR6g.text: The food here is excellent and authentic. We were looking for something affordable off the strip but good food and this place did not disappoint! We ordered garlic naan, chicken masala and prawn curry and it was ALL excellent. The staff was very friendly and fast. Dishes range in price from $11-14 and it's worth every dollar (if not more). It was exactly what we were looking for. 5 stars well deserved!

vGqlNufYo7Nu-OPxfOJGSg.text: Myself and a bunch of coworkers go here for the lunch buffet and it always pleases. A decent amount of options for a reasonable price. I've yet to have a bad experience, the food is great and the service is good too. I definitely recommend it.

GIm7jbOYSb8zNwd6ommbJw.text: Outstanding service, Prakash is Awesome!! Food is delicious, I traveled all the way from Green Valley, Henderson to have the sumptuous buffet. Great Food, Great People.

RoYYu8SdhuGDZNZfwcWXHg.text: Fail to understand the Yelp hype here. Very standard north Indian restaurant. Solid, and in the top half of that category, but not 5 star by any stretch. Only a couple of Nepalese dishes. Vegetable chow chow was kind of lame, just a few chopped peppers and onions.   There are too many Indian restaurants bringing the same menu and they all blend together. India is a huge country (especially when you're including neighboring countries like Nepal), and it has a vast variety of cuisines and styles. Somebody please bring something more adventurous than saag paneer and chicken tikka masala.

rXIb4f1JX4Zr7lrC2JWugQ.text: We got the mt. Everest thali and the lamb biryani. It is the best. We will come back for sure. Try the pickled vegetables. The service is amazing and two adults and two kids = these two entrees = fully satisfied. Glasses always full. Please do yourself and come here. Ask for Prakash! He will take care of your family.

4sL4omGzBUdHqFhbqOAoXg.text: Don't let the location put you off.  I've been here over a dozen times for both lunch and dinner and have left happy each time.  Definitely try the buffet for lunch.  Food is hot, fresh, and tasty.  You get both plain and garlic naan as part of the meal, all for $10.  Dinner is great as well.  Lamb and chicken dishes were quite tasty.  The only dish which has disappointed was the tandori which was flavorful but overcooked and dry.  I've tried it twice with the same result so I'm sticking with the curries.

MViZF857gbqsEDrPmzTtTA.text: Soooooo YUMMY!  My husband and I loved it!  Got the veggie samosas,  chicken makhani  and fish curry with Rita on the side,  oh and garlic naan! Definitely coming back!

oSKFwMtDF6FF72hGg09uew.text: I relied on yelp reviews and made a trip to this place all the way from Las Vegas strip.. It's not that far.. It took me just 10 mins by cab ($16).. I came in for lunch buffet and I didn't like what I saw so I asked if I can order ala carte but sadly that don't allow that. I arrive bit early and the food labels on the buffet were wrong. Samosa was good and so was the naan but rest of the stuff was disappointing. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

kPqW30rD5jJ7NPGa1vD3zg.text: Great food, great service!!   The staff took great care of our needs.  The owner even assisted in waiting on us and brought us a free dessert at the end of our dining.  We frequent Indian restaurants in all major cities we visit due to lack of options in Arkansas.  I would say this was one of the best we have been too.  We visit Las Vegas often and we WILL be visiting Mount Everest during our next trip.  Well worth the cab ride from the strip and we just hailed a cab from the street when we left.

WP_6cCWBrr18lL_PRni0Xg.text: When I saw Mt Everest getting ready to open I was initially a little put off by the locale - in a defunct Burger King building, next to a gas station, in a grotty parking lot outside Marianna's Mexican Supermarket on West Sahara.   Eventually we tried the extremely reasonably priced lunch buffet for $8.95 and were immediately blown away by the quality and variety of food here. I am a meat eater and my wife is a vegatarian, but there is so much for both of us.   The Chicken Makhani and Chicken Tikka Masala (these two rotate so you will get either one of the other) are both wonderful and there's always a few delicious vegetable dishes that are cooked and seasoned to perfection. Vegetables that I would never consider eating elsewhere are somehow transformed into pure delights.  Also excellent is the selection of pakora and the large, delicious Samosas (I usually manage to polish off three of these).  Freshly cooked naan (so fresh you almost burn your hands if you aren't careful) is so good you could make a meal out of it and some of the sauce from the buffet alone. Our hosts usually offer us our choice of plain or garlic naan - or even both. They are eager to please their customers here at Mt Everest.  Quite often I can tell when an Indian restaurant is going to be good by the number of Indian people eating there - Mt Everest attracts a diverse mix of clientele, yet does not fall into the trap of becoming too westernised. If I have one small criticism it is that Gulab Jamun (a personal favourite) never seems to appear as the dessert on the buffet, but this is an extremely minor complaint.  The dinner menu is extensive with as many as ten options for each base type of food (veg, chicken, lamb etc). At dinner you get a free serve of papadums along with well priced servings that were a good 30% cheaper than in some of the local competitor restaurants and possible TWICE the size - Extremely good value and the dinner time Butter Chicken could be the best I have ever tasted.  Note: You might want to look over all 1 star reviews of Mount Everest (and for that matter, all Vegas Indian restaurants) with a critical eye. You'll notice they are often from people who have written no other real reviews. I strongly suspect there's some "review wars" going on between different establishments. You'll notice they will always claim that staff are "rude, disrespectful, etc" - There isn't an Indian restaurant in Vegas I have been to where the staff have been anything short of gracious to the point of humble and Mt Everest is no exception. Don't believe the bogus reviews that claim otherwise.

JboJvXPiM6Y8Vqc9f-F-Cg.text: Wanted to try Indian food in Las Vegas. Since my last visit there were over a half a dozen establishments. We picked this place because it had a good yelp rating. When we got there around 830, the place was ratehr quiet. Its a spacious restaurant but when its not packed (on a Saturday night), you start to wonder. It took a few moments before they got our table ready and a little coaxing for them to come an take our order. Although we were in no particular hurry, they did not seem to be anxious to serve us. I must confess the staff were in uniform and when they finally got to us, they were very pleasant. The best part was the food. We ordered Shahi Paneer and Bhindi Masla. (we were vegetarians). The food was delivered by someone who seemed like an important person (could have been one of the owners - he was not wearing a uniform) and in an almost ceremonious manner !! The flavoring was very balanced (we asked for medium), tasteful, well presented, hot and in adequate quantity for two. The Naans were fluffy and fresh. My acid test for North Indian restaurants is the paneer tikka masala but the shahi panner gave me enough evidence that the chef knew what he was doing. We finsihed our meal leisurely and just as we  were finsihing up, we noticed the other tables were filling up. After it was Las Vegas and perhaps we were there a little early. Enjoy this nondescript, off the strip authentic Indian cuisine. You should not be disappointed.

WUBxOpiLVUzsv-N35LcfEw.text: I have to update my review to once again say how amazing this place is! Everytime we come here the wait staff is always so nice and attentive. The food OMG the food! It's absolutely amazing. We ordered the chicken tikka masala, chicken korma, and chicken Kadai. They were all amazing! They had the perfect blend of spices and the chicken was very tender. HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!

OGftel4ah66oOlKUmhKb_w.text: From the garlic naan to the perfectly marinaded grilled chicken tikka, delicious curries, and the world's best tamarind sauce, Mt. Everest tops the list of fresh, authentic Indian cuisine in Las Vegas.  Add a Hayward's 5000, and you get the perfect meal every time, served in a clean, pleasingly decorated atmosphere. Owner-operator Prakash and family offer great service, great food, and great value at one of the valley's best kept secrets. Whereas most Vegas eateries shuttle you through courses at a breakneck pace to make room for the next patrons, Mt. Everest India's Cuisine is the perfect place for a nicely paced dinner with close friends.  Visit once and, like us, you'll be back weekly for your fix.

STZ8snET6vV4KUFTelCw5A.text: I've been on a quest to find the best Indian cusine in las Vegas and My Everest comes 1st every time! And trust me I have tried many. Everest is nice, delicious food, friendly staff, and great food any time of day!

xJNo9DtXj3VFp5VMwYBMiw.text: This little place is wonderful. The service is friendly and welcoming with a family vibe. The food is absolutely delicious! My favorite dish is the butter chicken, but last time I went I wasn't eating meat and ordered a vegetarian curry dish instead. The rich flavor blew me away - everything I have had is great. If you like Indian food, you must try this place!

FvyaiF92J8VoKIUaP65UXw.text: Loved it. Has a large variety of vegetarian options, which is always nice. I can't wait to go back and try more stuff

zZ1OegV3kW_rc8_tce0i-A.text: This was the best Indian food I've ever tasted. My friends and I love Indian food and have tried just about every place in Vegas. Happened to stumble across it and wow! We must say we are impressed. If I could give 10 stars I would. Their tandoori chicken and Tika massala chicken was absolutely the best! Has become my favorite Indian spot in Las Vegas, and the owner is just the best and most accommodating! Has my recommendation!

9BfJA420SiSe8l0D6Vd8pQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised. The location is a bit ghetto so I wasn't expecting the great food and service. The dinner was seasoned and cooked just right. Next time I'll try the lunch buffet.

OJFuTovcRolz6aoAQXWLqA.text: The selection of really good Indian Restaurants in Las Vegas is somewhat limited, but thank goodness for Mount Everest. From the outside it looks like a converted fast-food joint (used to be a Burger King) but inside the decor and atmosphere are what you would expect in an authentic upscale Indian Restaurant offering fine dining. To cut a long story short, I have eaten at Mount Everest on several occasions. The food is excellent as is the service, portions are generous and the prices are very reasonable. I have tried many Indian restaurants in Vegas and none of them come close to Mount Everest - highly recommended.

_oH8xJ-SqPsB62Gr29NcLw.text: Great food, though kind of mild, compared to what I expected. I ordered medium, expecting the food to be super hot for my palette, based on my experience in other Indian restaurants. The flavor and blend of spices was superb. We had baigan barta, very creamy and delicious, and channa masala, which had a very unusual and scrumptious taste. The service was very good and everyone was very friendly.

EMj4sIbam0pxdc8O7Osztg.text: Very clean, great services, amazing food. Prices are reasonable and would definitely go back when in Las Vegas!! Great experiences must visit if wanting Indiana cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A must try great Indian cuisine

Z8woAil_ISCBMpY5QSohpg.text: The buffet was pretty good. tons of stuff to choose from.

d-WOVIHAPkHuBNUeyzn6Nw.text: Tandoori chicken was raw and tasteless. Curries were also too spicy inspite of we asking for medium spice. I don't recommend this place.

cQf-7dFHLPA_y10WwLZpTA.text: Amazing food, very welcoming staff, great service, value for money...... good food... Come Vegas!! Come Mt. Everest!! m short of words....5*. Spcl Thanks Mr. Prakash and Praveen.. & whole staff!!

nsPiJgjpRhGWOYxk9BpeSQ.text: Love this place! Food is always amazing and the owner is friendly.  Butter chicken and chicken momo w garlic naan.... u can't go wrong

XDlHT5eCNnbp7xdPGyXq5w.text: Never had anything better indo nepalese food anywhere in the states. If you crave momo, this is the place to be in. Besides excellent food, they have excellent customer service and most friendly ppl i have met in any restaurants. Their morning buffet is great but I'd recommend the dinner. Marvelous!! Every time i visit this restaurant, i am gonna visit vegas. Ops! Did i say that right? Oh hell yea!! Thanks guys :)

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious!!

3GYKQJgWRbDd6MSKGe1A7w.text: Had the lunch buffet and liked everything. Curry was amazing. There were 3 choices- chicken tikka masala, goat curry, and a tomato based chicken curry. All were delicious in their own ways. Great place to try while in Vegas.

IaDduof-prLCBX_NhSecqg.text: Food was amazing, indian food loves in Vegas or visiting  there, its a-definitely go place . I loved Gajar halwa, very similar how my mum cooks. Loved the place and good buffet option .

eh4b3jmgAkiuVuzvzrN5yA.text: Wonderful Indian food, great service and a most hospitable owner. We love the food and kind attentive service. Felt like a welcome guest and not simply a customer   To start we had the Chau Chau Soup...absolutely delicious, not to be missed. Then we shared 3 vegetarian dishes, Vegetable Korma, Mutter Paneer, and Malai Kofta...all were delicious. We also had Chicken Makhani (butter chicken) that was outstanding. The hot Marsala Chai tea was so pleasant and warming.  We're in from out of town on business, but always make room to stop here for a great meal.  Thank you Mt. Everest!

B4PUnnJoh1IeHjteDMVhiQ.text: Have been to 3 Indian buffet restaurants in town and this is definitely the best! Me and my husband love to come here and will def come back every weekend. The owner and manager are always really nice!

pEnpeAD_2rf9XBNVEwIKyQ.text: The restaurant is very authentic. All the dishes were full of flavor, especially the curry dishes. This was my first experience trying Indian food and it was not disappointing. I suggest going during lunch time to have the buffet option so you can try all different types of Indian dishes. The price isn't all that bad either. Definitely well worth trying at once.

PG9gBlMbXxrHvGm1zwCewg.text: Garlic Naan was very soft and delicious with slight crunchiness. Don't order the Pista Kulfi. They taste no where nowhere near to original kulfi. The service was good and they didn't take much time for the order to arrive.

P0DRfnpSJG8LqGi_z4yhRQ.text: Food was cold. We were super hungry that's why had no choice but to eat it. Flavors were missing. I told this to the owner but he dint seem to care. Highly disappointed!! Do not get fooled by the 1000+ reviews. This place is a disaster. BIG NOOOOOO

sRg7smqg1zRrQ7oZy-gBgQ.text: I woke up seriously wounded, defeated, +hungover on Saturday, and in a fit of hunger, I decided that my boyfriend and I needed to check this Indian buffet out. The price is right, at $10.99 per person. I also like how the lunch buffet is served every day from 11am - 3pm, which allows me enough time to catch up on my beauty rest on the weekends.  To my surprise, it was above average, very enjoyable; but mind you, not out of this world mind blowing. Plus, a small ounce of hatred flowed through me when I found out that they no longer served garlic naan for the lunch buffet...Man! I was really looking forward to that!   I appreciated their authenticity in the spice department. Whew! They don't mess around. Some of the items on the buffet such as the veggie samosas and the malai kofta, had some shocking heat and I loved it! I didn't care for every dish they had available on the buffet - Some were too starchy or dry, but no worries, there were more than enough options to get me stuffed silly.   Here are my favorites!  - Fresh Baked Garlic Naan Bread - they were on top of refilling our basket and making sure we had hot, crispy, fluffy and fresh naan throughout our meal. - Sweet Rice (basmati rice sweetened with honey) - It had a very faint sweetness and flavor of honey, plus I loved the color! - Saag Paneer - The cheese curds were a little on the overcooked and hard side, but the spinach curry was very deep and flavorful.  - Malai Kofta - It was interestingly sweet and packed full with flavorful spices, I loved the spicy kick it had. I really enjoyed dunking my naan in this one.  - Chicken Tikka Masala - The curry flavor was rather weak on this one, but it was very rich and creamy. The chicken was very tender as well.  - Tandoori Chicken - The chicken was tender and moist.  - Veggie Samosa - Spicy city! I loved the unexpected spices that came through in each bite. It woke my taste buds up!  - Mint and Tamarind Chutney - Refreshing and sweet. They both paired perfectly with all of the dishes and the naan. I especially enjoyed them with the samosa and the spicy curries!  - Raita - Very refreshing and cooling for the heavy and spicy curries.  - Rice Pudding - We loved the sweetness and the consistency with this rice pudding.  I'll Pass:  - Pakora - very dry - Aloo Baingan (eggplant and potato) - wasn't too flavorful or memorable.  - Curry Chicken - boring flavor - Chili Chicken - dried out - Yellow Dal - too thick and flavor was not exciting  - Chana Masala - not memorable on the spices and flavor  - There were many other buffet items that just didn't stand out to me.  After our lunch I had a minor stomach ache - but I'll blame that on my hangover and all that alcohol that was in my belly. Tsk tsk naughty.

beERFMTOcIoN_V-KtE-tcQ.text: I enjoyed this place. The food and service was honest and well done. I would definitely go again whenever I'm in Vegas. The whole family enjoyed it, with all our varying tastes.

ijJ7wwJ_UTd11wUleTnwbw.text: Food is good here buffet has lot of vegetarian option. Blend of spices is perfect here it's not too spicy

IBfAENSpVm7F4PofnBR_mw.text: The at this place is beyond amazing. I wish I lived in this area so I could come by here more often. I very much enjoyed the food

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The food at this place is amazing. I wish I lived near by to come here more often.

CgYhKcgKXeGioICfj05lHQ.text: This place is amazing! Probably the most flavorful Indian food I've ever had. The veggie samosa is SO delicious. The sauces that come with it top it all. We split an aloo chana, again, SO AMAZING DELICIOUS FLAVORFUL. Just had my left overs for breakfast, even better the next day. Nice restaurant, staff, bathroom, parking. Will be back!!!

oB5dZeePYYSuDH10ptkKaA.text: I got the lamb tiki masala and it was so delicious!!!  The owner Prakash took care of us and was very friendly.... Desserts were amazing  -J.   Loved this place  A hole in the wall and one of a kind!! Definitely have to try!!-S.   The owner, Prakash and his staff are extremely nice and attentive. This was my first time trying Indian cuisine and they made it a wonderful experience. They have found new customers with us!-A.   Amazing food. Shout out to Ganesh our waiter. Friendly staff and owner is super nice. Try the butter chicken, lamb curry and Taj Mahal beer! Delicious. -J.

gUq84DNrVPcyNmxi2WBMxg.text: 4.5 Stars!  Outstanding food!  Incredibly friendly service!  Slightly understaffed, but we are patient dinners.  For the price the quality and portion size was wonderful.  If the food was not so affordable, then I would have been turned off by the atmosphere.  It's certainly is not classy, but doesn't offer any warm/old/divey feelings to placate my heart either.  I would come here again and again .  I kept hearing "that was the best Indian food I've ever had" from fellow patrons...and for the price I would agree.  You literally have to pay twice as much to come close to beating Mount Everest!

UCGL4V3pD4wD92BDOSRODA.text: Overrated... I've enjoyed Indian food for many years and I was excited to try this place. - The restaurant itself needs remodeling badly. Carpets are super dirty bathrooms had no paper towel. - Servers dress very informal like if I'm eating at a taqueria or some street food place - Food is so so... I ordered the exact same thing I order at the restaurant I always eat and I was very set back with the flavors. Chicken korma wasn't creamy and it just didn't taste as good. Overall I would not come back... I always trust yelp fellows but this time I was let down.

w9wCcmLy9FL_m99qDUgRfg.text: We found this place after our previous favorite Indian go to place shut down, and I have no regrets, it is amazing. I've been here for the lunch buffet with my husband, dad, and one of my sons(other was at school), a couple of times, and even when the 2 year old got a little louder they were very great to us and have been kind and familiar in a good way. The food is all amazing, and usually not too spicy but not plain either, it's all great, and in general not too loud, or overly bright or dark.

1Q-43D1-ekXv1sZMVjxQWw.text: Good service, amazing food.  We had the mixed grill plate, lamb vindaloo, vegetable korma, garlic and cheese naan (for the kiddos).  Huge papadams as starters, free of charge.  Mango and sweet lassi both very tasty.  Prices very reasonable.  Food came out fast and fresh.  My chai cup was a bit on the tiny side, but it was very good.  Had a wonderful dinner here and would definitely come back!

9vubBy0OMQKxL8eUFeuMmQ.text: If your looking for great taste for Indian Cuisin this is the place. Service is awesome! Food is excellent! Price is right on the dollar. My menu, Chicken masala, Chicken tikka and the Tandoori chicken is the must have or at least try.  Happy service+good food=happy customer.  One of my favorite place to go too atleast twice a month.  Location not so hot, but who cares food is what we're talking about here.

Yi_NE2h4rM3BABcmDnSsTw.text: I'm glad I stopped in, the food was excellent! I asked for a spicy dish and it was the perfect amount of spice. Great food and great service. Definitely will be returning!

7ZqqNPfdYDnsmlNZ1Jx1Mw.text: I didn't eat their food. Walked in checked their menu and their veg Thali was 20/-??? Serious!! I know it's Vegas but come on! Get real!! Things are cheap here .  Crime!!

B5sOZbJKQf_nnFjba0FTbw.text: Since I love Indian food and my disappointing realization from Gandhi I went to Mt. Everest today.  They may not have as many items in their lunch buffet but, the food is so good. Its fresh  and seasoned almost to perfection. I love the fact that they bring you a basket of Naan bread right to your table. Its always warm and tastes straight out of the oven. The service was great too. I always had my water filled and our plates taken as soon as we were finished. Looks like Mt Everest is the one I'll be visiting often.  P.S. Pardon the pic as by the time I realized I forgot to take it I was already grubbing on the food, lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is buffet style lunch! Awesome!

MgNgCJvZEfTHcu9GWM81dg.text: Wow, very good food.  Impressive for sure.  We went with yelp on this, and it worked out.  Had to bump this up to 5 stars.  I am really shocked at the quality of food and the depth of flavor.   The lunch buffet is considerably underpriced for what you get.  I suggest a heavy tip if you can, this needs to survive.   Great service, friendly staff, and a family feel here.   My new favorite lunch place.

2R4Dr22WoUQs93LWJ3YDYw.text: This is one of the best Indian buffets in the Las Vegas area. Service is great and the lunch buffet was tasty and varied. The price was also right at 10.95.   Highly recommend Indian food lovers try this place!

2NGl-3r4q8oYEiBZz4WS6g.text: Very close to strip. Came for dinner- Ala carte. Had momos, biryani and chai. Very close to way we have back in India. Flavorful, perfectly spiced and sumptuous.

gbJr0vRJtOMMvVem3MsQEA.text: This is my third meal at Mount Everest and I'm pleasantly stuffed again! We had the Chicken Saag, Lamb vindaloo, mixed grill platter and garlic naan.  A True family-owned restaurant and pretty full for a weeknight.  Will be coming back!

w5CkDjYUSk-BHuGfDHRqsw.text: For my sister's 18th birthday, I suggested we skip the overdone Italian option and try Indian. Everybody was down, and I got to give the teenagers a decent intro to the cuisine.  As a party of seven, we ordered so many dishes.  Vegetable and keema (lamb) samosas were a good introduction and came out piping hot. Kachumber Salad, I could eat this forever. Such simple ingredients (lettuce, cucumber, tomato, and a dressing), with a nice clean flavor.  And then the barrage of flavor with Tandoori Chicken, Chicken Tikka Masala, Chana Masala, Aloo Palak, Lamb Korma, Dal Tarka,  Chicken Biriyani, Garlic Naan.  Service was excellent and attentive. They brought our dinner to a close with a complimentary rice pudding.  I look forward to returning and trying the Thali, which is a special made up of a little bit of everything.

afpqrhjp3NurDBJghWJroQ.text: I went for lunch buffett. Don't let the building fool you (renovated McDonald's), this place was awesome 10.99 for lunch buffett. Plenty of staff to let everything replenished and clean at the buffett station.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch buffett 10.99.

SjSyMwlAOKRHPd3lyjXKNw.text: A 5 star is probably good from someone who eats Indian food regularly. My wife and I went last night for dinner and enjoy some really delish food.   I tried the chicken momo's, while we ordered naan's and some shahi paneer... every bite packed a punch. The rice and daal were incredible too. Definitely a highly recommend and repeat for us the next time we're in Vegas.

hFFg_sl6dJlRyjbdLJ155A.text: Hands down the best Indian food I've had in the US.  Spicy actually means spicy, the samosa's were fantastic, the service was great.  We had samosa's, garlic naan, raita, Lamb Vindaloo, Chicken Kadai (the best dish of the night).  All for $38.  Unlike most Indian places, portions were big enough to take some home.  We probably wont try another place in Las Vegas.  Seriously good.  Left-overs didn't last til lunch...had it for breakfast.

7sHNwOOw9ifgBNrvWBM3FQ.text: My husband and I went to have some dinner and we didn't realize the time. The restaurant was actually closed and the owner Prakash welcomed us and gave us the option to order take out. We really appreciated that, and we were worried that his staff would be upset with us for ruining their closing routine! Prakash was so nice and he took our order and we even ordered extra sides after we had put the original order in, and he still accommodated us. We will definitely come here again within hours when we are in town next time. The food was amazing spicy and fresh. We absolutely loved it!

n7J3upeKPaU6LYMvxH1FPA.text: This place was great. We went for the lunch buffet on the recordation of a friend. It was excellent. Had never had sweet rice before and it was awesome! The naan was excellent and it was great to try a bunch of different dishes. Will deffinately be going back.

_yb_R8QOBEiYlqMyRgLpXQ.text: I love Indian food but we usually go to India Palace so when I got a $25 off coupon, we decided to try them out! I am so glad we did!  Their prices seem to be slightly lower than India Palace and their portions were definitely much larger.  We had the vegetable samosa to start- it was a tad salty but with the two chutneys, they really balanced out.  We also had: Chili Naan- was good, not spicy at all  Chicken Tikka- same as tandoori chicken but boneless. It was good, some pieces were a little dry but overall pretty good.  I don't understand the french fries on top though...that kinda threw me off..hmmm.  Lamb Vindaloo- delish.  Lamb were actual pieces of lamb, not the ground lamb like some places use.  Very flavorful, not too gamey.  Aloo matter- potatoes and peas in a sauce, again, large portion and large chunks of potatoes  Overall- everything was excellent, medium spice still gave all the entrees a little kick.  I just asked for hot sauce on the side to add to my food since I really like it spicy.  Will definitely be back, next time with my daughter as I know she will really enjoy it!  No butter chicken on the menu but think I'll try the chicken korma next!

rFwSVngFa2NgsIsJcH5aXQ.text: Food is good. Suggestion - make it easy for the customers to order food.. such as have an option to order a basket of breads vs. Ordering them individually.. same thing with starters..

px81PFOOl7lYFI2Ay093qQ.text: Food was Ok.  Probably won't be back.  Nothing special.  Mint Indian bistro is better.

DFgDpYl-mj4Ofu4cBvUUoA.text: Wow! Best Indian food by far! Everything tastes good and fresh! From the main courses to the soups! Its a bit heavy but you MUST order a naan bread when you are there! It complements the meal very well!

vsRVV1awfGfym7c109sgzQ.text: The best indian food in Las Vegas.  Tandoori Grill and Chicken Curry are amazing!  This restaurant is a Gem!

H39VxLTOf03XbGYM5WwZ-g.text: If you are an Indian food lover, the smell when you walk into what surely was once a fast food chain will slap you in the face and get your mouth watering. The menu will only frustrate, as everything looks great. I went with the vindaloo (lamb), an order of naan, and $5 glass of merlot. The merlot was about what you can expect for $5. The naan was a scoach undercooked and bland. The vindaloo was damn-near perfect. The waiter simply asked if I like spicy (no number game), and the dish was the just the right amount to get your tongue tingling, but not overwhelming. Sure the decor maybe flavorless and the staff unprofessional (a busser/assistant in a stocking hat?), but the spices are dead on. I plan many 'o follow-up at the summit of Everest.

2a5hB8bXV4wQtvQGAtCcjA.text: This place was awesome!  Seriously as good as it gets, especially out in middle of nowhere Las Vegas.  Super authentic, great food, and gigantic portions.  Very simple establishment and totally worth it.  You totally get what you pay for at Mount Everest.

f_PJwO5eMR7JcWA25H6NMg.text: I went here seeing 4.5 stars at yelp . This restaurant is not even 1 star . Food is terrible & service is worst. vvjyTnFNsA-gCCYrEnDYWA.text: I ws in Vegas for the weekend, and was craving Indian food, so we decided to go here based on Yelp suggestions. We went for lunch and had the buffet- the food was nice. Decent. Nothing extraordinary but not bad at all... overall decent place. The service is good.

hVhXYxBLSUA0Fyz3oPBvnw.text: I wish they were closer to where I live! The service was alright, we couldn't understand what one of the waiters was saying but he main guy was super nice. We waited for about 30 min for the food to arrive. I had the Lamb Korma and my husband had Lamb Vindoolo and we shared some traditional and Garlin Naan bread with a cup of Chai. The spice was perfect, my husband had the hot and I has medium. Hot enough for him and just a little kick for me..perfect =D I'd come back again in a heart beat.

cRrLhez5K458WR1_Ux0vPg.text: Absolutely amazing food, great service! Better than a lot of the curry houses in town. The place is clean and the staff is friendly. I watched a woman hand dry the dishes after they were washed one by one. It shows they care. Please visit and enjoy!

Since we came in on New Year's Day, he gave the ladies in our party roses, which was so nice! The green chutney was spicy and delicious. Garlic naan was also delicious. Best ones I've ever tasted. I would definitely come back when I'm back in town.

axf_eVWumsXJ6fE3C01pVQ.text: The food here is A-MAZ-ING!!!! I have been craving good Indian food for a long time because the food where I live is horrible but this place exceeded my expectations! I had chicken tikka Marsala with garlic naan and let me tell you if I an unlimited stop I could get it all day and for every meal! I was in heaven! If you are looking for good Indian food do yourself a favor and COME HERE!

qpsvxTKhXUl5K_R47Nx1vw.text: The food is phenomenal . I loved everything I ordered . I had the chicken tiki masala with garlic nom . I would suggest to order that .

NWkwnXCmLSfqIO-u-8lHsQ.text: Best Indian buffet in Vegas hands down. I have been to all of them, and at Mt Everest you cannot beat the selection and the price. My neighbor and I come here about once a week and it is consistently superb. Super friendly staff as well!!! Centrally located, can't beat it!!!!!!

WFV79DgqjG971btHgRPeuQ.text: The lunch buffet special is a great deal. The naan and garlic naan were so soft and tasted amazing. The food was great also. Lots of flavor and spices. Service was good; they were very polite and professional. I ate at around 12pm and was still very full at 9pm HAHA.

mtEZ5lMcTjZDsC90G5cnfg.text: Those who have rated this establishment highly have dead palette. The ambience and service is okay. But food is greasy, tasteless, possibly unhealthy and pricey for the price.

ALRibYMjZv8ocbXfw_ASiw.text: After seeing the great reviews on Yelp, I decided to try out Mount Everest India's Cuisine. I had never tried Indian food before, and wanted to try something new for dinner so I brought along my two buddies for the ride.   Upon arriving, we were greeted with quick and prompt service, which was a very big plus in my book. All the workers there were very kind, and quickly assisted us with whatever we needed. My friends and I wanted to try different things and share, so we ordered a prawn curry, chicken biriyani, garlic naan, and a very very spicy chicken biriyani.  When the food arrived, I felt like I was in heaven! Everything smelled so good and looked so flavorful, I immediately started to dig in.  -The garlic naan was amazing, and felt like it just melted in my mouth. I even ordered another round because it was SO GOOD.  -The prawn curry was the right amount of spicy for me and very delicious. It was big enough for us to split between 3 people. -The chicken biriyani was very flavorful and had tender chunks of chicken mixed inside. It was definitely something I would order again!  My first trip to an Indian restaurant was a good one. I hope to come back sometime soon and try out something new!

vBi9euEHZ-D6vuQeo6zIJA.text: Me and my wife were very hungry and randomly crashed at this place. Glad that we are  lucky this time.  Everything is good here . Food Taste , quantity , pricing and service everything is good .

GTynS6vHcNOlTiCINNr3rw.text: Excellent place in Vegas to get some quality Indian grub. Fantastic food and friendly service. Prakash our host was very accommodating to our culinary needs. Thank you!

OGRl612vxFiowCmB41Cdag.text: I've been here twice. The first time, we were the ONLY PEOPLE dining. The food was great, they were attentive. It was awesome. The second time was so bad that we may never go back! After getting our food, which was pretty good...we waited for 30 minutes AFTER finishing to have someone even acknowledge us. We asked for boxes. 15 minutes later...still no boxes. We stopped someone again and they brought them right away. We also asked for the check. 20 minutes goes by...NOTHING. We sat there for AN HOUR asking 4 different times for the check. Maybe it was stupid on our part for waiting so long...but we could have sworn we were being punk'd. If it weren't for the cheese naan...I'd probably never go back.

JsXBAmsWp3Z-47iTquG89A.text: Great Indian lunch buffet for 10.99 although not a huge selection. It has all the basics

OSWMsarIKBFORG1dk42pOw.text: Great food great service and good ambience, I'm pretty much impressed with this restaurant and please keep it up guys

GZ-xAI-luZqHo4bKXzjyxQ.text: Good buffet. Cooked well, good flavor. No khorma! Super disappointed. And the naan was doughy. Service was great.

VwJKiRX0Spb1C1BKGT-mMQ.text: Excellent food.  Unassuming location.  Got the navoratan korma, vegetarian.  It was excellent.  It came with rice but I didn't know that so I ordered naan.  I'm glad I di though because the naan was excellent. I would return.

4jfsEj30A9Z6qHjbYQvRSw.text: Chicken tikka masala is good.. I wasn't very much impressed with the garlic naan.. They're too thick

Wn_CriTW7WV4J1JsiyTK9w.text: REALLY don't understand all of the 5 star reviews. Not sure if you ate at the same Mt. Everest as I did. Overall, the food was poor from the very dry Samosas to the Chicken Tikka which had an embarrassingly small amount of chicken. Also, a carafe of water on the table would be a great idea considering the dryness of the food.  I  went in with an open mind, but quickly realized this was just not a good restaurant.

tNr6f5UEtKQuHM4ucEtwNg.text: We've been here for dinner several times and tried out the lunch buffet.    If you're going for the lunch buffet, try to plan around traditional lunch times because it gets BUSY and there is about 3 square feet of waiting area directly in front of the door.    That being said, this is our favorite Indian food restaurant so far.  The service is maybe a little slow (even when they are not busy), but the food is worth it.  The hubs sticks to the standard tikka masala, but we've had the Jel Frezi and Vindaloo as well.  Everything was fantastic.    The lunch buffet is a great way to sample a bunch of their foods too.    We'll definitely be going back for more!

Ce4_ekNrmo6dqPNPPHlYtw.text: I have been eating Indian food since the 80's. At that time, in Nor Cal, there were no restaurants that I knew of, that served Indian food. I got my weekly fix at my BFF's house, courtesy of her mom. I drank chai almost daily as an after school treat. Her mom is vegetarian, so I always ate the same thing at her house: some type of dal, rice, yogurt and fresh made roti. Flash forward to today, and that is still pretty much what I eat when I go for Indian.  We have only been to the buffet, so I can only base my review on the lunchtime offerings. I highly suggest that as you are being seated, you ask for garlic naan, if that is what you want. I stress, WHILE you are being seated. They are fast at this location and you will end up with plain naan if you don't speak quickly. They encourage you to start right away and your water will be waiting for you when you bring your first plate to your table. The naan will quickly follow. The samosa is vegetarian, along with a few other dishes. I have only had samosa, dal, rice, tandoori chicken, garlic naan, yogurt mixture and kheer. They are delicious. The only thing I would like to see is plain yogurt. I am not fond of the yogurt mixture, but I eat it because I cannot imagine eating  Indian food without yogurt... naan and/or roti. My man loves this place so much that he does not want to go back to Mint. I think Mint is good, but have had a plate get cold while I waited for my naan. The staff is pleasant and the place is small, but has air conditioning.  Enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qa7GPPMN2az_a1QhWrVlUA.text: You can't probably find a better Indian restaurant than this in LV. Amazing service experience. Although the restaurant was full, it didn't stop the staff from providing great service. Food was excellent. Thank you guys.

rjaVKxb4A1FfWi8AbTt05g.text: Worth the trip off the strip!  The curries here are so good!  My only complaint is that I wish the free naan that they give with the buffet was garlic naan instead of plain :(  But the plain naan was delicious too.  I will be sure to come back during my next trip to vegas!

ip5_hxXQ2HOM7jhFoon9xw.text: Of all the Indian/Nepal buffets I've been to, this is the least salty and greasy. The taste did not suffer in the least. It was, in fact, quite tasty. Not a huge selection, but a come-backer for sure. The staff was very helpful to ensure that I knew the vegan offerings, and brought me began naan bread as well.

htZWcn28D-WdrMN6gFc_nA.text: Shared the Mr. Everest sampler level 7 hot. Thoroughly enjoyed everything but mostly the LENTILS! The service was really good as well didn't have an empty glass all night. Overall a great new experience.

BMAM2XG9OS-UpO_A-3eOww.text: This place is great! We stopped by for a late dinner and was excited to try this place because of all the great reviews. The service is great. The food is delicious. The owner is so friendly. After we were done eating we were going to pass on dessert because of how full we were, but he wanted us to leave after we tried his favorite dessert. He surprised us with a rice pudding dessert that I absolutely loved. I am definitely coming again. Best Indian food I've ever had, hands down.

dLxJTez-r21UkaTOYeAZwg.text: A colleague and I changed our business lunch venue to Mount Everest today - and I'm sooooo glad we did!  I love Indian food - and haven't had any in a while other than the boil-in-a-pouch variety from Trader Joe's so I jumped at the chance to try a place in town I hadn't been to before. Just pulling up and waiting outside the aroma was so enticing - I could tell good things awaited.  Of course, since we were there for lunch - we got the buffet. As someone who primarily eats vegetarian/vegan I was immediately impressed with the number of veggie dishes offered - and I loved the fact that they separated the meat dishes into a different station all together. Everything I loaded up my plate with was delish!  From the basmati rice, dal, veggie korma, samosas and pakoras - everything was outstanding. The service was super kind and prompt too!  I'll be back - with my husband in tow next time!

6dn5DXPfgDgKeB6lcQuZkA.text: Really delicious Indian food at decent prices, I found this place on Yelp and gave it a shot with friends. This place has great service, they were really attentive and friendly. This place has a great atmosphere for going out on a date, family, or close friends. Naan bread was thicker than normal, but very tasty. Worth the drive from Death Valley.

3_SnhFP8l8wlYojKTj8e0w.text: Being spoiled with California's MANY Indian restaurants, I was sad when I came back to Las Vegas to find a VERY limited selection of places to get my Chicken Tikka Masala and Garlic Naan cravings taken care of. I thought the only way to get my fix was to fly back to the Bay to get it, BUT then I came across this place!  I have probably driven passed this place a billion times before I considered to try it and honestly, it wasn't until I saw the awesome ratings from Yelpers before I decided it was a GO. Boy am I happy I did! EVERYTHING on their menu is so flavorful and rich! My boyfriend and I LOooOoOOOove this place. It's inside of what used to be a Burger King in front of the Mariana's Supermarket. The area isn't aesthetically pleasing, but don't you dare judge a book by it's cover! Their service is hospitable, kind of quiet and shy, but hospitable nonetheless.   Their Mango Lasse is amazeballs. Their chai is alright, probably wouldn't order it again though. The Papadams (spelling?) and the little sauces that get served before you order are so dainty and delicious!   If you ever come for their Lunch Buffet, don't plan on eating for the rest of the day, haha! They have an awesome selection and everything is fresh! We're so excited that we found this place. The boyfriend and I were talking about how we don't know why Indian food has such a negative social stigma when it's actually delicious. But I guess we don't really mind. MORE FOR US! :)

tho3qJZIByKVbY9_M5SpZQ.text: We first went there for lunch.  It was okay.  Not really impressed with their buffet.    A year later, our friends invite us for dinner there and what a difference!!  Dinner was delicious.  We had the chicken tikka masala, chicken tikka, tandoori chicken, butter chicken, samosas, sweet naan, regular naan, mango lassi, kingfisher...    Ah so delicious!!  So far the best Indian that we've had in Vegas and very reasonably priced.  The restaurant is in a former Burger King in a mainly Hispanic part of town...but the food and service make up for it.

JLQIKSK8Ds30fiXN8n_dZQ.text: Never ever go for a Thali for dinner here, I have never ate such a worst thali at this expensive price here.... Staff were good in response but the food dint deserve the dollars paid... Especially veg thali is the last option here. Comparatively veg biryani tastes better however its not superlative. Probably i made wrong turn coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veg thali the disaster

DAahPtvAT69eNONXwiMGbw.text: Okay Indian at best. Used to be much better. Chicken on lunch buffet is all overcooked. Very salty. Limited selection. No refill on naan. New tablecloths draped on the floor before set up. Won't be back. Twelve dollars. Even samosas are mediocre. New chef? Very disappointed.

F7JkERmLTXmVWyfGhePcgQ.text: If you're looking to impress a date, this is not the place. Ambience is a little lack luster, aka. A hole in the wall. Having said that: the food on the buffet was great. And at $11 quite the bargain  .

_hfMH-SKR6ORwDQdlHHLwA.text: Can not say enough good things about this restaurant.  Most other Indian restaurants charge $5 for basmati rice with your entree.  So chincy.  Mt. Everest gives you rice with the meal.  That easily makes it the best value in town.  Add to that the fact that they serve the best tasting Indian food in Vegas and this place is a no brainer.  On several occasions I've brought Vegan friends here.  They're always super accommodating, even bringing naan specially made with no ghee.  Mt. Everest rules!

5eOdRvu3XG0iv4pjTHvVGw.text: I recently visited this place for lunch. They had buffet with large variety of dishes - both vegetarian and non-vegetarian. For 11 bucks, it was value for money. I tried their vegetarian dishes and loved all of them. Kadhi pakoda was delicious as well as potato zucchini. Their dal tadka was ultimate. For an Indian like me, I thought their spice level was medium, not too mild like in other restaurants. They serve Naan on the table, which was hot and soft. Dal makhani could have been better.  The restaurant was also clean and we were served well. I would definitely go once again.

PXtdIQUvVx55HPkPvRoe0A.text: We've been going to Mount Everest for yeeearrrrs! The food an service has always been excellent. Prekash (owner) is typically there to great us and always makes sure that everything is service hot, fresh and quickly. Lamb vindaloo and chile pakoras are our favorites but be prepared for the spice! If you a more of a sweet tooth I'd recommend the kulfi ice cream or mago lassi.

gcjW06b9XjaKUnzQHEI8gQ.text: The best Indian restaurant in town. Food is always fresh, authentic and of course, delicious. Service is impeccable. Dining environment is clean and pleasant, great for friends/family/company gathering. Highly recommended:)

L8rwuZ1N-YC-YlhAO4t-SA.text: Love this place. Always great service and you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

WfpVxkpLltDiJxPbtyrb1g.text: This review is a bit delayed as I visited in January 2013.  We took a cab here from the strip, which wasn't a very long drive at all.  When we pulled up, it looked a little shady.  But some of the best places are holes in the wall, though, right?  When we went inside, it was nice and clean.  White table clothes on the tables and we were seated immediately by a nice man who turned out to be the owner.  The menu has plenty of selection and it was hard just settling on one thing for myself.  I had two other people with me and we ordered the garlic naan, chicken biryani, chicken tikka masala, and lamb curry.  I also wanted shrimp curry, but I thought it best to not let my eyes exceed my stomach.  Our food arrived quick enough and the portions were huge.  We all shared what everyone ordered, as that is how it arrives...typical of Indian cuisine establishments that I've been to.  The garlic naan was excellent and so was everything else.  We ordered the mild spice level on everything, mostly because of my wife.  I could have handled it a bit hotter, but I'm okay with mild.  Everything was excellent.  The chicken tikka masala was the biggest winner of the night and the best I've had anywhere.  It was seasoned perfectly.  The biryani was amazing, too, and I've only had better in one other place (Amber India in San Francisco).  When we were all stuffed, we still had leftovers.  Our drinks were always kept full and the staff and owner were very nice.  The owner offered us dessert but we were simply too full to eat any more.  He insisted and gave us some besan ladoo (I think that's what it's called) on the house!  They were very good.  We were impressed and appreciated the gratitude he showed us.  I'm in Vegas about twice a year or so and this will DEFINITELY be a place I come back to every time I'm in town.

mPF6bv0uu2lwzNf3HZbelg.text: Excellent food and service!  Everyone's meal was delicious whether it was made super mild or extra spicy.  Super nice staff, they even gave us free dessert.  Price was also very reasonable.  This is a hidden gem.

WYO19jbO8IP5mlpj-DXGvQ.text: TOo hyped-up.   Service was slow, food was not super hot, at a level 5, I couldn't taste any spicy-ness ... vegetable khorma was good...tikka massala could've been better  I do have to say that the Garlic Naan and the raita were amazing   I miss LA Indian food :(

rlFlh0DIMazW4wGsucZzZQ.text: ...continuation  Everything is made fresh and the flavored are a thing of beauty. The complexities of Indian spices are exactly what you imagine they should be.   The owner, Praichash, came to the table to make sure all was as it should be.   As a bonus, we were presented with Gulab Jamun after our meal. This was, to put it simply, superb. Delicate flavors of pistachio and cardamom balanced with creamy rice. Fantastic.

AqGPdMshU8eYDFA33rOoRQ.text: It is very rare that I change my first impression, but that was the case here with this one.  My first visit to Mount Everest was not a good one.  I didn't think there naan was good, didn't try the sweet rice, and the samosas were overcooked.    Well, wow.  I have been back like, 7 times in the past month since that initial visit.  It is by far my favorite Indian lunch buffet place.  I had 3 in the running but Mt Everest is on top.  First, the price.  I believe it is 10.99... not bad.  Second, the choices.  It has the most choices I've seen!  What could make this place better?  If their labels were more specific.  I love the way some buffets put "vegetarian"; as a 75% vegetarian I like a quick reference guide to vegetarian options.  But... with my minor knowledge of Indian food I know what most of their dishes are.  If it were my first exposure to Indian food, however, I would be S.O.L!  Also another thing they could make better.  Their naan.  I don't like their naan.  I like buttery, garlicy soft guusy naan.  This is not my favorite place for naan (Saffron is).  If you like medium-textured, little buttered, barely garlic-ed naan then you would like it.  Other than that, it's so good!   Their choices are amazing.  Final thing (this is the Nutrition student in me):  They are so sanitary!  One of the only Indian buffets I've seen with in-place "sneeze guards" on their buffet.  Their buffet is actually buffet style so it has the coverings.  Furthermore, their bathroom has a sanitary spray above the handle.  How great!  So even if nasties don't wash their hands, I won't get their germs from when they open the bathroom door open.  Foodborne illness is no joke, yo.  P.S. Try the sweet rice!    P.S.S. The Bollywood they play on TV is a great compliment to the atmosphere.

T1cxjH5psxDmfDT4luebNw.text: I've been here a few times during my vegas visits for the lunch buffet.  The rice, spinach, and chicken.  The chicken curry is aromatic.  The naan has a buttery taste and and the oranges are sweet and juicy.  We always make sure to include Mount Everest in our vegas stays.  Definitely check this place out.  Looks ghetto and is in a ghetto part of vegas (lots of bums hang out at the adjacent gas station) but the food is worth the short drive from the strip.

49NNaOZTumQI_gDi0oj9XQ.text: With the amount of people in the restaurant I would have expected the food to be amazing.  It was nice change to have samosas at a lunch buffet.  Unfortunately all of the chicken dishes I ate had been overcooked.  The service was great and they were very quick at turning the tables over for the next round of customers.  Probably won't be back.

KQ8B5Hq6F0NPZPRgnT0P9Q.text: Had a craving for Indian food and Mount Everest was recommended by my cab driver. Started off with a chicken tikka plate that came out looking great because it was sizzling but after a closer inspection, i noticed it was doused in red color dye and no marination or flavor. I then had some butter chicken which had too much spice and not enough flavor. I did enjoy the naan bread however which was fluffy and soft. Needless to say- i did not take the leftovers.

e2Bpo0wxcgbtDNBvacC3Fw.text: Fantastic food and great service.  The staff is attentive but does not hover.  Large portions served spicy hot or mild. Reasonable prices. Try the Taj Mahal beer.

EIZmhqx2MkmmIgM-N1pB_g.text: This is the place for a great Indian lunch buffet!  There were a lot of excellent vegetarian options, chicken and really good fresh garlic nan.  Also a very friendly host who took good care of us. I'll look forward to lunch here again.

A3SJFFJyHcwlXmCHVhjhBQ.text: One of the best Indian buffets in Vegas for a great price $10.99. The curries are amazing and tasty. Spices were phenomenal. From the outside appearance it looks like a "hole in the wall" but the interior was clean and pleasant. Near strip, I highly recommend Mt. Everest. We would go there more often f we lived closer.

WFHbxMwS0TO15VbSZ629kQ.text: Wow. I like indian food, but I am very picky with it and only have made a few dishes at home which I like. My sister and I walked over here while I was getting my windows tinted a few weeks ago and man was I impressed. Very much so!!  I have never been a fan of lamb, but their lamb curry was to die for. Everything I put on my plate was absolutely phenomenal, and the sweet rice...oh the sweet rice!! I would live on that stuff forever. The service was fantastic, and they were very concerned that we enjoyed everything. The naan was fresh and delicious...I ate two plates full until I was ready to burst. I have decided I love Indian food, and am so happy because I was always thinking I wasn't so big on it.  I cannot recommend this place enough, absolutely DELICIOUS!!

sGZHlfI7FXMcfKazTVi3oA.text: We live in NYC. But the FIRST place we come to for great  Indian cuisine, when we are in Las Vegas, is Mt Everest. We LOVE their food. Seasoned to perfection and generous portions. Their lunch buffet is all you can eat for a reasonable price and such variety! The service is very friendly and attentive. We have tried other Indian restaurants in Vegas. This is our absolute fave hands down. Mt Everest, please move to NYC!!!!

tnUherexqEVqarIJ2vIxdg.text: Stopped by this unassuming little Indian joint before going to a show a while ago and I found it to be a great find. The restaurant is actually an old Burger King, but the decor inside hides its tragic past.   The food was well made and came out quickly. The service was great; the waiter was attentive but never hovered. He even made sure my table knew we ordered both vegetarian and meaty dishes so as to avoid confusion.   I would recommend this place and happily go back again.

caRUUFPjsDtHxCNCQofVnw.text: This is definitely one of the best Indian restaurants in town!  The garlic naan is on point!

Kiib0IFW0At0Lpxxr_ZbHQ.text: Today was my second visit to this restaurant. and like my last visit , I was thoroughly impressed.  The cost of the all you can eat buffet is $8.99 and it's worth every penny.  I'd be willing to be a couple of dollars more, it would still be an excellent deal. The decor is nice, nothing special, but it's white table cloth and clean.  The service and attention that your given is excellent. The food is absolutely fabulouso.  The lamb will melt in your mouth, the curried dishes are absolutely delicious and there is a great deal of variety so if your a vegetarian you'll be very happy.  The food is hot and very fresh and Naan bread was quite tasty.  I'll be going back to this restaurant again and again.

Xc-6gD2EpKxVbi99q0hWOQ.text: Ok folks, I'm not an employee nor was I compensated for this review. This was my first time here and this place is absolutely going on my return visit list.  OMG, this place is amaze-balls! If you're lookin for some down home Indian cuisine, this IS the place. The food wasn't too spicey but you can talk to a server and have em dial it up, I'm sure.  For the price and quality, you cannot beat this place!

wBeLVZ1AniVbFR4eKMOYQw.text: I have tried several Indian restaurants in town and Mount Everest is by far my favorite. The food is great the prices are reasonable, and the service is fast! For dinner the Chicken Tikki Masala is amazing, and if you're looking for a good fast lunch their lunch buffet can't be beat.

985WHOyFf5J7y27trHw22w.text: YUM!   The first time we came to Mount Everest was a year ago when we were in Vegas.  It was so good that when we came back to Vegas this year, we put it on our list of things to do.  I'm still trying to find an Indian place in AZ that's as good as this one.   If you're a fan of chicken tikka masala, you have to try it at Mount Everest.  It's the BEST that I have ever tasted, and I'm just sad that I have to come all the way to Las Vegas to get it.  It was even better than I remembered and I ate way too much just because it tasted so good I didn't want to stop eating it.  The garlic naan is also delicious.  The service is friendly and attentive, and the location cozy (in a good way).  I wish I could buy the food in bulk and ship it to AZ!    We'll be back, for sure.  If you're in the Vegas area looking for great Indian food, this is the place to be!

gFvFKBrX11elb4Sww3c-pw.text: We visited this place for lunch buffet based on reviews from Yelp after a long tiring road trip (Yeah we were very very hungry). Too overrated. We didnt find anything special. Everything was just mediocre. They didnt have many choices. I would not go go again.

c_J-9-HHvkzRlonWmXIwJg.text: I was practically raised on Indian food, and this is the best Ive ever had in a restaurant. I have went there during the buffet and for dinner ordering off the menu several times and you can't go wrong either way. The workers are all very nice and I get great service every time. This place never disappoints and is just as delicious as the last time I went there.

iXMAmVrnaNsBvyoR_bXV8g.text: The best indian food in vegas without a doubt.  The service is superb!  Love the naan and chicken makhani!

8WeEAkuWmmNkufAoDXmXig.text: Very friendly staff, fast service, excellent food! The chicken korma is the best I have ever had! I will definitely go back to Mt. Everest when I'm craving Indian cuisine.

3MohKVeS3uJ1PIL5M6thdQ.text: This was a really great place to go with my bestie!  We love to try lots of things and at the lunch buffet price who could argue!  It is a small place and I wondered how come there wasn't a line to eat this yumminess!  We went around 1pm to miss the lunch rush...I think we did right :)  Can't wait to go back

gY01YaxafcwYykzHTXTbbw.text: Came for dinner and had both the garlic naan and the cheese naan. Both were amazing and moist. Fresh out of the oven. Had also Chicken Makhani and Chicken vindaloo. The Chicken Makhani was sweet to the taste and saucy. The Chicken Vindaloo was mild but just the right kind of spicy kick for me. Both sauce is great for dipping the naan. I highly recommend this restaurant!

2KmzFXytGRpsbFTc1Hsa7g.text: I've been coming here for a while now. Delicious food, and friendly staff. I love the fact that they do not charge you extra for the rice like all other Indian places, which actually makes this place a lot more affordable if your on a budget.   If you have any special requests or concerns Pracash is the man to talk to.  Also be sure to check out their lunch buffet, they have a goat curry which is very tender. $10.99 (11AM-3PM)

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yammy!

ikA0loo-oPJlxXNm4detqQ.text: wondering who has been posting five stars for this place, nice people but just average food on the buffet--hard to discern the spices as most items were too hot for my taste.

dEjU3LiCls5tWBYaCwvl4g.text: This is my favorite Indian food place in all of Las Vegas. Their lunch buffet is amazing and their dinner is just as good! My favorite is the Palak Paneer. The service is amazing, and I've never had a bad experience.

D7u98Kovydfs4MlkEO1eeg.text: Went to this place after reading rave reviews on yelp. Was there for lunch buffet, their menu (vegetarian dishes) was so disappointing. Their gravies lacked flavor. The two stars are only for their bread (garlic naan) it was so soft and fresh.  PS: if you are there to try their veg dishes be prepped to get disappointed!

Y7bifPSRiR6tDXWQ_rQh8Q.text: I used to dislike ethnic cuisines. Thats when i was stupid. Now that i have more food experience indian food is one of my new faves.    Love love love. This place is amazing. I'm completely addicted to their garlic naan and braised goat. Just delish. I never liked Indian food before and this place changed my mind completely.   You must try everything here. The spices and sauces are perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy goat stew, chicken in tomato and naan with tamarind sauce.

9WRL9lEPMaCjoOyG9XRxWA.text: 1st time eating Indian food. I love spicy. So we chose their 2 of their appetizers (veg. Samosas) not that great. Tastes like it was frozen and thrown to fry. The other is chicken dumpling (forgot the name) which was delicious!!!!!!! Their sauce that came with it was also amazing Lamb curry and chicken curry as entree  and I loved the lamb (not much a chicken with fatty person) very yummy sauce.  Desserts. Never ever loved another dessert from diff ethnicity. Pistachio ice cream is sick! Insane taste. And rice pudding delicious.  Wow wow wow.  The only thing I didn't understand is why waiters don't dress the same so you know who is waiter and who isn't.  2nd- the 2nd appetizer came out after 30 min. Maybe it's because the place was busy.  It's my first time trying Indian food and only 2 out of 3 people knew how to explain each order  In other words the food was amazing. The desserts were even better!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow yes. Lamb curry and chicken curry
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh my god

l14WMR-XJQMR2LMjxlV66Q.text: I have to say I was VERY nervous when I drove up...it looks like a dump, but when you got inside the smells were amazing! The buffet had some food I had never seen at an Indian buffet before and it was ALL delicious . I will be back the next time I am in Vegas, which is this weekend! Can't wait

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The buffet food! It was so good! Keep it up Mt. Everest!

0dnhNsEPQvjqsvFfwp-wCA.text: I have been looking for a good Indian food restaurant since I moved here from Portland a few years ago. A friend at work invited me to join her and her husband at Mt Everest. Everything I ate was fantastic and I've been back three times in the last month. Even their lunch buffet is great. I'm usually nervous about buffets but this is top notch! I love a good "off the strip", hole in the wall and this is a great one.

TMXdYRTr9a4cIxH8FbL-eQ.text: The chicken was amazing. Everything was pretty good. They bring out fresh bread for you. The service is great there. You can't beat this spot in Vegas for Indian Food.

Sbe13yrfOknT3VZAHXZXRw.text: Really good and delicious food! Garlic naan is one of the best I have had, and the food portion is also very good! The spice level can be adjusted as it was light for our Indian tastebud! But overall gem of a restaurant! Will be back here again when in Vegas!

H8tzfxvmdJg29w4cJU_ZLA.text: This place is GREAT ! Good value, nice people, and delicious comfort food. We just discovered this restaurant , and we've already been twice .

fH1-eKkR9jVVjRVvyo7SaQ.text: Really good ! I got the Lamb tikka masala and the garlic naan. So good! I also ordered their curry. One thing is get your spice low because it's spicy! I got medium and it was just hot enough!

VqfbH6heAHT5r1hzmcnK5w.text: The staff is exceptional. I don't think my water glass was empty once, and whenever I asked for more of something, it was on the table within minutes. A man who was either the owner or manager personally asked us how everything was, and even gave us free desserts after dinner.   Overall, the food was great. The garlic chile naan was fantastic, toasty, fluffy and flavorful. The rice was cooked perfectly. The lamb vindaloo was phenomenal. The chicken tikka masala tasted a little different than I'm used to, but was still yummy.   The only thing I was dissatisfied with was the aloo tikki. Typically, this is my favorite appetizer and I order it every single time I go to an indian place. Their aloo tikki was dry, hard, and lacking in flavor.   I will be returning to try the lunch buffet.

HJl9ec4LxsYqyeahDU5KPQ.text: Really good Indian food, excellent service, and at a very reasonable price. I've eaten at this restaurant twice and I was impressed on both visits with the delicious food and the warm and welcoming staff. The restaurant is family owned and operated and they truly take pride in their product and service. It is hard to pick a favorite dish, but 3 of my favorites were the lamb vindoolo, the vegetable samosa, and Tandoori chicken. I think I've found a new favorite go to restaurant.

u7kksuGvIQDdtmfE9S57HA.text: There are 3 foods I can live off. A full British breakfast. Chicken wings from Rock'N'oodles yelp.com/biz/rocknoodles... Chicken Tikka Masala When it comes to the first two, well sadly the only place to get a full British now is the Crown and Anchor, who do an okay job on one, but not great, the chicken wings from Rock'N'oodle, well yeah I go to Rock'N'oodle, they are sublime and well worth driving downtown for. The Chicken Tikka Masala, it's Mount Everest every time. I've been coming here since the place pretty much opened, great food from day one, there were times when I thought the place wouldn't make it, but thanks to Yelp, word of mouth and the great food they serve I was happy to walk in last night and see the place packed, yep, Wednesday night and the place is doing good business. The food is fantastic, more Northern Indian than some are used to,but all the favorites are there. If you're in the mood for an Indian, or want to try it for the first time, this is the place.

mFmg8-K325NR5NEUS0azSw.text: This place is great. Love to stop here for lunch buffet as I am leaving Vegas. Good food good price

ueeJxAJQzOyeX4UNeubhXA.text: OMG what a hidden gem in Vegas! Hubby and I have already visited this place the last 3 times we came to vegas. The food and service are amazing! Be prepared to see some customers eating w/their hands lol. The servers are quick to take away plates when your done cuz this is a all you can eat buffet! Make sure to wear loose clothing cuz your going to be uncomfortable if you wear skinny jeans or a dress haha!

6mzVOX_SONPopRvM0JlUwQ.text: So yummy! Very satisfying and the staff is very attentive! Love how they have different dishes for lunch every time! Always a pleasure going back here!

Gqvp8EtEM0zQJ1Dt293Fmg.text: They have the best curry and Tandori chicken. A very cozy dining area with extremely friendly staff. I am kind of a regular. Once I arrived to pick up my take out and forgot my wallet. Porcash was kind and trusting enough to let me take my food and pay him later. I returned and paid him that same evening. He wanted me to enjoy my delicious meal while it was still warm. How often does that happen in Vegas. They also have a bountiful and clean lunch buffet. I used to go to India Palace. This place has tastier food and a much better ambiance. Go and take your friends

Y2cDDiUJ8LN4Ogo8KCMjiw.text: Good Indian buffet. Not every dish are good in the spread. To mention few - Naan, chicken butter masala, jamun, sweet rice, small samosas. The bad is  chilly chicken (too much oil), goat curry (not much flavor and its hard). I suggest this for good north Indian style food and its definitely  worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Z_ptQx3_qS1PGjen3AWMxA.text: This place might have the best Indian food West of Mumbai but I'll never know it. I went there on a Saturday around 11:00am in order to get in on the Buffet and I found the building was located in bum central. There must have been a dozen homeless vagrants, bums and gangbangers hanging out in the vicinity, I wasn't about to risk having my car broken into or being hassled for spare change. One star for the location, I have no idea about the food.

Y1cLoBQyfe9CCKHGQlLU8A.text: I had lunch here, and it was BOMB.COM! if you like legit Indian food you have to make a stop here, the keep the naan coming and every dish in the buffet line is piping hot. Everything I ate was traditional sometimes they serve a goat dish and lamb. You will definitely get food coma when you leave here and who cares if you smell like curry when  you come out! at least you know your full to the brim and satisfied.

lOrpgmRZ_1AWCZ0JwH6olQ.text: I don't know why it's taken me over 2yrs to review this place!!!  Simple put... It is THE BEST INDIAN FOOD I have ever had!  1. The food is just so flavorful, Hot, Abundant, and authentic! (50% or more of the place is full of Indian people eating here... So it must be authentic...right?!)  2. They are on top of filling your water!   3. It's only 10.99 for all you can eat! ALL YOU CAN EAT!!! Come ON!  The owner always recognizes me and I probably come once a month. Some times 2x a week. Or have a dry spell of 3months. It just hits the spot, when you need to get in some great good that is unlike anything else.   Love this place!
