Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kytmXXaM-gPZHN153dKDbw.text: Best Indian Food in the Las Vegas Area, It was really authentic North Indian food I ate after long time... Service was Awesome and nice receiving One of the Best Buffets I had in recent times.... I have to say it Samosa was like the same I used to eat in India nice settled flavor in it... Good job guys keep it up and we will be back again when we are in Vegas...

33cGL0RV1qF2Wf1_JPrfwg.text: This is THE best Indian food in Las Vegas and the best service. We come at least twice a week now and for us it's a thirty minute drive. It's worth it! It's family owned and we feel like family being there. Today we were brought complimentary desert (carrot and rice pudding) that we would of never ordered on our own. It was outstanding!!! We always get their options of vegetarian curries and the fried rice and garlic naan. The fried rice is ridiculously good with fresh peas, sweet onions, cashews, and raisons. We highly recommend this hidden gem and wish we could give them much more credit than a yelp review because it's always such an amazing dinner and experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best desert! Carrot pudding that they marinate for days! With rice pudding!

OmQqc0txRqxJ8VXv4Bo39w.text: THIS RESTAURANT IS AMAZING! Get the cheese naan to dip in the chicken makhani, you won't regret it! Truly a heavenly little corner of India right here in Vegas. Also, the owner is incredibly kind and attentive. You can tell he cares about not only the deliciousness of the food, but his patrons, as well. So sweet. And speaking of sweet, don't skip dessert. The kheer and gulab jamun pair perfectly together. Absolutely one of the best desserts I've ever had in my life. I won't climb Mount Everest, but this Mount Everest I couldn't get enough of! Looking forward to going many more times with family and friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kheer and Gulab Jamun. Absolutely divine.

YUHdTmxaBymWH12ZRyI4zQ.text: I wasn't expecting much because from the outside it's a converted former fast food building.  But inside is indian cuisine at it's finest.  A lunch buffet every day!  Attentive friendly service and a very nice selection on the buffet.  Prices are reasonable.  Mango lassi is a must.

0_EW6qOJbWYz1kzG825ajQ.text: Very good. We left stuffed. We try to expose our kids to all kinds of different foods. Indian food was a great separation from our norm. The staff was very attentive and made sure our daughters allergy restrictions were taken care of. We will be back.

kAxbRaUGEs0PowVQQpb_LA.text: The last few times I've come here the food hasn't been the best. Yesterday I ended up getting food poisoning from here. I won't be coming back here again. Both my friend and I are laying in bed and we have final exams this week. Worst timing! I do not recommend this place anymore.

sRBMAefegAIaXwwdo9Aiyw.text: Buffet Indian Restaurant on W Sahara. Nice foods and good for lunch here. About service is soso. But if you like Indian food you should try here.

HMSeqSugOJWidXVsbMLeJQ.text: Turned vegetarian for life after eating non veg here. Non veg is terrible. vegetarian curries were good. The place itself is average, service is ok. Malai kofta was great. Tandoori mix appetizer was a disaster so was anything non veg, I think the meat itself was years old or cooking style isn't right. 4 stars for vegetarian food. 3 for the place and service service.

jlJaDRCA_Wv-M9-I_XGztQ.text: It was really the best indian food i've had in vegas so far among the indian buffets i've tried, they have the most options and meats available.

cseG72vIVBHRD6N2wtoHUw.text: I love the food there it's fresh and nice but not the best! I've had a lot of Indian food before so this one for me is like 7 out of 10.

OsUbcbgMICfEC3QMeoloTg.text: Felt like Indian food today, so I decided to check this place out.  Pros-buffet at a good price, flavorful food, good Indian music, nice dim lighting.  Great experience all around. 5 stars.   Cons-none

vgBRMwEKlkptKyjtIkoKlw.text: Everybody who comes to Vegas must visit this place. Don't go by outside looks. We went for Dinner and everybody loved each item we ordered.  Very friendly family oriented staff My family said they can eat this food everyday.

6SgJs76Ezwg-bLHWbgu5fg.text: Although the outside of the building and the decor and Ambience art exactly upscale or even cozy for that matter. They could do something about their ambiance.  However I have to say the food was fabulous . Also the service was top-rate the prices were very good for the quality of food we had. We had the saag paneer  a combination plate,  naan  , salad  a bottle of wine. We tried the desserts and they were amazing. I wrote down the name of the desert but now I can't find it but the were little balls that had honey over them. We will definitely go back again to try some other dishes.

d6kx8CnglKxVNMuhnrr2_w.text: I'm surprised that I haven't been to this place sooner. The staff was super nice and made sure that I was satisfied with my meal from spice to side dishes. I went to both lunch buffet and dinner so I could just write a single review. I recommend going to dinner and ordering everything separately because I felt the food was extremely filling and although the it's only $11, you could only eat so little (1-2 plates). To me, it seemed like the dinner also had a little better quality but everything was still really good. If it's your first time, I recommend going to a dinner first to get a meal that you are expecting and want. I don't recommend the lunch buffet for the first time because the food will not be as fresh or made with quality and that may ruin your view on the restaurant. Hope you guys are apply to enjoy this restaurant as I did.

HE5Xk0kqOK4bYSZWgGF0sA.text: After a very long night Saturday night, my fella and I woke up around 11:30 absolutely STARVING.   We got up, got ready, and ventured out, neither of us really knowing what we wanted to eat. Our first choice was closed on Sundays (boo), so as we were driving back towards the house, I pulled up my trusty Yelp app, and did a search for nearby restaurants.   Mount Everest was the first one that popped up, and with such a high rating, we decided that since we hadn't had Indian food in a long time, we would give it a go!  We walked in, and were smacked in the face with the most delicious aroma!  It smelled like all the beautiful spices I miss from my Indian friends cooking for me back home in Chicago.   We were greeted and shown to a table, and told that we could go ahead and start on the buffet whenever we were ready.  For $10.99 per person, I thought that the buffet was nice.    Lots of choices!   First round, I tried almost everything...I was a little stand-offish about the goat curry.  I've never had goat before and was nervous, but I did try it second round.   My favorites:  Daal (lentil soup):  really spicy and full of flavor.  Its good on its own or over the basmati rice.  Chicken Tikka Masala.  Uh.  YUM.  Tender chicken in a rich and creamy sauce...mmm. Vegetable Samosas:  Delightful.  Lightly spiced, and delicious.  I went back for thirds of these, and they are really nice with the mint chutney. Naan:  I had hoped for the garlic Naan, but alas, we only got the regular.  That's ok.  It was AMAZING.  My fella's favorite of the day was the naan dipped in the tikka masala sauce.  SO delightful!  I liked the Aloo Baingan (eggplant and potato), but it was just a tiny bit too spicy for me. I found the goat curry very thin/greasy looking in the sauce, and it was honestly hard to get a couple pieces of meat, as there were so many bones.  It was a little fatty for me, but the flavor and cook was good.  I would be willing to try it again.    The tandoori chicken was just kind of "meh" for me.  My fella loved it.  I'm not usually a big fan of chicken on the bone though, so I know that had something to do with it.  Service was polite and quick.  Our water glasses were never empty, and we received our naan in a timely manner.  I loved the Bollywood music and videos playing too.    All in all, this was a good experience for me.  It wasn't mind blowing, but I found the food very tasty.  I would definitely return, and recommend it to anyone looking for good Indian Food.

WBULGiKrFEHGRH0KDm4tmw.text: My son and I were driving around running errands and saw Mount Everest India's Cuisine, we decided to stop.  I ordered the Aloo palak and butter nan. My so had the chicken tikka masala with rice.  Absolutely fabulous.  The best in Las Vegas without question. And Prakash, the owner, is gracious and a lovely man.  I highly recommend this restaurant

C1lopYapsZQBT_ECPY2rPA.text: Came here for ela carte. They said they only have buffet. I usually dont go for buffets but dragged myself to it. The buffet food was horrible. It was unbelievable how all dishes were bad. My gf didnt even eat much. 30$ wasted.

5BpGn-iuFi9JFSa9ByTxdQ.text: Food with flavors. Just wonderfull. They never let my water glass get lower than half. The best!

lmKvzvtEhLVSUP6vt6fYcg.text: The food was okay.   I had malai kofta and it was too sweet and kofta was hard.  The waiter asked how was the food and I told him exactly how it was.   Next time I may try different dish.  The place was busy, assuming the food must be good but that's not the case.  I guess it depends what you order.

yLwTnMH5_m8PQWypVLEKxg.text: The best in the city, I come from the UK and we think we know curry! I will just say I am in Vegas at least once a year and Mt Everest is one of my first stops...

TU46a5VnImCww1D6q6Csbg.text: Best indian food in vegas. We always go here and this food is delicious and authentic

wbkUMWXQJXHnuafE3XQIdw.text: My family and I visited LV in end March. We had a craving for good Indian food but could not find anything fair and decent on the Strip. We ventured out a bit and landed at Mt. Everest. The decor was good and inviting and we ordered about 6 items. Given that I travel quite a bit, I have tried a lot of Indian food in several cities. The food here was OUTSTANDING and I can say with good confidence that this was one of the best Indian food I have had in the US. The chicken was nice and succulent and the gravy had just the right mix of spices. The naan was perfect and the vegetarian dishes were excellent. I will surely come back here on my next visit to LV.

CekWzrFNJX-piB8QWSXJlA.text: Not an expert on Indian cuisine but I love this place. Very tasty food.  The waiter (owner?) has always been very kind and has dishes prepared as I like them...   I never see any crowds here and never have seen more than a few tables with people at them, I don't know why and its a shame.    But thumbs-up from me.  I really hope it stays in business.  I've visited other local Indian places, this one is by far my favorite so far.  Really good quality Indian dishes, especially spicy ones, can be hard to find and they go downhill really fast if not prepared with care.

AMz-x9ppwDGmI7oDeImSzg.text: Good food. Service was quick. Being Indian I look for a place with good flavor not here for the atmosphere but food is pretty great!

AMeb-w1Smim4hZFg1JtpTA.text: I went here about a month ago with my bf. The service was absolutely wonderful!! I haven't had Indian food in years but I am definitely going to be a new regular here. The environment is cozy, food was DIVINE, cost was cheap!! Don't hesitate - hit this place up, it's pretty awesome.

VazMV1s9e2k43QTDzGZEXA.text: We have been coming here for a while now. The service is always wonderful along with all of their delicious food choices. My favorite being the Palak Paneer, they always have great consistency. If we could we would give them 10 Stars! Prakash is also always very delightful and always makes a great effort to greet and accommodate his guests. Overall a fantastic restaurant.

E7tMBCn7jLowW-owPHTUKw.text: Had the buffet and it was among the best indian buffets I've ever had (and I try to test them all out)    The service was a bit strained, because there was only one person doing everything.  Being a buffet, that didn't really matter too much, but a little more attentiveness would have been nice.  I saw a review about it being too cold, but when we went, it was super hot and humid in the restaurant... so much that we wanted to hurry and get out.  If it is like that every time, it will definitely put me off of going in the future  Edit:  I've been back for the buffet probably 7-10 times since this initial review and things have been great ever since.  I'm upgrading to 5 stars.  I loooove this place!

fZ5d0wlHgkVuhKOG596mSQ.text: good solid indian food. The lunch buffet is an amazing deal. The food is always made to order.  Dinner and take out is always great. Would recommend this restaurant to any one craving indian food.

kLTPK57wN0Vf-pgOfKPu1g.text: I love the owner, Prakash, who is friendly and takes real pride in his restaurant. The food is great. I can't believe the okra; so good and flavorful without the slimy  texture okra normally has. The chicken tika masala is the perfect mix of buttery goodness with spice.

KgcKoYiZdwFJ158Gx3UJyQ.text: Wow!  The first sign that Mt. Everest was going to be a good restaurant was the complex scent of spices that hit our noses.  The next sign was that it was crowded...and most of the customers were Indian.  We had chicken curry and kauli aloo and found them to be fragrant, tasty, and freshly prepared.  The garlic naan was great.  The staff was friendly and prompt. The prices were more than reasonable.

avzBkV0k-hL1fTwIDKcPzA.text: Solid lunch buffet (lunch buffets seem to be a standard of Indian Restaurants).  I even prefer the lunch buffet to the preparation of the A La Carte menu for dinner service - I found the food quality at the lunch buffet to be a bit better strangely enough, and the sauces to be of a better quality in that format.  Definitely try to Gulab Jamun and the Chicken Tikka Masala.

_rPi5YeYQxSOVd2B1rg_FQ.text: Not the best area in town, but pretty good Indian buffet.  Good mix of standard curries, plain naan.  Was pretty full for a late weekend lunch.  Could have used a little more background music.

RLXljF2K3R4QVJyoCWRIUg.text: Busy place with many multi-generation Indian families enjoying a night out.  Not very big but we were seated within 5 minutes of getting there on a Saturday night with no reservations.  The mango and yogurt drink was refreshing.  It was reasonably priced and everything was wonderful.  The servers and I'm guessing the owner paid great attention to us and the other diners.  Will come again!

ZCzcUy2C6APfmhimFWYJXw.text: Good quality, tasty Indian food. Best Indian food in Las Vegas west of the Strip. Several vegetarian entrees.

iZ0h1bIj7hOvYxEpW4dx6Q.text: This is an extremely good Indian restaurant. The chefs certainly know their way around a spice rack. My favorite dish so far is the vegetable korma. I'd suggest ordering a side of garlic naan with your meal, since it's hands-down the best naan in town!  I highly recommend this restaurant.

_qcluANWSFOf3fclZeHOPA.text: Our New Favorite Indian Restaurant in Las Vegas.  We are SO glad we read the positive reviews.  While we can't comment on the buffet, we can say that dinner there was superb.  We started with the complementary papadum.  The mint sauce it came with was thick and spicier than we're used to, which we preferred, and the tamarind was just right.  For an appetizer, we ordered the keema samosas, which are filled with ground lamb, peas and spices.  They were so flavorful.  The shell was crispy, and wasn't covered in salt like we've had at other places, and they were as filled as they could have been.  We ordered 3 plates, which was enough for the two of us to take half home for the next day.  The sauce on the chicken tikka was better than we had in restaurants in London's Brick Lane.  We ordered it at spiciness level 6, and were pleased that it wasn't as diluted with cream as we've had elsewhere.  The lamb vindaloo (level 7) was great.  The lamb was lean, and there was plenty of it.  Nice to find lamb with potatoes, instead of potatoes with lamb.  Sometimes, all we taste is the heat and salt, but this vindaloo was layered with flavors.  Our third plate was baingan bharta.  It was delicious, with complex subtle flavors.  We enjoyed mango lassi with our meal (and took home 2 to have the next day with our left-overs).  They were so thick that our glasses were filled to the brim and the waiter didn't spill a drop.  The service was very attentive, friendly, and professional, without being overwhelming.  We loved that they were playing Indian music - it made a pleasing background, and didn't drown out our conversation.  Even though it's not in the best of neighborhoods, we felt safe.  Our only negative comment is that they use Styrofoam take-out containers, which aren't eco-friendly.  We will definitely be returning soon.

h_KdMMyMgNbtvg_WSIMLJA.text: My favorite Indian place in vegas for sure.  Everything is spiced right, portions are good and filling.  Its one of those places you can be adventurous in ordering and you wont go wrong.  3 stars because I cannot validate the care, and freshness of everything as they have a lunch buffet, and buffet's for the most part are suspect.  You could do a lot worse, plus my friend tried it who is not an Indian food fan, and he did not get sick, and ate almost all of it...small victories

_G7-t5e-qKq_snzFFlD8Jw.text: The Best Indian food in town The owner Prakash is best in hospitality he always take care of the customers . The staff is very kind and courteous The food is awesome , delicious,  typical North Indian style I highly recommend this place...

vjtJOVI3-zKzb-7vdMvgFg.text: Astonishingly good chicken saag, and their onion kulcha and mint chutney is beyond reproach!

O2DNp_r0Y75j9Vl23VYjFA.text: Buffet has a gr8 selection.  Service is top notch.  Good goat and chicken dishes.  Prices are reasonable.  Lots of vegetarian fare.  Conveniently located in strip mall.  Super dinner menu.  Some dishes oversalted.  Loud place in old building.  But worth the visit.

000BqmhDAkCYVa_MfJntpg.text: We noticed this place as we were out driving around. We thought it was a drive-through Indian restaurant, which we thought was such a great idea that we had to check it out.  To our disappointment, the drive-through window isn't operational.  Going inside, I expected fast-food furnishings and decor to match the outside of the restaurant.  No way!  White tablecloths and cloth napkins!  Waiters attending to the patrons.  And best of all, fragrant, delectable Indian cuisine - at a $10.00 lunch buffet!  The disappointment of the non-working drive through window was completely forgotten once we experienced the excellent food.  It was so good that we kept embarrassing ourselves, "mmm!  Mmmma!  Oh my gosh this is so GOOD!"    Every dish was fresh, seasoned perfectly, not greasy, gamy or too salty.  Occasionally they even changed the food, putting out a completely different dish in place of something that was there before.  The naan was amazing.  I could go there just for the naan.  They offered more, but we had to say "no thank you," because the rest of the food was so good.  The vegetarian dishes were at a separate warming table than the chicken dishes.  This speaks volumes for how they care for their customers, and I'm sure the vegetarian customers appreciate this.  The service was impeccable.  Our water glasses were kept full.  Even the water was good - no chlorine taste.    They didn't bring a check so we paid on the way out.  But that might just be how they do it there, which is fine by us.  We gave the highest tip percentage that we give due to the fine service and quality of food.  We will definitely be back.  This is now officially our place for Indian food.  We just went back again today.  It was every bit as good this time.  And they offered an accommodation for our disabled son without our asking for it, which was very kind.  We'll be back again soon.

ti-Qp0BU2zLldzUUg1qjcw.text: One of my favorite Indian places. Be sure to specify if you don't like spicy!! The regular dishes are pretty spicy (the tikka masala was great but much spicier than I expected). The mango lassi was delicious and perfect with the spicy things. If you're not into too hot, the lamb korma is amazing, especially with a little garlic naan. Service is great and the owner is always around and very friendly. If you're looking for good Indian in Vegas be sure to give this place a try!

mUu5iUI3zLWteey2JNG20A.text: Hubby and I went here a couple of weeks ago with a Restaurant.com coupon. We like Indian food and based on the reviews were looking forward to this place. It was virtually empty when we arrived, and we were seated immediately. I mentioned our coupon for $25 off with a purchase of $45 or more. So we had to eat a lot! Easy enough! Our waiter, who I think was also the owner/manager, suggested the Tandoori chicken to start as an appetizer, Eat a few pieces and take the rest home , which is what we did. The chicken was that awful red color that you find on most tandoori chicken, but it was very moist and delicious as were the onions and peppers served along with the chicken. Side note: We have only had tandoori chicken at one other restaurant in town that wasn't that awful red, and it was the best ever. But I digress. We ordered two kinds of naan, garlic naan and lamb filled naan. The lamb filled naan was OK, but didn't have a real lamby taste, but the garlic naan - OMG I could have made a meal on just that. I wanted a lamb dish for my entree and Rogan Josh was suggested, and it was delicious. Very tender and the sauce was perfect. Put some on my lamb, the rice and scooped up some with naan. My husband got a fish curry. It seemed to me to be very much the same sauce that was on the lamb but with fish chunks in it. I wasn't crazy about it, but he really enjoyed it. We also had a cauliflower and potato dish that we really enjoyed. I forgot to order raita, which I usually love with Indian food. We too got a complimentary rice pudding dessert , which unfortunately we were too full to finish. But it was delicious too, so next time I'll make room for it. I didn't notice the neighborhood. It's in a strip mall with a large Mariani's supermarket behind it. It's not inexpensive, but definitely not over-priced. While it is number two on our list of favorites, it is somewhat less expensive and definitely closer to home than our number one, so we will definitely be returning very soon!

1k21xTUn3E4L2TNsYYUAyA.text: 1st time here today,because of the stellar reviews sent me in mt everest direction. Mmm I wasn't very impressed,the food was fine,but nothing made me say outstanding. We were on the road and we were hungry.it definitely was not bad at all. I liked the salad bar and. The tamarind chutney. Just not spicey enough for me, alot of the vegetarian items on the buffet are made with cream, or butter. So i end up eating the few items that dont have dairy.even though it was not my favourite i would come back. What food they have was good, and the soup and salad are a welcome part of the buffet. Service was nice very attentive and friendly ++ on that

q2Cefd9uiYMtpspm5KdPSA.text: Best indian in town without a doubt. Great lunch buffet. Don't worry about the iffy neighborhood, staff is great.

MmXjNuvctdVaq-UD1tGtPA.text: Horrible. I came here just by looking at reviews and OMG!!! This is horrible. Food is stale in the buffet and the service is horrible.

zObT6Xj2KdxtsN2zXYnd7g.text: I'm not used to Indian cuisine, but the food was decent. I could eat it again. The service was ridiculously slow though despite there not being many people in the restaurant. That part was a turn off to me.

L7I-0fNec0I3HVJXvq-xCg.text: Fantastic quality buffet for just $10.99, delicious!

aBMjmvai5pziJ4IIqb9-Hw.text: Love this place! I always pick up instead of eating in, but it's fresh and amazing. Always have leftovers due to their generous portions. I recommend the Chicken Tikka Masala & Saag Paneer.

I_Xc5XZGwYN0EtFw8bbICw.text: I would definitely recommend going here for their lunch buffet. It's only $11 and you get to try a little of everything. I have nothing bad to say about any of the items served and they even give you free naan. Tasty food for an awesome price. Customer service is also great. Will definitely be going back.

V639WAbCo2PEjFLfPABhSQ.text: Service is too slow. Naan was not as expected. Chicken dishes were satisfactory. Waiters are very welcoming and five stars for them.

F6_rKgcMmmDb4OlByXiwcg.text: This place is prefect place for Indian food, the food is really authentic Indian food. Ask for spicy and you will get it. Naan and samosa are great

3175VkgaX_d5AwhlzYSkJA.text: Try to get there before noon if you want to get a seat. This place is a True gem! I took my coworker who was not sure of the cuisine and she got to try everything and had seconds! People around you are happy, food is fresh and flavors distinguished!

Jvt71bIUcxUgPiEXcdhH0g.text: I'm still a bit of an Indian cuisine newbie, so bear that in mind with my review.  Figured a lunch buffet would be a good way to sample a variety of dishes. The buffet line itself wasn't very large, smaller than anticipated. The standouts for me were the samosas, chicken tikka masala, and goat curry. The goat curry was almost like a very tender beef pot roast. Unfortunately I think the tandoori chicken suffered from being on a hot buffet line because it was extremely overcooked and almost inedible, though you could taste the flavors. It was a bit of a shame.  There was also an eggplant and potatoes dish that was extremely tasty.    Unfortunately I got full quicker than I wanted to, and one plate for me was enough. Though I wanted to go back for seconds of the tikka masala.   Service was efficient, with several of the guys always pitching in to refill waters and take away used plates. Don't know if dinner time is different, but at lunch the employees seem to not wear any uniform and just wear casual clothing. Which there's nothing at all wrong with, but at times it was hard to tell who was an employee and who was a customer.   Mount Everest doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside is some tasty food to be found.

1Giwrl4jphZQPj47-niyjw.text: Just ate here. Absolutely delicious. The staff was nice and comforting, when we needed refills it came immediately. This restaurant is probably the MOST AUTHENTIC Indian / Nepalese in Vegas. When I come back to Vegas I will be visiting it again.

KkYc8MMCYxwL-S_H9UUBhg.text: Just got finished eating at Mount Everest for their lunch buffet and I'm literally reeling in pain at my desk.  This opening line would work much better if you couldn't already see the 5 star rating I'm giving them.   Yes, this is that Sushi Mon all you can eat and then some, pants button undoing type of stomach pain, and not the having flashbacks of the Subway employee not washing his hands while making your Sweet Onion Teriyaki chicken sandwich type of pain.  I wish I could describe what I ate in detail, but the truth is I have no idea.  On the first plate I tried everything on the right side of the hot buffet items, which resulted in a plate of rice and an assortment of deliciously spiced veggie and chicken dishes along with some Veggie Samosas and Pakoras.  After a while, sauces were blending into each other, pakora were getting smothered with various other items, left became right, black became white, and soon a harmonious melting pot had been achieved on my plate that rivaled any buffet experience I've had.  With each bite I had no idea which item(s) I were eating, but they were all fantastic.  Some of these bites provided quite a kick and the quickly refilled iced tea and water were much appreciated.  I had no need for a 2nd plate.  I had no room for a 2nd plate.  Someone should have stopped me, but alas, they didn't.   Walking up to the buffet line, the only game plan I had was to try everything on the left side that I didn't try the first time.   Chicken Curry, Chicken something else, Chicken something else.  Done.  Unfortunately I also couldnt resist some more Daal, some more samosas, some more pakora.  3 bites in I knew I was in trouble.  12 bites in I started to hurt.  20 bites in I tapped out.   Now an hour later I'm finally starting to recover...  You may have won the battle Mount Everest, but I will be back to win the war.

KvcA4FC8KRRhRYT_Th-c3A.text: The food and service here is amazing. There's always a 20-30 minute wait for their lunch buffet but it is so worth it. The food tastes so authentic and is just incredible. Wait staff is very friendly and helpful. I just love this place

IAptWs-2fwcOk7JbYBBgMA.text: Best Indian Cuisine in Vegas, hands down!!! Never had better service either, so attentive to everyone!! Please come and eat here!!!!!!

6_pZXVE2GpXlZpkX07BaCA.text: Really the food taste is as home made food..This is the best place for Indian food in Las Vegas.

6zwaCXwmYi7PlevH8OW_1g.text: One of the best place to eat when you visit Vegas.  Pure taste of Nepali cuisine. Very good service plus reasonable price. Will recommend my friends and families to try if they plan to visit vegas.

uWf6UFBrmTfq6YW21tUxQw.text: The food here is pretty good. Coming from a guy who enjoys spicy food, it's pretty good for the balance between flavorful spice and spice that hurts to eat.

z9YLD0yWux6h_JDjJfA87Q.text: Worst butter naans ever. Food is tasteless and if you order something order without bell pepper.

A0JDuNIOS_dFjfTl0hjDMg.text: My favorite neighborhood food! Always on point with deliciousness and a smile! Great great GREAT food and really reasonable prices! The buffet is a go to! And they are open late!  And they have they Buffett everyday! Boom!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffet all the way!

Iy3bm1tgukWgRTFBobSFOA.text: Solid 3.5 star AYCE Indian goodness!  Will definitely return.    Tandoori chicken was a little dry, but the sag paneer and goat curry were spot on.  Just enough spice, not swimming in oil, and a good selection of lunch buffet items.  Several Indian / Western Asian families came in while we were dining, always a good sign.  Very friendly service.  Interior could benefit from a facelift.    Mango lassi to top it off.  Eleven dollars well spent.

kB23HF6quOt110hw_uBXwQ.text: 2 years later and this is STILL THE BEST INDIAN FOOD IN LAS VEGAS!!! Its a must-do every time I come to Vegas (which is about twice a year)  I am always amazed when I come here. Always get seated immediately, service is friendly, fast, efficient. Food is INSANELY good. I don't know how they get the nan so light that it practically melts in your mouth. Prakash, the owner, will always greet you and make sure that you are well taken care of. He is a kind and gentle soul, and genuinely cares about his patrons. Wish all restaurant owners were the same.  I don't know what else to say - I just can't recommend it more highly!

1osHBI7wZRWSIA1nvG4Caw.text: AVOID this place..all items served on buffet are cold..when asked, response was "this is all the food we got..eat watever available"..HORRIBLE food EVER

EQBA0UWcadCSG_4RJPRe3Q.text: Family Vacation, went here for dinner and had a great experience from start to finish. We have Indian food weekly in our on home town and the quality of food here I would rate 10 out of 10.  BillF

3V0zHeGrx5GlXvXoTwrZcg.text: Definitely my favorite Indian place in town. My wife and I eat here regularly, and it never fails to be amazing. The owner is super nice too, he remembers us and the fact that my wife loooooves super spicy food. I'm more of a mild food kinda guy, and they do that really well too.   Not that the lunch buffet is mild, it's really good if that's what you want, but stick with dinner if you want super spicy. Also, if you ask nicely, they have an amazing jalapeno hot paste that you can add to your food!

an3XvO8Ef1h1JSvbVp9fdQ.text: Food was great; service even better!  When you get here ask for Laxman or Prakas! They took time to explain my options, gave suggestions,  and made this the best business dinner ever in "Sin City"! A must visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2efe_fhxgzVJ7C61o9b6ag.text: It's now my favourite Indian restaurant. This is by far, the best Indian buffet in town. $11 for an AYCE buffet... Yes please.   I just finished eating and I can barely function.   Highlights of the meal for me:  Chicken tikka masala - very tender and juicy. Not as spicy, but very flavourful.   Pakoras and samosas - crispy, crunchy, chewy, soft, they got it all.   I could go on...   I didn't have anything bad and they definitely made a great first impression.   I highly recommend their lunch buffet!

n88k_tQZ5EM9sdET-kFpSg.text: I was drawn by the amazing reviews - food is good based on the level of your exposure to Indian food. Spicy food liver like myself my not easily be satisfied here. I have been to many amazing Indian restaurant and many bad ones as well. However, this is right in the middle. Naan were good. I never had Gopal Jamun (red sweet ball) with hard center - this has to improve. Don't try chi (tea), it cost $3/cup and not good at all. Overall, decent Indian food and very good Indian food for non Indian customers.

R3v478nKehA-0a1wMDRP4g.text: Average food really. Their best Item was probably the chicken makhani and gulab jamuns. Palak paneer, chickpea curry, chicken curry and lamb curry were all average. Not returning back

VsXAmVIWYKik-jnUXPdDGg.text: Awesome and authentic food -   You won't be disappointed - it's a quality place -  Go and eat till your hearts content -  Go and a see precaz he's the main man

f8Wzt_cveWaSu1pg-xwvsw.text: Straight up some of the best Indian food I  have ever had. I took my girlfriend there a few months ago for her birthday as she's never had Indian food before but always wanted to try it. The restaurant is in what looks to be a former Pizza Hut or maybe a KFC and they set up the buffet trays where the cash registers used to be. Despite the former use of the space, they managed to create a very nice ambiance inside, dark and with banging Bollywood songs on the TV. Those were some great music videos and our waiter was very knowledgeable about the actors/signers and movies being shown and was happy to share.   As for the food, as I already said it is some of if not the best Indian food I've ever had, and I'm no novice. I found that if there's  something not  on the menu that you'd like, ask and they'll make it. I'm partial to goat vindaloo which they didn't have on the menu but were more than happy to make. My girlfriend got chicken tikka masala. Both our curries were a 10 (which was a tad  ambitious for her) and the spice was very good. The vindaloo was done perfectly as was the chicken. I've found a lot of places when you order a 10, they just dump a bunch  of cayenne to heat it up, but it was clear it was an across the board spice increase  and you could taste the difference. My girlfriend also had  a mango lassi  and while I'm not as familiar with them as I  am curry, it seemed really really good.   As I mentioned, my girlfriend was  a bit overzealous in ordering a ten and while she managed to eat it, it was still a bit too spicy. The manager  must have noticed she was having issues because he offered  us a free serving of gulab jamun for her troubles. They definitely earn top marks for service as well as food.

DZEAlAs0ETDWlX0UomnaWw.text: This place is great. I love their lunch buffet. It is run by very nice Nepalese people. They do a great job of keeping the buffet line clean. The food is good quality, and the taste is as good as any other indian/Nepalese places I have tried here in the valley. The buffet price is quite affordable. I will be returning again in the future

KwtANAU-m6hc3uGnlmWWOg.text: I'm surprised I haven't done a review for this place. It's my favorite Indian buffet in Vegas, hands down. It's $10.99 and the food is good. They bring out fresh naan for you and the service is always amazing. The young gentleman that is always there is so sweet and nice. The food is consistent every time I go there and they always keep the stations clean. Never been disappointed with the food nor the service. I even went on a day where the health inspector came unexpectedly! the place was so packed and busy and the young gentleman/server/cashier was able to keep up with everyone's needs, clean up and talk to the health inspector. Keep up the good work!!

s6ij8aUD8hC54cajnPyOAQ.text: I take out food from restaurant frequently, food is good, prices and service are not bad. In fact in Las Vegas they are among the better restaurant.  I have 4 stars not 5 because they have limited parking although it's in a big shopping center, majority of the parking spaces are taken by Marianna Latino Supermarket. I also think interior can use a facelift.  But yes I will go back there and I recommend.  If you are there try the Kabobs, Tandooris, and lamb Korma.

_SaU5DkNu981A3Zm6RQieA.text: Food is not bad but i have had better! Place looks outdated and can really use a paint job. Service is okay. Prices are reasonable!

__2-S4S5m7PWf__Upo3Ofw.text: Excellent food and service for the price paid. Had the chicken Korma and tikka masala. I would also like to add that I gave 5 stars as this food is authentic with what is served in India, not just an "Americanized version of the dishes", which can please some, but makes food loose its authenticity. Will be coming back soon.

zajM8WKyEgUF2gXa4rjFEg.text: Went here with 2 buddies. We didn't have high expectations nor did we consult with Yelp before eating.  I was gladly and thoroughly satisfied with the lunch, as were my buddies.   Thank you for the great and friendly customer service too.   Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zack devouring the food!

84hqYUtsnn0F7MaWO0ucgA.text: Clean A Taste A Service A The Area C  Overall 5 stars just be careful not to park far night time.

JZ1mAx0_XecTEVTh1p4lAA.text: We didn't even go in I have to say. Very sketchy surroundings and looks like a total dive from the outside. Can't speak to food.

KLBGy2KHfgb4r_POljkVnA.text: My boyfriend took me to Mount Everest for my FIRST time having Indian food. I honestly didn't know what to expect and I LOVED everything. Garlic naan... whaaaat?? I love it! Everything was priced fair and the waiters were very friendly. For a more casual Indian restaurant I would give it 5 stars. Very satisfied with our experience and I know we will be back!

3WopHVTkjqQvgVMKOwrnqA.text: This is the most amazing restaurant. The service is impeccable and the food is even better! From the Garlic Naan to the Khorma to Baigan Bharta you just can't go wrong. Everything is flavorful, filling, and authentic. I love the pace that they serve your meal. You don't feel rushed and get to have a True dining experience. I can't say enough good things. If you don't know what to order or where to start, ask your server. They are knowledgeable and will find something you'll keep coming back for. Be adventurous!

5e5fYJlF9lQsC1cR1hdbHg.text: I knew I had to try this place the moment I opened my car door and all I could smell was the wonderful aroma of curry and other various spices you experience with Indian cuisine. We arrived for the lunch buffet  which runs from 11 to 3pm for $10.99 per person.   They also serve dinner from 5 to 10pm.  For me, a buffet is the best way to experience food you are not familiar with.  Trying to guess what will look and taste good by reading a menu can be next to impossible.     I thought the Everest crew did a great job during my visit today.  The staff was efficient and friendly and it looked like only two people running the front of house of 30 tables or so.   The food selection was a good variety of one side that had all vegetarian options and another with meat offerings.   They featured about 12 different menu items including basmati rice, tandoori chicken, chicken Tikka masala, lentils, and one of my favorites was the pancake like balls soaked in syrup.   All of the offerings were hot and flavorful.   Once again a good reason to experience the buffet is because the food always comes out fresh, hot and often when you have a full restaurant.   Once we were seated the server brought out a fresh basket of Naan bread.  So happy they brought this to the table the bread was hot and had a perfect char on the exterior for extra flavor. Yum! Speaking to server on the way out he said they change some of the buffet offerings daily so you might have a different experience each visit. I plan on going back to Everest very soon and I recommend you try it also.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The smells are amazing
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eKl1Evuc-Dxslk_2w-4Itw.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Vegas! Such yummy food. I personally have a favorite dish so do not deviate to try other things often but everyone I've ever taken with me has loved whatever they've ordered as well.

XjPQvABJATUrtt01vJQOPQ.text: Food is fresh and hot. Lots of favor and spice, service is fast and friendly. The bread (can't remember what's it's called) is right out of the oven and delicious. Great for a fast, healthy lunch with friend, coworkers.

oZ3YIFVGTWd7IJfxFbmoIw.text: Went here on out fourth night in Vegas, read the yelp reviews and decided to try this place out. It was a bit far from the strip. Uber costed 10$ from the MGM grand. We went in early by 7pm on a Wednesday (it was the last week of December though) and the crowd just started to fill in, we were quickly ushered to a corner table that another couple rejected, we were okay with the tight space, the ambiance was decent. the manager was quickly in to take our order. We got the samosas, some garlic naan, the butter chicken, mix vegetables and the veg Biryani. Within a few minutes our server got us some complementary paladums. It was all good till now and now started the wait, it took for ever to get the samosas which were dry and looked old and reheated and tasted as bad, the Naan was good but the curries were nothing special, in fact the chicken was just old dried up tandoori chicken pieces cut up and put in some hot gravy. The Biryani was okay. The only good dish was the dessert, carrot halwa. All in all a pretty forgettable experience owing to the huge delay and the average tasting food. Maybe it was the rush that made our experience bad but as we are from out of turn I doubt we will ever come back again.

84399bVfdw0KWv9-AUEZPg.text: I've been coming here for some time and I love there afternoon lunch. This is where I tried all of my first Indian dishes. I normally order the vegetable korma a 8 spicy and the chicken tiki Marsala 8 spicy as well. I actually got to try this mango drink today which was awesome. I can't wait to get back in there and try something else new.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ABFGvC-QryJr9h3aXkGQmA.text: The service was very slow. The food was not much better than frozen Indian food. I do not recommend going to this restaurant for authentic Indian food. I gave them 2 stars because there aren't many options of Indian food around downtown Vegas but it was absolutely not worth going off the strip.

kcLDVxB39HYungKgDfX-JA.text: Came for dinner and was pleasantly surprised at how good the food tastes.  Was at first put off at how slow everything was moving but then suddenly there was a surge of good service which was nice.  Free parking outside the lot and cozy atmosphere with booths. Got some free tamarind and mint chutney with papadum to start which was good. We ordered the bhindi masala (okra dish) and the palak paneer (spinach and Indian cheese) dish with a garlic naan.  It surprisingly came with basmati rice which was nice since we didnt order it. The bhindi masala was really good.  Probably the best one I have had so far.  Full bodied flavor and not slimey.  The palak paneer was tasty. I like that it was too pureed and had some texture left in it.  The garlic naan was dripping with ghee or butter or oil and my friend said it was really good.  It looked liked really good naan.  The rice was kind of hard or old, so not so good. Overall had a nice experience.  And they have huge portions so it was a lot of food for two people and had a whole box of leftovers.   Don't loiter outside if you don't have to.  Seems a little sketch.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lentil cracker free
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tamarind mint chutney
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bhindi masala - okra

Oe7BUf1UFvqEERek72a4SQ.text: Fantastic. Food and service.  Best Indian I have had in a very long time. Had butter chicken and alu gobi.

RN12YiqLnSRH5h48kowqBw.text: Great food, great service! The people there are very generous! The food came out quick and it looked and tasted fresh! I can't wait to try their buffet!! Definitely coming back! Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y_a3Icyqxr_djgoSyeaImw.text: Great big vegetarian/vegan menu. The waiters were very accommodating. We saw quite some vegan guests here. We had: Baingan  Bharta and Aloo Baingan, two delicious eggplant dishes. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan-friendly

rManWWgEObPaRU2KzTqjnQ.text: I love Indian food, and I have been coming to this place for 9 years now. Sometimes we'll go to other Indian restaurants that are in our vicinity because of time and we've been to all of them if not most of them, and I keep hoping we'll find something as good as Mt Everest since it's in the middle of town and we live in the southern end of town . Some come close but there is always something, service, flavor, portions, authenticity that has us saying Everest is still the best. Keep in mind this isn't a fancy joint if that's what your looking for. If your looking for something delicious, rich and comforting this is the place. You can never go wrong with their samosa chat and vindaloo. Good eating!

MMZfQJ1d3S2YnsgAfCJDyg.text: It has been awhile since we visited this restaurant. Was nice to see Prakash back in there. Food was delicious as always. Very polite, accommodating & professional. Thanks & we will be back again.

7A0GRi6jpRZsVtPHBxr8NA.text: This place was great! The lunch buffet was very clean and offered great options. The only thing that kept me from giving five stars was the location. There were homeless people crowding the building and I didn't feel very safe walking in and out.

YGyZ5ex8D__Zw7JZl2cIMw.text: My favorite Indian restaurant in Vegas. Never had a bad meal. Lunch is a $10 buffet and it's ok. However dinner is were they shine.

RMzjcmE9Wu2P6l8Je9qm3g.text: There are already plenty of reviews, so I'll focus on the korma sauce. It's a creamy concoction of special magnificence! Whenever this buffet has anything with korma, I have to eat it. The sauce is rich, slightly spicy, and quite magical.   Everything else is also tasty and the Bollywood videos are hypnotizing. My only complaint is that on several occasions the service has been rather grumpy.

LBsEtiMg4TMChwx9AlYTqg.text: "[Curry] makes the world go around The world go around The world go around [Curry] makes the world go around It makes the world go 'round." - "Money" from Cabaret [with some slight changes]  There's a reason Indian restaurant lunch buffets are so popular -- all the curry you can eat and lots of varieties.  Mt Everest knows it and does a great job with its buffet.  Options of vegetarian curry, lamb curry, chicken curry anchor the buffet offerings and they are all tasty, although a little lacking in spice (those looking to set the "roof [of their mouth] on fire" will be a little disappointed).    What makes Mt Everest's buffet exceptional are the additional offerings -- delicious samosas, sweet sticky rice, soft basmati rice and free, warm, garlic naan on the table.  All of which makes this the best Indian buffet in town.

uNoA0GBuH62IfDASHifAZA.text: 4 Stars for the food, 5 stars for the service, pleasant size, and great price.  For a small buffet it had great variety, I particularly liked the goat curry and sweet rice.  What really made my visit great was the owner.  He was constantly attending to all the tables, providing refills on water and asking his guests how their meals tasted.  Attentive and kind, while providing great food, earns 5 stars in my book!

M-NuRgp7nJhKw5YBoXRL_g.text: I drove all away from Utah to have their chicken tikka masala with garlic naan. INCREDIBLE!  Best combination of spices I have ever tasted.  Not only was the food amazing but the service was incomparable!  I will be making the trip just for this restaurant. You won't be sorry!

7UjJ-R_qnAKQp_lzNVPzYA.text: Indian food is my favorite food and I have been to multiple Indian restaurants in Vegas. For the price and food this is the best Indian restaurant. This is as closest to an Indian food you will get without being too Americanized.

yZxqmpfL_v4EXO9pQsTZDQ.text: My parents in law, husband and I were looking for some really good Indian food on our Thanksgiving trip to Las Vegas. My in laws had been to this restaurant before but this was the first time for my husband and I. We were not disappointed. The food was very tasty (but not oily at all), the buffet selection was wonderful (lots of chicken and non-vegetarian choices along with vegetables and dessert and salad). The service was excellent and the atmosphere was perfect.  My father in law does not eat naan and the restaurant offered to make him roti's instead at no charge. They are so kind!  The best part? At 9.99 per person for lunch, this is the best deal you can get! I wish they had a location where I live in California. I plan on visiting this restaurant everytime I come to Las Vegas.  Please visit this place next time you are in Las Vegas. I have nothing bad to say at all.

dWJ44F2FO2iWlBd9fqUPtA.text: My husband and I went to have some dinner and we didn't realize the time. The restaurant was actually closed and the owner Prakash welcomed us and gave us the option to order take out. We really appreciated that, and we were worried that his staff would be upset with us for ruining their closing routine! Prakash was so nice and he took our order and we even ordered extra sides after we had put the original order in, and he still accommodated us. He didn't even charge us for the extra sides. We will definitely come here again within hours when we are in town next time. The food was amazing spicy like we enjoy.

75GpFQyBu2gcTcmh5tO3yg.text: My co-worker kept raving about this place and it didn't disappoint at all! The food was delicious and fresh. The service was great. The owner was very attentive and conversational. You can definitely tell he's proud to be the owner and pleases to serve you. We will be back for sure!

fXFY6xZvRwGM67wWVXHz4g.text: Good food, decent service and decent price. The Food was so good that we eate each and everyday there while staying in Vegas. Would definitely suggest trying food here.

BrdPsBXfiKV_M-S_rGgrPQ.text: I have eaten at Everest many times. The Aloo Muttor Gobi, Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Biryani, Garlic Naan, and more. The owner and staff have  consistently been helpful. I will be returning soon.

OKyDKVztJZNzt8oUzweZ7w.text: Really nice selection for a veggie lover like me. Loved their buffet.

RtQyR-H5H0Vow1mjdu5PzA.text: My husband and I must have gone here on a REALLY off day for them. :/ We ate at the AYCE lunch buffet and I felt like we were eating their scraps. Food wasn't hot...just warm enough to eat. The chicken and lamb was dry. They forgot our drink orders and then when they finally did come out, they got our order wrong. The food was just ok...some of it was not edible though. I hate wasting food, so I usually eat it if I don't think it's the best...but some of it, I just couldn't eat because it was either too dry or just didn't taste right. I hate to say it but I would never come back here again, especially since we have found better.

qHieTA1rrPMoF2Ov9q6C8A.text: I've been here for dinner about three times. The food takes a while to come out because it's made fresh from scratch. I'm not Indian BUT I have eaten food in many places; Bay area, Montreal, Calgary, Vancouver, London, So Cal, Australia...and this place ranks up there with the best. Lunch buffet may not be so impressive because the menu is "predictable" for those that aren't adventurous. Don't evern THINK about going to Bollywood over this place...EVER. That place is bad.

WlDvuy1WeWgxLHqz1UaQMw.text: Truly authentic north indian food. Tandoori Chicken, Naan, Chicken Curry and Chicken Tikka masala was amazing. Dal makhani and rice was also good. Lunch buffet in 10 dollars is great value for money.

gZxZyvoK_EGapW0f47cXvQ.text: I have lived in over 4 states and have ate indian food around the world. I have tried every top ranking Indian restaurant and hands down this is the BEST! The outside may not be as attractive as other locations but it's not the location that makes the food taste good, it's the cook(s). You can't judge restaurant just by a buffet as I even managed one of the very most unique restaurants in Ohio. I am a very great judge of Indian cuisine. The chicken tikka masala is amazing and when you ask for hot or spicy and ask for maybe a level 7 spicy it comes that way. There chicken 65 is tasty and basically the way it should taste. The staff provides good service and they are very tentative. The real taste of this unique place is when you order it fresh. Furthermore, a lot of people making reviews are going by very personal taste and may not even know half the ingredients. I have never brought someone to this place where they are not blown away. Especially compared to others that over salt; nothing is worse than over salted take out food or worse buffet food. Also, I love this place even more for the price. In Vegas, it surely does not get better.

UlIb37Gq3SEEMKpp9_OUWQ.text: I'm a huge fan of Indian food. It all started in a place back home in Daytona Beach FL just a few years ago. Since then I've been on the hunt for more great Indian restaurants. I just can't get enough of the Chicken Makhani (also known as butter chicken), Lamb Korma and Naan bread, SO YUMMY. This place was really great. The flavors were great and very fresh. I agree with all the reviews. I do think the service was a bit slow. It seemed the hostess was also taking orders and closing tickets.  We had a show to go to so we literally had to take the check up to the register to pay our bill. I still don't think I have found a match for the place in Daytona Beach but this is very close......Highly recommended, no complaints or disappointments!

9jH8UxCQmoGzr8Q36_-rTQ.text: Lunch buffet was good - can't say it was the best indian food i ever had -But good. We got there around 1 saturday afternoon-  waited for a table just a few minutes. Every thing was good - is it possible foods were heavier than other indian restaurants? I thought the foods were heavier. They did not serve garlic nan - just regular nan - disappointed a little bit. I would recommend this place  - good place for something different  - but i don't think i would come back soon.

vvq4RLaCnwvUq8opwvijcQ.text: I have no idea why this place is rated so high. After reading all the great reviews we decided to give their weekend buffet a try. Needless to say we were greatly disappointed. Their service was super slow even when the place wasnt busy. We had to ask repeatedly to refill some of the dishes that were out. The taste of their food is definitely average. Their spread is limited. Their naan(bread) is one of the worst I have ever had. We won't be returning here.

tMU4OG_BGsKWIWvxNyyBFw.text: A great steal for Lunch buffet $8.99 / person, gets you fresh garlic & butter Nan bread. Every item in the menu was great, with a great selection from about 20-25 items on the table.  Ample parking space & about 5-6 miles from strip. My fav lunch destination in Vegas.... :)

dD41bujnFvwHiZ98U8Ofmg.text: Ordered goat curry with naan and lassi. Ordered Moro's for appetizer Momos were very good and freshly made and that's the only reason that I have given a couple of stars  The goat curry was just horrible, probably duethe goat being days if not weeks old.   Stomach got upset , took a day to recover . Not happy at all

hTj7A-sDi6BaMgJBW5uG_w.text: This is our favorite Indian restaurant in all of Las Vegas. The curry is the best we've ever had. Tiki Masala, Saag, Biryani, and Tandoori are amazing. The Naan is delicious as well. The owner is very nice, and always ensures that everything is to our liking. Prices are very reasonable. Mount Everest is a great local place, and we pass several Indian restaurants to make it our "go to" place for delicious Indian food.

33PHfoEo2G-fk37hv0ITHg.text: A very good buffet!!  They have good vegetarian options as well..  Naan's - Freshly cooked, super soft.   Chicken starter - chicken 65 can be better, has a bit more oil.  Chicken tandoori - can be a bit more marinated to have more flavor.  Chicken curry - spot on!!  Veg curries - palak paneer and veg koorma - very good, if you are from India, add a bit of salt for taste.  Dessert  - they had only one dessert(carrot halwa), they made it to perfection. I'd always prefer one dessert with very good quality instead of tasting  5-6 with average quality.  Service - pretty fast and good.  You'd feel satisfied at the end of the meal.   For 12.99$, absolutely worth the money!!

jJ76iu2xvVYmxnCDf3bpeg.text: This was such a gem to find in Las Vegas .The service was such a delight to have experienced .The ambiance was relaxing, and warm.The food was  flavored just right ,that  it can literally transport you to India , and back with every bite you take. The Buffet style or the way it was arranged was very clean and proper , so double points for that .  I would recommend you try the Honey rice and Carrot pudding;they are out of this world .

eBG5ilPqCr8VOhCvZoKOGw.text: Amazing service. Guy was hustling his ass off and even made custom food. On top of that gave us his appetizer because he didn't have time to eat it. I've lived all over the world and this is by far one of the best vegetarian tastes ever. Not too heavy on sauce and perfect spices.

RLzy8x_-Rb33nEz0Y2OJHA.text: Finally back after over a little over a year and Mount Everest is still crushing it.  Service was better this visit as the empty plates were cleared immediately, the hot naan bread kept coming and we had 3 jugs of water that were kept fresh for our party of 7.  The Chili Chicken is the perfect amount of flavorful spicy: I break a slight sweat with no discomfort at all in as I chew away.  Keep up the great work Mount Everest!

6jL7pX6xxuhUJ-o_jmB5UA.text: Ok so this place is amazing!!! We love indulging in buffets when we go to Vegas and since we were with one of our friends who is a strict vegetarian, we decided to go here. We went for the lunch special buffet which was only 12.99 per person. I'll say that again 12.99 FOR ALL YOU CAN EAT INDIAN FOOD. I literally engorged myself with DELICIOUS chicken tikka masala until I had my fill. The only thing bad I have to say is that we waited a while for Naan (bread for those who don't know) for them to only bring two pieces out for a table of four. We laughed at how we would divide it amongst the four of us which was kinda of NAAN Sense (insert laugh)!!!! but still it was one small thing GO ENJOY THIS PLACE FELLOW YELPERS.

QkkO_gxrINT2DEV8sCHhxg.text: Outstanding food! The food had depth of a depth flavor that was fantastic. Will be going back- often! Try the curry. Had chicken and goat on the buffet and both were amazing.

FhDY8zUKaNNv-UJYtUMCeA.text: We came here due to the Yelp reviews  Their lunch buffet was good and offered many common variety on dishes. I loved their Mango Lassi. The place is clean and the staff friendly. Next time we will try their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It was good!!!

j-9Dr-7Nd1Rw29bgHU5dkQ.text: My favorite Indian place of all time is still one of my favorite Indian places of all time but with some new unfortunate changes   Price: originally $10.99 for the lunch it is now $12.99  Naan: the naan was always prepared fresh to order and brought to the table but now naan is available at the buffet station.   Overall: The food has not changed and still tastes marvelous but instead of upgrading the restaurant they just raised the prices and lowered the work

sNTj4hEhtspccDt-42xPMQ.text: I searched Yelp for Vegas buffet, and while this was an unexpected result I decided I was in the mood for Indian. The lunch buffet has a quite large assortment of dishes; unfortunately they are mostly over-salted. Still tasty and filling, but the chef needs to lighten the hand on the salt shaker.

P8DIMFYCDj3j-I0ymKe3JA.text: On business trip in Vegas. First time here for vegetarian foods. Good service. Two dishes were recommended by waiter; yummy!! Good to go with rice or bread. Will come back again for sure.
