Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect for two adults

GMjpe3kYRQ1PXDdFiW2wGg.text: Please save yourself the disappointment. Don't go here. The food is not good. The curry is thin and flavorless. The chicken tasted old. The naan is not fresh and is limp. It is in a sketchy neighborhood and looks unclean. I came here because of the 4.5 star over one thousand reviews. I don't know how that happened but it is not accurate as of today.

p9I6Ybhstv9v_2tC2hWZ8Q.text: An explosion of flavors! A rainbow of colors!   This is probably the best Indian lunch buffet in town not just for the very affordable price but also for the variety of options. Lunch runs $10.99 per person and it's all you can eat. Unfortunately I can never make it to the second plate but I don't mind because I'm always very satisfied.   If you aren't familiar with Indian food I suggest trying a little of everything. They have lots of meat dishes that included chicken & goat and of course many vegetarian options as well. I like it all.   Everything pairs well together and is so damn flavorful! The spices and herbs! Yum!   The complimentary warm naan bread is just the perfect addition to all meals. Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good stuff! Lunch buffet ~

rYJ6UPLfBCLfN4l1ETnpwA.text: Indian food, for me, is seduction. The spice aromas alone can transport me to illegal, tiny apartments in Hong Kong where Indian men and women cooked and served fiery curries bursting with coriander, cumin, star anise, cinnamon, turmeric, amchur powder, and on and on. We'd sit in the cramped space and sweat from the tandoor's heat pressing through the concrete walls.  So when Michael and I hit Mt. Everest, the aromas, alone, sealed the deal. We're suckers for lamb samosas. Good sized, these golden brown triangle pastries come out hot. You break open a tip and spoon mint chutney or sweet tamarind sauce on and bite into savory goodness. For me, we indulged in an onion kulcha. This is naan stuffed with caramelized onions and spices. On first bite, I teared up a bit. I hadn't had one that perfect since those Hong Kong days.  My lamb saag was lusty and dense on the spinach, not watered down like some places make it. I scooped up servings with the plain naan. Michael ordered hot, lamb curry. Some places don't mean hot. This place does.  The portion sizes in relation to the cost are more than fair. The quality in relation to cost is top notch. While we were there, I surmised that the cooks and servers were Nepalese. They are, and that's cool because the national flavors add distinctness to many of their dishes. On our second visit, we tried Momo, a popular snack in Nepal.  Fresh, steamed, silky, dumpling skins ferry spiced chicken or vegetables into your mouth - that is after you've slathered on the piquant Momo sauce.  Ok, when busy, things slow down, but that's the price of quality at excellent prices.  Relax. Sip a masala chai. Chat about traveling. Wonder at the smells that seduce you into coming back again and again.

Q2WTrO0C65lQbMJXTsxPvg.text: The Indian buffet here is the bomb, one of the better buffers in vegas for the good value but last night we decided to try here for family dinner.  The food is slightly better than the buffet stuff but the quantity is significantly less.  I just don't think you get much value at night and it's too expensive.  So I will stick to the lunch buffet.  Still my favorite Indian restaurant in vegas and mint.

TiOyIRmALaa8jwpSRDgyXw.text: My friend Joe brought me here and thanks to him I discovered a hidden gem. The food is very flavorful and every bite made me want to take more. I'm sad that this family owned restaurant is only in Las Vegas because they've now set a high bar that's going to be difficult for other restaurants to surpass back here in California. The owner was very courteous and came out personally I check in the tables. Mt. Everest should definitely be a stop for anyone visiting Las Vegas.

UA5VLRBSd2XJvl651gNE4w.text: This review is for the lunch buffet only: Not sure if this is a Nepalese or Indian restaurant, as its name indicates one thing, and all the pictures and flag inside indicate another. Regardless, they offer classic Indian dishes, from Tandoori Chicken, to Tika Masala, etc. My favorites remain simply their basmati rice; very aromatic, and the Naan bread dipped in Masala. The decor is very basic and service informal but friendly. In comparison to other similar Indian buffets, I would rank this one at the lower end. In sum, if you are tired of bland food and you are looking for something out of the ordinary, this is a decent choice. On the other hand if you know a thing or two about Indian cuisine and are looking to expand your experience or take it to the next level, than this place is not for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basmati rice, Tika Chicken, Tandoori Masala, Samosa, Naan bread.

rX9BOr_PO5gyDPkYtbQ9Jw.text: I never do all you can eat lunches - but when in Rome (or at an Indian restaurant for lunch).  The great thing is the ability to try things you would not normally try - everything was very good.  Excellent service and a wide variety of Indian specialties.  Loved the Mutton curry and tandori chicken.

JZlKYi3UiZ86S7tm0NGAoA.text: We visited this restaurant on our recent visit to Vegas. It does live up to the reviews on Yelp. I honestly didn't expect everything to taste good and was pleasantly surprised. The lunch buffet has a pretty decent spread. Being a vegetarian, I sometimes don't have enough options in a buffet but this was different. Pakoras and samosas in the appetizer were nice and had the right amount of crunch. The vegetarian biryani was more of a pulav and lacked salt but was still flavorful.  I would recommend their gajar halwa as well. I usually don't like desserts but couldn't stop myself from eating the halwa here! Overall I liked the place and the buffet is well worth $13.  Bon appetit!

MzZULx_srWEogeOJg-JiXA.text: Hands down the best Indian food in Las Vegas. I have been here a number of times, tried a number of dishes, and have never left disappointed.   The chicken momos are my favorite menu item. They are Nepalese dumplings and are unbelievable. The sauce for dipping is so good I even use it on the garlic naan. The Kadai is my favorite of the entrees, but the Makhani (butter chicken) is close behind. Really though, you should try them all and decide for yourself.   Bottom line, don't leave without trying the chicken momos. They take a bit as they are made fresh, but are more than worth the wait!

_vJ8BR9xOZs3IYszmmo6wQ.text: The usual disclaimer: I have not visited this restaurant. This review is regarding my recent delivery experience.   I love Indian cuisine. I'm no expert on it though; there are a few things I like a lot, but many dishes I haven't tried.  I ordered the Chicken Korma, a tandoori plate, and regular naan. The Chicken Korma was described on their on-line menu as "mild." Now, I generally like spicy food, but I sometimes prefer a mild curry, so the flavors of the spices are present and the protein can be enjoyed. If this Korma was "mild," I'd really hate to think how spicy their Vindaloo is! It was also of a consistency more suited to hummus than to curry. I never got a chance to taste the chicken in the Korma (I usually find myself ordering a curry just for the sauce); the curry itself, while unexpectedly spicy, and thicker than I prefer my curries, was still quite flavorful.  The tandoori platter consisted of some white meat tandoori chicken nuggets; predictably dry, but well seasoned and a great pairing with the tamarind sauce. Also a samosa, which I haven't gotten to yet; some very lovely, moist lamb kebab; and these little fried things which I've never encountered before, but were quite tasty.  The naan, I'm sorry to say, was very dense and a little too moist, possibly because of the way it's packed for delivery. Naan is my favorite flatbread; this fell a bit, well, flat (really, no pun intended!).   I think I will order from this establishment again, but I'll put a request in for the chef to ensure that the mild curry I order is actually mild, and perhaps I'll try the garlic naan, for some added flavor.

_DLtBab-3PSwSHZXT-9y-g.text: Good taste. Less quantity. Parking facility. Good service and friendly professional staff.

92wSe1TEXm9pgSL-8TVDYQ.text: Not sure if chefs have changed or what, but today's lunch buffet was really delicious, fresh and flavorful. Chicken curry was especially on point with enough heat to be potent but not overwhelming. Butter chicken was more complex and rich, satisfying. I'll raise the star levels if they're capable of repeating today's experience.

kgUy8zVtQ7f3_Dwgc0e9BQ.text: First time Indian food diner and this did not disappoint. We also ate with a couple friends who eat Indian food regularly and said it was definitely better quality food than what they've had. Food was amazing, rich, full of spices, and left me feeling warm and light. Would definitely recommend! The dessert donut hole dish was fantasic!!

UVwtlA9vHnXCGUwwaTpDPA.text: Hands down best Indian in Las Vegas.   My husband and I just sat here and debated - 4 stars or 5 stars? I'm going with 4.5 rounded up to 5.  The reason this is not a solid 5 stars is one thing - ambiance. To give a 5 stars I'd like a better ambiance. Don't get me wrong, the place is clean, smells amazing, and plays lively music...it just needs maybe a little something extra for the solid 5th star. We make the drive from Henderson without hesitation to stuff ourselves with the tastiest Indian dishes around. If you are not a local, do not let the neighborhood deter you from going in. Go in! You will not regret it.  The Chicken Tiki Masala, Tandoori Chicken, Palak Paneer, the Chili Chicken, the Vegetable Pakora, and the fresh naan are all amazing every time we go. The people are super polite. The place is clean. Great job Mount Everest!

spPSBXY5FyW2fxwjx-fD3A.text: I've been looking in LV for great Indian food and finally found it.  We had a group of 16, the staff was very attentive, they didn't rush us or make us feel unwelcomed for staying so long.   The food was simply delicious.  I got the butter chicken-medium spice level which I should have kicked it up a notch but it was still so flavorful.  I started with the vegetable somosa which were perfect!  Get the garlic naan :-)   PS - my friend got his food at a level 10, and it was just as you can imagine.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter chicken &amp; garlic naan.

Pz7N9Bl88Zq8zoCY51K0lg.text: Butter chicken and chicken Tikka masala was amazing, garlic naan as well and our waiter was so incredibly sweet and attentive!

8ZbqqyZPZomSH5eJsxCbqg.text: I tried this restaurant for the first time on Friday night and went back again on Sunday. The food is high quality and so flavorful. The service was fantastic and the waiter was so helpful with offering us ideas on what we might like. We brought our teenage sons and they said it was some of the best food they ever tasted. This is a family owned and operated business that has been open for ten years. This is definitely going on my list of favorites.

cs1gyxUJdHTeQOgT1rJ-rA.text: Sketch hood, but the food is out of this world. The staff is professional and warm. I will brave the sketch to expirience the delicious.

djERFx4737O6Bi_OysOEYg.text: This place is awesome!! The best Indian food ever!! We had the mixed grill platter with lamb instead of shrimp. It was so good we ordered another platter of the sheekh kabob lamb!! I would recommend everyone to come here. Service is great.. my food made me dance!!! We will return soon!! Thank u guys!!

gum5sTdNrp7AYwzb4tgVOw.text: Not worth for the money you are paying. Too spicy and ambience is not that great.  It's Nepali food more over than actual Indian style .  Food is too oily and also very greasy

_fE5jy10NW44TUC4YWwMdQ.text: We were looking for an Indian buffet place for lunch, so a quick search on Yelp threw up Everest India's Cuisine with good reviews so we decided to give it a try. As usual I was skeptical of any Indian place with good reviews but decided to give it a try hoping to be proved wrong. Mount Everest is located on Sahara Avenue not too far from the strip and has sufficient parking so location and accessibility is fine.  When we entered at peak lunch hour on Sunday the place was packed which I took as a good sign. As the restaurant is small and tables are cramped close to each other so seating is very uncomfortable and navigating to and from the buffet is painful as you void bumping into other diners.  The dishes were standard fare that you will find in any Indian buffet. The appetizers included tandoori chicken, samosa and some fried potato dish. Butter chicken, saag, chili chicken and mutton curry were entrees. Then there was steamed rice and dal and lastly gulab jamun and sweet rice for desert.  Taste wise what stood out to me was that every dish was bad. Not just one or two items but everything that I ate was the text book definition of bad Indian food. Tandoori chicken seemed to be boiled and then doused with a lot of color as it lacked any flavor at all and was stone cold. The samosa seemed to be undercooked. The pan fried potato were limp and seemed to be days old. The butter chicken was barely edible. Chili chicken tasted gross and the goat in the mutton curry was undercooked so was chewy (not one person in our entire group could eat the goat). The naan provided at the table was thin and overcooked so it felt like a crispy flatbread. We asked for garlic naan which was better but it came at the fag end of the meal so it was almost useless. The gulab jamun was one of the worst that I'd ever had and the sweet rice was forgettable. I also noticed that there was no biryani in this buffet.  Service was also slow. As mentioned garlic naan was provided at the end of the meal. Plates were not cleared quickly so we ended up stacking them in one corner which made the small table feel even more cramped. Even stacked plates did not prompt quick service and at one time we were scared that the plates would topple over and cause a mess but that did not deter our servers from ignoring them.  At the end of the meal I was happy to be out of this small, cramped, claustrophobic place with terrible food. A sentiment echoed by each and every member of our group that ate here.  Price wise it was $10.99 which is typical for Indian buffet's but what I can't get is the high ratings for this place. unfortunately another Indian restaurant that did not live up to its sky high ratings. Obviously won't make the mistake of returning again.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance.
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance.
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lassi is fine.

Sk-MxXQIh_3lvuTzNE7INw.text: Went for the lunch buffet and was presently surprised by this hole in the wall place. The food was authentic and spices were just right. The naan bread was yummy! I would go back but I see they have a constant health food violation so that makes me weary.

CDKdKupke0XE2a0ZpIN-Fw.text: We found this little spot and the food was FANTASTIC!!  The owner Prakash was extremely helpful and made great suggestions for our meal. Highly recommended!! Even our kids enjoyed it!!

VRS5nXj-hQl8EHEArTvCAQ.text: Yelp took me to this place. I am a vegetarian. Food was good but they don't serve Nan instead flat bred was served. I don't like flat bread but garlic nan.

gWCc5h6cvBRZDIsvmmdPng.text: This place is amazing! $11 for a lunch buffet of all you can eat amazingness! The staff here is delightful, and very very helpful. The Bollywood videos playing while you eat are quite interesting, too.   They have traditional Indian rice, and the (Orange) sweet rice is absolutely delicious! I particularly enjoy the black lentils and the chicken tikka masala. The naan they bring to the table is wonderful to have with your meal. The place is really small, so if you want the lunch buffet I would suggest going right at 11 am or after 1 pm, as it really fills up fast!  I give this place 4 stars!

WWs1cAj7FIIWsbr36j6puA.text: Awesome food...lamb Vindaloo is amazing, the garlic chili naan, and a glass of Riesling!!!  The service is amazing, super fast, friendly and very welcoming.

pcsLKRK_ffkxvCLCQQZ-sA.text: Amazing gem of Las Vegas discovered after a day of hiking. Friendly service and fantastic food!

sXah6c0nmyNjZ27HcyiiQg.text: Best Indian restaurant in Las Vegas! Great service and huge portions. I was there with my family and we had very good experience! Would recommend to all of my friends.

jafAecy48lsKQkYzAQN3Uw.text: This place is average. The service is great. My water is always filled but the food is decent. I had better Indian food somewhere else.

2VamCyfEBs8CC3uARbsqNA.text: Best Indian in town. I usually go with the veggie korma and garlic naan if I'm ordering for dinner. The lunch buffet is such a good deal. 12 for all you can eat, and the food is soooo good. Love this place.

WoyJgBBGAu2yqGcqkru5Qg.text: Superb. I had Vegetarian Thali. Perfectly spiced and very subtle flavors. Too much food!  Very attentive service. Highly recommended

53xQzVNQefwHah4FJBlhaQ.text: I love this place. This truly is some of the best Indian food you can get in las vegas. Their lunch buffet is awesome. And the best part is they are not afraid of actually giving some heat to their dishes unlike some of the other Indian spots in vegas.   The food:  Finally some heat with my lunch buffet food. The food here isn't too spicy it has just enough heat to get the job done. You start in the vegetarian section which has some amazing dishes then move your way to the meats. I love the chicken dishes and the goat curry is one of my favorites. You then move onto condiments and desert. Make sure to grab some plain yogurt and chutney to dip your naan into.   Service:   If anything is low just let the owner know and he has them cook it right away. Service is excellent water or soda glasses are kept full. If you come in after they stop cooking for the buffet the owner will let you know when you walk in. He will also ask you to go take a look at what he has out to make sure you would like to stay.   Also don't forget if you are just driving by during the lunch buffet hours you can grab a to go box and load it up for the same price as the lunch buffet.   This place is one of my favorite las vegas Indian food spots. It doesn't quite hit the same level as mint for me but it is up there.

TGpgYPDeojKiwaUjiQ_-sw.text: Great restaurant, portions are large and prices aren't crazy. Definitely worth checking out, if you're looking for a good Indian restaurant in Vegas.

FDOIwRlAJRmOjONygFa2xA.text: Awesome Indian noms!!  I was in town for business and we wanted Indian.  This place was worth the cab ride off the strip.  Great flavor, and they offer spicy.  I always order spicy, but it never comes spicy, and this place nailed it!  Great service too. Would definitely return next time I am in town!

0Gzx5raEPttFvhn0CPOmZA.text: I came here with family based on the high 4+ star reviews it got.   The food was down right bad. Watery undercooked goat curry; tasteless chicken tikka masala; mattar paneer with no paneer; gajar halwa that needed more cooking; mint chutney that showed color and water. The only thing that they got right was the food colours :(  The ambience was fine: so it will do well with people who have no Indian cuisine experience and can't tell the stark difference between Indian food and whatever is being served here.   Lunch ended up being palak and naan (both of these were good).

Wt1xQwiggjkhOfIpYZvNEA.text: Authentic and awesome food with great customer service, an original menu and food that makes you want to come back for more.

lDFLE_MR2ZZ_fcKmNIsbeA.text: Had dinner here tonight and we shared the chicken korma, tikka masala, and channa masala. All were delicious....even the small plates like garlic naan and samosas. The medium is fairly spicy so it is plenty of heat for anyone. I'd recommend any of our dishes, particularly the korma. The owner, Prakash, greeted us and showed True hospitality which is rare sometimes in Vegas. We look forward to our next visit!

NjHFTEE_4MG8uTTyul_Omw.text: Delicious food - and the wait staff was very courteous inspite of an almost-full restaurant.

XX7d7wfytj967C67AJZT1Q.text: Wonderful service and even better food! We went with a few friends that had been several times and they recommended the tali plate. I suggest this for anyone trying Indian food for the first time, as it gives you a wonderful assortment of what they have to offer! This plate is perfect to share between two people and a level 7 was just the right amount of spice. The NAN bread was also wonderful! We tried the garlic, cheese and plain, all were deliciously perfect. Amazing staff at Mount Everest as well, never had an empty glass and they were very attentive to all of our needs. Will definitely be going back.

tgYgHwy32XmIAjFRWWEwKw.text: My wife and I drove past this run-down, ex-Burger King shack on Sahara dozens of times before we finally got over the creep factor and tried eating there. It was worth it!  The atmosphere inside won't win any prizes but the food passes the test compared to the other Indian options in town. The lunch buffet has some interesting selections you don't see very often, and overall we had a relaxing, tasty and filling weekday lunch here. We'll probably return when we don't feel like going all the way down to Mint.  The lesson: Don't judge a restaurant by its facade. Or its interior, for that matter.

xaXeybRVTfhh4t3rxlMR9A.text: I will definitely be coming back. Best Indian in Vegas. The food is wonderful and the owner is really nice. Gave my sister and I free desserts.

EdYfoqTTr15F87wWJtL-Mg.text: my first time in over 2 years since visiting Las Vegas and the food was phenomenal.  I went with my mom and we ordered the tandoori chicken, paneer tika masala, raita, jeera rice and gulub Jamun for dessert.  of course the green chutney that came with the popadoms was great in combination with everything, the chicken was incredibly tender and juicy and with all of the rich creamy flavor of the masala it was the most perfect Indian meal I've had in as long as I can remember.

lXEGPWx4i3HRyLlO6ewvPA.text: This place was absolutely amazing. Everything I tried was perfectly spiced and delicious. The honey rice is everything!!  And omg the samosas. I can't recommend this place enough!!

smDCFu5rqmP5jDWoamQcxQ.text: We have eaten here a couple of times now. Their entrees (especially paalak paneer and tarka dal) taste fresh and delicious. Garlic naan and tandoori roti were good but we won't order the onion kulcha again. Also, save your money and don't get the aloo tikki appetizer.  The reason I am not giving them 4 stars is because we did not enjoy our dinner experience last Saturday because the service went at a snail's pace and we waited for 40 mins between our appetizers and main courses!! The manager went around asking how everything was, but he had moved on to the next table before he hearing our reply. It was clear that he was doing his job half-heartedly and did not really care about his customers.

nKrSgMYKaRyeECpNU2O8Bw.text: Always excellent food and very attentive service. We have family and professional meals here and we are never disappointed. The nan is very fresh and the tikka masala is very good too.

Oh44nv2RODLM4VNBznSs7w.text: Right off, I'm very stingy with giving out stars and I'm not likely to assign any value to the outside of any place.  This restaurant is not much to look at from the outside but is a medium to small restaurant that is pleasantly decorated inside with a friendly staff.  The lunch buffet is served in some of the nicest heated tables (one iced table for the cold menu) with covered chafing dishes.  The food is kept hotter than any other buffet with dishes refreshed regularly.  The one meat table is separate from the vegetable tables, a nice feature for vegetarians to avoid cross contamination.  Every dish was delicious.  Although I would have liked to have one main potato dish (there were potato samosas and a great mixed vegetable dish with potatoes) and would drop up to half a star for the menu selection, the food was fresh, perfumed, and not overly South Indian hot.  The obligatory Tandoori Chicken was both flavorful and moist.  I suspect that the heated tables and covered chafing dishes help maintain the quality of the food.  The pakora were a little crunchy, maybe not perfect, but tasty.  Given that there are no half-stars, the only negatives were not worthy of dropping to four stars considering our overall satisfaction.  We arrived for a late lunch, around 1:30, but the food was great and refreshed before the dish was emptied, keeping the quality up.  The plain naan arrived before we were back from the buffet and I would have liked to have garlic naan, but no one asked.  I guess it is important to ask right away for naan other than plain, but the plain naan was good.  The service was fine with dishes cleared and water refilled, but a little invisible and surprisingly shy.  For any questions, just call out for them -- they really don't want to disturb your meal.  Overall, the fixtures were superior, the dining room was kept clean, and every dish on the buffet was terrific.  Not quite the huge selection found in some of the buffets in Silicon Valley, but it was all good.  Hard to believe that any other Indian buffet in Vegas will beat this spot for quality and value, this is now our go-to Indian restaurant for Vegas.

1hscuiM4z3W_pavfSEadrQ.text: It's all already been written, this place is amazing and such a good value. Hooray for Chicken Makhani and Indian music videos playing all the time!

IC01OWAhkij5BcEsbn93yQ.text: Been to ton of high end Indian restaurants spanning dozens of states and I have to say "this place is one of the best I've ever had!!!"  You HAVE to get the garlic naan. Their chicken momo's were killer and the tandoori mixed grill??  Niiiiiiice. Prakash the owner was going around to every table and talking to his clients and making sure they were happy. Great place. Great people. Great food. We are happy happy happy to recommend this great hole in the wall. Don't worry about the building and sketchy parking lot. It's home inside.

goW2_s4KFg7TlzkbfbE8tA.text: We came here for the lunch buffet and really enjoyed all of the food selections. It was also one of the best Indian food places I have been to. I Would go back when I visit Vegas again.

uewS0G3TSb-VBqo9BtI1Jw.text: Their $11 lunch buffet is amazing! Truly an amazing deal and you're really getting wonderful food at such a great price. When I arrived a few minutes after my friend, we already had a basket of fresh Naan and waters. The naan was fluffy, tasty, crispy, and just so scrumptious.  The selection was awesome!! The dishes that stood out for me were the Basmati Rice, Vegetable Korma (vegetables in creamy sauce), Vegetable Samosa (baked pastry with spiced potato mix), and Tandoori Chicken (roasted chicken marinated with spices). My absolute favorite dish had to be the Chicken Makhani (chicken in creamy tomato based gravy); oh my goodness, it was so, so delicious! Amazing flavor and it went well with EVERYTHING. The naan, rice, and even the samosas! I really liked the samosas as well because the pastry was extremely tasty and wonderfully crunchy. The potato mixture inside was also delightful. We also tried the Chicken Curry and Goat Curry, both prepared with the respective meats, tomatoes, and spices. Good, but overshadowed by the amazing Makhani! The Aloo Baingan (eggplant with potatoes) was tasty and prepared very well, but not something I loved. The last item I tried was the Chili Chicken (chicken with garlic, green chili, and onion), but I didn't like it; plus, it was way too spicy for me.  Service was really great too! Our waters were refilled quickly and frequently. We also received a Naan refill promptly. I was extremely pleased with the whole experience! This is seriously great food and I can't wait to go back!

XpBceKk75XugPtNK3Gc6-g.text: No other words other than amazing! From service, food, the owner is super humble and accommodating! Love this place and everyone who works here :)

i4EwayxHCCP4RS2opmuBWA.text: Most delicious Chicken Tandoor, Garlic Naan, papadom & pakora. Grassy vegetarian selections, too! Yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

faekyFNuAkfO3SBEDHWWVw.text: I just moved into this neighborhood and had heard a lot of great things so I stopped in for dinner. Wow. What an awesome place! I have tried a few other well regarded places but I think I found my new favorite! The lamb jalfrezi and chau chau soup were excellent! As was the garlic naan. I also liked that as a person who eats a lot of spicey food they matched my spice level request perfectly!

UXW71_Yna1mIGIM7jUc63w.text: Our whole experience was simply amazing! Wonderful food and wonderful service! Lamb Samosas, chicken curry, butter chicken, garlic naan and a special dessert recommended by the manager. My husband loved the Taj Mahal Beer. Our new spot to go on date night.

Mag8NRmAu4ZFFpshQ3c2-Q.text: Excellent food and very friendly staff.  My wife and I were searching for a good Indian lunch and found it.  They had a wide variety of vegan and meat entrees.  All were amazing. We will be back

0rb12FOnbbe0REtrZrYC6g.text: I have been to India 7 times, I converted to Hindu 3 years ago and I am even married to a girl from India.  I randomly stopped in here for the lunch buffet - it is only like 11 or 12 bucks and it is easily the best Indian lunch buffet I have had.  Don' tell my wife

4N34i0QhBrHR0ClbGbhg8g.text: Warning!!!! for cockroach!!!  I am a fuge fan of Indian curry. I found this restraint from YELP and decided to come MT indian's cuisine.  We arrived and asked a table in the corner. It was packed. First, the best boy prepared table for us forks and knives etc.. He was holding our knives from the sharp part( where we cut the meat) with his hand. And  instead of putting them on the table nicely, he actually throw the forks and knives on the table. Napkins and forks knives spoon  all were soppy on the table. It was completely unprofessional service. But it looked he didn't mean doing it. so we accepted it.  Waiters were friendly, they talked to my kids friendly too.It was nice!!  We ordered a chicken curry, tandoori chicken  and samosa. The Curry and samosas were very good! Actually it was really good.we really enjoyed it. But tandri chicken was so so. It wasn't look fresh to me. While we were eating , my husband found little cockroach walking on the wall. I was scared but we tried to tell the waiter quietly. My husband said "Now, I saw cockroach on the wall. Here you see?" He looked it and he said with not surprising face "it is hot in here so.."  Soooo???? He crushed the cockroach with the curtain on the wall. He didn't wipe and he was just said sorry there is hole in the corner so" Sooo? I asked "Hole?" then he smiled and said "no, no, it is not big hole  small hole we gonna fix tomorrow"  as we already ordered chai so we had to drink. We still tried to enjoy the chai but it was so so taste. And I checked the window glass but  there were  any cockroaches but I noticed the window glass looked so oily. I Also noticed the window counter was dusty. The Waiter brought free rice pudding. Actually it was good. My kids loved it. While drinking tea, I was remembering and thinking that  "When I arrived this restraint, I first checked the bathroom it was not dirty so we decided to eat here. But actually I was so wrong..."  ...And I came back to the reality from the thinking  And... I saw something moving in my eyesight.Something brown at my napkin on the table witch I wiped my mouth with. Yes, it was another Mr. Cockroach. I was surprised and screamed little big voice. Because Because ... I didn't expected a roach on my table. But with my screaming, No One other table were  looking at me except one couple next to us. The man asked me with serious face  " what was that ?!!" I told him quietly "I saw a cockroach". And He said " I knew it I thought I have seen one too and starting to check around his  table.  While we were talking with the man , Mr roach went to on the floor . The waiter came and asked" Is everything ok?" I told him about Mr roach was on my napkin. The waiter saw it and stepping on it with his shoe and said sorry to us.  Wow.what a experience!!! They billed 45 dollars and we put 5 dollar tips. We had worst  experience and for sure this is the last time to eat this restraint. I am writing it because I hope every restraint owner are honest. I know some restraint owners are really honest and loving their job hospitality and respectful to customers.And hard worker, clean job and good foods. My questioning is why 600 people are giving 4.5 stars??? So Mysterious!!!

V5XKFWaeStkgHHlhtu7c5g.text: I'm always coming here with my mom.... best Indian food around! I'm obsessed. The prices are fair and they also have really great mango lassis!

3xCXCEehWGZY-NOstQLqjg.text: I'm beginning to feel like all Indian lunch buffets are the same...  While good, and flavorful, this place was no different... Just about all the indian joints I've been to have the same shit... Chicken Tandoori, Saag, Lentils, Chicken curry...  Whatever... I think I'm becoming disenchanted with Indian Buffets the older I get...

ypoWbpgz1FMrVhUZUCrKcA.text: I eat a lot of Indian food and have no problem saying this is one of the best in the US.  GREAT food, prices are extremely reasonable and the staff is fantatic.  My first stop every time I hit Vegas.    Off the strip...worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_ifM8iki5g42O1oS6pvXBQ.text: Awesome Authentic Indian food.  We were bunch of Indian guys who are very finicky about Indian food. After a long tiring weekend, we wanted to have Indian food to energize.  It is the most authentic Indian food that you can taste. I usually judge the restaurant through their Yellow Dal (Dal Fry) dish as that is the most basic dish. It was simply amazing.  I loved all the vegetarian options for sure.  Would definitely go there If I am in Vegas again.

B_bHf-7Suh8edqZj7tvJXw.text: Awesome food.... Best taste of proper Indian cuisine so far in the USA... The chicken was well marinated and cooked. Spice levels were just right. Vegetable kurma too was tasty. Staff was good friendly and always with a smile....   I would surely recommend the place to all and also revisit in this trip itself

E5fjbpd-msIXum3eUM_HdQ.text: Another favorite in Vegas definitely the best Indian in town! I've been to the lunch buffet and the a la carte dinner. While the buffet is certainly worth the price I love coming for dinner so that I can order exactly what I want!   The garlic naan is a MUST. And I recommend it with some plain yogurt on the side! For main courses I really love the lamb (or vegetable) korma and the chicken tiki masala. I get both on medium (5) level and it still has a good amount of spice!! I'd say those two sauces are my favorites since I've tried others that are not as memorable to me. I don't love the chicken tikka but probably only because I'm a big sauce girl! I also really enjoy the okra vegetable dish! Full of flavor!  Though the talk of slow service is True I'd say the food is too good to pass up and don't mind the service. I also like to finish my meal with a chai tea at the end. Overall great place eating so many delicious spices just makes me feel very warm and calm on the inside I would definitely consider this "comfort food"

ZgOOhMfWtmf3Qk3lc_h2HA.text: I have now been to this place 2 times for their lunch buffet. I can't give this place 5 stars, but they are better than 4 stars. A 4.5 is what I'd truly rate this place. The vegetarian options are delicious. Don't know all the names but I can say that what I ate was definitely tasty. The best dish, however is a toss up between their chili chicken and rice pudding dessert. For very different reasons each dish is Tasty. The chili chicken has heat and a delectable blend of spices. The rice pudding is just sweet enough and a refreshing end to a meal filled with spicy goodness. If you're a fan of Indian cuisine or first timer, I'd suggest you try this place. There is something for everyone. And if it counts for anything, my Indian coworker says Mt Everest is better than mint and India Marsala.

EhvtvXadosmf5Y-GNk7Utw.text: This is my favorite Indian resto to go to. I was a little intimidated by the surrounding area but this restaurant definitely worth checking out. This is my second time here and I love the food. Chicken vindaloo and the chicken korma are very delish! My 2yr old is a picky eater and he was totally tearing up the cheese naan and chicken korma. The mango lassi is one of the creamiest drinks I ever had. The service is great and staff is very friendly. I will definitely come back for more!!

lw9OHmaJzXm7b_i0MiKFkQ.text: I wanted to stray from cuisine I was already familiar with, so I grabbed a handful of friends who were up for something new and came here after looking at some reviews. It was our first time trying Indian food, and I have to say, I do quite like it!  An $11 lunch buffet is a great price. There's a lot of room in there, and there is variety in the dishes from what I can tell. I spooned a little bit of everything on my plate and nearly everything I tried I was a fan of. The naan came, and the garlic naan was as good as everyone on Yelp had said. My friends were also fans of the sweet rice. I think it paired perfectly with the chicken curry.  The service was awesome, too! Being first timers, they were all very helpful. They made more sweet rice for us even when they were around 10 minutes away from closing and didn't hesitate to let us know what the fennel was for by the entrance. Lol. Overall, this place is a great experience for those who want to try it!

1rkKPAXNFvgeTh1rdqu9YA.text: Had dinner during Christmas week.   1) Extremely poor ambience. When we entered, it was so full of smoke. They had to keep the doors open for 10 min to let smoke out. we could not even sit inside and prefered to wait outside. This itself was a turn off but it was late in night and we were super hungry.  2) Dirty toillets, worn out carpets and dim lighting. Overall looks like a shack.  3) Bad food. I would still have given a good review if the food was ultimately good. But it was pathetic. We tried chicken and paneer and both were distasteful. we could not finish the foosd

gRoODRL8ngb4_5txswWIKw.text: Excellent!  We love Indian cuisine and this place is great. Shrimp korma was very tasty and chicken tikka masala was also great. Had the garlic naan and also a rice pudding dessert that was yummy. Staff friendly and helpful, food was out fast. Nice environment for families with kids, but not too loud for couples. A really nice night out!

K9KRCUyQ8RILxB-YtnmK2w.text: Best Indian food in Las Vegas!  What makes it even better is they offer a lunch buffet as well so you can try a little bit of everything.  I come to Mount Everest India's Cuisine at least once or twice a week.  Great service and delicious food every time!

P7DlmZOXp0lqmr_gJRRNBg.text: Upon seeing high ratings in Yelp we stopped by this place for lunch and as to our expectations lunch buffet was really good. Good amount of vegetarian options. Vegas biriyani, mix veg korma, dal makhni, samosa,pakora, saag,aalo beans, gulab jamun etc. Will highly recommend this place.

KRXaR8x4SBOO_d7C8e4xIA.text: Sorry, but I'll be a contrarian!   This place doesn't know Indian cooking! They are a Nepalese Restaurant who are a solid B- to C+ as Indian cooking.   Grilled food was unpalatable. Chicken was dry and overdone. Shrimp was rubbery, and minced lamb was mediocre.   Chicken Tikka masala was bland and watery.   Raita was not well done either.   Naans got for while we waited for the grilled platter so the owner graciously discounted one of my dishes 50%. That was a nice gesture.   The restaurant had terrible service with one untrained wait staff for about 25 patrons on 7 tables.    Overall NOT COMING BACK AGAIN and now you've been fore-warned

TNgAGVgMpi1SHzZZOqMh5A.text: Food is good. Palak paneer, korma, briyani was amazing. Pakodas and tandoori chicken were good too.  4 stars - we went on two days the menu was exact same.

StLDSS_-lV4GBB3J_4xsSg.text: As with many cuisines I am not a Indian expert at all, to be honest I have only been to two different places and I can't tell you off the top of my head specific dishes that are must have for me which is why my photos for this place aren't labeled yet cause I had to take a pic of my receipt to know what I tried .. So I will update that later (I hope)  My current S/O loves Indian which is why I discovered thiS Vegas gem..since being introduced to Indian I've decided it is a fun way to eat with people who are open to a variety of dishes.. As stated I can't tell you what you should try and get here because I'm ignorant on this cuisine .. I know from this visit that I love love their chicken Momo.. I also learned some dishes I don't like but that is trial by fire or if you dine here and the manager / server notices a pretty full plate he offers you something else to go which ... Hey  I don't know indian yet but I do feel I am very versed in good quality and amazing service ..  Price wise this place isn't cheap but I didn't find it expensive for what you get , overall it's worth the drive to come to Everest from the north side of town but if you're in the area and want some delicious yum Yum food like the masala or garlic naan check this place out !!! I've only been for dinner so I can't speak for the buffet or lunch service ..

xCrB7tzqff6J0h-oMf7R-g.text: Oh man! My fiance and I visited this place for our Thanksgiving dinner. The place was absolutely packed which is always a good sign. The service was great and although it was busy, the food came out pretty quick! Some of the best Indian food I've had! We got two orders of Naan. I especially liked the garlic one. Our meals spiced our heads off (in the BEST WAY). The prices are on point. You have to go!

E7Ygdk44CDSOjdSLfoO4Yg.text: Trust me we tried several Indian restaurants in our Vegas vocation but this one stands out for the best authentic tastes and cleanliness. We came a 2nd time in our 1 week time here, on top of it as vegetarians we had good options for us.

xYe61LaKWwdgM2EIi5dAIA.text: Amazing authentic indian food. If your in town go here its worth the trip. Its off the strip about 15 min drive. Service was good and quick.

M_K2WqrTipv8wBLercGkdw.text: "Life is just a buffet" - random girl walking by my table at the restaurant. If my life is a buffet I hope it's just like this place - cheap quality food!  So, I'm not a huge fan of Indian food. Well that's kind of an unfair statement because it was only my second time trying it. We got here about 1:30 on a Tuesday and it was pretty full which is a pretty good sign.  They bring the naan to the table and who doesn't love a basket full of naan- if you don't, then I probably don't wanna know you because it's a basket of heaven. So please move on from my review. They have a good variety of food, which is fantastic when you're trying to find out what kind of food you like! I wasn't a fan of the tikka masala that a lot of people talk about but I loved the chili chicken! I expected the tandoori chicken or chili chicken to be dry because chicken is dry a lot at buffets, but it was cooked superbly!   The service was pretty good. They're quick with taking the dirty plates and refilling the water - which is so necessary with the spiciness! All in all I'll probably be back!

MuTR6CoP3aP4ZrLvYkMXPQ.text: Loved this Lunch Buffet . Chicken Tandori so on point yummy. Loved the choices on lunch buffet and the staff just lovely!

gmEBFlOXV4QsiC6LN2Y28g.text: Come and try the butter chicken, delicious vegetarian food too. They have a buffet that is worth checking out. Great value! Authentic Indian food. The real deal. Indian beer of course too!   Yum yum.

KKRy537HIqB1Ao0l0GI2yg.text: Customer friendly staff and delicious food. Must try if you visit Vegas. Food is served hot and is fresh.  I was missing my indian chai and this place nailed it.

ZLHYvaSECHpAceyjXrtlTg.text: Buffet is not fresh. Tandoori chicken is dry. First and th he last time ever frequent this concerts lace

q0qhPZ4ZXyT9-xq--eeSiQ.text: Had the lunch buffet and I highly recommend it ($12.00). Good selection and plenty of choices for the vegetarian. Food was some of the best I've had in Vegas. The naan could use some work. It was plain and doughy tasting.  This place is small and busy. Servers were friendly while rushing around clearing plates and refilling water glasses.

DFjY0LMXKaquNr_Aj09z7A.text: I love Indian food! I always go here to get Indian food, Mount Everest has many options. Their buffet is only from 11-3pm but I love their Chicken Tikka Masala, Goat Curry and their Palak Paneer. I recommend their Mango Lassi drink and they do serve you with unlimited Naan bread. Very nice staff and the food is always delcious :)

5jEAe5KEjFxZWo2g4_TqNQ.text: Good food and friendly service. Waiters are nice and attentive. The masala never disappoints.

p2Lv6u273bF8A5a9Q9u8nQ.text: I have eaten here about 3 times now, and each time it was a good experience.  Today happened to be an even better experience, when I walked through the door intending on purchasing their to go special where you get to fill up a tray with food.  I don't necessarily know who it was, perhaps another worker, or a regular, or maybe even management or the owner--but he came up to me and offered to buy my lunch!  Shocked and caught off guard at first, but when I could put words together I thanked him!!  What a cool, generous, unexpected gift!!  Thank you so much to whoever you are, and you made a grateful customer that much more thankful!!

x8IjQxcy72oY0sPChDhhwg.text: Three out of seven dishes I tasted were yummy. Decent per plate cost. We had buffet. Lost two stars because of average/below average salad, chicken curry, mutton and desserts.

XWoPap9y-XekjLQwkzK-GA.text: Lunch Buffet Items Selected: Butter Naan Palak Paneer, Sweet Rice, Pakora, Vegetable Samosa, Aloo Baingan, Raita Goat Curry, Tandoori Chicken, Malai Kofta Chili Chicken, Yellow Dal, Chicken Tikka Masala Mango Chutney Gajar Halwa Kheer  Located on West Sahara Avenue and easily overshadowed as it sits low in the Mariana's Supermarket parking lot, Mt. Everest India's Cuisine has been serving Las Vegas a wide variety of Northern Indian specialties since 2009, the full dinner menu replaced by an $11.99 lunch buffet 7-days a week from eleven o'clock until 3pm.  Family owned and operated, the space essentially a fifty-seat box with limited lighting thanks to heavy curtains, those entering Mt Everest will pick up the scent of Cumin and Turmeric before even opening the street-facing front door, a staff member tucked into a hostess booth to the right offering greetings while one of two young men offer a choice of seating options.  A simple operation a lunch, Televisions displaying Indian Music Videos providing entertainment above steamer trays containing approximately two-dozen choices, it is with a basket of Butter Naan that the meal starts as diners gather plates and small bowls, the majority of the protein centered around Chicken though a look at the dinner menu shows a much greater variety including Lamb and Seafood.  Admittedly a little underwhelmed by the Naan, the two wedges provided flatter than that found elsewhere and a bit dry when taken on their own, the Bread nonetheless proved serviceable for scooping up tangy Raita or creamy Spinach with small chunks of springy Cheese mixed in, the vibrant orange Rice as fluffy as Basmati with a hint of Nuts and light Sugar that went very nicely with the baked Eggplant and Potato dish as well as the spicier flavors to follow.  Finding Potato and Onion Samosa's downright addictive while similarly flavored Pakora came across a bit too oily, Goat Curry was a welcomed sight that packed a lot of heat around tender bone-in chunks of Meat that proved to be worth the effort, the Tandoori Chicken varying from piece to piece in terms of moistness while the Malai Kofta ate something like big Gnocchi in a base rife with Onions and Tomatoes in a creamy base.  Drawn to the Chili Chicken against better judgement, the fear of indigestion at work looming, it was surprising how well Mt. Everest's Chefs managed to balance the Peppers with pungent notes of Garlic and Ginger, the Yellow Dal scooped up with Naan clearly the source of a lot of the Turmeric mentioned earlier while ubiquitous Tikka Masala featured big slices of Chicken Breast bathed in a sauce milder than many with a notable linger of Coconut.  Finishing off the rest of the Naan with Mango Chutney, the Jelly-like spread also a nice addition to Rice Pudding served room temperature with restrained Sugar, those looking for something sweeter should turn their attention to the hot tray of Gajar Halwa tucked amidst the savory items, the natural sweetness of ground Carrots ramped up by Fruit, Nuts and Cardamom - basically molten Carrot Cake without the flour.  ***1/2Admittedly no expert on ethnic Buffets of any sort, the low prices that attract many raising suspicion about ingredients, Mt. Everest executes the majority of its dishes well while offering a good variety at a fair price, the intrinsic limitations of serving from steamer trays mitigated by a good crowd that sees items replenished frequently.
