RPa7-BpHNGOwO_OSo9CI_A.text: I'm a huge fan of Indian food.  I know what's GOOD Indian.  I feel like I've finally find THE place for Indian cuisine.  First, this place is CLEAN.  I know this is such an absurd thing to point out, but I've seen some "not-so-clean" Indian restaurants.  Well, this one, very clean.  :)  Next, they provide a superb service.  The owner of the restaurant is very attentive and the staffs are professional.  Lastly and the most importantly, the food is excellent.    Now, I said it all.  Go try this place!

LE4Dm1AND1id0d9devmisA.text: Ordered take-out with this place for the first time at work. I love exceptionally flavored and spicy authentic Indian food.  This left much to be desired. I ordered take-out through Grubhub. The meal arrived within a reasonable amount of time and was hot upon arrival. All of the ordered meals were present. For these reasons, I gave 3 stars. The preparation of the meal left me wanting more... I ordered the Goat Koorma level- spicy, which was bland and mild. The pieces of goat were simultaneously fatty and dry.   A co-worker ordered the vegetable samosa appetizer and chicken tikka masala level -mild. She describes the flavor "as perfectly mild". I'm not tempted to try another dish here.

OYxSJrCB3uLicyB_vJ72_A.text: Hey !             Everybody Must Go!   One of my favorite place all the time including their ingredients, veggie sauces, 3 different kind of rice, curry sauce with garlic naan including you must try Mango Lassi which make your day like heaven!

3UlC9QqQvLzU81u_VxEi0A.text: 12.99$ for lunch buffet (every day from 11am until 3pm). Only things I enjoyed here and filled up on were the tandoori chicken & chicken tikki masala. Everything else was either kinda dry or funky tasting. Nothing was spicy either. Usually love getting vegetable samosas at Indian buffets but here it was way too dry. Fresh regular naan was brought to our table warm but turned cold shortly right after if you don't eat it fast enough. Also no gulab jamun (those donut holes/Indian dessert) here :( Only "sweet" option was oranges which was disappointing. Not sure if I just came on a bad day. I prefer Mint on Durango (~2$ more but worth it) or Delhi near unlv (same price as Mount Everest) since a lot more options and dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Indian buffet

SnaOxa430m6dSCR5ImuGRg.text: Friend suggested this place to us. Not on strip and hence parking available outside restaurant.   Not huge selection of good but enough and High quality. Only problem was with Naan which was not cooked properly. Could be a bad day of tandoor with us. Also, gulab jamuns were not tasting good. Nepali restaurant and hence don't expect punjabi taste here.   Service was fast and they were picking up plates as soon as you go for next round. But everything else was tasting nice. Recommended in vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BkZ-nR8zykDx0jj7zaEKig.text: We had just landed in Vegas and were pretty hungry.  After a bit of deliberation we chose Indian.  Mount Everest had a ton of good ratings so away we went.  They did not disappoint.  Not overly fancy it was a decent, comfy place with nice attentive staff.  We were brought yummy pappadum and sauces plus a carafe of water.  We decided on veggie samosa, palak paneer and sheesh kebob.    All were extremely tasty.   The samosa was gigantic.  I loved the whole thing; sherry wasn't crazy about the dough.    The palak paneer was so good!  I could have just eaten it from the serving dish.  It was served with rice.  Great flavors.  We agreed it could be spicier but there is a fine line between spicy and Hell!  We hate to cross it.  The lamb sheesh kebob was very well seasoned and good!  There was a big portion.  Veggies were a bit undercooked for me.  I would tell them to cook it more next time.  But that's me...  They also have a buffet lunch that is like to try.    UPDATE - we had the buffet for lunch today and loved it as I knew we would.  There must have been 10-12 choices plus a couple dessert options and fresh Naan brought to the table.   $12.99 per person.   Well worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palak Paneer
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Samosa
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sheesh Kebob

win165bjf9Y-GwAw7P_Cog.text: Don't understand the reviews and the ratings. It's pretty bad overall. Went in for the buffet on Saturday lunch buffet and it was about half full . I think it was representative of the quality of food .

vysHB3z8Y6YFFp9aXfn6TQ.text: Haven't felt the need to try another Indian spot since this place is that great :)  If you're coming in for lunch, it'll be a buffet, so if it's your first time, just seat yourself when you enter. Depending on when you go, can taste the difference in freshness.  It's pretty much routine for me, I stick with the tandoori, malsala and pick at the goat meat. If you're here when they open, or course it'll be fire.  They serve each table a basket of naan, so if you want more, you'll have to request it. Everything is pretty much self serve, like your typical buffet. Water is on the table, plates at the start of the buffet bar, so don't expect much service.  The seating is pretty limited. They have booths all around and tables in the center. If the restaurant is packed, expect it to be loud, what can you really expect.   If you manage to have space after eating, pick up some oranges, they are the sweetest :)

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First ones here ;)
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tondoori

3JrDrLpYjsKJXn4f7SBjQg.text: The food was A-1 and then some lol, the buffet is a great way for first timers to try a variety of dishes.  The servers are very friendly and informative. I will definitely be going back soon. The chicken vindaloo is amazing, the biryani with any protein is a must.

Zg7d9sIABdnSorj6uXupNw.text: We had seen a lot of yelp reviews about this place and definitely wanted to try it. We happen to be in the neighborhood one night and decided to stop by and we very much enjoyed it.  The waiter was very nice and helped us to navigate the menu and we appreciated his kind assistance. The food was very tasty and we had a wonderful experience here. The prices were fair, and we had this delicious chickpea breaded chicken that was out of this world and I would highly recommend to anyone, especially those who are trying to regulate their carbohydrates. It was so wonderful to find something that wasn't breaded with flour. That chicken was one of the most interesting and tasty dishes I've ever had here in town. My wife liked it as well. She was still talking about it the next day.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter chicken and Lamb something. They took the menu and I can&#39;t remember.
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried in chickpea batter. Gluten-free!!! Yum!!
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizer

nwFkPyXRUC_x6-iAEJea7w.text: What a great first experience.  We will be back.  We came for dinner.  Iswar (I am slaughtering the spelling on this) was our server.  He and everyone who we came in contact with treated us in a welcoming manner, almost like family.  This was the overarching feel of our good experience at the unpretentious Mount Everest India's Cuisine.    We are seasoned Indian food enthusiast and felt some of the tastes of the foods we ordered might have been tweaked for the American palette (some sweeter than expected like Vegetable Kormo), but overall, the food was reasonably priced, top notch and delicious.    The vegetable samosa's were the largest I have ever seen (probably another twist for the American palette) and also more potato than peas, but dough was tasty and dish was hot.  Not the best I have ever had, but good.    Naan, curry, samosa, korma, Taj beer.  These were our dishes and it was a respectable meal that felt welcoming and authentic.  Despite my small criticisms, we enjoyed the non-fancy, local feel restaurant.  The staff are sincerely nice and indeed welcoming.  Although we are not in that area of town all that often, we will make and effort to return.  We enjoyed our meal, portions were large (we took home leftovers), food was hot and tasted good and prices are more than reasonable

UfQMZBf1-KdpJouamez3xg.text: Not sure how it got 4 rating.  Might be I was there at the wrong time (Wednesday afternoon). I am an Indian and know very well how Indian food tastes. It was not even 2 star worthy food. Right from the beginning, everything was just okay or bad except Punjabi Kadhi.   I don't believe reviews of Indian restaurants by non-Indian cause their taste and our taste of Indian food is different.   Chicken tandoori- it was rubbery and feel like yesterday food.  Chicken chilly- it was rubber pieces which I did not eat at all. I cook much better chicken chilly than this Palak Paneer- by look it was like nobody touched it for days. Pakode was good. Mutton was tasteless. How can you cook mutton tasteless? Hardly a thing or two out of 20 things, I liked. Same goes for dessert. In fact, I ate lots of oranges.  Service was again very slow, the server did not fill up the water frequently or took our used plates.   Again not sure how it got good rating across platforms.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IrmIhbdObPYnXx-Bv4L-UQ.text: You would be hard pressed to find food this delicious, authentic and healthy for their AYCE price of $12.99 elsewhere. A few reasons I was beyond impressed with this place.   First, they are family owned and take great pride in their establishment. I was here with a friend for about an hour. In that time I saw them bring out fresh dishes maybe 6-8 times. Always making sure the buffet was fully stocked with fresh food. Even if a dish wasn't finished but had been sitting for a while, they switched it out.   Second, there were 2 gentlemen working the dining room, always moving, refilling glasses, bringing out more naan for all the tables, constantly clearing empty plates. They never stood still or sat down, they were always working.   Finally, to say the food was delicious would be a gross understatement. Everything was fresh, hot and so well made. Their Gulab jamun was to die for. Tandoori chicken and different curries made just right. Sweet rice with honey, basmati rice and rice with spices and chicken to go well with every dish. Excellent vegetarian options as well.   Absolutely cannot go wrong with this place and will be going back regularly! Can't beat it! Delicious, affordable, authentic!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pictures don&#39;t do them justice!!
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. always coming out with fresh naan!!
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the spinach with cheese (bottom right) was one of my favorites!!

GYaRVfIeGKC8inAXzNGTEw.text: It's a small place in the complex- I felt the ambience wasn't great - little tight seating and was pretty loud inside with the hustle-bustle of the customers. We ordered chicken momos, butter chicken, dal tadka, garlic naan, parauntha. The server was very carefully taking our order, service was good - first came the chicken momos- comparable to one's we get in Delhi (India), came with sauce but sauce was not the typical spicy red sauce but was an orangish sauce which indeed was good. Order arrived pretty quick as well and came exactly per the spice level we mentioned. Dal tadka and naan were good, butter chicken tasted a little too sweet, parauntha was dried out fast. The person taking the order inquired  about  the food thrice which was good. Overall. 3.5

Al4XjsWsW6RYXbAJdKZ7Mw.text: Had to come back and get the chicken tiki masala again. Also got the garlic nun. One of the best Indian food places I've been to in Town. I'll definitely be back again for the third time this is my second time in here now.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the inside of the dining room.
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love there chicken tikk

MCNNdl-_yZAh31po8v2ifQ.text: This place is SO GOOD. My friends and I went here for dinner after work and the food is phenomenal! We got the samosa to start which was crispy and spicy. The butter chicken, lamb tikka and the chili noodles which were all INSANE yummy. The naan is warm and packed with flavor.  Inside the restaurant was small but not packed. Atmosphere was casual with some music videos playing in the background. The employees were all really nice and accommodating. We were here along with a huge party so there was a little wait time but we didn't mind because we took our time eating as well. Will definitely be returning!

MhmBaE_-1_8DvpdRyTVrsA.text: This is one of the best Indian buffets I've ever gone to. It's not an exaggeration either.  What's great about each of the food items here on the lunch buffet is that each item has its own unique, distinct flavor. A problem that I see with some buffets is that once you have everything on your plate, it's hard to differentiate between each thing because they all taste the same or taste too bland.  Everything from the palak paneer (my personal favorite) to the lamb curry to the chili chicken was absolutely delicious. The best apart this place? They bring you fresh naan that has a nice crispy exterior that is also coated in a beautiful layer of butter.  The service is also really great. Our waters were constantly filled, which is always a nice touch.  I definitely recommend this place if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palak pameer. Chili chixken, gost curry, samosa,

2z6brWHZsPaPI-OkMR95vA.text: You know how good Mt. Everest is? You can tell by the smell surrounding the restaurant. The area around it isn't the greatest, but you know it's going to be great. The combination of their aromatic spices and decadent smells of the meat are absolutely divine. Indian food is one of those things that you just have to try. Whether you order the butter chicken, the vindaloo, korma, saag, or another multitude of great options you will absolutely not be disappointed. Specifically, I will always order the spinach saag. This spinach curry combines a creamy spinach with a blend of fragrant spices in a result unlike anything else. Pair that with lamb as the meat of choice and your saag is now extremely hearty. Additionally make sure to order the garlic naan to eat with your food. It'll make it that much more amazing. And as a dessert the mango lassi. This yogurt drink is light and sweet and will let your food settle while not over-encumbering your stomach.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Saag
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Jal Frezi
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Lassi

gFU6roTnCgtwOmHR7BYKNg.text: Service was good, personable staff. Aloo Gobi one of the best I've ever had. Butter chicken had some bone in the chicken which I didn't like. Samosa was not great.  Place could use some cleaning, it's not a place my wife would enjoy.   Still, if you only care about service and food, I would recommend you try.

riB6skC2WdRchvoQsCOS8A.text: I came her for a lunch buffet with my friend and the food wasn't bad but everything was warm and not hot. There was only 2 people working so they were busy but at first we weren't sure if we should just get up and start getting food but everyone else did so we followed. We didn't get to pick our naan like we can at Mint but the naan came out quickly and was piping hot. It wasn't too sweet and was perfect to soak up the sauces. I grabbed a little of everything but my absolute favorite was the chicken Marsala. The lamb was a bit too gamey tasting IMO. A lot of the dishes were really salty and there was not much meat left... I'm not sure if it's because we came around 1 or if they don't refill everything as quickly as other restaurants.   My friend ordered a mango lassi and he said it was good but they forgot his order and we received it towards the end of our meal. For the price, the lunch buffet isn't bad and there's a good selection of vegetarian and meat options but I just thought everything was too salty for my taste and I had to dig around for meat instead of bones.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oBeH_hJe99FVCumQPg3quA.text: Chicken vindaloo is incredible. The manager gave us a great personal touch and recommended dinner. We tried both the cheese and garlic bread, and my friend had chicken makhani. The vindaloo melted in my mouth and the makhani sauce was superb over rice. Incredible place to have my first time eating Indian food.

uhBuEf90O5EBwAKBRmBCZA.text: I love this place. I love how every time I need another refill it has already been done. They have this chilli chicken dish which is little pieces of chicken covered in their special chilli sauce and cooked for long time to become delicious as it is. I have been trying to find a great Indian place for a while and this one does it for me. I love the service here and will continue to come back.

7IDuFnkW-Ezi-aEnMkNZHA.text: Been back pretty much once a week and everything is good as always. Food is always hot and fresh and never dried out. Prakash always gives me extra paneer when they're out. Nice guy.

xh1Zu08r68jJQkxfxmTidg.text: I was looking for Indian take-out so I went to Yelp.   This place is out of my way, but I thought I would check it out.  I am glad that I did. I called ahead and ordered take-out. 30 minutes later when I arrived it was not ready.  It took almost 10 more minutes.  OK.  Now I know, so that is fine.  I ordered the lamb korma and garlic naan.  Woah.  Portions are for sharing.  I saved some for the next day and it was even better.  The large chunks of lamb (which I had to cut in half) were tender and tasty.  The sauce made me realize how much I missed Indian food.  The jasmine rice was perfectly done.  The garlic naan - delicious!  I saw there is a lunch buffet and plenty of seating. Maybe another day I will do the lunch buffet......   thanks to everyone who yelped on this spot.  I found a new Indian take-out spot.

yg8cR222QmU_rh3qFW246Q.text: Awesome authentic Indian food. Ambience is not that good but the food is just great. One of the best in US

VzOxCfUeWqV5WfmToJxLqg.text: Too much food. The two of us only ordered some naan and two entrees and we left super full. Very yummy though.

Jk_NbMXbkLWKU4Y-7Pnm2A.text: Great food! The food here was really good and I went home with my tummy full! This is the best Indian food we have eaten in America and the service is good too. Its a family resteraunt and the food is delicious. I would recommend this place to Indian food lovers.

kxGiWF4zfpDmy3ZZonJYqw.text: DOWNGRADED  went back yesterday for the lunch buffet and it was seriously disappointing.   the food wasn't as good as it use to be (before the place got popular). the food seemed to lack the love and attention it use to receive.  much of the buffet items weren't even refilled, one of them just had sauce left, ALL THE MEAT WAS GONE. (f.y.i i even checked before i left to see if it was refilled and still NOTHING.)  service wasn't all that great either. the owner was busy on the phone the whole time, didn't give much attention to his customers.  what was good before WCAP (went cheap after popularity): + we use to be seated and now he just points to a table for use to go to. + we use to get our water refilled without having to ask and now i have to wave down the waiter.  + we use to get the bill brought to the table, now we have to go up to the cashier + the rice pudding dessert use to actually have the consistency of pudding and now its super runny  FINAL NOTE: you can try this place if you've never tried it before, its not horrible but it wasn't what it use to be. BUT if you have ate here before, stay away or you'll be just as disappointed in them as i was. (never going back, goodbye mt. everest)

9cbF1zRtEU5oWnvpAQ3lOQ.text: Mt. Everest's food is good. It covers Indian cuisine from different parts of India, which is nice. The lunch buffet is HUGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGE! Like waaaaaaay tons of options. I like that they have sweet rice, because that makes me think of my mom's sweet rice, and well nostalgia makes everything taste better. They have a nice selection of meats too. I've NEVER seen a lunch buffet serve goat meat. Gotta give the props on that one. The naan is fresh and fluffy. I like that they give you both plain and garlic naan. Their roti is decent. Overall, it's a good option when home-cooked Indian food isn't happening.

ax5GlhDcKC_MgUSsY-ouYA.text: Wow, I'm going to be the black sheep here and give this restaurant only two stars.  When my husband and I entered for lunch a few days ago, the manager or owner was talking on the phone.  We stood by politely waiting, until he pointed us to sit *with his CHIN* - the phone still strapped to his ear, never once addressing or welcoming us to sit by words!   I was surprised, but didn't say anything.    The restaurant itself was really dark inside, there were no lights turned on at all, just a little natural light coming from the small heavily curtained windows.  Nice surroundings and kind interactions make food taste better in my line of thinking, so this restaurant just failed in these respects.     The buffet itself was fine, nothing was amazing nor was anything bad.  After we sat with our food, the same manager brought a basket of naan and actually TOSSED it down onto our table as he walked by without even making eye contact with us, still jabbering away on his phone.   My husband and I just looked at each other and laughed, it was that bizarre!  Needless to say, I will not be going back.  There are other Indian buffets in town that serve great food, have an inviting ambiance and treat me like a valued customer.

V0KIwz_mKe9LyUE8g7NDFg.text: first let me say I'm not a Vegas guy, if i never came back here I'd be happy. and trying to get a decent affordable meal on or around the strip is a nightmare. if you're being wined and dined, then by all means, have the sales manager take you to whatever over-priced Bellagio restaurant you see fit.  if, like me, a great meal in a quiet place is what you're after, run, dont walk, to Mt. Everest. Prakash and the fellas serve up some of the tastiest Indian cuisine I've ever had.   don't let the neighborhood (it's quite safe) or the former pizza hut exterior deter you, as soon as you walk inside it feels like an oasis. and the delicious smells of curry and tandoori greet you.  the chicken tikka, served sort of fajita-style, was tender and delicious, and spiced to perfection. the saag paneer, one of my favorite indian dishes, was savory and so inviting that i kept going back to it as i "filled in the corners" at the end of the meal, when i'd already eaten too much. we also had their lamb curry which was not a ground lamb curry but featured a generous portion of cubed lamb shoulder perfectly cooked and tender.  this is my new go-to spot in this ridiculous town. Mount Everest is fabulous!

DIFunE6nYV52zBF3mq2Gig.text: My friend and I were looking to save a few dollars in Las Vegas, little did we know that this would be a meal that would give any meal on the strip a run for its money!    The owner, Prakash, was very welcoming.  I had the chicken curry and my friend had the chicken tikka masala.  We also had an order of garlic na'an and cheese na'an.  First off, the garlic na'an was tremendous on its own, with great garlic taste.  The cheese na'an really shined in the masala sauce.    As for the entrees, both were full of flavor and well spiced.  Plenty of chicken, and the sauces were great!  We both ate more than our fair share, and that was before dessert.    I really appreciate the warm atmosphere, the great food, and the fantastic taste of this place and would return in a heartbeat.

lfVvabEhtn-qi0on05yMSA.text: Modest atmosphere - great food.  I went with a couple of friends while in sin city. Garlic naan - fluffy and garlicy - yum. Samosas - solid not amazing. Mint & tamarind chutneys were really good. Chicken tikka masala - outstanding Chicken Kardai - really good Lamb vindaloo- great flavor - lamb a bit tough. Saag - great flavor. Rice - nice. Owner couldn't have been nicer. His son even drove us to the closest hotel to catch a cab because it would have been more than 30 minutes for one to come. Get off the strip and get some real Indian grub here.

wOY7ZwaybQBVsX6WWqoYDw.text: SUPERB!!!!! This food was so full of flavor and the owner and his son were wonderful hosts! We were in vegas for my birthday and I was craving Indian food so I looked on yelp and found Mount Everest. When we first arrived we were greeted with a smile and seated right away. Just by reading the menu we knew we were in for an amazing food experience. We ordered somosa, chicken tikka masala, and tandori chicken. The food was absolutely outstanding! the spices and flavors were a little spicy but too good to not eat!! Since we left Vegas I have been craving the same experience but have not been able to find something remotely close. Literally, THE BEST INDIAN FOOD I've ever had

J_45sZOYYeK9o01lPDBGiA.text: The tandoori chicken, yellow curry and naan is great! I'll be back!

6t18ncXwqKQLgnJPmVDI8Q.text: The outside of the restaurant does no justice to the restaurant. If I had not read the reviews, we would turn and drive away. I have been here for Buffett and it was pretty good with a very nice lamb curry. Tonight we are here for a take out. Unfortunately we waited for over 30min for our food. Like all Indian foods, the potions are surprisingly small during dinner specially if you are used to Indian buffets. The quality of the food is good. Overall I rather go to Indian when they have Buffett.

-d02WOptdcbN6JNclOcepQ.text: We were here for dinner the first time.  Food is delicious, service is good especially the waiter named Sujan who provided excellent and professional recommendations.  We did enjoy our night here.

fC6pItvbQ5h01xyY6WMQlA.text: Mt. Everest is the highest mountain on Earth; in terms of indian restaurants in Las Vegas.... this is that one!

RnTGg8z3Wj_0eCPDQ0yPsA.text: Don't judge a book by it's cover! The outside may appear to have been a former fast food joint, but inside you will find a great Indian restaurant with a good selection of Indian dishes. Lunch time prices are reasonable and the establishment got pretty busy within minutes after opening. Good sign! My wife and I were impressed with the selection from the saagaloo, to the chicken tika and tika masala. This restaurant is about 2 miles west of the strip near Palace Station Casino (The Casino where OJ finally got arrested). This Indian restaurant as well as Taj Palace, located in Henderson, are my two favorite Indian restaurants.

ZIzIwqExsOFEveLe0XNQHA.text: We went here for dinner about a month ago.   We had the samosa chat for an app (cubed samosa with yogurt and mint sauce). It was good but I'd probably try something different next time. Seems like it's made out of leftover samosas.  We also got raita which was good but a little tarter than I like. The garlic naan was yummy.   For main courses we had prawn biriyani and mateer paneer. The prawn biriyani was tasty though the rice was on the al dente side. The matter paneer had a nice sauce.   The dinner was good overall, but there are better Indian restaurants in town.

NeTE6kVpU-2kDZHgb_22yQ.text: If you are around vegas and craving for indian food, this is the go-to place. Food is delicious and very balanced menu for buffet. Goat curry was too good and overall it was worth our time and money chosing this place for lunch. I must also mention about the quality staff who were so cool. Great going and keep up the good work.

KXDG6xXU04awPPYQb9Gl2A.text: One of our favorite Indian restaurants in LV. We especially love their chili paneer. We usually order with spicy level around 6-7 and the food is very flavorful but not overly spicy hot.

mw6CA_B2tHOtfwuQt55Dxw.text: Excellent!   Our host was very nice and service prompt.  Food was excellent!  They did not hover over us like some places but we did not go wanting either.  No complaints.  We will be back!

UPHwyv716DTjZB5GMbXvFw.text: Food was tasty and I really look forward to having the lunch buffet.    We ate all the things!

XABifw7cNkr-GtCO_70Mag.text: Such a great Indian restaurant right off the strip!!. Has the best buffet lunch for a very low price!!. High quality food and great service!.

ePNR7Hc8SmZeOIJbg9P06w.text: Average food. Service was bad. Dirty Plates (buffet) were not removed promptly.The guy on front was polite but he gave us the check before we were finished. I thought that was rude.

HFqiqkmzOFFbx6kQczALDw.text: The absolute BEST Indian food in Las Vegas plus personal, friendly service. One of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.

vt-vt-uR7_O4mKzAc1_fcg.text: Excellent food  and wonderful people we love the lunch buffet. The service is excellent and the choice are varied

dKCC24cYqtddzS2Z7aaq2A.text: This is the best Indian restaurant in town. Parkash is the owner, who is wonderful and very attentive to his guests. We have a hard time deciding which dishes to get. It's always hard trying to decide between the Biryani, saag korma and tikka masala. So we usually end up getting 3 dishes!

dnFLyKXm0P5eJRExgHGnaA.text: I am visiting from the Bay Area and found this on Yelp.  The restaurant inside looks OK and the staff was very friendly.   The portions of the food were very good.  We ordered the onion Bhajia, Chicken Tikka Masala, and Beigen Bertha.   The appetizers were great and eggplant was outstanding.  The chicken tikka lacked flavor.  I was a little bit caught off guard with that since that typically is a signature dish of Indian food.  Don't think I would come back here again I would rather try some of the other Indian restaurants in the area.

nK21Bzak30Wq2hnV30GgWw.text: Every year I come to Vegas at least once.  And every time I'm in town I make a point of eating at Everest!  Highly recommend their appetizer sampler, garlic naan, any of Tikka Marsalas, Curry's, and especially the saag / palak paneer.  Medium to hot spice is amazing.  Best Indian food I've had, and I travel to India on business!

9kXBb4_xYzKB3jN4pLIokA.text: Food was absolutely delicious. Herbs and flavors really came through; fresh, not salty. Naan was perfect - light and fluffy and crispy. Complementary papadam before the meal.  Daal soup was spicy and satisfying. We ordered two seafood and two paneer dishes; all were excellent.   Our server was friendly, as was the owner, who came over and introduced himself and asked about our meal. Overall, a very good experience. Definitely lived up to their excellent Yelp rating!

euHbzW-0jj-3f58xYJXULQ.text: The food at this place is amazing but that not the best part! The customer service is even better. Every one try the different naans and obviously got to have the paneer tikka masala !

sg6D2E7aCSfxNAIGZb3g1w.text: Food was amazing loved the roti #amazing  The servings were amazing free refills on rice #UHMMYESPLEASE

De5MYlxN93v5P6FVkWbNgQ.text: Nepalese veg momos were great! Loved their dal soup and jeera rice. Rice could have been cooked a little more. Rotis were good but had too much butter on them and very hard. But their mixed veg curry was good accompaniment.

9_2zvKxTfGxjJzBylp0dTA.text: Kadai paneer , chilli garlic naan were top of the world. It was spicy and delicious.   Area of improvement- garlic naan was think and undercooked . Also , kadai paneer can go easy on cloves .

FWvSuQAi9e-Y_Tnqi3-qfg.text: My husband and I absolutely LOVE Indian food and we eat out quite frequently. We found Mount Everest via a Groupon we had purchased. It wasn't too far from home so we made an evening out of it. At first we found it interesting how the restaurant seemed like a renovated Burger King but that didn't matter as at least the building was being re-used instead of sitting empty or knocked down.  We were taken aback by how wonderful the food was. The Lamb Saag, Chicken Vindaloo & a vegetable dish is always our main staple. Every time we go in the owner (I think it's the owner) Prakash greats us and recognizes us. It's very nice to know he cares about his guests and treats them with respect and makes us feel special.  We've tried several other Indian establishments, and although they are good and offer a nice experience we always seem to compare them to Mt. Everest. I guess when the bar has been set high it's hard for others to compete with quality. Well done Mt. Everest, you have loyal guests for life.

qzkHSHaG3WpW-TdEGJq_bw.text: So far, This place is the best authentic Indian food in this town. Recommended by my friend, decided to check it out. Service was good, staff was friendly and food was bomb! For apps we had the veggie samosa which was stuffed with their indian spices. For dinner we had the garlic nann and the butter chicken. Spice Level 3! Just dipping that garlic naan into that spicy curry was bomb AF! This will be my new spot when I crave Indian.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Samosa (left) and Butter Chicken with Garlic Nann (right)

OkoPTlRdvRiMJMyi4JwKZw.text: This was a nice little find off the strip. We came for the lunch buffet which was $10.99/person.   BUFFET ITEMS:Vegetable korma, yellow daal, chana masala, vegetable samosa, sweet rice, basmati rice, vegetable pakora, chicken tandoori, chili chicken, chicken makhani, chicken curry, goat curry and the BEST part was that they had my favorite GULAB JAMUN!!   The chicken curry was very flavorful, it had a great balance of creaminess and spices. It also contained big chunks of chicken which is what most people tend to skimp on (abundance of protein is always a plus in a buffet dish). I was surprised that they had goat curry (gamey stuff is not my cup of tea so this one I did not try). The gulab jamun were little balls of perfection.   SERVICE: our server was very attentive and quick to refill our glass of water.  I subtracted a star b/c although the gulab was legit, they only had the gulab and rice pudding for dessert. There was no mango pudding or the carrot halwa the sweet carrot dessert, but I guess you can't have everything. I also wasn't a fan of their naan that they offered. A good naan has a little bit of crispiness and SOME flavor. This NAAN HAD NO FLAVOR whatsoever and was very thick and heavy. It was more of a PITA than a NAAN.                     For $10.99, I would come again.

1JCikAvzbX3MCYWe4CWgiQ.text: Great lunch buffet. Amazing flavors on all dishes. I love their little doughnuts and I don't recall how to pronounce them. Staff is very courteous. Second time dinning with them. Bring some friends and enjoy!

KS7JIFSTm2Ruuj5T1b63Zw.text: After talking about Indian food with Doriee D and Andrew C we decided to check this place out the next day for their lunch buffet which runs from 11 am to 3 pm daily. I usually like to order off the menu at places like this but for some reason it seems like Indian places in Vegas prefer to do buffet only for lunch. After seeing a bunch of positive friends' reviews of this place we figured it was a fairly safe and solid choice  Given the time we arrived, I'd say the buffet was still fairly full since the lunch buffet ends at 3 pm, however, we never saw it refilled while we were there. On my first plate I tried a little bit of everything which meant I had a pretty full plate to work through. The stand outs were the curry chicken, tandoori chicken, and chili chicken, which had a little kick to it. The veggie samosa and sweet basmati rice were ok...and are probably an acquired taste. Fresh naan was brought to our table and it was warm and delicious! Not burnt, old, or cold like some other places. After the first plate I was already pretty full and just got seconds of the chicken dishes I liked.  We wanted to try their milky balls =P for dessert but they were all gone by the time we were done eating so we had to settle for the sweet rice pudding instead, which I believe is called kheer? For $10.99 for an AYCE buffet the food was decent and I would come back the next time I have a craving for Indian food.

IMoXWpGre9Af23pMPApHiA.text: This restaurant is a little further from my house than I usually travel but I was recommended by a friend from out of town and I'm really glad I came, I decided I would put a review on yelp before I had finished my main meal!   While I waited I was given water and poppadoms which kept me ticking over until my main meal arrived. Even though I was alone I was given a booth and made to feel at home despite the restaurant being crowded.   I ordered lamb biriyani, keema, plain rice and garlic naan. Everything was amazing! It was far too much for me alone but I like to take leftovers home for the next few days. The biriyani was particularly flavorful and with lots of meat which is lovely! It's really hard to find keema in the USA at restaurants and this was a treat for me so I added as an extra... Tastes wonderful and authentic! And the portions are an excellent size.   I had both rice pudding and gulab jaman for desert and both were delicious. It's really unusual for me to be so pleased with every aspect of the meal, but this was above and beyond what I was expecting.   The restaurant is clean and tidy and the staff are kind and attentive to your needs. The owner, Prakash was very keen to receive feedback and see if there was anything he could do to improve my meal. There wasn't! It was really a perfect meal and I'm a curry snob / takes a lot to please me!!! Oh before I forget I highly recommend the garlic naan! Very fresh and fluffy and tastes just like it should.   I will be a regular customer, I am pleased to have been recommended!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gulab jaman (I ate one before I took the pic!)
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rice pudding
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic naan, keema, lamb biriyani

tG926oWbm8m597xdkP8GKA.text: Of all the Indian places in Vegas... this is a frequent stop for me! I am pretty stuffed and satisfied everytime after dining here.  The restaurant seems like a family owned business and the customer service is wonderful!! They are super nice, friendly, and seem easy to get their attention if you need anything. There's also a TV playing in the corner with current Indian movies with plenty of bollywood dancing and hip current Indian music.    The usual dishes we order are:   - appetizers: vegetable pakora and samosas, thinly spiced cracker (don't know the name of it - sorry)  - main dishes : tandoori chicken, palak paneer, chicken korma, chicken makhani, lamb curry (rogan josh)  - sides: garlic naan and rice  The appetizers are very tasty and a good size that come with a mint jutney sauce and a spicier sauce.  All the main dishes are very good also.  Warning though, if you ask for spicy... these dishes can definately make you sweat like a banshsee!! just ask my bf!! I like them milder and ask for mild or a level "3" and they are delish.  Maybe "5" or higher will be too spicy and possibly not enjoyable... but up to one's palate.  The tandoori chicken comes out on a sizzling plate and the chicken is so tender and tasty, always a safe bet.  The chicken makhani (butter chicken) is my absolute favorite! The korma and curry are pretty rich in spices and have very distinct flavors to the dishes.  I think the palak paneer is alright but reminds me more of creamed spinach - so maybe a pass.    This place is small and cozy but usually hopping with customers.  The food may come out a bit slower when they are busy but it's worth the wait.  Always happy with the food and service here that makes me keep coming back for my Indian food fix!!  I really need to come for the lunch buffet which looks like a great deal for the same food.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V_swr05ZC6UWwFSi9uKeGg.text: Great food. Ordered a paneer and chicken main. Was really a different taste and delicious. Paneer mains was prepared different than ever eaten elsewhere. Well packaged for all preparations and also followed all instruction through Ubereats. Highly recommend for around 30 mins delivery.

0qiaaKyJ5seiTk4QU7HVGg.text: This place is really good. It's always consistent and you can smell it coming in.  Delicious!

2eXXepuC5JU9hzHN_A7XiQ.text: I was here on Sunday 6/21/15 I always come here when I'm real hungry remained me the days that I was traveling in India n Napal back in 2006 Food smalls N looks good,delicious,  Great service,great food,thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reasonable prices too,check for 3 ppl
