PMsUsKfr3OIX1UKHx8q55Q.text: A little underwhelmed by the much-hyped Chicken Tikka Masala. Ordered take out, added on the garlic naan and galub jamon. Specified a spice level of 5/10 for my 'tikka and order was out in 10 minutes flat, with a large side of basmati rice.  Chicken tikka masala was a good size for the $13 price tag, which included the rice. Garlic naan was worth the upcharge: delicious, soft, and flavorful, with a garlic scent that wafted through my car as I drove home.   My disappointment came when I finally tried my entree. For a spice level of 5, I tasted absolutely no spice. And the sauce had a sweetness to it that I am not familiar with. It wasn't necessarily bad, but the dish didn't have the kick to it I was craving.  Chicken in dish was in large chunks, sauce was a smidge on the thin side.  Based on other reviews, I'm going to have to come back for the lunch buffet and reevaluate.

QCBu-ckosqOlQTZhOveWDw.text: I don't understand the 4.5 stars this place has. Granted lunch buffets are not a good representation of an Indian restaurant, but the food was bland. Not worth it.

Qxx1jnS7yTXLDyVulqpFoA.text: Great food amazing staff and lots of parking and seating for families  We ordered a variety of dishes and starters along with desert. Must visit if u like indian food.

dP6AT1hgBBXjV51HBQz6aQ.text: If you're in the mood for some authentic Indian food & spice this is a place to go... The food is absolutely fantastic down to the  Naan bread- spices are True to scale & flavors are on point!  The location doesn't look like much when you first pull up; in fact might find yourself questioning your choice, but trust me you will get over it as soon as you try the food.  Also, this is a very family oriented restaurant, so bring the kids and whoever else in your family tree. -B

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Naan, Chicken Tikka Masala, &amp; Prawn Korma...

hSrSQtwrac8GgIqyl73lQQ.text: Good food. Nice people quiet and clean. And not to pricey. Lunch buffet was good.  Definitely going to be back.

ESDGS8uWIfW3AtjQN5eIqw.text: It's average north Indian food. Giving 3 star as food items are very usual, some chicken items weren't looking fresh.

tgjZymDHmLtJFQhKiySN4w.text: Well first the food is fantasic. Everything I'm in town I try my best to stop in for a meal. Probably one of the best Indian restaurants I've come across in my travels. The service is always exceptional but tonight they went above and beyond. I can't remember the last time left the hotel with my wallet but tonight it happened. They offered to let me come back and pay tomorrow but I was able to go back to the room and get my wallet. I appreciate the service it was above and beyond.  If your in town make sure to stop by for a great meal!

_8yFZ5IWY4ysTKjeS0Qq1A.text: Some of the best Indian food I've had in a while! Being new to town, we stumbled upon this place driving around. Not much to look at from the outside but the food was very good. We arrived at lunch time so decided the best course of action was the buffet so we got to sample a large variety.   Of note, the dishes used good quality cuts of meat (no nasty gristle surprised when you chomp down), service is good, and the flavors in the dishes are great. The only negative thing I can come up with is that the naan bread is a little "bready" for my liking.  I'll definitely be back and would recommend it to new and old Indian food eaters.

OU2eGOu5zNRXeY_cQFoM8A.text: My friend and I just ate the lunch buffet here, honestly I was blown away! This place is great from the chicken masala to the mint sauce.. I was hesitant because a lunch buffet doesn't usually sound appetizing but they hit home! Thanks for a great meal, we will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sBNGq_NcYn8db4wi5rRl8w.text: Best Indian buffet I have ever had. Price was very fair and the employees are super friendly. Its our new stop when we comw to Vegas.

ubmEPhiONoDFau-Rd7msQA.text: This is a really good restaurant, service is good, owner is very friendly. With my parents visiting from India this place provided a good option for food, we came here twice, once for dinner and second time for lunch buffet, we enjoyed food both times especially the naan.

2j8r3yNvGFVUlaEcywScNQ.text: By far some of the best customer service I have ever had. We got the mix grill plate and the chicken was a little on the spicy side for my son, so the owner brought him some Chicken Tika Masala just for him and it was a hit. My son usually hates anything with sauce, but this was a winner. Food was awesome.

zWTT8vjKpOWQcfKftV7FCQ.text: I really enjoy this Indian restaurant.  The owner always greets the customers with a smile.   Wonderful Indian food, very consistent.  I also like the lunch buffet.

gfDeIiFpd39Go8GvLfQicw.text: Can't believe I haven't reviewed.  The awesome guy I order from called me out on it today -  considering how often I come to this joint,  it was time for their five stars.    Attentive service.  Solid Indian food.  Wonderful lunch buffet.  Great to-go service.  I'm never disappointed with my visit. Sad they simplified their menu.  It's super simple to point and order,  but I do miss seeing the full name of what I'm ordering.

gYlBoy1_FGgzzyU4IwdmZg.text: I was wondering if part of my less than "a-ok" experience was the result of dining alone. I often find that single diners don't get the same quality of service as larger parties - I've always thought that this is due to the lower expected tip - who knows.   In this case I ordered an appetizer, soup, and main course, but the soup came out first and while I was about 3 spoonfulls into the soup, the appetizer and main course arrived.  Of course, by the time I got to the main course it was cold.  When the manager visited the table to ask me how things were, I told him how the food had been served and his response was to smile and walk away.  Otherwise, the service was prompt and pleasant.  I had lamb filled samosa for appetizer which was overcooked and the meat dried out.  The Dahl (lentil soup) was watery and tasteless, and the $12 dish of lamb curry had about 7 small chunks of meat hidden in a lot of sauce.   For $2 extra I got about 2 tablespoons of chutney and another $2 for an equal amount of spiced pickles.  The best part of the dinner was the onion stuffed naan.  Mount Everest could be mistaken, both inside and out, for a fast food joint, except for the white cloth napkins and tablecloths.  Again, if 3 stars means A-OK, then this place should be 2 1/2 stars for Just OK.

i9zwkHCR_L51zUqgemYA1A.text: Went in for buffet and food was so so. Some of the dishes looks like not even fresh. After eat all some food colors left in my hand. Would not recommend to go again.

68fWxbgyRmFUn9GS6TfGNg.text: Love this place!  Awesome lunch buffet!   Don't let the outside fool you.  This place is nice!  Food is fresh.  Good.  Service great!

r-iqFQx9kkqmXgESrXQvkg.text: I am just wondering how this place got more than 4 stars!!  We were in Vegas last week and were craving for good Indian food, this was the first Indian restaurant that popped up in the search and had pretty good reviews which we trusted. The experience was far from good right from the start with bad/dirty ambience and sloppy service to food that tasted nothing like it should.   This was one of the worst Indian food that I have had in US.

nbnbwjOnJyx7E5HaON4tqg.text: I am a regular here. Best value for an Indian lunch buffet. The Naan never disappoints, try the garlic naan Most of the food is somewhat spicy as it should be. The owner doubles as a waiter and even with 6 tables and 8 booths the service is still excellent and he also works the register.

6l0ITMeC0JPKXsT1r1zxgw.text: My husband and I have eaten Indian food across the country they and world, and this was definitely the best we have had.  We had the lamb tikka masala, vegetable pakora, vegetable korma, and naan.  The sauces were very rich and flavorful, and the level of service was beyond what I ever imagined.  The servers were highly attentive.  The prices were lower than what I expected before dining, and having dined there, I can tell you that you get immense value in food quality and dining experience here.  I hope to visit again while I am out here.

p3QFXIkt1mAAzsmTDtwgZA.text: The portions were larger than we expected, the mango lassi was delicious, and they have a huge variety of dishes on their menu. :)

unucsnaP5h_Eb4M7eOATpw.text: Best Indian Food in Las Vegas!  I lived in England for a while where Indian food was predominant and I am so happy to have found this place in Las Vegas.  Service is also great!

8YQX8Kan_9j7B953D6RudA.text: I had dinner here tonight.  It was my first visit.  I had the Lamb Saag and an order of Garlic Naan.  I really enjoyed my meal.  I asked for it to be spicy.  It was a little mild for me, but it was still very good.  I'll be back to try the lunch buffet to get a mix of their food.

lBOwLil_aTFeo1CYDF0U8g.text: I love Indian food and am able to cook most Indian dishes being an Indian from Singapore. Occasionally, we will eat out and my first choice is Mount Everest India's Cuisine. Why? The service rendered by Prakash is worth mentioning and he caters to our every needs. Thank you Prakash for excellent service and delicious food. Love the tea too..

HgqudvE_BoBQj2rGEyx-tA.text: Absolutely delicious. Best food in Vegas!!! EVERYTHING we had was delicious. There were six people on our group and ALL of us were very happy with the food and service. Every dish was perfect.

p1A0gJcg0p-G1S8t_Ih-yQ.text: Saw the previews, went to try it out last night. Good was good but the price was kinda high compared to the taste of the food. Overall, it was great!!!

hmB2BDSbsTMqeDP3RBzGkw.text: Great food! And better yet, great service. A great alternative if you want to get away from the strip. Trust me I was skeptical at first, like you, who is currently reading this (4th wall) but it was worth the risk. Excellent Indian food.

ZgTW8zYtv9lTxrtG5goUYQ.text: Food was no good. There were lots of indian customers inside. Is it a sign of good Indian food? For our taste, not good at all. Couldn't even find a spicy dish! Find another place in LV!

FsM3otCSt17DWi0d2736zA.text: After having a first bad experience with Indian food many years ago, I was a little hesitant to try Indian food again.  When my family came into town, they were craving Indian food.  As driving around the neighborhood, we happen to come across Mount Everest. This was my first trip to an Indian restaurant in Vegas since living here. Upon arriving, we were greeted with quick and prompt service. All the workers there were very kind, and quickly assisted us with whatever we needed.  We tried out their lunch buffet.  My family knew what they wanted to eat, I, on the other hand, was taking my time as to not knowing what I was eating nor I didn't know half of what the dishes were.  So, I kept it plain and simple and had the chicken tendoori, basmati rice, and also tried their stew.  All was good.  My family enjoyed each dish they got and loved every meal they ate.  I came back again the second time around this time with a friend.  We actually both enjoyed our meals.  I kept it simple again, ordering the usual, the tendoori chicken with basmati rice.  My friend ordered some chicken curry dish also with rice.  We both had the plain naan and it was very good.  My friend and I would come back again to Mount Everest and perhaps try other dishes that they have to offer.

dR9-45ezJkYRYYA9Gow0Sw.text: Roti's were softest ever and buffet items were decent.  I am giving one star because of the rudeness I received. We wanted to order from menu and we were told there is a 15$ minimum per head including kids for ordering.  This is after the waiter asked us if we wanted to order, owner/manager came and told us that there is such a minimum and thats why they provided buffet(kind of telling us we cant afford 15$ per head luxury of ordering from menu).   So if you are desperate for food, go here.

D8PY_U0i56YSDSeN2UGOhw.text: Used a Groupon deal here. Wasn't sure it was good for the Thali, which if you go to an indian restaraunt is your best deal. You get a bit of everything. Like previous reviewers, this place is owned by Nepalese. When you drive up it looks almost like it is dark, not open from the outside, but I think thats because of the glare stuff they have on the windows for the heat during the day time. The service was great. We ordered a vegetarian Thali and I ordered the Mt. Everest Thali, which came with lamb, tandoori chicken and butter chicken, along with the vegeterian options. Normally at other indian restaurants I never get appetizers with the Thali. This came with the usual Paperdums, which had both mint chutney and tamarind chutney, which was made fresh you could tell.  In addition to that we got pakoras, fried califlower, and appetizers size chicken pieces and lamb. Ours came with dessert. Rice pudding and Gulab Jamman. The best we have had thus far. The Gulab was nice and firm and the syrup was thick not watery like I normally have experienced.  We also ordered chai. It came in a big 32 oz cup, like a take-way, and was made fresh because it was pipping hot. My boyfriend wanted to go back the next day just for the tea! Highly highly recommend this, especiallyif you know your indian food, much better than Tamba on the Strip.

NYIdqcOccTPUjrWzWzbx6Q.text: It was a fluke that my friend and I passed by Mt. Everest in search of a quick lunch after visiting the salon. We passed by Chinatown because she could not eat anything in that vicinity.   Running short on time we were not able to get to our original destination. While on Sahara we passed by this place and good thing because my heart was set on Indian. Seeing that most of my friends has written so highly of this place, it was worth giving a try. For $10.99, the lunch buffet is one amazing deal.   I wasted no time, got a plate and created a mountain that would give Everest a run for its money. Saag Paneer will always be my favorite. I spooned some onto my plate and was elated with the large cubes of cheese swimming in my spinach. The sweet rice can be eaten on its own as a dessert like the similarly florescent orange rice found in Vietnamese eateries or used to balance out the spice in your favorite curry. I ate it with my meal and it contributed a nice contrast to everything else on my plate. The Aloo Gobi was seasoned well, but did not have much cauliflower. The Goat Curry was tender and did not possess the gaminess that people normally complain about. The stew did contain many small bone. I spent some time picking through to be safe. The tandoori was dry on the outside and moist on the inside. I have never seen that before, so it was not a total bust. If there was an aspect to complain about, it was that I was not at the table to order garlic naan. Plain naan just doesn't do anything for me anymore. The Gulab Juman are delicious, but more than two of these fried milk balls and I am sure to become diabetic.

glOXLsyftOCXKBugZuBx6w.text: This place is great. It is our favorite Indian Restaurant. The food is amazing & the service is even better. Would definitely recommend this restaurant.

RqeYkhv1ZoebY0-UA90afA.text: Managers/Owners were incredibly nice.  They made it feel as if we were eating in their home!  Food was incredible, repeat visits are in order!!  Some of the best indian food we've had anywhere and the best in Vegas.

R5ApPHeOko62IpbbjWTZjg.text: Moving on up! In case you don't know, Indian lunch buffet is a major food group for me. Currently, the Everest is the pinnacle of options. We discovered they recently changed chefs, and you can tell! New, tastier and spicier dishes, and  my fave saag in town. Some saag carries the spinach flavor a little too heavy, but here it is beautifully spiced. Plus, they have no problem preparing roti for us. Buffet bliss!

QnPMI8A1nGCe1674yeTFSQ.text: I have been here a few times and it is always great the reviews are True! Certainly the best Indian on west side and reasonable!!

98PD5DPvJKGBsOzTh4RUnQ.text: We went here in our May 2012 trip. We are generally pretty picky about Indian food as we have eaten in India and almost all across America in many Indian restaurants. We were craving for some Indian food in Vegas and decided to try here. From the outside, it didn't look that inviting. But once. we were in, the service was awesome.  Every food we ordered was authentic and to our taste. Tandoori Chicken is one dish that I am usually never satisfied in most Indian restaurants in the states. But the tandoori chicken here just rocked, it was juicy, scrumptious and perfectly cooked. Just like the clay oven cooked chicken in India.We love it.  The host was generous in proportions and very friendly.  Its a little gem in vegas.

T-ZjIox7D-yWOFkPknAtMw.text: Very tasty, reasonably priced Indian food (especially considering the cost at some of the other restaurants and resorts in Vegas). We made the drive from Henderson and it was worth it -- chicken tikka masala and lamb korma were both tasty (but had kick! I had to order a mango lassi to quench the fire). Attentive staff and easy parking - just be aware it might feel a little sketchy in that area, but we had no problems. Get the garlic naan, too!

y37JNfqN5kLi8fJOwyJpfg.text: Took my Punjabi friend there for the buffet lunch and we really enjoyed it!  Will be back again & again!

qVIKsVetlmnbBdPHf9gkbQ.text: We tried the lunch buffet, it was wonderful.  Food was very fresh, service was prompt.  The only reason I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 is I wish the items were listed in English as well or maybe just a description.  I went with my husband who is not the biggest fan of Indian food and I know what I like but I can't really explain exactly what is in each dish.

8Tuvs52aeyDOBNwF00ZPVg.text: From the outside it doesn't look like much so we were a little nervous about eating there but after reading the reviews we decided to give it a try. The chicken tikka masala was delicious, as was the garlic naan. The service was great and our server was friendly and very attentive.Would definitely recommend.

U1qKRHTU3cV7yIhmcnoNuQ.text: Authentic Indian food. The chicken tikka masala is a must at our every visit here. The host and staff are very friendly too. Highly recommended!

iRUnsxllnio4BIfKaPb8Dg.text: Love the food here and especially being that we are very familiar with Indian food, need it to be authentic which this restaurant is. Service is awesome and staff is very welcoming. It truly is one of the better Indian restaurants in the valley and don't let the location fool you. If you come here once, you're bound to want to return!! Love love it!!

IA6QJ9Mo_LSN1uiksMDT0Q.text: Can't be beat for the cost, and quality. Sauces made slow over 8 hours at a lunch buffet? Sign me up. I have to come here at least once or twice a month. Hand down man down, worth it.

mG4MO6RFbYoiMn9AxGc_Cg.text: This is the best Indian Restaurant in Las Vegas!!  It is my go to restaurant when I am craving Indian food.  The have a lunch buffet which is a great value for the large number of choices you get.  There are numerous vegetable and meat dishes.  The chicken makhani and chili chicken are my favorites.  The food is appropriately spicy and goes well with a Mango Lassi.  I have also eaten dinner here and taken dinner to go.  I enjoying having dinner here and have always enjoyed the food I have ordered.  There garlic naan is excellent and very garlicky.  Definitely try the Chicken Korma at dinner!  The owner is very friendly and always remembers me when I visit and says hello.  The service is very good as well.  You should definitely give this restaurant a try.

Jle8nOTBoHbUNL0CWF3XfQ.text: If your in Vegas and your at all a fan of Indian food, stop here!  The neighborhood is a little sketchy and the place is an old fast food joint, but be brave. Inside it's comfortable and clean, and on the hot day that we visited it was cool.   We had the sample plate that had a smattering of various Indian dishes, and all were very good.   The owner and waiter were very nice and answered all questions we had about the food.   We will go again next time we are in town.

EosfgFPjPhhRm0FqW_1aOQ.text: Awesome food, I am a vegetarian and a proper desi food lover. This place was brilliant and I have bookmarked it :)

NOS07_0rvexko6WDYAdwtQ.text: Food is great! Prakash and his staff were all attentive. Prices are reasonable..Will definitely go back and share to my friends abt this place.

DBLFNToR5pqfiH6SrNNgGw.text: Love this place, the food is great.  I had the curry chickin and my fiance had a lamb dish.  We also had a few appertizers.  Everything was so unbelievably tasty, fresh and the food was served piping hot. The place was small and not really fancy but clean and a nice atmosphere.

HGnalIXJyX6jlfwi8W-3SA.text: Worst service ever... No sense of serving... Ordered food just small one and it took 20 min for that.. Very slow and worst food... I would never recommend this restaurant to anybody... This is my first yelp comment... Because of these people i created account and to enlightened other that this restaurant is not worth for such a rating

L_VDFGrwFxYOZ7pB7mGmhg.text: Excellent place for Indian buffet.. I stayed in Las Vegas for 3 days and I tried couple of Indian restaurant but this stands out because of the quality and variety of food available. A+

pKleLkC8cVk2knmqKoqHkQ.text: Best Indian food in Las Vegas. Anyone who loves and have passion for Indian food they should certainly go to this amazing restaurant.  Everybody who waited on us was very nice and friendly. Customer service was great. They were serving food with smile and happiness and that's make a big difference now a days.  The restaurant manager(Prakash) even came and ask us who is food and everything. The restaurant ambience /atmosphere was so great. Everybody was so professional. I should definitely mention that restaurant is so clean. I went with family and even kids loved their food. This is going to be our permanent Indian food stop when we come to Vegas. Prakash  and all his staff helping him and food deserves MORE THAN 5 STAR.

CSWzblv8JR9YHtGrpDai6g.text: My favorite indian food in Vegas! Always yummy and full of flavor. Service is usually on point. The reason I took off one star is brach of the ambiance. It's not so great. It's actually inside of a converted burger which, while converted, is still not the most tranquil setting. Also, not in the best area of town. That being said, I still love love love it and will continue to frequent the place!

hp2e8Pwtqah2YlfJwnKSDg.text: Great service by the friendly staff and owner and rich, tasty food in generous portions! This food leaves you truly satisfied, not just full.

NEx-hZCfe3UbCGO8K5cTNw.text: Best Indian food in Vegas! We got the Tandoori chicken, Chicken Makhani, and of course the garlic naan. Tandoori tasted like they used the right oven and everything was very flavorful

IwlBDGXQe-z7sI0CBCVLiw.text: This is my absolute favorite Indian restaurant/buffet. Even at the buffet (go early if you don't want to wait) they make your naan only after you're seated... FRESH!!!  Their sauces/dips are also outstanding... GREAT assortment of meat/chicken/Vegetarian dishes... and I love that it's staff all seem to be family... with the owner manning the register AND making the rounds,  talking with patrons from time to time... a real LOCAL'S hangout with a LOT of Indian nationals in the croud, every time I've been...

9JZKZcfO2kLjVlTS4HbttQ.text: Fantastic butter chicken! Loved the mango lasso as well. Very friendly staff and management.

yyrQwCnzfepA9H3jNQXEJQ.text: This is my second time here. Not a Vegas native but this is a must visit upon arriving. The manager (Prakash) is very accommodating and courteous with his customers providing over the top service. The food is an orgasm of flavor  and taste with an abundance of options.   I travel frequently and this is by far the best Indian yet. Highly recommended. DEFINITELY order the gulab before you leave :)   Guten Appetit  Jen und Nick

ad05mO3J9FCTm0181CLv4A.text: My gf and I were taken to this delightful dinner place from her father. The food was amazing! We loved all the food and the service was amazing!

KYjfWPWVQjvnfSPGFevvww.text: Authentic Indian Buffet!  I went here with my parents who were visiting from India. The vegetarian selection was great.

X08HVUnK73R8O_PHi7vPUg.text: I have eaten at Indian restaurants around the US including Missouri, IL, IN, WI and CA.   Everest in Las Vegas is probably the finest. It's the food I used to eat at home and not like the restaurant food other restaurants serve. The food at Everest is simple and delicious. You can taste how fresh the ingredients are. The chutneys smell and taste of cilantro - which is only possible if it's made fresh.   Their naan is the best. Make sure to order it.   I can't say more about the restaurant other than - if you are in town, give Everest a try. You'll love it.

F_zqPd8xoeHy4F3zkQOu0A.text: The best Indian restaurant in Las Vegas. Period. The highlight is the delicious garlic naan bread and the host's friendly and quick service. The food is well-prepared especially the Palak Paneer and Tandoori Chicken with just the right amount of spices and seasoning to bring out the heartiness and flavor of the food. Mt. Everest is buffet style which also means you can't beat the value it provides in terms of variety and price for the amount of dishes they offer. We loved the garlic naan so much we ordered it to-go, but our awesome host gave it to us gratis for being first-time diners. We'll definitely come back and let our friends and family know about this hidden gem in Las Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A must-try: Garlic Naan Bread.
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Going meat-less for 40-days means delicious Indian food!

FU-L5WCYphdVrBAnQgKiMA.text: For a lunch buffet, it's good quality and choices.  They have some exotic choices such as goat, along with the classic Indian dishes such as curry, saag (the best dish), and paneer.  It comes with an order of naan bread.  All of this for just above $10 is an awesome deal.  I ordered the mango lassi and it was too sweet.  That's probably the only real compliant.  Service is quick and friendly and easy to find.  Parking is abundant.

FMTYv5XbgxChbdJE6-uJnA.text: My favorite go-to place to get great lamb Biriyani and garlic naan. The kheer is amazing. Never been disappointed.

ABEOHhrByq4mqaFk7KVfxQ.text: Fragrant, bright, fresh, simple, and deeply nourishing: the food at Everest was a welcome reprieve from the over-execution and usurious pricing of the strip. I snuck away during NAB for vegetable jalfarezi and tardka dal. My request for real spice was met with a query of "1-10?" And my '8' was prepared with subtlety and real appreciation for the spices, as opposed to a crude bath of chiles. Everest is worth the cab ride. The staff is attentive and kind in the Nepalese way. I would definitely categorize this an off-strip gem in line with the (pre-renovation) Lotus of Siam: great food prepared with care and passion.

tx8COe-nHn8I2ZVkm15-IQ.text: Definitely my favorite Indian food place in Vegas, and one of my favorites over all.  Any time I'm in Vegas I make it a point to eat here.  The garlic naan is awesome and the chicken tikka masala is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Naan, Chicken Tikka Masala, and Lamb Korma

ARDBWH4ndezJidDJwWBAlA.text: Ordered for delivery. Missed an item and the items delivered were hard ( aloo paratha and the aloo tiki) . Would not recommend again

uKdEKzJxZw0Wsmdb1kjU1g.text: My boyfriend and friends and I have been coming here to eat for about a year now and every time I come I leave absolutely satisfied; whether it be lunch buffet or dinner. The food is authentic and delicious. Some times I have to come back a few times a week. Not only is the food delicious but the service is also great everyone is really friendly every time we go Prakash makes us feel right at home. I recommend this place . Go try them out!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nxFmeezKcLK61aYoWC1Vdg.text: If you are into heavily spiced authentic Indian food than this my friends, is your new spot. everything that was served here is literally made with a heavy hand of authentic Indian spices with traditional cooking methods.  The chicken tikka masala is perfectly creamy filled with chunks of juicy chicken that give a strong beautiful punch to excite your taste-buds. The meat to sauce ratio is great, you literally have meat in every bite.  Palaak Paneer is thick and creamy filled with slightly crisp chunks of paneer to accompany every spicy bite. I know a lot of places have issues with over and under salting this dish but honest this is probably the best i have had in a long time.  Vegetable Korma had a yogurt taste to is making it super delicious. I really enjoyed how the curry for this was not too tomatoey in taste but more of a orchestra of flavors each playing there part.  The naan is hot and fresh offering garlic and regular. I would recommend and come here again when in town.  seriously the most cleanest establishment to date and such a friendly staff.  ++huge plus++ hand sanitizer and lotion at register :)  stay hungry folks

cqNkIlnnHERGNCixyv7jhA.text: One of the best Indian restaurants on the west coast.  He's the shrimp curry, chicken tikka masala, lamb saag, naan and pokora.  It was all delicious.  Next time in am in Las Vegas I will come here.

pKy2a-XIQtLPo5yTdynbRw.text: My first trip to Vegas, and instead of partying or gambling, my favorite memory is of dining at Mt Everest. I wonder what that says about me....maybe it just proves how big a foodie I am. :D  Was in the area looking for some desi food, Yelp suggested Mount Everest and off we went. the server was polite and friendly, and helped us decide what to order. I ordered the mango lassi, naan, Chicken Makhani and the Paneer Tikka Masala. All the dishes were really good, and the Paneer was really soft, and not chewy (unlike a lot of Indian restaurants). The highlight of the meal, however, was the Chicken Makhani. If you've tasted the Butter Chicken in Old Delhi (around Red Fort), this is as close to it as it gets, here in the US. Just the memory makes me drool. :P I will make it a point to go back on every visit to Vegas, for the Butter Chicken alone.

xkc8hgFrytVulVWpCRBYsA.text: One of the best spots in Vegas. Great lunch buffet options for a very good price. If you are visiting, it's only a few minutes from the Strip by Uber.

zW19y_r3NrxIsuqT9_D9yA.text: This is by far the best Indian food in town epically for the price. Everything I have ever had from here has been fantastic and you can tell it has that"home cooked". And what is better then supporting a local business.

vMLWF71M14U-3U0D9fneOQ.text: The owner dusted the table with us sitting next to us. All dust particles came and fell on our table. Unclean.  Somosa was okay. Everything else was ordinary. Not too bad. But very ordinary.  One star especially for the service, cleanliness. Would not recommend.

k5SKpvard3rC1tDucyxWsw.text: Prakash, who I believe to be the owner, greeted us immediately after being seated. He was extremely helpful and I'm sure that a noobie could be easily accommodated by Prakash. His place is about what you would expect from a cozy neighborhood restaurant. It's not like a joint located in the strip. Thank goodness. My friend had the Lamb Tiki Masala. I had the Chicken Tandoori. Both plates were amazing! The Bread we ordered was Kabouli Naan and garlic Naan. My buddy had a Mango Lassi for his drink. The Rice Pudding finished us off. Mount Everest is completely deserving of its Yelp standing. Indian food now is at the top of my list right next to Vietnamese. I can't wait to return the next time I'm in Vegas. Do yourself a favor and go here. Tell Prakash Trent sent you!

ZKzr4P1DQkh3oDeiy9AjMA.text: The food was delicious. Very traditional.  The yelp act does not go thru to the restaurant tho so you have to actually call them. Portions were fair for the price.

L0KzOIxlCyVQGuxZ7q2bHw.text: My family and I just had lunch here. This is hands down the best Indian/ Nepalese restaurant we have been to, and believe me we have been to many of them. The lunch buffet was amazing. The butter chicken was yummy and the tandoori was perfectly done. Mango lassi, king of all drinks, was truly refreshing. It is a busy place, yet the individual attention was given. I highly recommend this place for individuals and families.

aZP4MByo9ltbu9EXirIocw.text: Incredibly delicious and well priced. It's definitely some of the best food in Vegas and certainly the best Indian cuisine. We had some new items we'd never eaten before, and we have eaten in many Indian restaurants before. Treat your taste buds to a wonderful Comfort Food experience. AMAZING!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the most amazing food in Vegas. I left feeling like I had just eaten a full Comfort Food meal. Absolutely amazing!

P7u9zOTGP2Fpo3X6bQFY5A.text: Mount Everest has to be one of the best Indian food places in town.   Good was excellent - chicken vindaloo, tikka masala, garlic naan, fried rice.   We're Indian food experts and this is our new place.   The owner touched the table and gave us a complimentary dessert that was YUMMY. Ask for the honey balls.. :)  Can't wait to come back!

Wl3pQWuR_iB_HbwSZ1LSZw.text: Outstanding food! My favorite is the butter chicken with the cheese nan, it's to die for!

ofqX0irsKQ5je8rkNxWfiw.text: Awesome tasty food, Server was knowledgeable about menu. Hospitality was incredible definitely worth coming here. Food quantity is more than enough for 4 people, definitely recommend it!!!

jlgoFsaN--1g5UBZCE2qwg.text: So, we are in Vegas and wondering which is the best place to have some Indian food. We check Yelp and see the ratings and say sure.. Why not ? We reach there and as we try to push the door open, the door pushes back !! After a couple of minutes of intense trying and my worst Hulk imitation the door yields and we see a huge crowd in front of us. Just like back in India:(   We wait for a few min to see if there is a chance to give our name to someone and then decide to order takeout. We suspected that the take out would be sooner than waiting to be seated. It's a small place not equipped to handle the crowd. People ended up waiting next to others table mentally wishing them to Finish soon so we can grab their seat!  We placed our order and got it about 90 min later. The chili chicken was average. The samosa had the distinct flavor of being refried. The oil from the veg noodles dripped out in the plastic and the chicken biryani was palatable.. Barely. For good measure they threw in some cut onions and lemon just before we left that was previously refused by a customer!  Now I understand why they call it Mount Everest. The effort needed to get in and eat the food with the ambiance provided makes the name quite apt. Wish Yelp had a no star option :/

SukwxasDSYShbW8DfWgVKA.text: Best Indian food in Vegas! Look no further, we always eat at this place whenever we visit Vegas. Few great items on their menu - masala chai, gajar halwa and navratan korma. You won't be disappointed!

Qi0HdDphfi_4NcmxbB2vPg.text: Tastes like India! And best of all the owner is very nice and genuine. He gave us complementary dessert on him.

AZJBkA4imMh-W755wAbSdA.text: While visiting Vegas, we were in the mood for some Indian food.  Yelp to the rescue again! Found this place with great review and off the strip.  Hit a Uber and ventured off... when we got there, I thought Yelp let us down.... But don't judge a book by its cover or this place...  great service, friendly staff, and some of the most AMAZING Indian food you will ever eat! This place will be one of our return destinations for sure!

-LG5boC7WEdiUX2rixpfXg.text: I love the taste of all their curries here. Full body flavors. Not too spicy but spicy enough when it suppose to be spicy. There location and decor kind of ghetto but their service is excellent!! If you go on the day that they done have gulab jaman you can ask for it and they will bring it out for you. This is one of the best Indian lunch buffet in Vegas.

s4o4Nn2jNYezjNnJtJMTGw.text: I wish I could give No stars!!! A toe nail in the middle of my dish ... the paneer was stale and stinking. The owner paid no heed to any concern ... Never ever coming here ! FYI / I'm of Indian origin and this was anything but good Indian Food

ZvqlKnXWcKbVTtJGbV7YJA.text: Giving 5 star for the food. Awesome food. Decor is something which can be improved. But Its good to eat nice indian food in Vegas.

wDwUU8hG4Pxw5i-OsARBjQ.text: This place is so yummy!!! I went for the buffet which is a great price for all you can eat. The owner is really inviting and made sure we were comfortable. The Naan bread is so fluffy and good. Everything I ate was delicious. I will definitely be a returning guest and bringing more people with me!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Lassi, so delicious!
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy rice pudding #fave
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmm

ZRhoYyO-438DAY7OFjyeLA.text: Came for lunch on xmas day 2016. The buffet is 10.99 and the food is yummy. Very flavorful. The naan was very soft.

QCakTNZ821gwnkkGlA6fpA.text: AYCE Indian Lunch Buffet review!  From the FIRST bite...BAM!  More spices, a little more heat, and much more FLAVOR than all the other lunch buffets I've been to so far!  Indian food is like Thai food to me...the more spicy it is, the better it tastes!  You get much more flavor and depth in the curries and misc, so it's much more enjoyable!  And the Garlic Naan of course! The most "garlicky" I've had...so much flavor...yum!  I think we ate three baskets while we were here LOL.  Super cheap prices...gonna be hard to beat at only $10-11!  Weeeee  Pics :

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Second round...the favorites! My top choices : Tandoori chicken, spicy fried chicken &amp; Goat
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Naan...the best! Too bad they ran out of its ingredients or could not prepare it for us more than this one time today :(
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First plate...a little bit of everything! Yummy :)

kexVhhEjHeivhZQkN-KdRg.text: Nice restaurant ! Cheap for the lunch buffet. You need to like the spicy food lol if you want to appreciate. Too spicy for me and the choice is reduce for a buffet.

O4fM2Hwd8PNDzUgztk4BHQ.text: Awesome food(we ordered naan , chicken curry and chicken tikka masala), would love to come here again and again :-) Owner was lovely and Polite. :-)

ok_mdZg7rEIejbIVwwQwxQ.text: Ok Indian food, I came here for lunch.  Ok ambiance, nothing special.  Mint is much better.

3OYuCAOiqghlnT5Dnqq2SA.text: Loved the food at Mt.Everest .. We were here in January 2014 and absolutely enjoyed the food & hospitality at the place!  We had Bhajia, tomato soup, Bhindi Masala, Daal Makhani, Vegetable Noodles, Biryani, Mango Lassi & Salt Lassi. Yes, we over-ordered!!! :P   The portion sizes were good & were enough for our dinner & lunch for the next day. The Bhindi Masala, Daal Makhani, Bhajia, Mango Lassi & Salt Lassi were very delicious. Would give a 5 star for them. The tomato soup didn't meet our expectations & the Vegetable noodles were too thick.  So wouldn't rate them as high.   The owner was very helpful & hospitable. The orders arrived quick enough and we don't recall waiting too long for any dish. Over all, all the customers looked pretty satisfied and happy.   Would definitely recommend this place to any friend!

I2RD0bkF3SeXr9Ya_IVskA.text: We really enjoyed the food. Great flavor throughout the meal. The chicken dishes were moist - fork cut, and the lamb we had was well prepared. This is a little gem of an Indian joint

nrs739cYIRvlQB15Vebq3w.text: We spotted when we were just driving by on the way to church. We decided that we'd give it a try on our way back. The exterior doesn't shout yummy Indian food; but the interior was nice and clean. I always check the restroom to see how well it is maintained before dining somewhere. It also was quite clean. There are booths against the walls & windows with round  tables in the center. There were several families and a few couples dining.   What I really noticed was that everyone seemed to be having a good time and the conversations from the other tables could not be heard from where we were sitting. I thought that was a plus because you could have a private conversation or laugh at jokes without disturbing anyone else. They did an excellent job at seating their customers throughout the restaurant.  All in all, we were impressed with the quality, portions and price of the food. For starters, you get a basket of papadum with two little dipping sauces. We ordered Lamb Vindaloo (classic spicy lamb w/potatoes), Chicken Jel Frenzi (chicken with bell pepper, onions, mushrooms in sauce), Aloo Kauli (potatoes & cauliflower), and two orders of naan (garlic & keema/lamb). The dishes had wonderful sauces with excellent consistency for sopping up with naan. Everything was fresh, hot and yummy.   The service was good. The waiter never let our water glasses get empty. And the food came out as ordered in a timely manner. I will definitely put Mt. Everest at the top of my list for non-franchised Indian dining.

aRss5CJ8qWL1rX55SgB0xQ.text: I used to come to this building all the time...when it was a Burger King.  This was my first visit since Mt. Everest took over.  I went for the lunch buffet.  The selections were somewhat limited, but the food was pretty good.  They bring naan to the table.  Those who have eaten at other Indian buffets know that this is a nice touch, because it seems that you always have to wait and fight for the naan if it is on the buffet line.  The workers were friendly and efficient with water refills and plate removal.  Strangely though, they did not come to refill the soft drinks.    Like I said, this used to be a Burger King.  With that being considered, the decor was nice.  The white tablecloths are a nice touch.  The parking situation can be a bit dicey as it is located in front of a busy market.

RnhOQi7JGjXpAXw6W0nZwg.text: Pretty good Indian food for the price. Lunch buffet is 11bux. Can't get better than that and their nann is amazing!

O6qxOqV_-W9ScieYsgWXhg.text: This trip to Vegas my husband put the kabosh on expensive strip restaurants. So after yelping the best off-strip restaurants we decided to see what all the fuss was about. The bottom line (in case you don't wanna read on): food so good we came here 2 days in a row.   Don't let the neighborhood scare you. Only a lil sketchy. The food is spectacular!! Best Indian food we ever had. EVER. we tried the Mt Everest thali which was plenty of food for 2 big eaters. The naan is yummers- both plain and garlic. Even the lamb, which I'm pretty picky about was so tasty. Not gamey at all. Our favorite dishes: chicken tikka masala, saag paneer.   We came back for the lunch buffet the day after. I highly recommend it if you like variety and don't really know the names of the dishes. There wasn't a single thing we didn't like.   Not only is the food amazing but service is great. Prakash is a great host.  We will be coming here every time we come to Vegas.

lQO6w8eVrsT9WfazAP55gg.text: Don't let appearances fool you! My. Everest offers some of the best Indian cuisine I've ever had. While the staples are tasty, their best dish (in my opinion) is their chicken makhani or butter chicken. It's delicious! Add to this the courteous busboys and waiters. Their lunch buffet is a great way to sample the yummy dishes. Always guaranteed a good meal at Mt. Everest!

gbozpWs7UIa1BMnAYx5xHQ.text: Great food, good vibes. The onion bread was off the charts! Go for lunch and enjoy the buffet. The samosas, oh the samosas!

WOS5H0WtF8e5qslZdrdmSw.text: I had never tried Indian food before and there's no better way to try it for the first time than to come here for their lunch buffet. Prices are very reasonable: $8.99 and the selection is pretty extensive. There were at least 4-5 different vegetarian currey options and 3 different meat options.    All the food was very fresh with tons of flavor. You're instantly smacked in the face with all the different aromas of the Indian spices as soon as you enter the restauarant. The service was also great. My water glass never got more than half empty before someone was by to refill it. I was very impressed.   I think my favorite part of the whole experience was the Naan basket. They give you a basket of what looks like toasted pita bread, but it's so much better! It comes plain and with garlic and WOW the garlic naan was SOO good. I could probably just sit there and eat that all day.   Overall, this was a good first experience. A little overwhelming since I didn't know what half of the food was, but it all tasted delicious.

BVTM-19yKIcIRwqyNj3bVA.text: Loved the place. Glad we found it on Yelp because the outside isn't very inviting. I'd definitely pass the place if I saw it since it looks very plain and the buiding is aging.     First, the price is great at under $8 for the lunch buffet. The manager and staff were very nice and attentive. We were seated right away, so no wait around 12pm.  I tried everything, the chicken curry, chicken korma, veggie korma, palik paneer, dahl, soup, rice pudding, etc. with a hot Indian chai.The veggie korma was very creamy and seemed even better than the chicken, though the chicken was really good. This isn't diet food and we had a very light dinner since we were full all day. I saw some people get the buffet to go, which seemed like a good idea. At $8, you meet or beat the price of most other lunch spots.  Other stuff: chai was as it should be. Nothing super special, but I'd order again. The garlic naan was different, but we prefer regular naan. The garlic changes the flavor of the food too much. Regardless, it's nice having warm, fresh naan brought to your table instead of having it sit on the buffet .   Due to our complete, total satisfaction, the price and friendliness of staff, I'm giving a rare 5 stars.

ZQVovis4ZnMYCQ3JJSO3sw.text: Fantastic!   Quite possibly my favorite cuisine!  Our first time dining here was last night.  I was not feeling well and only had some white rice a naan. Couldn't eat.   We ended up taking our meal 'to-go'.   I reheated it tonight and everything was delicious!  Lamb Vindaloo, Chicken Biryani and Baingan Bharta.. And plenty of Garlic Naan.  Definitely going back!

jeU5gUpBlpAYAiQqnt7wlA.text: I went to buffet on Monday feb-16. Price of buffer is 10.99. Tandoori chicken is awesome worth each penny. Every dish have correct amount of spice. Its best indian restaurant in vegas.

RA9qtUGN91S75GWogxXxGw.text: This Indian food was soo delicious. It was not too expensive. My friend and I split a Veg Thali special and it was more than enough. So much flavor. Wish I never got full so I could keep eating.

jIWC6Ya3YgvTiVLKIChWew.text: Great food Great service. I ate too much tonight. I ate tondoori chicken, garlic Naan, and lamb curry with my wife. We live in Henderson, but we drive over here when we want good Indian food

aDojT8vN7jhwIubIzeun8w.text: This place was ok, the food was good no complaints but the service was bad. They asked if we wanted bread and I asked if it was free multiple times, he kept asking me for garlic or regular and avoided my question. Upon leaving the waitor blocked us from leaving by cleaning up the whole table before we left. Then, surprise, we were charged for the bread. Bad customer service.

U1R69J0c0aoqM7XAMugSUQ.text: Great Indian food. The owners it's always welcoming. Family owned and Pops are in the kitchen! Authentic, affordable and great overall. Cheese and Peppers dish, lamb curry and the winner: Naan

kDvP4F_rr3ZS92vfTurgSQ.text: Had a dinner for two here during a weekday and ordered their Mount Everest Thali special for $21.99.  It was just the right amount of food for heavy eaters like us but would probably be too much for the average appetite.  The quality is above average and quite enjoyable, kinda like good home cooking.  The restaurant was quite clean and the service was friendly and prompt despite the restaurant being more than half occupied.  I can't recommend getting their thali combos enough.  It's like getting a tasting menu as you'll get quite a good variety of staple Indian dishes. Overall, I'd eat here again.  You get so much eating satisfaction for the money.

nA0C6zeT-4oZAsCup_eGDw.text: This is our go-to place when we're craving an Indian lunch buffet ($10.99). Favorite items include their Murgh Makhani (butter chicken) and saag. In fact, their saag is so incredibly tasty that we suspect it is prepared with MSG. The wifey gets very sleepy after consuming MSG so we generally avoid it, but yet we keep coming back for more. Although the ambiance needs refreshing and their naan is too doughy for our taste, overall this is the best tasting place in town.

I2kO0xod_s4-z63jo5NSWw.text: Just as fantastic as my last visit.  Great food, flavor was awesome, spice was out of this world.  My only suggestion would be to turn the A/C on.  The warm weather combined with the spice of the food makes for an uncomfortable visit.

_9RML2dv21qPPjKsv7d_2Q.text: What's up with me? 2 Indian buffets in 4 days. That must be a first for me. I don't think I've been to one for six months prior to this. My craving for the Indian buffet had not been satiated by my visit to Mint and so I was determined to have a good experience today.   After extensive research on Yelp I decided to try Mt. Everest. A co-worker of mine agreed to join me (ditching his diet) thanks to the fact that Shari S had described the Naans here as being "billowy." We made the long 10 mile trudge to Mt Everest from the office.   This buffet is seriously amazing. For a little tiny place charging 8.99 per person, it seriously hit every craving and made us happy campers. There is an extensive vegetarian selection in the buffet: soft Basmati rice with peas, Palak Paneer, Punjabi Kadi, Malai Kofta, Dhal, Cauliflower and Potato Stirfry, Sambar, Idly, Samosas, Pakoras and a myriad of chutneys, yogurt, salad and dips. I have only good things to say about every single dish on the buffet. Tasted good and the ingredients were all fresh. Indian buffets frequently omit primo dishes like Paneer (indian cottage cheese cubes), Kofta (indian dumplings in gravy), Samosas and fresh (not frozen) veggies in their food. Mt. Everest did no such thing...they spared no expense and made this buffet experience fantastic.   My co-worker who eats meat couldn't stop raving about the creamy Chicken Makhani, Lamb Curry and the Samosas (he went pretty crazy with all the chutneys).   And yes, the garlic naans that came with the buffet (we asked for garlic) were billowy. And extremely tasty.   My only gripe with Mt. Everest is the dessert selection. They had sweet rice...which really is a cop-out dessert. But I settled for their fresh fruit selection (oranges and watermelon). I would give these guys a 4.5 stars (taking off a half star for the dessert) but since I can't on Yelp, they get a four. Next time, if they serve Gulab Jamun I will be more than happy to up it to a no-questions asked 5 star review.  It's truly heartwarming to see an Indian buffet keep it's quality consistent even after being open a while. Mt. Everest really did warm my heart and brought back some of my lost hope in the Indian buffet genre in Las Vegas.   Thanks to all the Yelpers that did a wonderful job describing this place. You guys were spot on!

dq75FPoc7Ga_C3YH8C45Zw.text: There aren't many Indian places in Vegas like there are in LA so I'm really glad that I found this place! It's so good! The prices are decent and the location is centrally locates. When you walk in you instantly smell all the deliciousness! It's in the same parking lot as the Mexican market and I definitely recommend you go if you enjoy Indian food! We got the chicken tikka masala and the tandoori chicken as well. The garlic naan was amazing as well. The service was also impeccable :)

xwfqrFMO4XLtE6URhIVESQ.text: Ambiance: awful  Food: below average  Service: terrible   We were planning to have a full and hearty dinner  They served us burnt pappadam and when we asked for a replacement we were told that it was complementary and hence we won't be served more  The chilli chicken and paneer were so tight that it tasted like stale frozen food   Never coming back

Rdh2gm0wesn48zc3kmqorA.text: Serving time sucks. The oldie at the counter after we ate food asked us to pay at counter instead of giving check at the table. That was totally unfair for a customer no matter where is he from. Thats kind of a racist behaviour i have ever seen.

bjCjLwOAPQmrzJer3DwJAw.text: This one - wall in the hole place - that I've never seen since I've been living here in Las Vegas.  I was getting my car wash and saw this on yelp so I had to try it out.  The reviews were great.   I was one of the first ones in that dinner time at the restaurant.  Checking this place out why they have Mount Everest all over he place.  Mmmm thinking to my self maybe they like that place. I knew it was part of China the big country but learning something new. It was also part of Nepal - a country just above India.  I had many question about the food they served and why it's not Indian Food. Finding out that Nepali's are very similar food of Indians but some of them look a bit Asians.  I asked the server and he told me that some food would just have a bit twist but other then that it's the same.    I asked the server what's good to eat and he recommended me to try out a dish that had a varieties of different types of Nepali food. It was priced $$ right for the fact that you get a sampler first, 3 small dishes, pita bread, and rice.  After you think your done they ask what type of dessert you would like to eat and they have many different types of dessert that I never knew.    When I was done they also had this different type of breath mint that cleaned your mouth.  Very different from American style were we just get a mint candy and tooth pick.  It was like a tea seeds with other types of seeds and they add a mint flavor and it works like the mint but I guess better.     I really had a great experience at this place for the fact I've never knew a lot of history and new thing.

Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Kulfi. I think that is what it is.  Really good stuff. Never had it and willing to have more.

6Qpy6zb-GBy76A690UeYDw.text: Great food, clean and quick service.. must visit if you crave for Indian food.  Chicken Biryani was great, and they serve pappadum as you arrive.

sBTYFGPyhwIZ6_D_0zkJlw.text: We went to the lunch buffet. They had a good selection of vegetarian and meat dishes.

qjmNAQW_DBLLFKRzBGm3Zw.text: Great place. Desi food you will really enjoy!  This is more of a traditional Indian restaurant.  Talk to Prakash and he will take care of you.

Unfortunately, this place is just average compare to what we get at home. We had Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Tikka, Lamb Vindaloo, Goat Biriyani, yellow dal, and all types of Naan. yA-t-s-p8-yqniRX_Gidxg.text: This is definitely my favorite Indian lunch buffet option in Vegas, and I've had my fair share of trying out the Vegas options. The buffet here is VERY vegetarian friendly, generally with 4-5 vegetarian options and 3-4 meat options. I very much like the paleek paneer and the daal. The meat options are general goat curry, chicken curry, chicken tikka masala, and chili chicken. The chili chicken is my favorite, its slightly friend with delicious chilis!!!  The minute you walk in, the smell of spices surrounds you. You cannot go wrong here.

oR7_nZcC1wZX2Y3j3lWj2g.text: Having been in dubai for quite sometime, was craving for Indian food today so we went to try here. We ordered cheese naan, lamb biryani ( make sure to tell them how spicy you want it cuz it can be very very spicy) it was good, chicken curry taste okay but I think it lacks something like d flavor and aroma of a curry.  We enjoyed d foods and d mango lassi, this is a must try! Plus d in charge was super accommodating, friendly, knowledgeable, and really good with customer service that u will feel at home! Plus the staff are also nice and helpful.  Kudos to the owner of this restaurant, because of your staff that are super helpful plus the in charge, which we forgot to ask the name, but he is from Nepal: They have lunch buffet which is from 11am to 3pm at $10.99.  At d end we paid a minimal amount of $41 plus, good offer huh. So if you guys are craving for some Indian food and affordable, I will suggest Mt Everest.

-pr8K6dabzAGpVx7ovpzRA.text: This place is pretty decent! Their butter chicken is delicious! My only complaint would be the service. The waiter was not friendly and didn't seem as though he wanted to help us.   If I'm on that side of town and craving Indian, I'll definitely be back to check out the buffet.

PEEPOMKrebOEgKnWYlK1kg.text: Great authentic Indian food!!! Reasonable pricing too!!! We went for dinner at around 7pm...surprised to find such good Indian food at Las Vegas city!!!would definitely recommend!

ZeIwNKrR17Ky8eoCXMGdqg.text: With so many high reviews, I had to come and try for myself. Took my Fiance here a few weeks ago. We were not disappointed. The food here is awesome.   This place is located off the strip. Next to a Spanish grocery store.   The inside was not appealing at all. Very tiny. Small little tables in the center with booths wrapping the walls. Very very casual dining.   Service was pretty good. Food came out fast. Very attentive.   As for the food - We ordered pretty much everything they had to offer:  Chicken Masala - Not the best in town, but good  Chicken Tikka - Very good  Lamb Josh Rogan - Very good  Garlic Naan - Fire  Biryani Chicken Rice - So good  We ordered a few other curries, I forgot the names. All of them were really good!   Overall - Great flavors. Huge portions!

o5Fzff7aoDjMVQMSFnkQWA.text: Pretty good food , filling and just what you need after a night at Vegas ! The dal and saag paneer were exceptional. So was aloo gobi. Their gulab jamun could have been a lot better. No dessert here for me.

Tk6HCC0s-ljGAOV5gvWp0Q.text: I looked at all the stellar reviews and decided to give this place a try. It didn't live up to my expectations. The restaurant itself is nice and the owner and the customer service here is pretty amazing.   Not sure if they were having an off day, but the food was okay! Nothing out of ordinary. My parents weren't too happy. I don't think it's fair for them to compare to the food they get in India. But, I too have had better food in LA and North California. I wasn't happy with the appetizers (samosa and pakora) it lacked good flavor. I think overall the vegetable korma, spinach and mixed vegetable was good. Chana masala wasn't that great. They brought fresh naan to the table and that was soft and tasty. The absolute disappoint was the dal! It wasn't quite done. I could see the whole lentil and it had no taste. I think the gajar ka halwa and rice kheer was ok! They did have other non vegetarian options which maybe the reason this place has such high reviews!

m_pXtOhYPZyUoleTpwquBA.text: If u don't recognize me I probably haven't been here before #justsaying.   Waited 2 b seated ... A bit.  Waited @table & got up to find out #lunch only #buffet. Cool. If you want something ask...they probably wont ask you...  After that...  Best #naan ever but no option for garlic? (Unless you ask)  Water unless you ask for something else.  Food.... GOOD!  Plentiful.  I'm getting used to a little spice, but it didn't overwhelm my tastebuds!  Rice pudding a little thin & underdone but still...cream & sugar...c'mon.  I think this restaurant could #moveonup.  ##bollywoodmovies on TV on wall with sound!  Not too loud.  That would be a fun #theme night!  #dinner & #amovie!  Solid adventure.  Great value!

5K-5HC-_ZMuOPHErB4UG4g.text: I love this place. It smells amazing from the second you walk in the door. The food is authentic, amazing. I love coming here. I would recommend the restaurant to everyone.

c3JLdgDxfB-Oai5GOwadeA.text: I wanted to like this restaurant. I really do - that's the reason I visited this place twice. Seeing all the good reviews on Yelp, I wanted to give them a second chance. The first time actually wasn't bad at all - it was however average. I visited this place first time in September, and ordered chicken tikka and some other stuff which was okay enough. After that we visited this place once again because we wanted to grab quick lunch - and it was a complete letdown. The two stars that I am giving are for the fluffy and warm naan bread that they serve and the decent service. But that's about it. The lunch buffet was bad. No second thoughts about it. The chicken tandoori was the driest that I ever had. The chili chicken tasted like it was from a bygone era. The whole non veggie menu tasted like it was recycled. The veggie courses were poor as well - everything tasted like it was half cooked or made with quantity in mind.  So - I can probably say this - stick to A'la carte menu. Avoid the lunch buffet at all costs.

Fx0zCrBh8my3zHWUyAlsOg.text: So sad this is 5 hours away from us, but our new favorite Nepalese/Indian spot.  We had delicious vegetarian momos with a fragrant sauce, chicken kadai (which was a first for us) and delicious, plus a unique variation of malai kofta with a rich and creamy sauce that begs for your naan bread.  Prakash took great care of us along with his staff and even brought us complimentary dessert.  I highly recommend this place and don't show too much bravado on spice, a "7" was the perfect heat for us and we usually go "8" or "9" at most places.  Enjoy!

gQCYlkJVm9olFO5Ap7Sd_w.text: The chicken tikka masala and garlic naan bread are amazing. My wife and I love coming here. The staff is also very friendly.

Y7OZdnT0n5-CC0kfit4k-w.text: It is not for South Indians, pakora was not good and there was no biryani or pulav in buffet. Whatever they have, those were good but mild. Naans were good.

ibKpDXtZZKz0JHCecvN1Qw.text: Shame on them to use "INDIAN" cuisine as their best. Pathetic food, no where close to Indian state! N the place was dirty too.

nwwN_fyu-QTGX0XnBFJK5Q.text: Alway SO delicious. Staff and the owner are incredibly friendly. Best Indian food in vegas, hands down. The lunch buffet @10.99 is a steal. Have never had a bad experience. It can get very busy very quickly, but wait times are reasonable and worth it! They have classic dishes like spinach with cheese, goat curry, chicken Tikka masala, chicken curry, lentils, vegetables, chickpeas, tandoori chicken, chili chicken, samosas, pakoras, so much stuff! Naan is cooked to order and water glasses are always full. They don't charge for our 2 year old, even though she eats a plate with various items, and we love them even more for that. Glad to support this family restaurant, and recommend it highly!

_h-6BDXQRHjT2QqdrYatOA.text: We had a fantastic meal here the other night. The chicken vindaloo (with a spice level of 7) was plenty hot, and I like spicy food. The jeera rice was sublime - trust me, you want to try it. The kheer we had for dessert was also very good - slightly sweet without being cloying. All around delicious, and reasonably priced. Will definitely return.

p3LOsPXnXqjJQ54Od2Ov7w.text: The lunch buffet is diverse and delicious.  They have beer which is a fine accompaniment to the cuisine.

I ordered both dishes to go and we're both surprisingly greasy. I ordered dinner. Wouldn't mind checking out their lunch buffet to get a sampling of their other dishes

hY80_LglL_jVLBPiLdBOmA.text: I'm new to Vegas & I was looking for a good place for Indian food, and boy did I find it! This place was AMAZING!!! I tried their lunch buffet ($10.99) and everything was superb. The restaurant was clean and staff was extremely nice. I will definitely be returning!

v4VFxRY2BKi_mue8p4VcNA.text: I love Indian food so I searched yelp for the best place in Vegas. Wow! Mt. Everest did not disappoint! Their flavors were extraordinary. I will definitely be coming back in my next visit!

There was not even a single item that stood out. Seemed like everything was stale food. The tandoori chicken seemed to have been painted with red color. Even the Naan was not good. Even before we settled down the server brought the Naan out and by the time we came back with our plates it was already cold. Please stay away from this place.

Not to mention I am obsessed with the mango lassi! The service is always impeccable and everyone including the owner are lovely people. I can't wait to eat here again!

QV3yzZJ38KZ_Mmh76QJF5g.text: Location is good for this place only 15 Min away from the strip. 4 stars for good customer service owner didn't even charge us for the extra tea we took after we paid. buffet was decent lot of choices the best masala chai I had here.

MzBWY192NyDAzNrH4Lz1Sw.text: Mt.  Everest is a fantastic hole in the wall Indian restaurant. I had a few hours to kill before flying out of Vegas today, and wanted to grab a leisurely bite to eat.  While I'm not usually a fan of buffets (I'm a small dude, the value isn't there for me), I know the lunch buffet is the norm with Indian cuisine.    Everything was very fresh and tasty.  The naan was particularly good, as was the vegetable daal.  And the owner and his family were very friendly and accommodating.    I don't pass through Vegas often, but I'll stop at Mt. Everest the next time I'm in town.

L5dRnF93BI4vm6uTiguYtg.text: Amazing food.. If you are a non vegetarian, this is the place to go. Chicken tikka masala, chilly chicken, goat curry... Delicious! Must visit, highly recommended.

3lhfVmrzJvTG6sBQJGGOiQ.text: Good stuff, will definitely meet your  need for Indian craving. ..would come back for sure!

is8wBNfjH45Yg_TzWpe0EA.text: Great lunch buffet at a great price. We ordered gulab jamun (which is sometimes on the lunch buffet but not the day we were there) and it was incredible. Owner was very nice, we'll definitely be back!

-i08gwUYYmpgbREzJfKyrQ.text: Excellent food and service with a big smile! I had the vegetable thali, what a great way to sample the wonderful food here! I highly recommend. They also offer a nice beverage selection including wine, go and enjoy!

iQxbujd5lma2p2UMip2Dmw.text: This place has the best Indian food in town! I've lived in Las Vegas 18 years and I have tried many restaurants...and I keep coming back to this one and have never been disappointed. This one should go right up in the "Best of Las Vegas" along with Pin Kaow on Rainbow (for best Thai food).   Their lunch buffet is reasonably priced and you get a lot of choices. Their butter chicken is the BEST! And their chicken curry is awesome also.  And they serve you fresh naan with the buffet.    If you go for dinner, its a lot more expensive, but you of course can order anything on the menu that way.  The owner is always there at lunchtime and knows us too well because we are always there!    I highly recommend it. -SG

X_qvbDkRLovjrwYRGhUCsQ.text: Great service and delicious food!  Fulfilled my friend's and my own craving for Indian food.

6JS2vRpmDwcK2nZ3t15GGA.text: I was just visiting LV on business and found this place on Yelp. The food was excellent, the service was very good and it was a great value. I highly recommend it.

Y-HO2qYv1W9IC7Y4lc48Yw.text: I love, love, love this place... best indian buffet in town. I have been enjoying there food for years. Recently they have had a staff of 3 or 4 waiters that are always walking around, never picking up your plates, slowley refilling your water and darn near not even making eye contact with you....PLEASE FIX THIS!!! YOU GUYS ARE BETTER THAN THIS !!! I will up the stars when you up the service. I am not usually a complainer but when service goes down, business goes down and I dont want to lose you MT. EVEREST.

7zLxJ2Lik13j_8u6KPjyzw.text: There are so many reviews, so I'll keep it short. This place is awesome. For an $11 lunch, you get a buffet-style taste of authentic cuisine from India with attentive service every step of the way. A must-try for seasoned lovers of Indian cuisine and new-comers to this culinary niche alike. I'll be back!

N82W8PrjtjvFz1YPW81zVA.text: I've been there for lunch and I've been there for dinner. This is my favorite Indian food in Las Vegas. The flavors are all there, but it's not as expensive as many other Indian restaurants in town that I find to have less appealing food.  As far as buffets go, their lunch buffet is excellent. They always have several of my favorite Indian dishes available and they keep the warm, fresh, pillowy naan bread coming. The only problem I have is that I overeat every time I come here for the lunch buffet.  Last night was my first time trying their dinner menu, and it was so delicious. We started with vegetable samosas which were cooked very well. The had a perfect crisp on the outside and beautifully seasoned potato filling inside. Then for our entrees, I ordered Lamb Vindaloo and my wife ordered Chicken Kurma, and we both ordered garic naan to go with it. (Unlike many other Indian restaurants in town, Mt. Everest doesn't charge extra for rice. I very much appreciated that.). The Lamb Vindaloo was the best I've had. So flavorful! The Kurma was very tasty, but a little too sweet for my tastes. My wife loved it though and couldn't stop raving about it the entire meal. She's already mentioned to me how much she's looking forward to eating her leftovers.  Somebody in a previous review seemed to think the fact it's in a building where a Burger King used to be, and in a predominantly Hispanic neighborhood is a bad thing. Me? I don't care where it is or what used to be there as long as delicious food and great service provided. This place has both.   The owner even brought us out a free rice pudding for dessert for us to try. I don't think that's standard for all guests, but it was delicious. I would recommend Mt. Everest India's Cuisine to everybody.

tytXj6rkec870jcdNUwHAw.text: Love the service and food.  This place really has a family-run establishment atmosphere.  Perfect naan and paneer tiki masala.

foel30gd6GV3xFBtUuABhQ.text: Well thumbs down for this indian restaurant. The food is not bad for 10.99 lunch buffet . It is only good if anyone is looking for food at a lower price. The worst part is the staff of this restaurant. They do not know to interact nor they know to take care of the guests. You have to wait in the queue to get the table and no one responds well except the owner. They don serve good and hardly care for the queries of the guests. I am an Indian and i feel ashamed when this kind of attitude is shown to the customers because not even in India you will come across such rude behavior from the staff in any restaurant.  I read reviews which said this place is very good and amazing for indian food. But my opinion is do not visit unless if your left with no other option

Jbb4EdcjRzkGz2gyqsOpog.text: Don't go by these ratings. Food is not that great. Service is okay. We didn't like anything we ordered apart from Mango lassi and chicken tandoori.

FnbE6r9B2-JRYsokDmpkvQ.text: Excellent food! Figured I would try this place out because of all the good reviews online. I got the chicken korma, regular rice, and garlic naan. Everything had excellent flavor :) highly recommend!

OVeS5tJ0WJPcEklQXx5_eQ.text: The food is authentic and so good!  My husband I love coming here. The naan bread is amazing!

prcwhlwL502bGRyNaiSQaA.text: I feel drunk after dinner not because of drinks but with all the great spices they have on the food.   We had Chicken Tikka Masala and Prawn Vindulo with Garlic Naan. The flavors were all great especially the Masala. I think it's the best one I've ever tasted. The portion size was also just right compared to the other Indian restaurants I've been too.   The only downside is the service that's why I'm giving it 4 stars. The servers were very nice but they were short handed. They need more people there.   We will be back for sure!

ss2FMGwBhoqzlp0RubcGog.text: Very disappointed in this restaurant.  I had eaten here twice before and the food was reasonably good; not outstanding.  I was craving Palak Paneer - spinach with cheese cubes and so I ordered that and another dish for pick-up.  When I got home, the spinach dish tasted so terrible it was inedible.  It was a combination of burnt with something else.  The dish has a green, slime look so it's bad enough the taste matched how it looked....usually, it has a fresh, bright green color and is so delicious.  The other curry dish was only vegetable and I lost my appetite I could not eat it as well.  I can't come back here again after losing the cost of two dishes.

YpNmnaoudL6CsgapXoF2nQ.text: This place is awesome especially because of the great customer service shout out to the servers and owner Parkash for being so welcoming and nice and thank you for the free mango drink it was delicious ! I highly recommend this restaurant to vegetarians since they have so many options for all the vegetarians out there in the Vegas area.

1faVh0IHSo3TSxfdL_dp_Q.text: I've came here about 4 times now this year for the buffet. Never dissapointed. This place will satisfy your Indian cravings. I came for dinner once and had the paneer tikka masala. It was so good, it became my favorite Indian dish. Even more so than chicken tandoori. Definitely give it a try.

OAnXxa-o1TParysB3GWATg.text: Fabulous experience!  Food was perfect and service was even better.  Will come again next time we're in town!

qhOj8huNEdJ8rp926dxiFA.text: The food here is incredible. I've been probably 20 times now and have never been disappointed. The customer service is great, and makes the meals all the better. I'll be back as often as I can. The owner (Prikash, sp?) consistently goes out of his way to make the dining experience even better.

1oMjxQA3tEIXqE_WiqUQMA.text: Hands down the best Indian food we've had and that is saying something. Excellent vegetarian options and they made two perfectly executed custom Vegan dishes for my husband. Customer service was beyond expectations; nice relaxed atmosphere; and located off the strip so great prices for lots of amazing food. We will definitely be making a trip back.

yKHTNw_BMyWhn_qMgoDKcQ.text: One of the best non vegetarian and vegetarian Indian restaurant I been to. Take it from someone from who lived in Indian for 20 years... Your buffet was amazing...

54jS29noyBYtAMgRNt89Ug.text: We were out of towners in Vegas for New Years who were craving Indian food. We decided to go to Mt. Everest and my gosh, we ABSOLUTELY loved it. The buffet had great vegetarian and meat selections. Every dish in the buffet tasted different than the last one and had so much flavor. I am Indian, so I know my Indian food. This place really reminded me of home cooked food. The owner and the servers were really attentive and made sure we always had naan and water on our table. They cleared out plates as soon as we were done. Because it was new years, the owner came and gave me and my friend a rose stem each and wished us a happy new year. It was a great gesture! (And no he wasn't hitting on us, we were there with our husbands!) He was genuinely a really nice person and they get an A++ in food as well as customer service!

mSgqHDCVoVAAqWsX7NL-sg.text: Updated after my second experience..the dinner was yummy despite the bad experience, hence decided to give their buffet a try. Again, a value for money, the food quality surely stands out. The manager also recognised me from the yelp review and admitted the issue was due to a rush the last evening. I appreciate when people take the pain to check the feedback and work on that, so updating my review and comments.

iLfQUpEd6pOkB-sjCr_kRQ.text: So far the BEST in Vegas. Small place but excellent, authentic and delicious Indian food. Goat curry is to die for. Owner/Manager Prakash was great! Highly Recommended. Just  go and eat there!!! Saw S.

b_xh2t9DbHDCJll4o9kzLw.text: Just awesome food. I am a vegetarian and the food here is very good. Haven't had such delicious indian food in months. If you are looking for a good indian food in Vegas look no more. This is the place to go. You will never be dissatisfied. All the 4 and 5 star reviews live up to their expectations

X-ZmyWJXcOXGE2APuGuMww.text: Amazing yummy Indian cuisine...if you want the best...you need to come here. Service is friendly. Everyone is happy and the atmosphere is casual trendy.

zeKTsnciXkdczNKj7lko-Q.text: Great value. Great food. Friendly people. Defiantly worth stopping in if you are up for an Indian lunch buffet.

r_KV71j_bvWgLKpM9AN7Yg.text: Everytime I come here the food is out of this world. So is the service. So many selections for my vegan belly!

uBxm0YYyfLDP3050MUbDFw.text: This restaurant has personalized service, excellent food. The owners are very friendly. They give free Indian bread with a meal. It is a small restaurant, and a former franchise. But it is a very nice opportunity to get an Indian buffet at a reasonable price. We recommend it to our friends.

3tNtueihV1RD4eaz29llow.text: A real hidden gem of Las Vegas. I've been going here for a couple of years now and have never been disappointed. It is a local favorite and do not be surprised if you see the Mayor and former Mayor there. I'm a big fan of the Chicken Tikka. When my family comes into town I love to take them here. I highly recommend.

zS5G_H5cSKdjcLSOUoGe3Q.text: Another lunch favorite!  I've been several times for lunch, and always eat at the buffet.  The food is delicious; there's various traditional options, including basmati rice, samosas, chicken dishes (e.g., chicken tikka), dal makhani, and other vegetarian dishes.  There's also fruit.  The buffet actually has a good variety of food.    My absolute favorite is the sweet rice, which is orange colored and has peanuts (or cashews?) in it.  I have a sweet tooth and love rice, so this is the best of both worlds for me.  I'm not a huge meat eater, but am not vegetarian either so I end up loading up on the sweet rice.      My runner-up favorite (or actually maybe tied) is the naan.  Whoa nelly, the naan is ALWAYS warm and soft.  We always get a basket that has plain naan and naan with garlic.  The garlic naan is super good.  Although I'm sure it's a huge faux pas, I love getting the orange marmalade from the buffet (for the fruit) and putting just a little on the naan.  That's my dirty little secret at Mt. Everest.  Overall, it's a great place to have lunch.  It's generally busy or at least half way full.  I think it also feels a little nicer because the tables in the center of the restaurant have linen table cloths.  Oh!
