And another plus -- they usually have a Bollywood movie playing on a flat screen tv above the buffet.  The sound is not on or is low, but it's fun to watch nevertheless!

QlDDYTa8t418wMpeVB48dQ.text: As recent Los Angeles transplants, this has become our favorite place in Las Vegas to grab dinner to go. The Chicken Tikka is amazing and the Saag Paneer is one of our favorites that no one ever mentions. Can't recommend Mt Everest enough.

2Th8foX8_a3S3vuTApZy4g.text: We came for the lunch buffet and it was just ok. A little disappointed since the reviews were so positive.

ySHJXCCO872uEtVqJzGVQw.text: This is my first time here and I am shocked how good the food was I just got out of school and what better way to have lunch then at a place like this. I am very satisfied and the service is unbelievable they are very good workers. I'm definitely coming back.

nt1ToZV469J5OnbM8O0uwQ.text: What a refreshing dining experience. As we sat down, Prakash (the owner) came by and said hi. Through the evening of great Indian cuisine, Prakash continued to make us feel right at home. Great food, wonderful service and a surprise for dessert.

N93vHuJkzFGj6m-FiSj7oQ.text: Our favorite Indian food in Vegas. Buffet had a good variety, a range of spiciness in the selections, and nothing too creamy and fattening. The room is nicely decorated and staff are attentive to customer needs. The biggest problem we have here is getting there before it's crowded.

8WifRP1FnKUFhde12FNWpg.text: My fav. Indian restaurant in Las Vegas. Really excellent food.  The curries are all superb.

bz18FBtmwcvTxoU6P_LJfg.text: This was our first time to Mt Everest Indian Cuisine and we are SO happy we found this place on yelp. Every time we come to Vegas, we want to eat Indian food and now we have our go to place!!  The place doesn't look like much on the outside, but it is quaint and clean on the inside. When they were turning over our table, they even moved the table to clean the floor underneath!    I ordered a glass of Merlot which they filled to the rim!!  Got my money's worth!    For food we ordered the tandoori mixed platter ( a must!!!). We also ordered the chicken tikka masala (their signature dish) as well as the lamb vindaloo. Everything was cooked perfectly and was moist.  The garlic naan was warm and soft and delicious!    The owner came and checked on each table a few times and was such a pleasant and friendly guy!    We will definitely be back!!

oITjJwi_EZ3yf4rDpU0yUA.text: Went with my mom and my partner for the lunch buffet and it was delicious. Service was great. Their naan is delicious.  Can't wait to return!

h2sHn1R4VLrwGmdEyDLxkg.text: So it took me 3 months to convince my co-workers to try this place for lunch. We will now be regulars.  The $11 AYCE buffet is fresh, colorful and tasty.  Your taste buds will thank you, but if you are not into spicy food your tummy may not.  The service is outstanding and they are quick to refill your water glass.  Do yourself a favor, ditch the lean cuisine for lunch and check this place out.

JDzN7k7VM1s3lJrAtrrxag.text: You cannot go wrong with this place. If you are visiting Vegas and wanna try some Indian food, you have to visit this restaurant. Though I must say that I was in double mind before entering the restaurant(even after reading the reviews) because of the outside ambience but glad we went through it. Their saag paneer and dal(yellow) were fantastic along with soft breads.  Staff was friendly and fast!!

npz7GS2Sk5qntpF1zu6OTA.text: Whenever we visit we always have our indian fix.  We love this place.  People and service are great.  Even have is a complimentary dessert.

UVH5KdLjEugJmqY7gdBMqA.text: We just moved to Las Vegas from the Seattle area and decided to give this place a try for their lunch buffet seeing all the good reviews.  Wow...disappointing to say the least.  I know that coming from an area where Microsoft is means there are many Indian restaurants but the food here was a zero compared to what we are used to.  Everything tasted the same...hot and spicy.  No variation, and only one flavor whether it was the chicken tikka or the vegie dishes.  I guess Indian is not one of the specialties for Las Vegas.

XOHDe-3mH18SuTxeV79IYQ.text: My opinion has always been that Mint Indian Bistro is the best Indian restaurant in town.  I've been to their buffets and a la cart dinner. I've only had Mount Everest's buffet, and I was really impressed by it. When my sister was in town we decided to check this place out. We came for dinner around 7:30PM.   The restaurant wasn't that busy at that time. We were seated immediately. We ordered Samosa Chat for appetizer. The chat was ok, it was covered into much yogurt and there was no tamarind sauce on it. The dinner order was Vegetable Navarattan Korma, Daal Makhani, and Chicken Tikka Masala with Garlic Naan. The curries come with rice, which is a plus.  The curries were delicious and there was plenty leftover food for next day. The naan was fresh and tender. I really like this restaurant for their food, with the exception of appetizer this location is almost as good as Mint.

LMF9xCSMqMF6E93ARudHXw.text: This is the first time I had the REAL delicious Indian food in the US and surprised to find the spot in Vegas. We were starving and the last thing we wanted was good food and this place totally served it !! We were warmly welcomed by the owner Prakash. Keep up the good quality of the food and service :)

DE3r2iYzcea4iAH1Io7Y4A.text: From the heavenly smell when you enter to the savory Chicken Tikka Masala, large portions on the Mixed Tandoori Platter, attentive staff, fresh naan: loved the entire experience. All the food was well flavored, hot and fresh. I couldn't stop eating the Navratan Korma; the mix of vegetables and spices was pure bliss.   After settling the very reasonable bill for two people who ate a king's amount of food, and while we waited for a taxi, Prakash brought us delicious masala chai. Worth the trip off the strip.   We'll definitely return next time we're in Vegas.

tMf3VnWCQhTyL_zFldwrEw.text: Best place to eat Indian food. We had masala tea and samosa. It was tasty and samosa was big and feeling in size

W0qJB97zVBNmXYWxjW5bEg.text: This place was great.  The service was friendly and I really enjoyed my Onion Bahjia appetizer.  The naan was tasty and the chicen in my Tikka Masala was nice and tender. I don't crave Indian food quite as much as some others, but next time I do, I would definitely go back.

kVaPQfJ-YRd7m69QAiG2yg.text: This place is really awesome. I've been coming here for years but I think it only recently got better. Buffet is excellent. All the food is kept warm (really warm, not just lukewarm like so many buffets) and they have a good variety of veg and non-veg foods. There are usually a couple of dessert options, and a small salad bar, as well. They give naan for free, which is nice. The wait-staff is always very friendly and attentive, even during the busy lunch hour. The food is delicious. I've never had anything there which I didn't like. Very flavorful, and the spice level isn't so weak like most Indian restaurants who try to cater to the American palate. Highly recommended.

7jF3izU0xETWZSLGi54BHg.text: Great restaurant! I have eaten Indian food in lots of different cities and this place has some of the best! Had the Korma and butter chicken. Delicious! Owner was super accommodating and even gave us a free dessert. Not expected, but very much appreciated. Highly recommend.

UyNGsJeeaiYQoRnR6uZKRg.text: Not saying that the food is bad but the price my gosh $60 for two chicken curry and some naan bread and a mango lassi this is very,very costly will not be coming back

WJ0vif9NnsTmocTaedm8mg.text: Best Indian restaurant in Vegas! Super authentic and the owners are so nice! Would highly recommend this restaurant and their Masala tea is a must try!

taAnZ9BeBhDsPaEI1ureow.text: I try to stay low carb as much as possible but when I go off the reservation, this is my place.  My standard is Palaak Paneer, Chicken Tikka Masala, and some shrimp dish (mushroom Masala tonight).  Then garlic naan, 2-3 orders and they provide rice.  This food is orgasmic.  I've been coming here for years.

xcRm3F-DNOy4RurfE6Hddg.text: This is our first Indian lunch buffet in Vegas, so we have no comparison. However, we've gone to others in Michigan. We chose Mt. Everest because it appeared in numerous lists. It met our expectations. We arrived at 1:15 with concerns whether the food would still be fresh and it was. We tasted just about everything and enjoyed it all. Nothing was too spicy. Naan is brought to the table. The tandoori chicken was moist and seasoned just right. I especially enjoyed the cauliflower and potatoes, the lentils, and the spinach paneer. I did not try the goat curry but the hubby did and he liked it, which is surprising because he never orders curry. We will come back.

iUeAyrx4D8HB8O8WW7KHvA.text: One of the best buffet I would have had in last one year. Gajar ka halwa was awesome! I would highly recommend this place for those looking for Indian food in Vegas.

YN2N7Embx0wBhT3Bpet00w.text: Really good Indian food. My roommate recommended this spot so had to check it out. This place may be better than Mint.

9Nj7_etAdcKhXU6Si0kZZA.text: I had been wanting to try out Indian food for the longest and I was recommended this spot as being one of the best. We did the lunch buffet today for about $11 bucks each person which I thought was reasonably priced considering all the delicious food you get. I don't remember the names of all the dishes I ate (there were too many to remember), but everything was so good and wasn't disappointed! They bring a basket of buttery naan to your table which was delicious as well. And there was this sweet bread dessert that killed the sweets craving. I definitely recommend trying out this place! And if it's your first time like me try a little bit of everything, you won't regret it. I'll definitely be coming back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was my second plate. Everything was delicious!!
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was some type of sweet bread as dessert. It was good!

_L4iHbMoJCMslXnBtkPgQw.text: I've never actually eaten in here before, always gotten take out with my boyfriend, so I can't comment on the service other than taking my phone order and paying the bill haha but they are really nice when I do! Also, the food is delicious! The naan is amazing and everything tastes so good!

2aBRQsAzovTJ3-7o8j5qng.text: I'm no Indian food expert but you can stamp my Indian food non-expert seal of approval for Mount Everest. It is an All You Can Eat Indian buffet with all sorts of Indian dishes for just $10.99.  Believe me when this very reasonable price of $10.99 is worth way more than the price you pay. Each time I've been here for lunch it's been packed with people spilling out while waiting for tables to free up.  There's even not a lot of parking.  Most of the time these are good signs of how delicious a place is and this was the case here. Is it authentic Indian? I wouldn't know but a few of my vo-workers from India like them too, though I haven't seen others from India dine here at the same time as me.  I never asked what a dish was or what's inside so all I can say is that I enjoyed them all, the green stuff, the orange stuff, the yellow and brown stuff, the stuffed bread stuff, and the fried battered stuff, all very delicious. They were labeled but I don't remember what each was because I usually sample them all. There was a red chicken, not to be mistaken for char sui, and another meat dish. Ask for the Garlic Naan, the freshest right out of the oven?? the better.  They do have non-buffet options.  It use to be a Burger King so imagine that kind of space on the inside and they have a TV playing films from India. Customer service is usually fast and friendly so the only reason that I think there's a long wait is because they are very good and those there first are enjoying the goods.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the goods.

VuDe0m1PkaaMWry1ZRG9wQ.text: Craving for Indian food on a chilly night, I called Mount Everest to order take out. The yelp reviews were extremely good (4.5) and  I was already salivating.  I ordered a medium spicy Chicken Tikka Masala and Palak Paneer with garlic naans. I was promised that food would be ready in 20 mins and it was. The price was extremely reasonable. Once I reached my hotel with the food, the food was gone in 15 mins. My kids loved it. My youngest quipped that this was he best Indian food he had eaten in a long time. The yelp reviews don't lie. This is a True gem in Las Vegas.

KXvmfN5YGGSZm-la8ruqpw.text: The place to go for Indian food.  Very attentive staff, fresh food and not too spicy . This is a busy place yet they were able to handle big crowds very efficiently.

bfUy333cSy0gz-RQledd7Q.text: One of my family's GoTo Indian restaurants in Las Vegas.  Food is simply amazing. Staff is friendly and provides great services.  My daughter was suffering from sore throat the day we went and without asking the server got her warm water to drink! That tells me they care about their customers and theor wellbeing.  Food came fast, fresh and warm... very reasonable price and great choices for both Veggies and Non-Veggies.  Their Paneer Chilly... MUST HAVE IT!!!  Thanks Cheers!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rice
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Naan
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilly Paneer

d-qhBi-p-iWwzgDmVvb2RQ.text: Loved it ! Came back twice in 2 days . It was a perfect satisfying meal before we headed out to the strip .

UbHW-O2-EHSeHmGnTbRlLg.text: Food and taste amazing! Right amount too. Delicious definetly will come back! Excellent service and pricing. Satisfied

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NUBF4r5JpyHoi-dsbb0A2w.text: In town for a convention went with couple co-workers. It's located in semi-rough looking neighborhood, yet the food was tasty.  We had the garlic naan and ordered three entrees should have been too much yet we ended up eating 90% before leaving.  Ground lamp and veggie mix I think it was a Lamb Korma.  Shrimp Korma and a favorite Chicken Tiki Masala.  Attentive service had us stuffed when we left.  Definitely will be back when in town.

PO-yiq8gN47ULF-EcF69sg.text: It's all about the food.  It's very, very good Indian food, spicy, big portions.  I live in Seattle and we have Indian restaurans by the dozen and this can compete with the best of them.

O4IDt-pIr884UjBZHA_aHg.text: This place was super good.  6 star spicy was pretty spicy.  Everything I ate here was excellent and we tried everything it seemed like, I love their sauces don't use tons of cream.

AoWReeyA3zmAzT44-tVJFw.text: Good place for Indian food, with some decent choices, although the buffet price have gone up a little with not much improvement on the choices. Service is ok, not super friendly and choice of food on the buffet, which pretty tasty is very limited. Would help to have better description of the dish selections since not everyone is a native and would want to know what we are getting. I still go there from time to time, expecting a better experience, but at least the food is good enough to have a (barely) positive experience.

36yFR3r5IiRSCFeP4q7H_A.text: My wife and I stopped by this place as we were craving some Indian food during our Vegas trip. The decor is fairly simple and to the point. The food however was excellent!! We had the baingan bartha and dal makhani and it was the best baingan and dal I have had. Coming from Dallas, we have our fair share of Indian restaurants but the simplicity and taste of food here simple blew us away.   This is a must visit for Indian food lovers anywhere!

roPOF16_T_-1qF0jOoQIIA.text: great casual style Indian food - the Naan was fantastic chewy but with the right amount of crispiness on the bottom - korma and tikka masala sauce was so good as was the curry basmati and sweet rice - for $11.99 cant beat the quality or value

mmLhgkLJUAZ3GpLyeZTiXA.text: the food was nothing to talk about. the buffet was standard fare of indian food and the flavors were just like anywhere else. totally unimpressive

iPwCfjFX9EHuWffFgXU1vQ.text: I went here for my first time tonight and wow, what a great place to dine. Such amazing food! The service was phenomenal. You can tell that they appreciate your business. The staff was so friendly. They recommended various dishes and everything was so delicious. I will most definitely be back! Hopefully next time for the buffet so I can try a little bit more of everything.

xGGiIgrSV3p0um2LYYnttA.text: Whenever I'm in town this is a must go to restaurant for Indian and Nepali cuisine.  The food is great and the service is outstanding.

5qXq5qFLf8OQKuTu0LjvWA.text: I've been in Vegas for 5 years, and this spot is the first one that I was happy with!  It was my room mates first time trying Indian food and he loved it as well!  Great spot!

7K2sCTZlCn6-cFyhBo9AdQ.text: Very good Indian food. Service was amazing. Great tandoori menu. Their spicy level are real, if you need spicy don't go beyond 6 or 7.   Veg food was also good, properly cooked..

b9AIPEqZwsEkV7K5ms1sNw.text: This place is definitely a 5-star establishment. The food was incredible, the service was great and it is the perfect family owned restaurant that deserves to be supported. My wife and I will absolutely be back, our new favorite restaurant!

Lnq6STbvoC38_7c1-Frtiw.text: I have only gone to the buffet. I really enjoy the tandoori chicken with rice. Oh and the naan, it so yummy. I always leave with a smile and a full belly. You can't beat the price.

F9RUkzbJ3AJpgTn1MnqPlA.text: I have been to a lot of Indian restaurants. There was nothing in this that we liked, and that includes the gulab jamun. That's saying a lot because  I love gulab jamun. The food wasn't fresh. I don't like to put down places and have never written a review before. This place compelled me to do it. Service was fine. Restrooms were clean. Needless to say, not coming back.

7ZIdkIwv-gAXmhR7oPA6bA.text: Great service and great food! Chicken Tikka masala is the best in town!

eLYYGHPOYldSBjQGbHMqYw.text: I took the family for the lunch buffet and it was the best Indian buffet in Las Vegas.   I had been to just about every Indian buffet in town before getting a recommendation from a friend.  The place was clean, the food was well stocked, and the fresh naan that's included with the $8.99 was excellent.   Particularly good was the chicken tikka masala.  Since my kids liked it, I will be going back there often.

G2kRCNFztB1jlOqwTfvzCg.text: We eat Indian food a lot and are quite particular.  I am pleased to say that this restaurant exceeded my expectations in all respects.   I like that the owner and his family work together and are very service oriented.  Of course the food is why we would go and, again, it exceeded our expectations.  Clearly, the best Indian food in Las Vegas.  The chicken tikka masala was excellent as was the lamb vindaloo.  Big menu making it hard to choose and I found myself looking at all the great dishes coming out if the kitchen.  Try and get there early to get a booth as it looks much more comfortable than a regular table.  Highly recommended and we will be back soon with our friends.

75nhgpunC-iudv-fyvJjHQ.text: okay, this place is awesome. Well worth the quick cab ride.  The owner and staff were attentive. Food, really good. The garlic naan hit the spot. Prawn tikka masala was nicely spiced and yummy. I highly recommend.

aaZ3dvJMQhBEbW4C36dfOA.text: Went to eat buffet. This is the Worst food ever I eat. All the dishes are tasteless. I won't recommend this to anyone.

7HFudLOquD4V3a6NffaavA.text: I've been coming to Mt Everest to get my Indian food fix for the past 5 years, and every single time I eat here I come away happy. I'm a vegetarian, and they have a superb list of veggie dishes. Some of my favorites are the paneer tikka masala, the malai kofta, the dal makhani and the palak paneer. One of my absolute favorite dishes here is one of their appetizers-the veggie momo. It's a supple dumpling filled with mixed veggies and spices, perfectly steamed, and served with a spicy dip. I dream about it. The owner is so down to earth and nice. He always recognizes me and my family and is so kind to us. I don't usually post reviews of places that I eat, but I'll definitely go out of my way to recommend this delicious restaurant. Give it a try!

8Wi5FX6CAN4-4b3Xk4U7bw.text: Mean lunch buffet. The place is not fancy. For a buffet, the food is really good.

0rs-QoLa1mhmjpuOxWL30A.text: I went here for lunch buffet and think that its an an ok for an indian lunch, its not over the top but its not bad either. Very limited items, tandoori chicken a little too dry, the lamb meat was good, chicken was good and thanks for the naan that cooked fresh.

W-yo6Y29XIyQb5_VW81EAw.text: Absolutely delicious, every time. Favorites include the makhani chicken, vegetable korma, and lamb keema. Staff is incredibly friendly and polite. 10/10 would go again.

wAcKTyvwAgJE4Y6esXKYZg.text: not bad at all.. food was not spicy enough.. usually a 5 out of 10 is spicy for me.. we had to add hot sauce.. fairly priced.. decent food

Clf_kK8S-fpChlHNq2zX3Q.text: Always go to this place when in Vegas. Still 5 stars in my opinion. Great food, great service.

_vR5R1uoMhgXVROP6B8-pA.text: Was a very good experience. The owner literally ran to the kitchen when I ran out of water and was very attentive to us. I had Lamb Curry and it was very good, although I ordered it a little too spicy(7). Will definitely go again.

7pNb5q_Mcaop73XXk69jBw.text: The restaurant smells fragrant and mouth-watering upon entry. The staff are friendly, efficient and attentive (they even remembered that I liked my water without ice on my refills!) We had the buffet lunch  and it was outstanding. The variety and quality of the food was first-rate. I ate a little bit of everything on the buffet and would have gone back for seconds, but saved some room for dessert. I became a completely devoted fan on the last item I had - a small dish of rice pudding that almost brought tears to my eyes as it tasted like the kind my father used to make. I will return here again and again on my own as well as with guests and friends and relatives who visit who will truly appreciate authentic Indian food.

Hwl3nSQOjS654cbJtLhMtw.text: Great local place off the strip for indian food buffett!  Have been twice and love it!

sDQGVsuijQxWtNgs48QeKA.text: The buffet is pretty good compared to all the other indian buffet in town. but you really have to try some of the stuff off the menu! the vindaloo and jalab gamun were excellant.  I also tried the chai here, but it left something more to be disired. all in all, its always a positive experience here. ANd like everyone says, you have to try the garlic naan bread.

ZmsJqffeyV0Ib5p6tDrzsA.text: Lunch buffet was not worth the $10.99.  Very limited selection.  Fatty lamb.  None of the east indian "staple" dishes included in it.  Will not return and will not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

caU_ITgCRE7nBQCKV3Cf6w.text: Amazing food and the service outstanding! They owner even provided us free dessert and called us a cab to get back to the hotel. By the time we finished our dessert the cab was ready for us outside. My girlfriend and my 80 year old mom from Italy loved it! Thank you for a great meal, a charming restaurant that was easy to get to, and a lovely experience for the whole family.

xLeVWgHH-otenI2nd-3wEg.text: Come here very often. Good service,, good food,, at good price. i like shahi paneer and mutter paneer.

38QVAHhpQejhztKf29eAWQ.text: I know my Indian food. I grew up eating it and this is a pretty good place when you can't have home cooking. The staff was really friendly. I had the Biriyani, with chicken. It was so good. One of my friends, who had never had Indian food, tried the vindaloo and loved it. The location is a little sketch but a lot of Vegas can be like that lol. Prices about expected for Indian food. Also, they don't play when it comes to spicy... You've been warned! If you're craving Indian I say check it out.

ZeFu-9P0ZZHKnX6IHAR0cQ.text: I don't always eat Indian.....but when I do - I prefer Mt. Everest Las Vegas.   After eating at Mt. Everest , it's all downhill. ha ha get it? that's right my friend, you will never have it as good.   So far I have only been here for the lunch buffet. Here at least once a week. sometimes twice.  My only previous experience eating Indian was when I lived in nyc for 20 years. There is probably 2 million indian restaurants there....one for every cab driver. Let me tell you my friend, even the best one there could not compete with mt. everest. I remember the last place i used to eat at, called CHOLA. Supposedly it was great. Always packed with indians. Their food was always greasy and made me feel tired afterwards (probably from chemical, or cheap quality?)  Mt. everest is NOT like any other indian restaurant you have eaten in. The food is NOT greasy!!! The quality of the ingredients is fresh, and of high quality. I don't know how they do it...EVERY dish at that buffet is a solid TEN.   I wish they would raise their buffet price to keep all the riff-raff like you yelpers out. Sadly, this place gets jam packed at lunch.   The best part is that a corona is only $3.50. I really appreciate it when restaurants don't try to RAPE customers on liquor prices. Actually the food is the best part.  wait the best part is the great indian music videos on tv there...wow, those guys know how to deliver a show

qZBJnfXvnP29UBFohIvHMQ.text: Mt. Everest has amazing food!! I came here for the $10.99 buffet and was amazed at the quality of food. The servers were also very attentive. The buffet had authentic Indian/Pakistani food that would rival any other Indian Restaurant in Las Vegas. Will definitely be back again

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 10.99 buffet special!!

RPJTDZraccUQ7-E1U6cP9Q.text: This place is great. The food is excellent and we were served by the owner (he was very nice). I talked my husband into trying a different cuisine and he was weary about the place from the looks on the outside; if it was not for the open sign we probably would not have stopped. The inside is very nice, linen on the tables and clean. We are early eaters so we were the start of their dinner crowd, it filled up quickly as we ate.   We ordered the garlic Naan and it was awesome, made to order. My husband had the Lamb Korma on my recommendation and I had the Chicken Korma. They also have a veggie Korma that is probably just as good. Portion sizes are large.  Don't judge a book by its cover or you will miss out on some really outstanding Indian Cuisine. My husband liked it so much he wants to go back before we leave Las Vegas. That does not happen often and means he really liked it as did I.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Chicken and Lamb Korma around, they also have veggie Korma. Yummo!!!

1RxSS3EIYZoB8c7CKp6YVw.text: Tasty main dishes with good flavor profiles push this place into the upper echelon for take-out Indian cuisine.  The Tikka Masala wasn't overly dry like many places and everything tasted great.

53O3GfFMVSCnRQieinlkqg.text: The Best indian buffet  in las vegas.. highly  recommended  for indian food lovers..the deserts are simply awesome and the tandoori chicken ..

-UmzekHWMeMphIBNoqORiA.text: Good buffet! Samosas, pakoras and chicken curry were very good. Garlic naan and chai were a little disappointing. Overall for 10.99 it was a good meal.

8C3d-GNUA4_bM2g3BbUc4A.text: The very best Indian lunch buffet in town!!  I literally enjoy every hot dish they offer and I'm glad they're still doing brisk business.  Stand outs for me include the korma, saag paneer, chicken tandoori and the chana masala.  How do people operate after stuffing their faces here for lunch?  I only go on my days off since I'm in a coma for at least a couple of hours after.

vOVwOdIA4idAVpUDB6TfDw.text: Kababs are too good. Didn't realize that I will end up liking an Indian restaurant in Vegas. Being an Indian, I am very picky on Indian food. But this restaurant left me astounded - awesome food. Every dish we ordered was amazing! Service was also good - very attentive.

WZkjv3k-OLDU6NN6xZBwYg.text: Came for the lunch buffet.  Not very impressive.  It was OK but certainly not worth returning.

2_Ad-HWuXyEc6HRR3oRi3w.text: Found this hidden gem off yelp and it is by far the best Indian food we've  had. The owner was the sweetest person and most attentive throughout our whole dinner. He suggest foods we weren't going to originally  order and customized  foods based off what we told him we liked. He demanded we try and dessert which was beyond amazing. Great family restaurant with 5* food. Next time we are in Vegas, we will definitely be back.

SYA5gbsR3SCWBqZgt4GpjA.text: Outstanding as per usual. It took us a while to find a great Indian restaurant in Las Vegas, but this is it. Food quality is amazing, service great and the value for money is perfect. A number of 'top' Vegas Indian restaurants are way overcharging, but not this place!

1cf6QhK-nE1Ejbbj75agMA.text: Came here with a big group and thought the service wasn't great (but that might have been because they were really busy at the time).  I've had way way better indian food though the people at my table who ordered the chicken tikka masala said it was really good.

yGsbgQYt2WK6K5fehZChSQ.text: Visiting from NJ where there is a large Indian population, I can say this was a great find in LV.  The flavors here are not quite as bold and cater towards more of an American crowd, but everything was delicious.  We shared the mt Everest combination meal which was a great deal and had a good amount of food. Would recommend to anyone looking for their curry fix,

OfcM2oLuFxb7fdXAMjjBEA.text: Having read all other Yelpers, we went for their lunch buffet. Being Indian I would rate their buffet 3/5. Having tasted other Buffets in Midwest, I would say they are 4/5.  Their food has a lot of chilli - so beware. Vegetarian selection was - kofta, kadhi, dal-makhni, aloo-gobhi, 2 kinds of rice. Their naan is below average.  You must must order their mango lassi - its thick, and delicious.  We didnt try the non-veg food so no comments.

RNgaWW9oTOZxWanXrsp3BA.text: Honestly this is the best Indian food I've had aside from homemade! This was the first restaurant I went to on moving to Vegas. Service was so wonderful. We went in for dinner although they do have a lunch buffet which I definitely plan on going to. We had the owner as our host who recommended their 4-course (I think) special. Came with papadums, chicken appetizers, a sampler selection of entrees, and pistachio ice cream. After talking with the owner and getting to know him he let us try the rice pudding which was absolutely wonderful too. The place was almost packed within 30 minutes of opening, and for good reason!

CfHgl7jkb5_QtQ1LAZM8IQ.text: This place is just okay. There are many rave reviews, and I feel like I may be missing something. I will give it another shot if I am in the area, but I don't see myself driving out of the way to eat here. Their buffet is fairly limited and most of the food lacked ANY spice factor. It was almost bland and some of it was overcooked. My favorite part was the rice and the naan. I did finish my small plate and had no desire for seconds. The meats were fatty and low quality and the buffet was not exactly cheap at $10.99 + tip. The owner seems like a nice gentleman and recognized my friend who worships this place. The service however was close to non existent and toward the end we felt rushed. I am a fan of Indian food and have sampled several places around town, and this would probably stack somewhere in the middle. I would be interested in trying their dinner items to see how they stack up in that category. Overall, just an okay Indian buffet with not much separating it from the rest of the pack other than the owner who seems to care about his return patrons.

DOeCQbgC4xLA3be_EHCW-A.text: We were all craving Indian one night in Vegas (we were staying a little off the strip) and decided to order take out from this place, because of the great reviews. SO happy we did, the food was delicious (Chicken Tikka Masala, naan, etc.) with a good amount of chicken in the dishes and plenty of rice to have left-overs for the next day. AND we even came back later that week, because we couldn't get enough of the great food. Really nice owner too!

N8_aesA395K-lENRTDiikQ.text: Eat here. This place has the best of all the worlds. Great food, inexpensive, excellent service, exceptionally clean, comfortable. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for Indian food. The staff here are extremely friendly and know their food. The owner came over to our table to make sure everything was to our liking, and seemed genuinely thankful to us for visiting his restaurant - very rare in this town! Their food is incredible, and doesn't come out highly oiled like some Indian food does. Bottom line... Give this place a shot!

RuCp8o958sOIGHA0MwNH4A.text: This was my first time eating Indian food and it was excellent. Mt. Everest has delicious food. We had the lamb curry, chicken Tikka masala, tandoori mix plate, and garlic naan. I usually hate lamb, but I loved it here. The service was a little slow only because they were busy, but our party really didn't mind. The owner is very friendly and also let us try their rice pudding dessert which I found surprisingly different in a great way. Definitely will be coming back. Yum!!!

UysSzh4QyRB0JiTmk-y29g.text: I haven't been here in about a year, but in that time, Mt. Everest India Cuisine, hasn't lost its mouth watering touch. Bollywood movies play in the background as I wait, and then dine on my Chicken Mahkani  my 'go-to' meal when I come here. The Garlic Naan is bar none, and I could really just eat that as a mea,l in of itself. The Basmati rice is always cooked to perfection and a nice accompaniment to the entrees. Las Vegas' Best Kept lil secret! Who needs fancy deco when you can have fancy Indian food at an extremely reasonable price. Vegetarian options are always available.  A GREAT first date place..snd a GREAT Happily Ever After regular. LOVE this place!

3UywOfssfg8KjVpbMMPq7w.text: I decided to take my parents here since they actually haven't tried Indian food. We didn't find out it was a buffet until we pulled up. $10.99 per person? Not bad.   Their naan bread was deeeelicious! The garlic naan was our favorite. They were very generous with the amount of garlic used on top, unlike other Indian restaurants I've been to. The chicken tikka masala was PERFECTLY spiced!  ..Even though we had to dig for pieces of chicken. I'd definitely go back just for the garlic naan and chicken tikka masala! Being our first meal of the day, we were too full for a second round. We each had a mango lassi which might've been why we got full so fast.   It's a super casual place, not formal at all. The service was good as well. If you're looking to satisfy your Indian food cravings, this place will do its job!

7F-lu0--m6chtGS19zyASA.text: Excellent food .owner gives personnel service to all clients. Eating food here reminds of home cooked meals.keep it up guys.

RukXBWZmcoqB1XPb3lr7zw.text: New to Vegas and 1st time here... Absolutely LOVED every bit of it! The food was amazing and customer service was even better! I'm very picky with food and I don't play about customer service. So the five stars is REAL! This place is great!

d03qzkS7S3tw0j6Z3TiFeg.text: Mt Everest is my go to place for Indian. I've only been here during lunch for the buffet. It's $11.99. I absolutely love the chili chicken! Curry chicken and Tikka Masala are very good also. The buffet has about 8-10 dishes along with fruit and salad. They bring buttered Naan to your table. The decor isn't much to look at but that really doesn't matter to me. I LOVE this place and if they ever closed down I would be heartbroken!

m6UmJdFULpLyRYxR5q6zTw.text: One of my favorites, food-wise! They have some of the best Tikka Masala sauce, Palak Paneer & Garlic Naan/Breads! Service is OK, nothing special. Parking lot is sketchy but I would eat here anytime I'm near it or grab take-out! ;)

gqxVuldE9z8a1aqU10ubaQ.text: I am surprised Mt Everest has a higher rating than MINT because it is not even close to the same quality.  When I pulled up I was surprised to see a drive thru but then I realized it was closed and the employees were using it to park their cars. Upon walking into the restaurant, I noticed the buffet in the back corner looking sad and unsanitary. I sat down and shortly after we were brought out the papadum and were asked what we wanted to order. The papadum and sauces just weren't good and to top things off the basket it was in was not cleaned. I shouldn't have overlooked this but I did because I was craving Indian food. I ordered two mango lassi's, garlic naan, malai kofta, chicken makhani their speciality, and basmati rice. The mango lassi's were brought out instantly. This one was not made well, was overly sweet, tasted artificial, and was not thick enough. I was able to stomach mine but my dining partner wanted to send hers back. I asked the Asian man if we could send it back and he giggled and said no. Then our Indian waiter comes over laughs and says Mango Lassi's our supposed to be sweet and I said I know I have had my a Mango Lassi before but but this overly sweet, he begrudgingly took it back.   Our entrees come and the portions are huge. Both of the curries had that artificial taste and reminded me of curry at a food court. The chicken in the chicken makhani was dry and the fat was not trimmed off properly. The veggie balls in the malai kofta were extremely hard on the outside and not very moist on the inside. The garlic naan was tasty but once again it was brought out in a basket that was not clean.   The Indian food here is mediocre and I question how well things are cleaned.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken makhani
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic naan
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basmati rice

z8Gr3OTHJ4ewlUunzoFwAA.text: Such an awesome restuarant, went in for the buffet today and it was delicious! Everything was hot, fresh and the customer service was great aswell! Would defiantly go there again!

kRo1rLPIhoEWMghheyFR9A.text: i felt pretty dubious about this place when i got dropped off. converted fast food blg. absolutely GREAT indian food though. i got the sampler and would come back tomorrow.

1YSS4ZNSajEFmtwUzT7wCw.text: BEST INDIAN FOOD IN LAS VEGAS. Their butter chicken is soooooo delicious! To die for. The owner is so friendly and very professional. I always recommended people to go there when they are craving Indian food even when I help my guests visiting me at the spa where I work.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hEaBPIG-ZkS1k369FXK4ZQ.text: Cruising in my Lotus Elise rental, I wanted to get some good eats + a nice drive off the Strip. Indian food popped up and I dialed in this place.  The inside was a bit darker/cooler than I thought, with just the buffet lamps giving light besides the natural light. Still pretty nice, the food was great and the waiter/owner(?) was nice. When I asked them about not having rice kheer dessert, they said it rotates with other different items (that day had a mango dessert). Darn. To my surprise, he brings out a complimentary bowl of kheer. Awesome! It is one of my favorite desserts; so simple, yet so good. The naan is nice and fluffy, too.

LvGFM0OVm00gEjoZSssTSA.text: Such a pleasant staff! My water was never empty and the food was delicious. The owner Brikesh (spelling?) was so nice. We will be back on our next visit to Vegas.  We ordered Mixed Grill (tandoori chicken, lamb kabob and shrimp) and Chicken tikka masala and the garlic naan. All wonderful. Since it was my husbands first time having indian food Brikesh bought us desert.   Best of all dinner was under $40!!!

nCNqQxIJBGESy64keMymng.text: Best Indian food I had so far in the United States. Good vibe, good food, good company. What else could you ask.  Owner was friendly and I had a good conversation with him.  Everyone visiting Vegas should come here

YSqThQGoSdfRkTZDZDB5Jw.text: Absolutely amazing food! From Butter Chicken to Palak Paneer to the mouth watering, freshly made Gulab Jamun. Friendly servers and comfortable environment. Can't wait to come back. I highly recommend!!! Thanks Prakash!

2uq8NnYLmpKXePAET3w6sQ.text: Excellent! I have brought the entire office to the buffet, and come back again and brought the wife & family. Don't hesitate to stop in and have your fill of Indian.

fkRxNJOkcOeesgoC3QwDqQ.text: Lucky to have found this GEM two years ago. In a city where it seems like Indian restaurants are popping up all over the place, I have yet to find one that even comes CLOSE to Mount Everest! Food is made with LOVE and you can taste it in every bite. Hot, flavorful, tons of options for every palate! I'm a veggie so I love the Paneer dishes and Veggie Korma but I would be happy eating anything on the menu!   My boyfriend gets the Tandoori chicken and Paneer dishes as well but tonight he tried the chicken and noodles. He died over how amazing it was! Try this place, you will leave in a good mood with a happy belly. And take first time Indian food eaters HERE! Remember to order the crispy, soft naan bread perfectly cooked every time! Enjoy, and you're welcome :)

5cDDjonuPyaOs7smAvyHiw.text: The flavor of the food was wonderful.  We had the buffet which is very reasonably priced.  The service was excellent.

5DGwLPD4jMrlg-ommOpplg.text: Review from a Tamil couple from South India. Every so called "Indian Restaurants" outside india usually a money pulling rip off with no taste. This guys everest doing an extra mile to bring a better presented dish on the table. Lamb briyani was good and tasted nice and this guys doing a great job in Las Vegas. They dont have Dosai kind of south indian dishes, How ever this restaurant is a good choice in LAS. As this is my last day in Vegas I cannt visit again in this trip. Will come again in next time.

lQISjsHpRxXDXc75vfZj0Q.text: Food is too good and price is also very reasonable. Very nice homemade North Indian food.

Zxh96V_Zp7y18rlFEyYiFQ.text: I am a BIG fan of Indian food, in fact, it is my favorite... While visiting Las Vegas this past week we searched for something delicious, different, and off the strip. Hopefully, something filled with locals rather than tourists. Well, I have to say this place exceeded our expectations. The food was phenomenal and the service was outstanding! The only thing that would have made us feel more welcome was if the owner/staff sat to eat with us. My husband ordered our food a bit more spicy than I could handle (it was obvious) and the owner brought out yogurt to help with the "singe." Yelp should have "extra" stars for those exceptional experiences. If they did, Mount Everest India's Cuisine would have earned them for sure. Just for fun, I will give them, 20 stars

CfNg1G6idH-1deYtbmdlCw.text: We traveled to Vegas and were looking for a good Indian food. We found a good review of Mt Everest Indian restaurant and came to try the buffet.. Food was very delicious and staff was very courteous.. Definitely recommend Indian food here!

fTAbLRFyzJonflVFCqgSDA.text: I don't know how the food is being advertised as "Indian".  Dal Makhani was watery (a little more watery, I would have called it soup).  Naan was just ok.  Aloo Gobi was better.  Malia Kofta was too sweet.  Spinach looked kind of burnt and black, didn't get the courage to try. May be my expectations were high after reading positive reviews about the place. Food was below average  Overall not a great experience.

RHhMB4-YPuHV-TPR2xJY1w.text: I was a bit skeptical after I saw some 1 star reviews however wanted to give it a try and I didn't regret my choice.. I did the lunch buffet everything was well cooked and tasty.. I would give it at least 4.5 stars

cY1HFNZSZ8kxmF_ySRk_AA.text: The food was really awesome. I would really recommend Panner Tikka Masala, Chicken Curry. Their buffet is amazing. I came in at the ~10pm at the time of closing, however their hospitality was great. I would also recommend their Jeera rice and Dal.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #Desert Rice Pudding with GulabJamun

jtdqjhsq8eIpmbzI5VC2fQ.text: This place has some fantastic food! The wait was a little long, and I didn't really have any service when I needed refills, but the food is A+. If you got a little extra time, definitely check it out.

ruaoN27xLRRvjq3jCdpuGA.text: Wonderful buffet in Vegas!!! Good vegetarian choice but not so much sweet option !! Try carrot halwa here!!! Amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-Uzrd5Ut5pL4ZW-ZHi46jQ.text: I come to this place whenever I crave indian food , when you walk in the aroma of the food immediately makes you more hungry then you actually are then you start ordering alot because you feel like youre starving while waiting for your food. The staff is nice and the chicken isnt dry and jerky on the edges , like sometimes when you get cheap chinese orange chicken . Its just delicioussss here !  I know its basic but try their butter chicken. only thing i would change is to have an itemized copy of the receipt given to all customers including togo order customers that way we can see the itemized charges.

D_HfeEiynVT2NcdPFoaC4A.text: Great tasting food, can't go wrong with unlimited naan. $11.99 lunch buffet till 3, the selection is less than Mint but taste is on par.

PEKUB-921VVVXNTGPiP6hQ.text: My favorite place to go for indian food. The lunch buffet is incredible and such a good deal. Try not to stuff yourself up on the delicious naan and save room for all the good food. The Chicken Tikka masala is a must, as well as the vegetable koorma. They've also got some great desserts - rice pudding and gulab jamun!   The food, service and attention is great and I can't wait to come back.  Looking forward to trying their mango lassis.

OQ5f33gT5u_1lo_6u9xsVQ.text: Great lunch buffet and I think it's really authentic. I can seriously eat this every day. They have this mashed carrot dessert (gajar halwa) that is served hot and it's got a unique taste and texture. I haven't been able to find this at other Indian buffets and I really like it. They rotate between that and the sweet ball thing (gulab jamun) and it always makes my day when I see they have the carrot dessert out. But after several missed encounters with the carrot dessert I actually have a calendar now to keep track of the days they would have it. They have very good palak paneer as well and the owner is really nice.  Update: My sister's Indian friend really likes this place and says the carrot dessert tastes exactly like how her mom makes it. Authenticity confirmed.

Z0NuicbdqPaTxPtYKsQgjQ.text: I tried this place for the first time and loved it. I thought I had tried most Indian dishes which I have, but they had some very unique dishes that were absolutely delicious such a sweet rice. Each dish had its own flavor which is somewhat unusual because usually a lot of the Indian restaurants all the main dishes taste the same. In this case each one had its own distinct flavor and it was wonderful I highly recommend it.

x7j3ECq0MZ2tfgabEm6DfA.text: Great good and relaxing atmosphere. Only $11 each for the lunch buffet, which I was pleasantly surprised by.   I swear though, they must have drugged the food with sleeping pills though because my boyfriend and I were both exhausted after eating here and needed a nap lol

gi9BUklKWtJ1dTQKztZW9g.text: I tried their buffet while I was in Vegas.  Totally not worth!!  Starters were too oily. Curries were okay types. Bread was good though (because I asked for fresh Naan) Dessert- Bad.  Not recommended!!

pipOpl1eynCrBjrqYe2OUQ.text: One of the best Indian food restaurants I have found. I have tried most of the vegetarian dishes and loved them all. Very flavorful dishes. The restaurant atmosphere is not anything fancy or special but, it is cozy. The staff is always friendly and knowledgeable but, the service can be slow depending on how busy it is. The lunch buffet is a great value and one of the few places where they serve samosas as part of the buffet (usually costs extra). I would give the food 5 stars and the staff and atmosphere 3.

sfwMkQkXSJ0_v8tfYgY5mA.text: The food here is good, but I can't say it's great.  The Tikka Masala was a little too sweet for my liking.  The service is on point and the food is good.  I have heard great things about the lunch buffet, but I came for dinner and ordered off the menu.  The spicy chicken tikka masala was perfectly spiced with the right amount of heat.  Mad me sweat a little, but didn't kill me.  That was ordering a 7 of 10 on the heat scale and I like spicy food.  My only complaint was that it was a little too sweet.  Otherwise, the food was great!  I will be back!

zCEDI6B2ZcUjeF7O9QlM0A.text: Very Kind waiter & host but the food just did not meet expectations. We were greeted & waited on by a very kind and attentive staff. However the restaurant itself and the food were not what we were expecting from such a highly rated restaurant. The food was not necessarily bad but it also wasn't good. It was quite average. Given we did come at the beginning of dinner hours so this may have had an impact. Overall the food was 2/5 , Restaurant dining area 3/5 , wait staff 5 / 5 for an overall 3/5 rating.

rFJryRbYGlGn9DQmO-j-KQ.text: We were a party of 8 folks who flew from Buffalo to LV and were super hungry. We got out of the airport and folks decided to go to an Indian restaurant for dinner.   After seeking some yelphelp and thanks to fellow yelper's review - we decided to go to Mt. Everest. The place is not ambient or upscale..It is very casual and less attractive...but the best part was the food and then the service. We got in that night close to getting the kitchen closed...and there was a huge party that was leaving. So it took some time for the restaurant folks to have us seated. Once we were shown our table, the owner Prakash made sure we are comfortable and took our orders. We had a good mix of Veg and Non Veg order. We ordered that night Chicken Pepper Fry, Chicken Biryani, Goat Biryani, Shrimp Biryani, Naan, Aloo Gobi, Veg Biryani and one more veg gravy....(don't remember it now)...The food was a mix of Indian and Nepali style. The service very prompt and we got our first order Chicken Pepper Fry and it was not that good - we felt like it was taken from the leftovers of that afternoon buffett..however the biryani - all of them were presumptuous quantity and excellent taste..so it out beat the chicken pepper fry. The aloo gobi was excellent and it was perfectly made.   So our first night in LV experience was very satisfying. We decided to go there again before we head out to the Airport for our return flight. This time, more or less we ordered the same menu item. We did give Mr. Prakash the feedback on the chicken pepper fry. He acknowledged and let us know that he is going to the let the chef know to make it a better and he did. The food was amazing but the real 5 star is for the service that the restaurant provided.   This is a definite go for me the next time am in LV. Way to go Mt. Everest.

DcNeWxzUngt4LILO1rTceQ.text: This place has been my go to spot for Indian food in Vegas for as long as I have lived on the west side of the strip.No matter what I have ordered,it has been top notch.  Our default dishes (not all in one sitting though): Veggie Pakora Chicken Makhani (butter chicken) Nice and thick creamy consistency. I cannot stand watered down chicken curry Rogan Josh (lamb curry) Great sauce and loaded with lamb.  Chicken Korma  Saag Paneer I am not a fan of this dish in general but I do like their version. I goes very well with the garlic naan.  Tandoori Chicken. I know it sounds stupid but I love the pickled onions that come with the chicken. Oh and the chicken is good too! Garlic Naan. Always fresh! Not to mention the complimentary  papadum served with mint chutney and tamarind sauce.  I have dined at most of the Indian Restaurants in the Valley and crown this place the Champion of Indian food in Las Vegas.   Eat with Confidence  -P

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie pakora
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter chicken
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rogan josh

C0rF_xwexbbC1Obn5-ATWw.text: We were here for lunch buffet on Saturday. The food was at most edible. The seating area was not very clean and poorly organized. Not recommended.

KcuXluHySZARG39I1rVp_g.text: I've been looking for a good Indian restaurant since I've moved to Las Vegas. I've tried a number of places and most are sub par -- the food is fine but over priced. My friend and I went to Mount Everest for dinner on Sunday night after seeing good reviews on Yelp.   The only downfall of the restaurant is the location. It's in a sketchier place in Las Vegas, but luckily there are large enough windows in the restaurant to keep an eye out on our car. The service was great to start. We ordered a chicken tikka masala and chicken vindaloo, with some naan, and a mango lassi. Every order was authentic, fresh tasting, great portion, and awesome quality. Definitely will come back here and recommend for anyone looking for good Indian food.

vdEp38o7ObXBf8hXtksBkA.text: We ordered veg momos,kadai chicken,malai kofta,one paneer dish and butter naans.Everything was good except the malai kofta,koftas were dry and hard .

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JS6LbBWORBPIgChNRbjVvQ.text: Ordered via UberEats.   Chicken Tikka Masala and Fish Curry. I spent a few weeks in India and since then I'm always looking for the best Indian food I can find. This is definitely my new "go-to" spot in Vegas.  Nice big portions when you order rice and naan. I hate it when you order a side of rice to be delivered and it comes in a tiny container. Here, you get a huge to-go box full of rice, and 1 order of naan is plenty for 2-3 people.

6Pj6tIfX9cif-o4QoeSYNg.text: Some of the best Indian cuisine I've tasted in Vegas. The lama samosa was phenomenal! The Mt. Everest Thali was everything that I expected it would be. We will definitely be back, and we will bring others with us!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ExXcEt9LQ_DF8Exd7YVNxg.text: What a wonderful surprise was this place. I have never been to a Indian restaurant which uses whole spices in a curry. We tried vegetable momos which were fantastic, dal makhani and malai kofta with naan & roti. Everything was super delicious and made with good ingredients. Naan & roti were nice and soft. Overall we were very happy with the food. Sadly I couldn't take pictures. The owner is very nice and attentive. Overall must visit for anyone looking for good Indian food.

UV6976102v9q-fmSK9SXQQ.text: Whenever Ive eaten here the food was great in my opinion, but I was totally grossed out when my husband went there to sell them facility services, he went into their kitchen & it was filthy, he said he even seen dead roaches in the kitchen. We haven't been back since.

9deKTuAksxO5ju_cg1Gxyw.text: Amazing for the price! $13 for a good Nepali/Indian buffet. Good naan, momos, paneer and curries. 10/10 would come again. P.S. Try the mango lassi. They're really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bR4VPu5f2EbinMAZ0t_3HA.text: I used to work at the bank across the street and came here many times during lunch.   I usually get there right when they open. The food was obviously fresh and just out of the kitchen, so I got the benefit of not having buffet food that has been sitting there.  The service was always quick and fresh hot naan brought right away. The place is not one of the newer ones I have been to.  Some of the Lunch Buffet items are Palak Paneer, Vegetable Samosa, Yellow Dal, Aloo Baingan, Raita, Chili Chicken, Goat Curry, Tandoori Chicken, Malai Kofta Yellow Dal, Chicken Tikka Masala. Gajar Halwa and Kheer for deserts.  Lunch buffet is $11.99  The Tandoori Chicken and Goat curry were solid and well spiced and the Chicken Tikka Masala was very good, with a nice little kick, and all your other standard-fair Indian buffet options were tasty. The rice, which of course is an important element of any indian meal was fluffy, warm and flavorful.   They also do buffet takeout, you get a box, naan and a cup for your soup.

CEkK2zvwTRaQVVI9IQ6O5Q.text: Visited for Lunch buffet. Good spread with many vegetarian dishes -which is quite rare. The dishes were well prepared. Polite staff. The restaurant gets a bit noisy.   Will definitely visit again,perhaps for dinner when there is no buffet.

4_aKN_PkCKTYCL4W1OjTpg.text: I ordered through Uber eats.. never been here before   The samosa chat was amazing!  Great flavors super delicious   I got the lamb samosas as well, dry, hard and not tasty at all, i couldn't eat them.  Lamb vindaloo was ok, sauce was tasty but the lamb was mega over cooked and very chewy, I didn't really eat much if it.  Mint & tamarind sauces are great

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jd7X3CemO_QgLrA8Wnd0mg.text: Very friendly service and reasonable prices.  The chicken tikka masala and vegetable samosas are amazing.  Their tamarind sauce is to die for.  Their all you can eat buffet is so good too.  If you're feeling adventurous, try their vegetable korma and butter chicken.  The owner is very friendly and provides great service.

7g5U2wSNf_JhL1cf4UJ05g.text: Absolutely outstanding!! I ordered the Mt Everest Thali and every dish was as good as the next, same for my friends who ordered the Vegetarian Thali and Chicken Kadia. There's not all that much I love about Vegas, but I look forward to coming here when I come back to the area next time!! Our server Ishwor was such a delight!! Definitely come here!

y4xhKDgeDowpet4RVcSb3w.text: This place was "BOMB"bay.  First time here.  Just walking into the place I knew it was going to be awesome.  You can smell the aroma of the spices... so good.  You'll see/smell what I mean when you walk in.  We went for dinner.  Because I had "just a taste" of Chicken Korma from another restaurant, I had to try it at the next Indian restaurant I went to. We also ordered the Goat Curry, the Chicken Biriyani (Rice), and Garlic Naan.  We ordered the Korma and Curry in mild.    Once we got our food I went straight for the Naan to dip into the Chicken Korma sauce to get a feel for the spice level.  Some places you order mild and they give you extra spicy.  So for me my first thought was "oh, this isn't bad, it isn't spicy at all, maybe we should have gotten a level up."  Then I took a bite of the chicken by itself and it was nice and tender... and then it came, the flavor of the spice kicked in and magic happened.  The spice level was perfect to my liking.  I took the sauce of the Chicken Korma and spread it on the Garlic Naan as if it were jelly on a piece of toast and that there was magic in my mouth.  After you bit into that, there's a hint of sweetness and it's amazing.    As for the Goat Curry, I love the meat itself.  I wish we had a lot of meat that came with it.  Because the Chicken Korma sauce was awesome, I wished the Goat came in that sauce instead.  But the Goat Curry was still good. The Chicken Biriyani too was full of flavor and awesome. But to my liking, I would have taken out the raisins and the nuts.  That's just me tho. I'm not a fan of fruits in my entree.  And the Garlic Naan was delish!  So good that we ordered more to go!  This place just became my favorite Indian restaurant hands down.    So with that being said, Happy Eatings!  Until next time @~}~~~

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Naan - 5/5
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Biriyani- 4/5

sc1umBKSOL6NZYuozDgjpA.text: I love this place. The food is outstanding, and the service is excellent.  Try the saag and the shrimp biryani.  The spice level can be as mild or hot -- you will love it.

6UMK01UM5qqhFiJPSUDctw.text: I mean what more can you say about this than AMAZING ALL YOU CAN EAT LUNCH. seriously though, the quality for the price here is ridiculous. As I said in the beginning, do yourself a favor and come here during lunch for their all you can eat special. It's like $15 and it's amazing. Best Indian in Las Vegas hands down.

awhXtun0Hc7hDl2DD0QJcw.text: Run by humble people. Food was good. It was bit crowded may be because of holiday season and we have to wait to get a seat and then to get our food. Overall experience was quite nice. Nothing to complain about.

6Z9NmbbKZMMZABAdsG7nzA.text: This is no-frills Indian Food off the strip. The food is good, but I've had better. Of all the things we ate, the rice was excellent, flavorful and perfect. The Mango Lassi was a standard lassi flavored from a can, and nothing special. The potato pancakes (Aloo Tikki) were excellent, but could have had more spice/flavor. I enjoyed the eggplant-potato (Aloo Baigan), but asked for medium spice and got no spice at all. Meanwhile, the chicken tikka was asked for with no spice and got medium spice. The chicken was very tender and flavorful.   The service is a little bit slow, and there were a couple of times that the wait was long enough for service to get our order taken/between sources that we had to flag a waiter down (the restaurant wasn't busy).   I would have liked to see a place that had a more comfortable/upscale feel - it was pretty divey.   All in all, the food was okay, and I could be tempted to go again for some cheap-o Indian food. It could be better though, and with a variety of choices to choose from, I'm much more likely to go somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6Tfgc7LJ5GmTKUToT2NbQw.text: I had the chicken biryani and my friend had the goat biryani. The biryani is not the typical Hyderabadi Dum biryani and they tell you that upfront. It wasn't disappointing at all, though. The portions were big. The taste was good and it was spicy.

CnoNIYzYWr0N2nW5zCJ2Dw.text: Great place for buffet will definitely go eat there again soon...great service by there staff..all the item was great hopefully will be coming soon

2Addn9sWMEprCTQ4rLwWUg.text: Every time I visit Vegas this is my go to place. Food is so True, they don't add cream to everything unlike most other Indian restaurants in the US.  Food is 4 Star, which is very good but I give it a 5 for their service. The guys who work there are humble and take your order with patience even though it's closing time (once I went there after closing time, still was treated well).   If you like real spicy food, go here.

udcDXMbDvHQEEp1uS46H2w.text: Absolutely delicious food. Very attentive service as well. Try the butter chicken and pair it with a mango lassi. Mmmmmmm.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TGomwwU4O1rMBAkLSioicQ.text: What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas!! Not this time!!! I have got to share my epic experience at Mt Everest Indian restaurant with all of you who are going to be visiting Vegas in the future. Bookmark it, put it on your must do and have to visit list.  My Everest at 29,028 feet is the highest mountain on earth and one of the most beautiful sights and wonders of the world. Lucky to have flown over it in 1998 and taken some priceless videos and photos.    Wednesday September 20, 2017 Las Vegas, Nevada got a similar rush and thrill as I had an amazing lunch at Mt Everest Indian restaurant on W Sahara Ave:  1) Tasty, wholesome, lovely food prepared and served with a lot of love. The brown lentils and kidney beans were to die for. The potatoes and cauliflower dish was done just right and the flavors were so distinct and unique. The garlic naan bread was probably the best I have ever had. It was hot, fresh and had that lovely garlic that just stimulates your taste buds. Big smile!! The raita or yogurt with diced cucumbers, tomatoes, onions and spices was the best I have ever had. It was cool and not creamy and lumpy. Bigger smile.  2) Beautiful staff who were so caring, proactive and warm. Lunch hour was packed and they sure kept the flow going with grace and class. Loved meeting the very sweet Nepalese chef in his awesome Nepalese hat( or Bhadgaunle cap) who came out to check on the items and wished me with a great smile.  3) $10.90 for an AYCE featuring 6 non vegetarian items, 5 excellent and ample vegetarian options, a great and fresh salad and pickle bar plus multiple v good desserts and fruit is beyond sweet.  4) Perfect getaway from the strip. It is almost 2 miles west of the casinos and  I-15 on Sahara Ave and Valley View with no crazy traffic and loads of parking.  5) Clean place! The staff is on top of the buffet.   6) Clean, air conditioned and stocked rest room.  This was perfect. My review is the 1092nd review of this wonderful restaurant. I concur, I loved Mt Everest!!

bSPY0fKV_VMRdLuqUxEaWw.text: Love this place for indian food. Authentic, priced right, great variety of choices and its not as spicy as other places. My go to place when am craving Indian food in town. Their nan bread is just perfect. Goat curry, lamb, chicken masala are just my preferred choices. Place is clean, service is great and enough parking in the area.

fgNCvCUan7JN1RC3lZJXWw.text: Great food, great price for buffet style dining. The restaurant was clean and staff very friendly.

8Adf9oJB-2UnxKSJm_QLIg.text: This place is amazing, top quality food every time I have been. Flavors are amazing as well as the customer service. I highly suggest the lunch buffet.

W3Gp9p46fbhOtBKLE-0e8g.text: I hardly review restaurants but I really need to review this as we came here based on the highly rated reviews. We were super shocked how indians have reviewed this place so highly! It probably rates as one of the worst indian restaurants not just in Vegas but in North america! Even Mexico had a better one than this! The food tastes really horrible! Not even one dish was decent enough! So disappointed!

QRzKH_a4X2HNFzDYtMLHxw.text: The high ratings on Yelp drew us to this restaurant, but the delicious food and the warm and engaging staff will keep us coming back.  The set up is simple, but the food more than makes up for it. We ordered chicken biryani and shrimp tikka masala with garlic naan- so well made! The serving time wasn't long, and the food tasted totally fresh. They do serve wine and beer too.   Definitely recommended!

1kHUQEKRydYDCTQdYVR4sw.text: Food and service was awesome, much better than other Indian restaurants on the strip. Saag paneer, Korma, Samosas and Naan were pretty yummy. Tea's taste was so good. It reminded us of our origin. Thank you so much for such a wonderful good and warmly welcome.

mDAJUeo0l7q6sO9rKOS2XQ.text: I ordered through yelp and when I went there to pick up my food they told me order didn't go through so I have to wait for 25 minutes. I am ok with that it happens sometimes. Anyone writing these 5-star review doesn't have any idea what the real authentic food is? Food was extremely bland. Butter chicken doesn't taste like butter chicken and there was no cashew nut in korma.   Final verdict -  Strongly NOT recommended.

QXrALeLpumaKEVRJtIUOBQ.text: Our go to spot for gourmet Indian Cuisine! 5 Stars ALWAYS! Never disappoints. Ever... In the least. Ordered all our favorite dishes. Undeniably all guilty pleasures. Yummm! Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Biryani, and Chicken Korma. Hosts/Servers here always A-1 with genuine authentic attitudes. Great vibes and atmosphere here you're always going to find. I want to thank Prakash for his hospitality. Can't wait to circle the flame again when I'm in Dyer need of a excellent gourmet India dish. Highly Recommended by all means. My compliments to the Chef.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Tikka Masala accompanied with Chicken Biryani. Absolutely Fabulous

-zwPnjC2svfqfaY2luWlqg.text: This place is a True hidden gem. Mount Everest is by far my favorite Indian buffet in town and this review is way overdue.  When I think of buffet, I think of mediocre food lined up under the heat lamp. The food here is all good quality.  I really like the fact that they offer honey rice here. I can't handle spice too well and honey rice has a hint of sweetness that balances well with the spices from curry. I would highly recommend getting their spinach paneer (cheesy spinach curry) and lamb curry (lamb is super tender).   As for dessert I like getting their rice pudding and fresh fruits.   I've brought my friends here who lived in India for many years and she assures that the food here is close to the traditional Indian food she used to eat back in India. I am no expert in Indian food but I absolutely love this place!

OOqg1eY78lzScWEnu02A_g.text: On August 9th, I decided to take out buffet. I come here because the food is good but today, i was disappointed by the interaction i had with one of the associates. Once I paid, I asked for a small container for my dessert. That's when this staff had an attitude towards me. I am not going to pay $14 and not take advantage of my dissert. When I came back to place my food in the bag, he made a comment to the cashier to make sure I pay. Dont treat your customers like a thief. I understand your resturant is located in a shitty neighbourhod but also understand that paying customers have rights to anything from the buffet. It's not like I came in with my own container. Also understand that your customers are "desi" and we understand what you'll saying. In the other hand the cashiers were nice to me. Could be the owner or wanna be owner with a nasty attitude.

oTPLQ-c5ATHPz5a86E_gxg.text: Driving a couple miles away from the Strip to experience this was an utter waste of time, money and everything else! A very shabby looking restaurant too. As soon as we stepped in, we felt like getting out. Since we drove some distance to get here, we decided to give it a shot anyway! Being in Vegas, almost every restaurant seems to have a good number of reviews and that fact deceived us. The people who dined here and gave these good reviews seem to not have tried authentic Indian food and thereby this restaurant ended up having a 4.5 rating with 1200+ reviews which paints a completely wrong picture altogether.  When we arrived, there was a little wait time. The lunch buffet had some really mediocre dishes. Even the choice of dishes seemed pretty boring and everyday like. When you go to an Indian buffet, you expect some lavish dishes, but here you won't! Tandoori Chicken and Fish Fry were overloaded with red food color and were both bone-dry and no flavor. Awful! How can they mess up a Samosa? I can go on talking about how bad every individual dish was but it is only going to sound redundant because everything was so below par. To top everything, they ruined the Gulab Jamuns too! My goodness! Never again :-I  Rating the following out of 5:  AMBIANCE - 1 I want to rate this in negative!  FOOD- 1 Lunch Buffet - 1  CUSTOMER SERVICE - 2 The servers are inattentive. My husband asked for some cut onions and we kept waiting for so long.  WAIT TIME - 3 A little wait time. Not too bad.  HYGIENE - 3  PARKING - 4 This restaurant is located in probably the dullest part of Las Vegas!! It is in a complex so you shouldn't have a problem finding a place to park.  I usually take pictures of the food(always) and restaurant(sometimes) but this place just turned me off!

NQ9ZGiQ1Msb_rhqsICRQvw.text: I searched for a near by indian restaurant and found this in Las Vegas. Me & my three friends were excited to find this one, that we are from Nepal as well. We went there for dinner and at the end it was time for check out. Most surprisingly the owner ( I believe) asked us to go to the counter and pay. Instead of bringing check to the table he treated us in a different way. Maybe he thought we are not from here. But we are customers and all customers should be treated in the same respectful manner. I'm damn sure he ll remember this for his life time every time he serves a foreign customer. And I hope he learned a good lesson.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RPBYzDfBY0_UB9LnDrZpwg.text: The first time I ate here was almost 20 years ago as a high school kid. I've been here periodically throughout the years whenever I was in town. I recently moved back home and took my family here. Their lunch buffet was exactly how I remembered it; excellent. While their selection of food during their buffet isn't the largest, the quality of the food is amazing. From goat curry to tandoori to other North Indian dishes; this place always delivers. The only knock on this place during my latest visit was our waiter. I don't know if he was having a bad day but he wasn't very friendly which isn't normal here. But if you want good Indian food at a very reasonable price then come to their lunch buffet and support a great local business. I've been going here throughout the last 20 years and will continue to come.

WA28K4e2l5ctX2nb3ep1iw.text: Good food for $11.99 lunch buffet. Not a great in quality but good for a quick afternoon lunch with more variety.Being vegetarian we had plenty of options.Definitely place needs some change in menu day by day as I was there 2 times in 5 days menu had Same desert and Host needs to work on brining NAAN little faster then picking up plates.

EOdGxGT0kJnt0vp_caN7DQ.text: I think I've found my new favorite Indian restaurant in Las Vegas!   They have a good sized menu that has very good descriptions to help you if you aren't super familiar with Indian food.     We ended up getting the non-veg Thali which is about 22 bucks.  It seemed like not enough food at first and we were worried we'd have to order more but we left fully satisfied with stuffed bellies.    I really liked how they allowed us to substitute items (I love jalfrezi) and choose what dessert we wanted.   I also really appreciated that the server had a good amount of patience for us and made sure we were getting exactly what we wanted.   We can't wait to come back and get a full order of lamb jalfrezi.  So good!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our choice so we picked gulab jamun
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Customized non - veg thali with garlic naan and lamb jalfrezi instead of plain naan and lamb curry
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pakora

ZnogMK2NJxTUmS_e-Qx0jA.text: I am a newbie Indian foodie.  I am still discovering the menu. The hubby introduced me to this cuisine some years ago and I fell in love with the flavors of India!    We came in for the lunch buffet. It is a decent price (10.99) with a good selection of menu items.   I had the chicken tikka masala (thumbs up), basmati rice (had some hard pieces, that was the downer...otherwise the flavor was on point), vegetable korma (sooo good!), palak paneer (absolutely amazing!!!), tandoori chicken thighs (flavor a bit bland, and texture a bit dry), plain naan was brought to the table...I normally do garlic naan, but this naan was so fresh and delicious without the extra spices, mango lassi (just near perfect...missing cardamom...I added some at home and it was perfection!), gulab jamun (it was good, I was so full by then, I only ate 1...and this was my first time trying it, by the way),  vegetable samosa (tasty and spicy), vegetable pakora (very flavorful, good texture to have been sitting on a buffet line).   So in conclusion, I was very happy with my meal and have been thinking of their food ever since lol!    The service:  Good service and friendly staff!  Needless to say, I will be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oP1WK-vprzwffzT2NHT1tg.text: Ohh yeah, I've been to most of the Indian food restaurants in town, definitely one of the best ! Spicy and delicious , I'll be back soon Hey, maybe today ?

Cj4osUVg_ZO0s661UbCIVg.text: I'm a fan of this Indian buffet.  The servers are really nice and I think the food is good as well.  They serve the typical curries you would see at Indian buffets:  chicken curry, chicken tikka masla, tandoori chicken, vegetable koorma, samosas, vegetable curry etc.  They have a great vegetarian selection.  My favorites are the paleek paneer (the spinach one) and chicken tikka Masala.  The servers are also pretty quick with the Naan.    Mount Everest also serves dessert which is included in the rice buffet.  An option of oranges or rice pudding.  Their mango lassis are also delicious.  Its pretty thick and has a heavy taste of yogurt.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch buffet!

9e8G1kEe1c5h4SehE0vLTg.text: We're spending a few days here for new year's.  We went by Yelp reviews and we wanted a buffet.  The kids, 7 and 9 year olds were with us. We got here around 2pm and there was a short line.  The place was completely packed and the aroma was so good.  Packed with People of Indian / Hindu descent - great sign! The buffet spread had plenty of vegetarian choices and plenty of meat dishes along with a few dessert dishes and a small salad bar.  Every dish I tried was just heaven.  Not too hot but the nose was a little runny and my forehead sweaty (spicy but not too spicy).  Just delightful.  The kids loved their samosas and chicken tikka masala. The service was very attentive and courteous.  Prices extremely reasonable.  We would definitely come again.

mFFrpmYKuJxsNUQnB1jbwA.text: Absolutely fantastic food quality and taste great. Yes, place and ambiance  is just okay or may be below average...But the quality of food is just great. Hats off to the chefs !!. Goat Curry is absolutely amazing !!
