yF8gTvxoPVBeoVxnEpJhYQ.text: I came back to try the lunch buffet and yup....they did not disappoint! :)  Everything was DELICIOUS! :) I especially loved the goat :) so tender and no trace of "goatiness" if you were worried about that.  Lol ;)   There was not one thing that I would change except the size of my stomach.  :) I wanted to eat more BUT my stomach pleaded please no more!!! So I had to stop eating.  Lol  And all the food for only $10.99...is a steal. But I would recommend coming on a day that u are not working.  I'm at the gym now trying to get over the food coma trying to work off some of that yumminess. :D  And yes there are no pics because I was too hungry to take pics.  So come on by and take your own pics.  Lol

yZ1HslsrWOPa616tbQvQLw.text: We used to come here a lot and always loved it, and we always had a restaurant.com certificate. But that site isn't what it used to be, and since Mt. Everest is quite a distance from where we live, we hadn't been back in over a year. But I missed the place, and felt bad that the owner had always been so nice and accommodating to us, and didn't think we were being upstanding citizens by not rewarding his hospitality. Not only did he remember us, he even remembered the fact that I hate overly salty food!! I ordered a glass of the house Woodbridge Riesling, and for $5 got something rare: a FULL glass. We thought we'd order a mulligatawny soup to share, in addition to the Mt. Everest thali that we were also going to share, but the owner talked us out of it, saying I'd find it too salty. Now that's service! He suggested the Chau Chau soup instead, which has noodles, onion, cilantro, and tomato. It had just the right amount of kick and was very tasty. And not salty. Having the thali was definitely like coming home again. A large appetizer platter of goodies, including a delicious samosa, tandoori chicken, beef kebab, and lots of pakora filled me up before the piece de resistance, the large silver tray with my favorite - palak paneer - which had a goodly amount of the paneer, lentils, chicken tikka, lamb curry, raita, and the dessert, kheer. We had asked for kulfi instead of the kheer, and for it to be served at the end of the meal, since it's frozen. No problem - we got the kulfi, and were told to keep the kheer anyway. Everything was excellent, except for the lamb, which was tough. I could have said something, but who needed more food? We took some leftovers home anyway. We're not going wait another year before going back to Mt. Everest. It's that good!

BEHrpi8jPgoAazYU49ZcnQ.text: The quality and flavor of the food was quite good! They got the order exactly correct, even though it was a large one.   It came within the time period they estimated. Friendly and quick delivery guy.    One thing really stood out... the portions are H U G E !  I was thinking, hey, we're kind of spending a lot on food, but then when I saw how much they give you, it's a total bargain!  One order of rice came in a very large container.  If you put one of the sauces on top, you could easily make 3 portions!  4 even! Maybe even 5, depending on how hungry people are.   They are probably the most generously-sized portions I've ever seen from an Indian restaurant.  Perhaps because I ordered during a buffet hour?  Not sure, but wow.    I would like to actually visit this place in the future.   Thank you!

1g0Cj7FKBws1pd3mX0tZGA.text: I usually like to eat with friends so I get to share a few dishes. However, I was alone tonight so I ordered the Mt. Everest Thali so I could sample a few things. Everything was excellent. The chicken curry and saag paneer were definitely the highlights for me. Will definitely stop by next time I'm in town.

5U8loM2j5dXqEMqzNqlniQ.text: The staff is very friendly and the food was great. I took the advice of the owner and got the lamb vindaloo, spicy level 7. It was perfect with the cheese naan. I will come back the next time I'm in sin city.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nRlfwTAXuZ-xNe2ncR83qA.text: I will never take chance coming to this place again . Worst. Did not expect this bad food. Don't waste your money on this shit save urself .

nKY6XmNH-JR5U3Q4xuD3nA.text: Pretty good food, but the atmosphere is a little TOO ala hole in the wall. You've been warned! I'd really like to give this place a 3.5. We were seated in a dark corner where I literally needed to put my food under lamp in aisle to see it. There's a bunch of mismatched furniture everywhere.   Ordered the Mt Everest thali platter. It was mostly delicious, a little under-seasoned. One of the first things that is brought out is some kind of sausage (?), some battered veg and a pakora. That part of the meal was underwhelming. The sausage was very dry and the battered veg was just ok. Neither was too tasty.   There was a variety of 4-5 V and NV curries that were served along with rice and plain naan. The naan was incredible and had a bit of a crust which I've never seen before. I'd come back again maybe if I was in the area and order thali as it was very filling and provided a variety of foods to try. Lassis are tasty!

if93DH3CZt9rGPOo8oKEqw.text: Awesome indian food. Must try.  Garlic naan was crispy and flpvorful. The mango lassi was the best ive jad in the usa

DeW9_NFpxHEYTisHRcxWRA.text: The best Indian food I've ever had, it really is! Fresh, hot and spicy if you like that. Great service, wonderful beer selection and the dishes are bountiful.. We had the mixed grill, saag with lamb and biryani rice with chicken. They were all my favorite...I highly recommend this establishment!

5yO2n2RzrG5clskeNl80Dw.text: Very good food staff very friendly and accommodating.authentic indian food.highly recommended

jgPZ27a9JGQbLn972o614Q.text: Indian Buffets in Las Vegas r a dime a dozen. So it is quite difficult to give a fair opinion about each one of them. So far, I had a very satisfy experience with most of the one I've been. And if U r a curry lover or a vegan. Going to an Indian buffet is an absolute delight. Mt. Everest is a bit distinctive n stand out from the rest is because their oven roast butter chicken drumsticks r amazing. Also they give U a basket of freshly made Namn for each table they serve. Even though the selection of food r very limited to around 20 items. U will walk out the restaurant feeling happy n full.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All these n more for just $10.99 during lunch at Mt. Everest Indian Bistro.
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Lassi n Nann. Nice combo! Ha ha.
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Curry, Samosa, Seasoned Basmati Rice, etc. What&#39;s there not to like!

zpJ3oGfmr-vlj2iw7jKAKw.text: Don't have any critiques for this place really, you come here for the great variety of indian spices and flavors. Very reasonable price at 12$ per person or so, decent service. Tikki masala is excellent, and their naan bread is very crispy and airy. The honey balls are ridiculously good as well. Overall solid Indian cuisine. 4.75/5

4ogxN7WxVDE8P8N5ABzqQQ.text: Amazinging delicious food from main course to dessert. We came for lunch buffet. They had plenty of vegetarian options as well as non vegetarian options. Good place to enjoy indian food.

f9YGaT1s7eCx9UzHE4C4uw.text: Another one of those ole standbys in town. While it may not be the most authentic Indian food, for Vegas it's pretty damn good and tasty! For tourists if you're willing to venture off the Strip and looking for a healthy budget conscious option Mount Everest is a great choice. Don't let its former Burger King looking architecture dissuade you, inside its clean full of some of Vegas' better options for Indian food.

qo54HWyKaHdi2KxfGhRv1w.text: Today is my birthday dinner and my lovely main squeeze brought me to Mount Everest!!!   Always fantastic.  The Owner, Prakash ensured our order was perfect and even surprised us with a wonderful dessert.    The service was and always is impeccable.   I will never go to another Indian Restaurant in Las Vegas!   What a wonderful meal and a perfect surprise!!!  Thank you Mount Everest for making my special day more meaningful.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Naan
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pudding and Lychee

d84eWQguHgewFGw0-WUNAw.text: So delicious! Hands down the best Indian food I've had in a long time. We were in a rush and called ahead to make sure we had enough time. The manager (?) went ahead and started cooking our order to be ready when we got there! Great service, fantastic food!   If you're looking for a quiet place away from Paradise chaos with excellent Indian food - this is it! Disclaimer: if you care that they don't have brand new tables, fresh paint, etc - this place isn't for you. I prefer the 'hole in the wall' that has amazing food. I don't care about cosmetics.

WSp5kEJVVeeKO9pDyLnMcw.text: I love this place! This is my 3rd time visiting this restaurant in 1 month. Prakash, the owner, was incredibly friendly. They even gave us complimentary dessert. I will come back again and again!

JtN-vct_kqXWMlAOBYL9Ow.text: We love this place. Friendly service and great food. We enjoy the buffet for an easy lunch but the best dishes are on the menu.

Lge4EjXhqonbhwgX0ZFAkA.text: This place was great! Super delicious and the staff was pleasant! I highly recommend this place. We had a big party and they were very accommodating and set us up in advance :) Be sure to try their veggie samosa, YUM!

unT9Ouu-m-G5565HmzjaUg.text: This place is a tie for my favorite Indian restaurant in Las Vegas. The atmosphere is nice and dark and they have fun music videos playing in the background. The food is delicious and their menu is loaded with a lot of options.

2rgbdLnfSE2p6MKIe5G4OA.text: This place is delicious all the time. Lunch buffet or dinner.  I love the goat curry and the chicken tandoori. Have been eating here for year and don't see any reason to stop.

cxDYuFsl06CZlibL8tTDiQ.text: Had lunch buffet on the weekend and food was great. Naan was very fresh and soft. The vegetable samosa was excellent. The pakora was mediocre. Plenty of vegetarian options.

B8bhf2yA1BpwFu4PVvo_zQ.text: Ridiculously busy on NYE.  Crowded.  Decent turn-over.  Felt rushed when eating the buffet.  But food was exactly as I expected for an Indian buffet.  I would return, but not on a busy day.

bBmzpqnDLnGzK1Q7_1zQ0Q.text: The service and atmosphere are great!! The Naan is delicious.. I had the chicken curry and it was excellent.. Definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tandoori chicken

OuJ917kiBH2NM3cEXNEqTw.text: Best Indian in Vegas! My husband is an Indian food connoisseur so we searched all over. The food is super fresh and tastey and the service is perfect they can make everything to your liking  such as making the Naan extra crunchy if that is what you like. Go for a lunch buffet to try their specialties. Very economical but most importantly super yummy!

qTUSSNG1dz87t_5WOavvBQ.text: We ordered Sikh kebab, chicken tikka masala, palak paneer, lamb vindaloo, chicken korma, and garlic nann. The Sikh kebab was flavorful, but a little dry. I've had better. The tikka was ok, big chunks of tender chicken, but the sauce was too sweet. The palak paneer was very good, although I like it a little spicier. The lamb vindaloo was excellent. Big, juicy chunks of lamb perfectly spiced. I'm usually not a big fan of lamb, but i really liked it. The chicken korma was excellent as well. Again, big chunks, perfectly spiced, delicious. Garlic nann was perfect. Two pieces were plenty for the four of us (with all the rest we ordered.)   The service was exceptional. Very prompt, polite, and helpful. No one at our table had ever tried goat, and my brother-in-law was asking our server about it. The server was a very nice young man and tried to describe the flavor, texture, etc. Anyway, we ended up with the lamb vindaloo instead. Later, the server came by with a sample of the goat curry. He didn't have to do that, it was very nice. And, I found out I love goat! Absolutely delicious. He also brought fresh rice to take home with our leftovers. I felt he went above and beyond. We'll eat here again next time we're in Vegas!

eV9FzuCWCfrZNmRYvJzHZA.text: Here's the go to if you are on the fence about trying Indian.  Garlic naan + butter chicken ( 1-10 spicy level) can't go wrong with a 4. Has slight kick to it with no mouth burning affects.  The owner Praicash is always friendly.  Oh and the service is suburb Never had an empty water.  Never had a disappointing meal here in 20+ times.

hUQ57LopT58-ShpB1FPc2g.text: I love Indian food. I've lived here for 8 years and was skeptical about trying any Indian food out here because I'm originally from New York and the Indian food there is outstanding. I didn't think Vegas had any decent Indian restaurants until I walked into this place. I was hesitant because from the outside, the place looks sketchy but the food was outstanding. The Korma and Tikki Masala were full of great flavor and  the meat was perfectly tender. Dipping the garlic Naan into the sauces was just delicious. The service here was outstanding as well. Very attentive staff and they have a great sense of humor as well. Definitely coming back and I hope you foodie fanatics that haven't tried Indian yet will give this place a shot.

ZbVsjJxjbU5ih9uzcbJz_w.text: The price was decent for all you can eat Indian food. The chicken was very dry in both the tiki masala and the tandoori. Service and table clothed tables was nice but the bathroom was dirty. This place was okay, but nothing to rave over.

gZrV_ZsogTDlCZu_M4mfLQ.text: Yes.  Yes.  Yes.  My wife and I took a little bus ride over here on one of our annual trips to Vegas (honeymoon this time yay!) and man was it worth it.  We love Indian buffets, but in the Midwest the quality level can vary quite a bit.  Mount Everest hits it out of the park.  Price was incredibly reasonable (10-15$), they had just about every Indian food I've ever had available, and the taste was sublime.  Mouth-watering delicious.  The staff was polite and friendly too.  The bus ride was very reasonable.  We bought a Deuce Bus 24 hr pass ($8) which was also good for the city bus, so we were able to hop one from the strip over to there.  Its a pretty quick ride and the neighborhood seemed fine.  I've snagged the Duece pass each time I've been in Vegas and despite being slow at times its one of the best ways to save money when out on the town.  If you are an Indian Buffet lover, this is my favorite of all the ones I've had, so definitely make the time and give it a stop.

agzVvjhM1JV9fPU_eWEC5w.text: I went there for a lunch buffet and the choice for food selection was very good for both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes. The food was tasty for a lunch buffet.  The only thing I did not like much on the menu was the gulab jamun. It was cooked well but there was an overdose of cinnamon in it. This place is a great find around the Vegas strip especially for people who crave Indian food as there aren't many Indian restaurant option on the strip.

0z8Z0Mshs5Go2m90HEPr8g.text: Great family owned restaurant me and my family have been going to for 4 years.  The staff are friendly and always  remember us.  Best Indian food in Vegas

AtSix3fLjJ4a9xzqW4XKDw.text: Mt Everest Indian restaurant is perhaps the best in the valley of their kind. They have a great team and service accommodation mountainous to equal to and an unparalleled feat of culinary execution that won't send you to Everest in economics. Personally, since I live by it then I have it favorably but their plaques and wall of achievements are not on paper but in the appetites and sensibilities of pleased returning guests. If there may be contestations there are but two: proceed to India or reincarnation! Amen.

pcCPrFUnTl2z590963R8Ug.text: Absolutely love this restaurant!! Great food!! And a fantastic lunch buffet! Anybody looking for a great Indian restaurant this is a awesome choice.

yZdrHwrxOF42GOWSBIIHEA.text: The food was excellent, the best that I've had in a long time! But aside from the wonderful food, the service is excellent! The owner was very courteous and friendly and  even brought us something special for us to try. Definitely recommend if you like excellent food and excellent service!!

kL2zsopXGwDvU4ekxAv5yQ.text: Amazing Indian food! Highly recommend the lamb saag! Get it really spicy, what they consider 10 is not that spicy.

C4nbwDGCshvLnUbYDPs9MA.text: My daughter wanted to try Indian food this was her first time. The food was tasty, service was good. I rarely eat this type of food so I really don't have much to compare it to. Maybe would try it again.

CeiH84DQIsNA4EQFpK415Q.text: The food was great with only a few disappointments.  The Goat stew the meat was a bit tough but the flavor was good, disappointing though cause goat meat is usually very tender and is hard to mess up.  The biggest fault was the chicken curry.  The chicken curry had very little flavor that stood out and considering all the other fantastic flavors of the other dishes was a bit bland. I still give them 4 stars.  Cause everything else was really really good.  The restaurant was very clean.  So now that I reviewed the food I will say that the service was just mediocre.  They don't check on their guests to see if they need anything and are usually talking among themselves in the front corner of the restaurant by their register.  I would return however to this place again.

Bu8CsBU2d7TiBbrPD9_mjg.text: Since my favorite Indian joint was shut down due to health code violations (come on, what are a few cockroaches when the food is amazing?) I decided to give this place a shot.    I really liked it!  My date and I split the Mt. Everest dinner which had a little bit of everything and it was delish.  It was also more than enough food for the two of us!   We also added an order of garlic naan and it was so tasty.  My only complaints are:  the paleek paneer only had one small chunk of paneer, and the service was pretty impersonal.  The prices were pretty average, and the location is not the best - but I do love a good hole in the wall from time to time.    Will I go here again?  Yep, I'd love to.  Will I keep hunting for the a new go-to for Indian food?  Yeah.  This place was great but isn't quite as good as some other places I've been to.

W5kVmSiZMx4ehCiQgiGTYw.text: I'm a simple man. You serve Butter Chicken on your menu and it doesn't suck? Instant fan. Actually, their Murgh Makhani is as good as anywhere I've ever had it. I ate the whole thing. Not sure what else I need to say on the matter.

ic097IJsoMwac_RIHaashg.text: This is a little gem. Great food and a welcoming staff. Ordered five entrees and all were fantastic!

hlJmEprt6-gBuazEQJH_dw.text: Not recommended for dinner. The chicken makhani was made with overcooked meat and chilli chicken was made with refried meat probably cooked few days ago, it was tough as leather.

76dxY5DmtkKSoqrkmJRUZg.text: Brilliant food, delicious dessert, attentive staff, cordial owner.  Naan was great, tandoor and vindaloo was also delicious.  Shared a kheer for dessert, great.  Cozy atmosphere that takes you out of the city and into another location, friendly crowd.

tH0QZB3p0X3YrpPaTg5IZg.text: So from the outside, this place looks shady and like an Indian food restaurant you would not want to set foot it. I am pretty sure it was a Wendy's or Burger King building before. Go in and eat...you will not regret it.  The $10 lunch buffet is so good. A little on the creamy side, but the food is spectacular. There are a lot of choices, vegetarian and meat and everything has usually (one bad dish once) tasted really good. They even have good Indian beer to help wash it all down.  The service is quick and easy. We were in a hurry once and got through the lunch buffet in like 25 minutes from walking in the door to paying.

0QDvhMkg48dWEjUyLKzjdw.text: I am in Las Vegas a few times a year for work and decided to stop eating on the strip. Found this place on yelp and am happy we decided to try them out. Dinner was awesome might be the best Indian food I have had. Service was great staff couldn't have been any more friendly. I would recomend trying this place will definitely come back next time I am in town.

5Wsoyq0Av5Xzu62B0mbTpQ.text: Had a great experience here! Not really a fan of Indian food but this place changed my mind. Loved the recommended chicken tiki marsala and korma. Also their rice pudding was fantastic. In addition the staff is very welcoming and helpful. Overall 5 stars! I will definitely come back again!

mLYEGlk6UowYePYnKyKcfA.text: This was some of the worst Indian food and service I've ever had. We ordered vegetable samosas, dal makhani, paneer tikka masala, biryani rice and vegetable biryani. The vegetable samosas were okay. But all the other food came out cold. The rice also looked like it was reheated.

gcgsL9uF-RBCSZZOaBNcbA.text: We come here every time we're in Las Vegas, which is 2-3 times a year (major trade shows, and weekends away), and the owner, Prakash always recognizes us, which is nice. The food is great, especially the vindaloo, which is my favorite! Get the samosas, and some Naan to round out your meal. Bring your appetite, the portions are generous, and the prices very reasonable. Well with the trip off the strip!

1yZOfGWVWG8wiJE40EAtuQ.text: Local celebrity Yuhi K. recommended Mt. Everest to me and oh boy was she right? Oh yes. I'm a Brit, we know , or think we know, everything about Indian food. We grow up eating the stuff, there are more Indian restaurants in England than Mickey D's. Really! Would I embellish? Maybe but I don't think so in this instance.  Anyway, Friday night and the kids ditched us. Outrageous I know, but gives Wifee and I a rare chance to eat what we want. "Yuhi K. recommends a place down on Sahara" I explain. "Who is Yuhi K.?" asks my leader. " She knows about food" I explain unconvincingly.  It is a long drive down W.Sahara from my hood and Wifee is viewing my choice with suspicion. " It will be great" I proclaim "be patient".   Mt.Everest sits in front of a slightly rundown strip mall but parking is easy and my expedition was a success.  We were greeted promptly and offered a table or booth. Booth. The greeter/server guy seemed to be the owner. He was great. Recommended a great beer, Taj Mahal, 1.5 pints of frothy cold delight, Wifee grabbed a nice cold Chardonnay.  We started with a mixed dish of samosa, kebab, chicken tikka and some other stuff. Fantastic and more than enough to share.  Mains: I had a Mushroom lamb dish, I am asked how spicy I would like. being a big shot expert Indian food eater , I asked for 7/10. Too hot! I'm such a wimp after many years away from Blighty, Really quite pathetic. I tell my server/owner/guy. No problem! He took it away and brought it back re done at a more acceptable spiceness. ( I'm pretty sure that's not a word, sorry). Delicious! Served with rice and a garlic naan.   Wifee has Chicken Saag, she ordered 6/10 on the heat scale. Perfect!  Water was always topped up, drinks were offered frequently. Really great and we are going back. Often.   Thanks Yuhi K.!!!!!

c5Bucne_LlfRS4bda1ZBRA.text: Craving Indian food and my husband and I stopped in for the lunch buffet. They had great variety and delicious naan!    We are counting down the days until we get to go back!   Good prices. Great friendly staff.

DjSfBDIpPqa6g-pSFxg0FA.text: As a vegetarian who's with non-vegetarians all of the time, it's really hard to find great restaurants where you have a few or more intriguing options on the menu. As far as Vegas is concerned, this place is the best!! The 5 stars is for a combination of great quality food at a very decent price brought to you with amazing service. I always feel welcome here and have been recognized and acknowledged by only coming once. After they meet you the first time, they remember you and treat you like a friend. I am so grateful I was referred here by my boss who is from Pakistan and recognizes good Indian food.

B73Esdbc9Le367sMju6lHg.text: This is our go-to dinner restaurant in Las Vegas for delicious Indian and Nepalese food. We over-order, so we can fight over the leftovers the next day.  Their food is always fresh, and perfectly flavored. The chutneys and sauces are great, too. Our out-of-town guests are always impressed with the food here. The staff is always welcoming and the service is above average. We love this place!

j7YEGO-lK2J-B5dnm_h18Q.text: The lunch buffet is great.  Especially for the price. They have a very nice variety. You can see many locals come here.

MibdtzU-G2MwYZJvmroJnw.text: The buffet is great! $11 for pejorative and samosa and a good variety of Indian favorite dishes. The Mali kofta, tikka masala, and mixed vegetable entrees were awesome. Also the dal and naan were tasty.

WpUikQ14FvRVQTQq9l54gA.text: The hubby and I come here often for the buffet lunch. Absolutely love the food! Service is good. The restaurant is a good size but can get packed quickly on the weekends.

Rucg7_LRZ-h0vxktJV6DpQ.text: I've been to Mount Everest about a dozen times and have never been disappointed. I don't go anywhere else for Indian Food in Vegas.  Atmosphere: Great Mom & Pop shop, clean, nice culture and music. Service: Excellent: They probably fill up my water glass 8 times during the meal whenever its half empty! Now to the good stuff, the food:  The food is consistent every time I go in and is large portions. The prices are reasonable. The food is always extremely hot and can be adjusted by spice level. The raita is a good way to go with the garlic naan. Also the crackers with indian chutneys at the beginning of the meal are complimentary and great.  Chicken tikka masala is unreal! Check this place out, you won't be disappointedf! Thanks, Prakash and Mt. Everest :)

Gmxk7R2wfVZOyaHnUEfq7g.text: Fell in love with Indian Cuisine the food is very delicious. Will definitely be a returning customer! Thank you

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Chicken Tandoori and Prawn Tandoori, Lamb Vindoolo, and Chicken Tikka Masala with a Taj Mahal beer!

Q4tBoDemRYQ9bdQ_Ql3ywQ.text: My boyfriend and I just had the lunch buffet. The food was FANTASTIC!! It was our first time to eat here and we will for sure be back. The flavors were so good. The sweet rice is the bomb. My water never went empty. I don't think it ever got even half empty because they were all over keeping it full. We both had the buffet, we shared a large beer, and it only cost us $40.... Including tip. We will for sure be back to dine here again. Thank you My Everest for a fantastic lunch!!

XCmQ1eAbNf5BVAI4nF40Tw.text: This is my little gem from India! I don't care how far I have to drive, this is hands down my favorite spot in Las Vegas. The service is great and the staff is very friendly. You never have to wait to ask for anything. They are great at anticipating your needs. I can't wait to come here for the lunch buffet! This is my favorite girls night restaurant. The owner is awesome too!

aooqhKFE8MIaofw4GGKkiw.text: Try the Lunch buffet special , I really like how I get to try many dif kinds of Indean food and feel out what I like out of all of it. The mango selassie is nice( mango yogurt drink )  , helps with the spice if you don't handle it well. Great place for lunch I'd say. Indian   cuisine done the right way

j5aF_YZ1F8cyLYYRKopuwQ.text: The buffet is good, but placing a regular order is the way to go. The Korma and Tikka curries are both great.

GpcNmU8DaQiYcBSj6ZCW5Q.text: I went here to convert two of my girlfriends to try and like Indian food, and it was a success. A classmate of mine told me about this place. She said this is hands down her favorite Indian restaurant in the city. So after a couple months of persuading, my two friends who aren't so adventurous in cuisines as much as I am, finally decided to accompany me to Mt. Everest. I'd admit the venue is a bit sketchy but I just kept pulling the two inside. I already know my favorite Indian dishes, so I ordered for my friends since they don't know what dishes are what. We went for Chicken Tikka Masala, Korma, and tandoori. I thought those dishes were the most "friendly" to those who've never had Indian food before, so yeah. We also got garlic and regular naan combination, and mango lassi (my favorite!). I liked every dish we ordered, especially the Korma. I can't stop dipping my garlic naan into it. And the lassi was just perfect. I wanted to drink a whole pitcher if I could. The service was very friendly and he didn't hesitate to help us with any questions regarding the dishes. In past experiences with Indian restaurants, I felt like the service have been quite rushed and somewhat rude, but Mt. Everest's server was quite congenial. I think the prices aren't bad and the serving was enough for people to share. I think I've found my go to Indian restaurant. I'll definitely try their lunch buffet.

x5u3swsusPKlFKoJcSJkFA.text: My wife and I are new to Indian food and not all that familiar with different dishes so I found this restaurant online and saw in thier online menu that they had combo plates.  The food was amazing and a perfect journey through the different tastes and textures of Indian food. It was a perfect way for someone new to the cuisine to experience many different tastes and in wonderful and large portions. The service was top notch by a gentleman I assume was the owner. I regret not getting his name but plan on returning there many times so I will make sure to get his name another trip. The inside of the restaurant was nicely decorated and clean, quiet and fairly empty for a Wed night, but has a very welcoming feeling and we both enjoyed it very much...thank you everyone at Mt Everest India's Cuisine!! Anthony and Alashia

slf9ZkJP5O2pUwOAOouDTg.text: Best Indian food and Buffet in Las Vegas. A great value.

RAs9BSIqvU-ZwMyAX_AXEA.text: I guess it's not fair for me to review this place while I didn't get there until the last minute of lunch buffet... I was actually surprised they let us in. Food was old and dried by then, but they sure tasted great. Next time, I'll come earlier.

GFqDfncAsDfK8ASQwyre6A.text: Delicious lunch buffet for 12 bucks. Good variety and fresh food. I will return.

-pX2x7cl5jmTXzov71ArUQ.text: Prakash and his staff continue to prove that they have the best, most authentic and welcoming Indian and Nepalese Restaurant in Las Vegas. Prices are always very reasonable for the portions provided, and the staff is happy to tailor the level of spice to any palate without losing the key flavors. The atmosphere of the restaurant is always warm and welcoming with soft lighting and a real ceiling with better acoustics for a good talk over a meal (rather than the new fad at restaurants of a large cavernous warehouse ceiling and raucous noise requiring you to shout at your dinner companion.) My personal favorites are the momo, the butter chicken, the paratha, and the mango lassi, but every dish we have tried is of the highest quality and flavor. I highly recommend Mt. Everest to all my closest friends and visitors to Vegas who want to get away from the Strip for something different that tastes wonderful!

Z124mzXfYF8utDLHvl6SRw.text: Here is the place you can get the authentic indian food and the best family owned recipies as well. Also their mango lassie is my favorite and the buffet 8.99 for bunch of verities. Best of all.... the chef is the owner and you get the best taste you ever imagine.....

2bRj57weIhwGZoWI6y0qnA.text: Thursday lunch, spouse and I arrived at about 12:25 and were seated quickly by a friendly male.  The booth had white linen table cloth and white cloth napkins with better than the usual flatware and water goblet.  Unfortunately, lunch is ONLY the buffet for $10.99 [it is not clear if this is ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT].  A menu is only for dinner. The buffet had a "sneeze" shield with sticky notes with handwritten names for whatever was under the shield.  The labels were for the Indian name of the dish; not very helpful if you're not an Indian speaker. The "wet" items were soupy and the "dry" items were dry to an extreme.  The two best items, IMHO, were the chicken curry and the white rice, while the others were forgettable.  The condiments I normally associate with curry [like coconut, peanuts, grated onion, etc. were absent; although the chutney was present, but unremarkable as chutney]. I would hazard a guess that those giving five stars are native speakers and are familiar with the food in the buffet.  Since I'm neither, this made things awkward.

dypuBaO9c5qaTXqbSzAXZA.text: Great customer service! I had surgery yesterday and my husband had promised to take me to Mt Everest afterwards - I was starving. We were running late and I called at 2:45 and begged them to place a carry out order (they close at 3:00). They saved the day, and let us pick up our order right after they closed. Great fresh food, with just the right amount of spice (they will kick it up to however hot you want no problem)!

TseDfN1FXv1OhmmVxU9PvQ.text: I was surprised. Driven by this place countless number of times but never ventured in seeing as it used to be a Burger King back in the day. The food was tasty. Tried them out via a Groupon Now. The cashier didn't know anything about the Groupon which was a little bit of a turn off cause I felt guilty trying to use it but they honored it anway for takeout service. Had the Chicken Briyani and the Chicken Jalfrezi. I think the Briyani could have used for chicken but it wasn't bad. The jalfrezi was not bad either.

RN5Wn6zuq2MKJq1Pof6U4g.text: I'm not a huge fan of Indian food, but this place was pretty good. Lunch buffet was only $10! Great price for Indian food and they had an array of different dishes. I really liked the sweet rice. I've never had that before at an Indian restaurant. Great place if you like Indian food.

d7RjUV1SAy682_t9LMMp2g.text: We had dinner one night and came back a few days later for the lunch buffet.   Both were excellent. We've tried a few other places on the strip but this place is far better.   Worth the short side trip. One of the best indian restaurants I've been to in a ling time.   Service was fast courteous and friendly.  Food was authentically delicious.

f2FvtwGV8gJgq8DmckNbLA.text: Buffet doesn't look like it will be tasty- but all of it is very good. Plus the Garlic Nan bread is the bomb

uD6hULS6V2icgkS8mdc03A.text: Took my daughter out to dinner when I visited her in Vegas.  The service here was excellent. We had three appetizers and I also had the tomato soup  which had a wonderful flavor of some herb.. We ordered a veg entree which came with rice,but I wanted nan bread too.  I had a mango lassi with the entree -- in case the food was spicy for me Then we topped it all off with a glass of wine. She had the "house red"  and  I had a  Reisling.  When the bill came--  I couldn't believe it was only $45 including tax.  It  was True Indian cuisine. (We have been to India.) We left  a generous tip and went home with take out boxes for lunch the next day!!  Five stars..............

hBc2BYljP2Ey-0rJ2dJaLg.text: Great AYCE Indian food for the price and I will be going back soon. There was a constant stream of people coming in for the lunch buffet so you may have to plan ahead if you don't have a lot of time. For a small buffet it had a great mix of sweet, savory, and spicy flavors. Everyone in my group left satisfied.

tLJ_CB6aeGIHvlRlYyAULA.text: Went to Mt Everest again last week and noticed that some items were changed, so I'm not sure if they have different items each day or not. No goat curry, bummer!!! Anyway, the food were not as good as the last time I tried it. I mean, it's not bad, it's just not as good to be rated 5 stars. Anyway, last week experience deserved only 3 star, so I kinda averaged it out to be 4 star.

R-PIZD3kV_rnYMlv1EIz0g.text: Great atmosphere and even better food. I am not experienced in Indian cuisine (this was my 1st experience). I had the lunch buffet so I could try a little of everything. The lamb and chicken were moist and tender, and everything was very flavorful. The lunch buffet is a steal at $9.99. I was overly impressed by everything at this restaurant.

VVJwAeBHMLQ6V4Wo-LD_9g.text: A bit sketchy on the outside, and thankfully I did not judge the book by its cover.  Buffet had many good options and was a steal at only $8.  Naan was among the best I had in Vegas this trip.  The korma sauces were rich and flavorful, just as other yelpers mentioned.  I think the one I had was cheese cubes with peas, and it was quite delectable.

x2E-l1Io16a3pxeD8vwR4Q.text: This is my favorite Indian cuisine restaurant !! The food is delicious and the staff is superb! They are extremely friendly here!   If you are visiting Vegas this is a must that you come and try this restaurant out! They have a lunch special ayce from 11AM to 3pm for only $11.99 !

P4njPP1lfSBWFfG8TuE4pA.text: The worst taste and bad service. They don't know how to cook indian food. I will never go again and will not recommend to friends.

Mxjm-T0Jjm2xpgs5E_U_Dw.text: This is one of my fave buffet restaurants in Las Vegas. I usually visit this restaurant 4 to 5 times a month with my husband. The owners are really nice and very accommodating. Their chicken tikka masala and chicken paneer are my favourites!

NrPmuhQkJ8Ht8ymY-2UL3Q.text: Decided to try this restaurant as it was highly rated Indian restaurant on yelp. We went during long weekend dinner.  Place : Ambiance is big but bit dark.  Service : This is where I cut one star. We had to wait 15 minute before owner/server took our order. We enjoyed free papad in mean time.  Food : We ordered Paneer Tikka & Malai Kofta. Curry came with rice. I loved the taste, my wife didn't (it was bit spicy for her). Food quantity was big.  Price : Reasonable considering quantity, free papad & rice.  It was good experience overall.

hadIPTB3vNGM_op2NVGXyg.text: This is most definitely the best Indian restaurant in town. The food is absolutely phenomenal and the prices are so reasonable unlike most of the other Indian restaurants I've come across. You can tell everything is made fresh and from scratch which I love. Everything I have gotten from here has always been delicious and I've never been disappointed. My personal favorites are the mushroom mutter and  the aloo baignan (I apologize for any misspelling).  The sweet rice is also to die for. I'm assuming it was the owner who asked us how everything was and asked if we wanted dessert. We declined and he didn't take no for an answer (which I'm so happy he didn't!). They brought us some rice pudding with what was essentially a donut ball in the center and it was mind blowingly delicious. I recommend this place to anyone and everyone. You'll never be disappointed here.

oHgTCnqw0NYrZdy_QlBBcA.text: Great food and service.  Owner was very accommodating allowing off menu ordering for vegetarian food.  Thank you Prakashbhai.

QyXgJSKR11kTN2jgzMnSgg.text: Best service, tasty food, amazing people, must try the mango lassi when you visit. :)

9pZvniGSfoX19rGZgOoorg.text: Good India restaurant, they have lunch buffet, food are fresh and service is excellent.

7JhXXfHpB4_rrcLhpGAxdQ.text: Super good Indian food! Quite possibly the best I've ever had.  Was there on 12/15 with 5 friends. We all loved it. I would definitely recommend it.

6Ann-Wii66A0TFE9tqL-Pg.text: This is one of the best Indian food that I could find in Vegas. It's 15 mins ride from the strip. The vegetable curries are delicious. We had bhindi and dal makhni. They also have momo as appetizer. You will be surprised with their masala chai, such a refreshing experience. Highly recommended.

bcuog0hB1sOtrL053E2uwQ.text: Hubby and I decided to try this restaurant for dinner upon yelp recommendation and boy... it was really good. It's a casual place with excellent food and great service. We tried the Chicken tikka kabob, Paneer Kadai and Dal Makhani with Garlic Naan. It's a little drive from the LV strip but totally worth it. Come in hungry and you won't be disappointed... we will visit again when in Vegas!

olfUJyMt_pogLRyCUAKIIQ.text: Average Indian food. Masala was watery and not very creamy and think. Nan was good. Rice was ok. Service was great though.

_E9JjYnoW26J_1-dzTY2Ug.text: The king of Indian restaurants in Vegas (maharajah?).  There are a few other good ones (Turmeric, Angara), but Everest is the gold standard.  Always consistent and delicious, perfect spices.  You can't go wrong.

q1lq4MhhOSoVWz-H77Z6ww.text: The best Indian food I have had in Vegas.  Only turnoff no chicken briyani in the buffet.

v2xxbRD9tkYUgM7XPyRrRw.text: Service was fantastic with friendly and warm loving people. The owner made sure to perdonally come and communicate with every table. You can tell the food is made with Love and caring in great flavors.  We were a party of 6 and had several dishes to get a full Indian cuisine experience. All went smooth with Taj Mahalo premium lager. ;)  The Lamb Vindaloo and chicken makhani were exceptional. We went mild on the spice because of a few guests with us that were reluctant to get to intense with spice. Everything was just great.  Casual setting, casual seating and superb people with great food.  Thanks Prakash and your team!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable &amp; Lamb Samosas

oeL3ztKq6L22ZnoD4osWuw.text: So I tend to be a Indian food snob. Yeah I said it! Snob. I called for some quick Mali Kofta and naan with jasmin rice considering I'm going vegetarian for two weeks .i needed major flavor. This place is near work so I thought I'd give it a go.   Well they didn't disappoint! I ordered through the YELP APP for pick up and it was simple. I got there before my order was ready but they offered me water and allowed me to take up booth space to wait. The atmosphere was in assuming typical hole in the wall Indian food.   Considering it was 9:30 pm and they close at 10pm I figured I'd get the last scraps of the day, but I didn't care. However, I received the order promptly, got back to work to open my to go box to the luscious aroma of curry, garlic and veggies! Oh my! The dog even started to drool! It was phenomenal!! No doubt exceeded my expectations! I inhaled it and the naan too! Naan was warm and garlicky! It was crunchy yet soft in the middle! Perfect! Only complaint was my mango lassi was way too sweet! Other than that, spot on! Good job on great food late at night! Now if we can get them to deliver!!

0e3jt5Im1Fgny4zexaGkxQ.text: Took my family here for the lunch buffet. The food and the service were outstanding. My husband ordered a Taj Mahal beer and it was really tasty. We tried every thing they had to offer and were not disappointed. We have an 8 year old and a 6 year old who aren't very adventurous with food. They tend to be picky eaters. They were open to trying new things here and they both ate a ton and really enjoyed the food. This might be our favorite new lunch spot.

ygVxrL7v_mITQJ1wBwLzAw.text: Excellent variety of Indian vegetarian dishes. There were two rices a Basmati and a very beautiful reddish colored rice. There was a sweet carrot dish that was uniquely flavorful and smooth. The curried lentils were hearty but not too spicy. The Nan bread was lightly coated in a nutty delicate sweet taste. Excellent

Tka4SqXUO45EoiPS3rBFyA.text: Excellent food but can improve service and response time for serving!! Really flavorful menu for veggie vegan and meat lovers.

EDjoRUWD-LDRmn2_T74mmg.text: Food is hotrible. bad. Came here after seeing the reviews but I think they are all bot reviews. The mixed appetizer was not good- seekh kebab and chicken was stale. Vegetarian food was better than non vegetarian. Bhindi masala was better than the chicken tikka, biryani, dal tadka that had a nepali flavor because of the owner. I recommend you go if you are okay with below average food. Hope the stomach doesnt get upset for you guys.

YSfM_BJ9Cr6IIGR_1Pq1AA.text: THIS PLACE DOES NOT CARE ABOUT ITS CUSTOMERS.  The problem I have with this place is more than the mediocre food.  The real problem is the behavior of the staff.  When I was in the buffet line one of the employee leaned over and touch me in the small of the back. as he handed me a plastic cup.  He claimed he touched me so that I didn't back into him but it was much more than that.  He claimed it was innocent but I doubt that. When I complained he did not act apologetic or professional but merely claimed he did no wrong even though he admitted the touch.  NEVERGO TO THIS PLACE!!!  The staff does not act professional and to make matters worse the food is not that good.  There are plenty of other Indian food places in Las Vegas with better food and where you will not get assaulted (definition is unwelcome touching) while dining there.

Ul9s1DbFVRHRccWAY1se6g.text: The best place for Indian food in town! This is a hidden gem that's been here for years. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

cGHMicRfBgOWCPcilJxG5Q.text: We had the most amazing butter chicken!  The naan was out of this world, but the gulab jamun was unbelievable especially when paired with rice pudding. Do yourself a favor and go there NOW. I don't care if it's closed; go there NOW and wait for it to open- you'll thank me later!!!

jGujimAIgSGepAfNDX0Kbg.text: Really good food!!! Little mishaps with the drink orders, but forsure they try their best to please the customer!! Very home like feeling and the wait isn't that long. Waiting to be seated though can take a while due to how many people come. But definitely a must try Indian cuisine!

5qEItzxD9NWgE6UqmncBLA.text: I came here with my husband about an hour before closing time. I don't usually like going to restaurants last minute but I have been craving Indian food for awhile. I really wanted to try a lamb dish even though I've never been a big fan of it in the past . I've always thought the taste of lamb had a weird after taste. I tried the Lamb Vindoolo ($12.99) which is cooked with potatoes and Chilly sauce. The lamb was tender and surprisingly no weird after taste. It was really good ! I also had a Mango Lassi that was super delicious. I'm glad it came in a clean glass because at Bollywood they gave me a glass with a whole bunch of fingerprints all over it. That was a turn off!   My husband had a salad with garlic naan .The salad tasted great with the naan but too sour without it. The naan came out hot and had a nice garlicky taste to it.   We didn't feel rushed even though we came in an hour before closing time. The service is attentive, quick, and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Lassi
Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Vw_VlwQdrLrR2WS7Siacpg.text: My fav Indian buffet in town. Eaten lunch here a dozen times. Inexpensive. Love the rice pudding, honey rice and chicken chili. Simple but tasty. Wish there was one in Henderson. I'll be back again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

atxHQm5fwz8mbIVRtLDlnA.text: The best Indian food I've had. The tikka masala is amazing. Ate here two nights in a row and it was great both days. Owners are very nice and accommodating.

XsZTOtoZTDBkRxWE8u4xBQ.text: I had gone here in the past. back when I was 20 lbs lighter, The owner would always hit on me. I always got that weird foreigner vibe from him EVERYTIME I came in. Eventually I stopped sitting in and dining, and would just grab n go. Hoping to have as little conversation with the owner as possible. Now, probably three years later and 20 lbs heavier, the owner won't let me forget it Haha. To b honest it's kind of funny seeing as I'm also 7 months pregnant. But every time I go in he's gotta say something about my weight. I don't think he knows I'm pregnant because I'm just so shocked he'd treat anyone like that, much less a customer. But then again... Weird creepy foreigner vibe... Am I right ladies ?  So I just stopped spending my money here all together. due to the fact hed treat me the way he has it makes me wonder how he actually handles what's going behind the kitchen.  Btw the buffet is crap.

muH_6AE-ehR3AYkvpuhOgQ.text: Love this place, food is amazing and so is their service. I have been to other Indian restaurants here in Vegas but by far this place has the most tasties Indian food. Service is also quick compared to other places, definitely 5 stars from me.

fGRopG1fJYhBfJhnc1UC1w.text: Yes, yes, yes. This is the indian buffet I have been searching for and thank you, find Yelpers, for guiding me here. The food is excellent, the service is good, and the price is right on.   I don't even have a lot to say for this review because, if you're coming across it, you're probably looking for an indian buffet AND you've let your search area cheat outside the Strip. Well look no further. Hit the directions button and get on down to Mount Everest India's Cuisine!

cgqmOjIr-_3eA50u9-kz3g.text: Still my favorite Indian restaurant in Las Vegas. Praicash is friendly, personable, and provides a relaxed atmosphere. The staff are kind and don't seem to mind at all when we bring our rambunctious 2 year old with us. They are also reasonably priced; don't charge extra for rice or any silliness like that.  And the Taj Mahal goes great with a spicy dish.  Also, lots of vegetarian dishes to choose from!

gIRkYNAqej-LIPLLM8Ca0Q.text: Just delicious!!  I can't handle too much spice and this had JUST the right amount.  There was such a variety of foods at the lunch buffett.  For $10.99, you can't go wrong.  And the staff were so friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sampling of their lunch buffet. The sweet honey rice is to die for.

jbeG6x-cxgwD3Zp9rwDgYA.text: Very friendly staff. Good parking. Went here after a recommendation on NYE and was given free dessert! Good portion sizes. Had a highchair for my baby.

PKa7rFM0XMzP57TM-IXmiw.text: The came in with my hubby one night last week, the food look good but the taste was just average.

photos.caption: Photo of Mount Everest India's Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dodd looks good but taste just average.

_ey3dtXRrbK9KIMWcbYvWA.text: Loved the buffet last time we were in town from LA and can't wait to try it again. It's delicious

U-N-bnltol-xlf6y_Pq7_A.text: My sister and I were craving Indian food and decided to stop by for the lunch buffet. The food was just fine. The flavors were there but didn't blow me away. The spices just didn't come through for me. The tandoori chicken and chicken in the tikka masala were also dry.   As a buffet, the choices and most of the flavors were pretty solid. I guess I was just looking for more. On the other hand, the service was attentive and polite. If I crave Indian food, I may stop by for dinner to give it another try.

rTU_Lj8nfHoygcHYiY-_-g.text: Great service.  Very polite staff.   The onion bhajis were okay.   They were not what I am used to.  They were flat and Round.   The mixed veg appetizer was a bit overpriced fir what you get.   The lamb tikka kabob was not spiced very well.  It could have used a sprinkling of lemon.   The chicken tikka was pretty good.   The began bartha was very good.   The spices were just right.   The restaurant was very clean.   The staff was very personable.   I would rate the restaurant 3.5 overall.

pbTspc21_feMebW0VSQ7Eg.text: Portions could be a little larger for the price. Food was beyond excellent. Fast service. And did mention absolutely fantastic flavor?

3AVI1uAck1Pu77b1zqWDfw.text: Great Indian food, great service. This place doesn't look like much from the outside and is not fancy on the inside but this place is great! Had the chicken tikka masala garlic and cheese naan, and milk chai tea. All were extremely good but the naan is so delicious! The waiter was very patient in answering all my questions as I was a little nervous about what to try as I am new to Indian food and wasn't sure what was spicy and what wasn't. The service here is always great even when packed and I am always impressed. I highly recommend this place.

aMoYOrHSRJdOQT4E1WK6Zw.text: 11/10 best Indian food in Las Vegas. Prakash advised that I shouldn't get the spiciest tikka masala. Long story short,  I still got it. He was so impressed that I actually ate it without sending it back, he gave me a free dessert for me and my girl.   Keep it up, guys!

5X6B6kGVfSF6RuawRwiyoQ.text: This little place is a hidden charm outside of the strip. After being away for 2 weeks from home and traveling we were craving some Indian food. This place hit the spot. We ordered the chicken momo, chicken tikka, and some goat curry. Everything was amazing!! Momos came with this sauce that tasted incredible. We definitely recommend leaving the strip for some authentic Indian food! :)

JISid-D5_z1ysnM1oV56hQ.text: Food is great and affordable.....Great spot for vegetarians...Worth visiting...!!

rOz6NHei5RJrvbE4iSZ3wQ.text: Excellent Indian Food!! Had Saag Paneer, Chicken Tikka and Lamb Jalfezi with 10+ heat... Excellent flavor.. And it burned so good!! I love really spicy food, this place is awesome!!

uihqraLj2fUby-fm1jdiWQ.text: I love Indian food and this place delivered. I ordered the standard fare for me at an Indian place.. Tandoori Chicken Tika, Chicken Masala, and A mixed grill dish. All were very good. I was with my parents and could not ramp up the spice so it was pretty cool but I didn't order it spicy. So I am curious to hit this place and tell them max spice and see how it is.  Each dish was good I thought it was kind of odd that I only got one rice with what appears to me to be 3 entrees. I requested a second rice and got charged. I dunno, thought it could be included. I also ordered these deep fried chiles to start. They were good but really unpredictable. One chiles was melt your face off the next had nothing so it was an interesting experience not sure what would happen next!  I would go again for sure. Everything was done well and the food was good. Hopefully with some spice it will be great! Oh yeah.. had a groupon there too which was nice

e_2M_LTaQuPRrNEun7uGVQ.text: The BF and I came in and we were sat down immediately with some ice water and papadams with chutney as we browsed the menu. We decided to get the Mt Everest Special ($21.99) Which comes with: mixed appetizer, salad, papadam, chicken tikka, dal makhani, palak paneer, lamb curry, chicken tikka, rice, naan, raita. For dessert gulab jamun and chai tea. We did not really get what was on the menu as we didn't get salad or our dessert but Kheer rice pudding instead. I didn't realize this until looking at the online menu for this review. Either way- it's alot of food but would have been nice to get what we ordered. The mix appetizer was some grilled sausage, chicken tikka pieces, a samosa and little papadam bites. It was a very big plate and was super filling. The main dishes were decent with the paneer being my favorite. My one thing was that the paneer and the dal needed a bit of salt, but still good. Raita was more tangy and watery than most I've had, but was good to dip my naan in. The kheer was very nice and not too sweet. Chicken Korma ($12.99)- entrees come with rice. It was decent, but was more yellow curry flavor than other kormas I've had. We also got some garlic naan ($2.99) thinking that there might not be enough naan with the mixed plate but if we didn't order this the plain naan would be more than enough. The amount of food for two people with that is crazy. We had leftovers which I had for two separate and still very sizable lunches. We would have been very full and satisfied with just the mixed plate, but we had a restaurant.com certificate to use. Service was okay. They started off good with drink refills when they came to drop off food. After a while they were doing tasks and seemed to be really into it towards of our meal so we sat there for a while needing things. Overall, the food here isn't my favorite Indian but decent. It definitely is the most value large portions than any others I've been to.

DbYCjCxKHwp7EKLTH37orQ.text: Tandoori is good, serving is good.. Owner is nice.. But Looks like they just prepare Veg biriyani, add chicken / goat on top and serve it.. But it really tasted like tomato bath

5HVGFfLgjYrQ160McpxAIw.text: Decided to try this place because of the Yelp reviews, glad we did.  Really good Indian food!  Quick, clean friendly service.  Will definitely come back next time we are in town.

_sLOcyfHcZA7Am0Z9curyg.text: Impeccable food and service at lunch and dinner. Butter chicken, saag paneer, garlic naan all on point. Wash it down with a Haywards 5000. Great place!

b_JJWTPi1Yw5SHFCl4enYw.text: I cannot express the gratitude and over all atmosphere at this fine dining establishment. This was my first time dining at an Indian restaurant and i wasn't sure what to get. From the reviews I read I noticed that many customers suggest increasing the heat that comes with many of the entrees. I was afraid so I picked mild. I had tried the chicken vindaloo and I'm so glad I did. The spices were very well represented in this dish. It wasn't over whelming on your palate. And this dish comes with potatoes and a assortment of flavors. The sauce was tomato based and creamy. It came with rice, and if I could, I would eat it all day. There was no worrying about heartburn or indigestion having it mild. The waiter, the busboy and the manager are very professional. The manager, Prakash whom I shook hands with has such a kind heart and I look forward to coming back again. Before I forget, try the kilfi which is  ice cream with saffron and pistachia flavors that is very well represented. This is a must go to restaurant if you're in Vegas for a visit.

Ng27RltJa2UDoPrJQvU5Yg.text: We use to go in this place as often as possible because it's just wonderful !!! The food is really good, tasty and fresh. The service is friendly and we are really comfortable there. We are so lucky to have this address in Las Vegas, an amazing place to eat a great curry !!! Good job !!!

8mEcWgU7q6lWchl-aJy_dw.text: It is a good place for an Indian lunch buffet. I did not find it very impressive since I enjoy south Indian food more than the north Indian food.   Varieties are not much. There are a lot of curry varieties, but only with one kind of bread. I could have given it another star had they included another rice option in the buffet spread.   The place was very crowded, but the staff managed the crowd well.

HGS7jrcX_pdsL7alnvX3yQ.text: Excellent food, fair prices! Only problem was the long lines out the door were letting in a draft! ;) portions were generous, tikka masala was wonderful.

8bPLQVk3Fk-iwjiaXyIpNw.text: I LOVE this place!  I've eaten here many times and they've never disappointed.  The food is delicious - I almost always get the chicken tikka masala, but the chicken tandoori is to die for (spicy without being too much), and the naan (I've had garlic and regular) is fabulous.  Really, all the food I've had here has been excellent!  I also love their lunch buffet.  It's a good deal at $10.99, and there is always great variety.  I've been able to try many things that I would have never ordered (goat curry - yum!) but there are also always some of my favorites.  Their dinner menu is reasonably priced (especially with a Groupon) but the lunch buffet is definitely the deal to get if you're in the area at lunch time.  The first time I went the location was a little scary - it's on the corner next to a gas station and Mariana's supermarket and the outside is not super bright.  I was a little nervous, but as soon as I stepped inside I felt much better.  It is a cute place - tablecloths on the tables, well lit (not bright but definitely not "shady"), and the people are SO nice.  I've always had excellent service - definitely the nicest servers I've had in a long time!  I definitely highly recommend Mt. Everest!

rq8k7sNjA_5HoP0yUE3kGA.text: Excellent food, quick prep and helpful serving. We ordered chicken mono, tandoori chicken and biryani .. Pleasantly surprised by the food quality n taste.

yf7oZF12F2WugzhQibJ3Mg.text: Very delicious food very friendly  attentive service. Highly recommend this place! I will be back!!

1PY6WV4L__kIT2c6kAHbXA.text: Excellent Service, Excellent food!  I will definitely come back again!   Prakash thanks for the great atmosphere and food!

bneQJwDDEOjmZXF8bR_AhA.text: So far I have tried seven different Indian Restaurants in town and this place is my favorite in all of Vegas.

EswC-Ay-piScvxM7_ooxUw.text: The Chicken Curry was good, not great as some have said. We also had Prawns Tiki Masala, the "Prawns" were just small quarter sized shrimp, hardly a deal for a dozen of these at $14. When we asked where the prawns were, the waiter tried to tell us there were large and small prawns, and these were small ones. LOL

MTs-YY_RXvYxT756hPUApQ.text: I love spicy and I miss the one restaurant in Los Angeles (closed recently) that used to make the best Chicken Vindaloo...    While in Vegas I discovered this place and I'm so looking forward to my next visit. AWESOME FOOD! super delicious! Wish they moved to Los Angeles :oP

BtB5TfR1244saGT4SQMsmw.text: Lunch buffet definitely THE BEST INDIAN FODD in Vegas.  Not overpriced and attitude-y like Origin.  Just a nice, clean establishment with a huge variety of excellent Indian food.  Everything was fresh, nothing greasy.
